Provides gross income tax credits to support development of New Jersey-based small business start-ups.

Revises animal cruelty provisions concerning euthanizing and impoundment of animals, and provisions for court disposition of seized animals; establishes civil penalty for improper euthanizing of animals; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members to temporarily defer mortgage loan payments and suspend property tax payments.*
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Appropriates $3.5 million to Phillip Alampi Beneficial Insect Rearing Laboratory improvements project.
Increases maximum municipal contribution to fire districts and volunteer fire companies; indexes amount biennially for inflation.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.
Permits qualified person with post-traumatic stress disorder to obtain handicapped parking placard.
Establishes process for recovering cost of caring for animals involved in animal cruelty violations.
Clarifies that use of propane-powered noise making device is allowed as non-lethal method of wildlife control on farmland.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree to unlawfully use a controlled dangerous substance or prescription drug while pregnant.
Permits agriculture-related events on preserved farmland.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program in several counties."
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for certain firefighter training graduates.
Implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain environmental purposes; revises State's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs.

Updates factors for consideration for grandparent and sibling petitions seeking visits with child over objection of parent, guardian, or custodian; adds preference for child's temporary placement with grandparent under "Child Placement Bill of Rights Act."
Establishes grant program for homeless veterans shelters.
"Music Therapist Licensing Act."
Establishes multi-species depredation permit.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education for dependents of certain veterans.
Requires retail establishments to allow persons with certain medical conditions access to employee restrooms.
Permits sale of motor fuels that have not been blended with ethanol for certain purposes.
Allows eligible landscape operators to make certain purchases of certain materials and supplies without payment of sales and use tax.

Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to have one veteran coordinator for every 200 veteran students; requires veteran coordinator to work with DMVA to ensure veterans have access to all available services.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $1,000,000 to Department of State to fund Haskin Shellfish Research Laboratory at Rutgers Agricultural Experiment Station.
Allows consumption of food on craft distillery premises.
Requires Dept. of Agriculture and DEP to work with US Army Corps of Engineers to establish joint permit application process for aquaculture projects.
Requires Dept. of Agriculture and DEP to adopt coordinated permit application and review program for aquaculture projects.*
Appropriates $1.6 million to Dept. of Agriculture for Jersey Fresh program.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
Permits a joint meeting by the Senate and Assembly Budget Committees to review and veto utility rate increases approved by BPU.
Makes "Skinner's and Michelle's Law" violators subject to No Early Release Act sentencing guidelines.
Directs DOT Commissioner to allocate Transportation Trust Fund monies for concept development and design of Route 55 extension.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Excludes veterans' entitlements from income for determination of PAAD eligibility.
Concerns withholdings and deductions from employee wages for certain payments.
Restores State fiscal year 2011 reductions to Garden State Preservation Trust payments in lieu of taxes; appropriates $3,400,000 to DCA.
Establishes "State Vehicle Reduction Task Force."
Establishes compensation program for State, county, and juvenile corrections officers and parole officers injured while performing official duties.
Prohibits sale of certain laser pointers that exceed certain power output.
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.
Requires DOT and DEP to conduct study on options to alleviate congestion on Route 47.
Expresses additional rationale for existing statutory prohibition of self-service dispensing of motor fuel at service stations.
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.
Establishes guardianship monitoring program in Office of the Public Guardian for Elderly Adults.
Makes Fiscal Year 2015 General Fund appropriation of $250,000 for restoration and maintenance of A.J. Meerwald.
Concerns Code Blue alert plans to shelter at-risk individuals. *
Provides that civil service make-up examinations not include the same questions as the original examination.
Expands number of disorders included in newborn screening program.
Establishes guidelines for dissemination of vital records.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Expands eligible municipalities under the "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act" to include Harrison Town in Hudson County.
Provides for school and medical family leave.
Requires clinical laboratory that provides services for accountable care organization to establish clinical laboratory testing advisory board.
Waives certain commercial driver license fees for veterans and spouses of veterans.
Waives certain professional and occupational licensing fees for veterans and spouses of veterans.
Changes title of animal cruelty investigator to "municipal humane law enforcement officer" and defines term in statute.
Establishes "Fund to Prevent Use of Tobacco and Electronic Smoking Devices"; supports activities to prevent use and promote awareness of associated health conditions.
Establishes Animal Cruelty Offender Registry; prohibits purchase, adoption, and breeding of animals by animal cruelty offenders.
Requires hospital employees assist uninsured patients with creating account to apply for insurance coverage through Federally-Facilitated Marketplace.
Prohibits certain mental health facilities, drug and alcohol treatment facilities, and homeless shelters in residential zones and within 1,000 feet of schools.
Prohibits release of home addresses of certain public safety employees by governmental entities.
Revises licensing requirements and procedures under the "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act."
Establishes "Hazardous Drug Safe Handling Act;" requires promulgation of standards and regulations concerning safe handling of hazardous drugs by certain health care personnel.*
Prohibits purchaser of used motor vehicle from waiving dealer's obligation regarding emissions control equipment.
Provides employee time off for events regarding education of their children.
Establishes minimum certified nurse aide-to-resident ratios in nursing homes.
Prohibits telecommunications, utility or cable television companies from charging certain customers prior to actual billing due date.
Increases rate of tax imposed on little cigars under tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax to equal tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Allows person with allergy to drugs or medications to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
Establishes a loan redemption program for teachers employed in chronically failing schools.
Provides certain reemployment rights to teachers dismissed due to a reduction in force.
Prohibits Governor from using State helicopter for personal and political events; requires quarterly reports to the Legislature.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain security-related goods and services.
Directs MVC to establish driver's license endorsement for autonomous vehicles.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support United Way of New Jersey.
Extends statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands the categories of potentially liable defendants; and revives certain actions.
Creates Task Force on Distracted Driving.
Establishes special license plates supporting American Red Cross.
Requires removal of equipment and markings on certain used emergency vehicles; requires that Attorney General issue guidelines or directives.

Excludes certain out-of-State businesses and employees from certain taxes, fees, and business registration requirements when temporarily performing in-State work or services during declared disaster or emergency.
Requires prevailing wage be paid to certain workers.
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school and summer programs; appropriates $60,000.
Requires DHS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Requires registered qualifying patient's authorized use of medical marijuana to be considered equivalent to use of any other prescribed medication.
Concerns enforcement, penalties, and procedures for law regarding failure to pay wages.*
Requires MVC to accept Transportation Worker Identification Credential as proof of identity for issuance of driver's licenses, certain permits, and nondriver identification cards.
Establishes program certifying certain broadcast station personnel to undertake certain actions during emergencies.
Removes statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands categories of defendants liable in such actions.
Allows nonimmigrant alien students who have applied for a green card to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
Establishes the "New Jersey Safe and Responsible Driver Act."
Upgrades crime of false public alarm when act done knowing it will result in law enforcement response against certain persons.
Requires direct payment of homestead credit to claimant following sale of qualifying homestead and upon claimant request.
Increases number of days per month bingo licensee may conduct bingo games.
Requires fantasy sports provider to adopt policy prohibiting its employees from playing fantasy sports.
Creates fourth degree crime of operating drone equipped with weapon.
Permits municipalities to enact ordinance prohibiting operation of drones under certain circumstances.

Establishes DOT roadside memorial program for fallen police officers, sheriff's officers, emergency medical technicians, firefighters, hazardous material first responders, conservation officers, and game wardens; designated as "Patrolman Joseph Wargo's Law."
Requires government entities to provide law enforcement agencies with access to exterior security recordings under certain circumstances.
Prohibits charging prospective tenants of affordable units credit and criminal background check fees unless unit will be available within 30 days.
Requires charter school to apply for new charter to open new school building or satellite campus.
Requires charter schools to disclose on website and recruitment materials certain information regarding staff certifications.
Requires State to make charter school payments for initial year of charter school's operation.
Requires public utility employees to immediately place 9-1-1 call to report emergencies that arise from work conducted by public utility employees.
Establishes task force to study issues and make recommendations regarding Marie H. Katzenbach School for the Deaf.
Requires bidder on State contract to be evaluated on report of its gender-based pay equity and job equality standards for its employees.
Establishes guidelines for creditworthiness determinations concerning affordable housing programs.
Increases value of Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program residential tax credits to $650 million; restricts $50 million of tax credits to certain qualified residential projects.
Establishes certain network adequacy and standard application requirements for health insurance carriers; requires determination of hospital diversity for tiered networks.
Requires carriers to disclose selection standards for, and establishes certain requirements regarding, placement of health care providers in tiered health benefits plan network. *
Establishes "New Jersey Task Force on Tiered Health Insurance Networks."
Revises treatment requirements for convicted drug offenders receiving general assistance benefits under Work First New Jersey program.*
Strengthens State's assault weapons ban.
Upgrades harassment under certain circumstances; restricts cyberbullying offenders' access to the Internet.
Makes harassment by electronic means a crime of the fourth degree.
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Imposes time constraints on submission and analysis of rape kits.
"Reproductive Donation Safety Act."
Revises penalties for a school bus driver who leaves a pupil on a school bus at the end of his route.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Regulates certain practices of pharmacy benefits management companies.
Allows New Jersey gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions for Hurricane Sandy relief in New Jersey.
Prohibits service and sale in schools of food and beverage items labeled as not intended or recommended for children.

Requires electric, gas, and water public utilities to provide bill credits to volunteer fire companies, first aid, rescue, and emergency squads, and nonprofit homeless and domestic violence assistance organizations.
Requires DHS to dispose of newborn screening specimens within 60 days after testing.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Authorizes eight hours of leave for parents and guardians from work for school-related events of children.
Establishes bill of rights for authorized family members of persons with developmental disabilities.
Establishes pilot program in DCF providing animal-assisted therapy to victims of childhood violence, trauma, or children with behavioral health care needs; appropriates $100,000.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Domestic Violence and Abuse.
"Pet Groomers Licensing Act;" designated as "Bijou's Law."
Establishes Behavioral Health Insurance Claims Advocacy Program.
Authorizes certain gestational carrier agreements.
Establishes Medicaid demonstration project to cover room and board services for certain terminally ill patients in the home or other non-institutional setting.
Establishes additional county recording fees to support "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund."

Requires resource family parent, relative, preadoptive parent, or caretaker to be party to reviews or hearings involving a child under the Division of Child Protection and Permanency in the Department of Children and Families' care.
Authorizes free fishing licenses for persons with disabilities.
Allows gross income tax deductions totaling $300,000 over five taxable years for psychiatrists.
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.
Requires State contracts to include provisions imposing penalties on vendor or contractor for contract violations.
Requires hospital patient's medical record to include notation if patient has Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.
Expands membership of NJ Task Force on Child Abuse and Neglect.

Requires school districts to inform DOE of number of students in certain out-of-State placements and number of students with individualized education programs identifying DHS or DCF for transition services.
Reforms PANYNJ; "Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Transparency and Accountability Act of 2015."
Provides transparency and accountability reforms at PANYNJ; modifies governance structure; provides legislative oversight of PANYNJ.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; upgrades crimes against individuals with developmental disabilities.
Prohibits investment of pension and annuity funds by state in companies that boycott Isreal or Israeli businesses.*
Implements person-first language and changes pejorative terminology referring to persons with certain disabilities or substance use disorders.*
Creates new $100 assessment for convictions of certain sexual offenses to fund counseling for victims and their families; establishes Sexual Offender Victim Counseling Fund.
Allocates at least $100 million from Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund for coastal and inland Blue Acres land acquisition projects in flood-prone areas.
Denies custody and visitation rights to minor child by family members of individuals convicted of certain crimes.
Authorizes criminal history record background checks of employees and volunteers of nonprofit domestic violence victim serving organizations.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Supplemental appropriation of $5 million to DHS to develop community residences for Division of Developmental Disabilities clients on the waiting list.
Provides NJ STARS II Program eligibility to certain students who attained an associate's degree through a joint program offered by a school district and a county college.
Increases penalties for violations committed by provisional driver's license holder.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Includes screening for toxoplasmosis in newborn screening program.
Expands scope of serological testing of certain defendants to include blood-borne diseases.
Changes law regulating size limits of lobsters.
Upgrades penalty for certain aggravated assaults when victim suffers serious bodily injury.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on the dangers of texting while driving as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Transfers responsibility for establishment and enforcement of ethical standards for local officials and school officials to the State Ethics Commission.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to include sales of properties in age-restricted developments by third parties in table of equalized valuations.
Modifies school funding law to incorporate recommendations of DOE's Education Funding Report.
Requires newly-constructed grocery stores to have generators.
Requires electric distribution lines be located underground in areas affected by severe weather or natural disasters.
Requires local governing body and DCA to suspend collection of certificate of occupancy and related inspection fees for homes being rented by persons identified by FEMA as displaced individuals.
Provides certain immunities from spectator-based lawsuits arising from youth sports events.
Prohibits sale, distribution, and use of urea as an ice melt.
Requires labeling of ingredients and restricts phosphorus in household cleansing products.
Requires driver's license to display license holder's blood type.
Prohibits additional jughandles on roads or highways in State.
Requires water purveyors to notify municipalities they service regarding water supply and water quality issues.
Requires public body to publish notice of public meeting on official Internet website.
Requires private vocational schools to provide adequate written notification when planning to close facilities.
Permits voter registration up to 29 days before an election; reduces polling place hours by one hour in the morning.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Allows TPAF retiree to be employed as certificated superintendent or administrator for limited time frame due to critical need without TPAF reenrollment.
Imposes criminal penalties for discharges of untreated sewage from containment devices installed on watercraft.
Restricts gifts to certified homemaker-home health aides from patients.
Makes General Fund supplemental appropriation of $350,000 to DMVA for Council on Armed Forces and Veterans' Affairs for preservation of military installations in case of base realignment and closure.
Requires DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to use only native vegetation for landscaping, land management, reforestation, or habitat restoration.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employing immediate family members of members of the Armed Forces of the United States who were killed in action.
Allows shore municipalities to provide spouse and dependent children of veterans free or reduced cost access to beaches.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
Establishes municipal authority to supervise, discipline and terminate employment of construction code officials.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Supplemental appropriation of $250,000 to DLPS to assist local police departments in paying for new NICS terminals.
Eliminates the New Jersey inheritance tax and repeals chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Provides immunity from civil liability for persons performing animal rescue and authorizes formation of emergency animal rescue response units.
Establishes "Seniors Helping Seniors Who are Blind or Visually Impaired Demonstration Program" in DHS; appropriates $360,000.
Allows gross income tax filers to designate contributions to VetGroup, Inc. for services for veterans.
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Requires State to reimburse counties and municipalities for salary and fringe benefit costs of employee on official leave of absence for military service in war on terror; makes an appropriation.
Extends veterans' property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Allows PERS ordinary disability retiree to earn up to $3,000 in PERS-covered employment annually before cancellation of disability benefit and reenrollment in PERS.
Extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Establishes task force to study issues facing returning members of the United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard and make recommendations on how State should address issues.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.
Establishes NJ Business and the Arts Commission to promote art Statewide.
Creates New Jersey Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act.
Exempts veterans' organizations from motor vehicle registration fee.
Revises current law permitting paid leave of absence for municipal police officers.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $5,000 income tax deduction.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10.5 million to DCA for State Rental Assistance Program.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to develop and promote NJ Heritage Weekend.
Allows municipality to petition county for removal of abandoned vessel after declared state of emergency.
Eliminates the New Jersey Transfer Inheritance Tax and repeals parts of chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Continues tax exempt status of certain real property owned by disabled veterans during reconstruction of homes destroyed by flood, storm, or other act of God.
Designates New Jersey Commuter Pass Credit Act; provides for temporary gross income tax credit for certain commuting passes.
Allows adoptees access to nonidentifying family medical history information.
Requires insurers to provide coverage for medications and dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers.
Provides for notification to law enforcement authorities of discharge of certain persons brought to screening services for evaluation and assessment for mental health services.
Clarifies enforcement responsibility of State Housing Code concerning multiple dwellings from municipalities to the State under the "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Prohibits emergency shelters for the homeless from refusing to provide services for minimum time frame unless shelters are at maximum capacity.
Requires emergency shelters for the homeless to admit persons with mental illness unless they pose danger.
Exempts from disclosure as public record information provided by individual to government agency under certain circumstances.*
Clarifies that teachers and professional support staff employed in charter schools and other public schools must meet the same certification requirements.
Establishes task force to study issues related to the establishment of full-day kindergarten.
Reduces lawful maximum capacity of certain ammunition magazines in New Jersey.
Establishes procedures for the approval of the closure of a public school.
Provides that no more than 120 credits will be required for baccalaureate degree awarded by a public institution and no more than 60 credits for an associate degree.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish common course numbering system for public institutions of higher education.
Requires school districts and charter schools to annually provide to parents or guardians of enrolled students information on certain tests to be administered during the school year.

Requires that if a school district satisfies 80% or more of the required NJ Quality Single Accountability Continuum standards in an area of district effectiveness under State intervention, the State must return that area to local control.
Provides that a school district may be placed under full or partial State intervention pursuant to the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) for no longer than five years.
Directs Commissioner of Education to appoint coordinator and regional consultants to coordinate the education of students with traumatic brain injury.

Places five-year limit on State control of any school district; requires local control to be returned in any area of district effectiveness under State intervention for which district meets 80 percent or more of standards.
Revises financial reporting requirements for charitable organizations.
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school, and summer programs.

Prohibits DOE from regulating maximum salary amount school district may pay superintendent of schools and eliminates TPAF enrollment exception for certain certified superintendents and administrators.
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; dedicates monies from foreclosure filing fees and fines.
Requires each board of education to adopt policy establishing temperature control standards and guidelines for school district facilities.
Eliminates $375 minimum Corporation Business Tax on New Jersey S corporations with New Jersey gross receipts of less than $100,000.
Increases penalties for certain criminal offenses committed against elderly and persons with a disability.*
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Reduces State hotel and motel occupancy fee from five to two percent starting FY2011; preserves dedication.
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults as crimes with bail restrictions.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Requires DCA to establish training and certification program and arbitration standards for new home warranty arbitrators and publish a "New Home Buyer's Bill of Rights."
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Provides annual salary supplement for teachers earning National Board certification; appropriates $500,000.
Establishes maximum fees for providing copies of patient medical records.
Permits board of education to accept donations for purpose of providing property tax relief.
Provides that limitation on lawsuit option does not apply in accident caused by drunk driver.
Permits municipal police officers to make arrests for any disorderly persons or petty disorderly persons offense outside the territorial limits of their municipality.
Establishes crime of participation in criminal street gang initiation ritual.

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Allows person calling certain State or local government entities to have option of speaking or leaving a recorded message with a human telephone operator during normal business hours.
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Requires ballot question on approval of State bond issue to disclose total amount of debt of State or other entity, debt service on which is funded through annual State appropriation.
Makes desecration of a military monument a crime of the third degree.
Creates the "Local Unit Audit Teams" program in the Department of the Treasury.
Authorizes members of the New Jersey State Legislature to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Provides for public comment period at certain sessions of each house of the Legislature.
Allows physicians to jointly negotiate with carriers over contractual terms and conditions.
Eliminates minimum corporation business tax on New Jersey S corporations.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain donated vehicles.
Makes all persons convicted of sexual assault subject to the No Early Release Act; specifies that any use of force elevates sexual assault to aggravated sexual assault.
Reduces gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years.
Establishes threats of violence against prosecutors, law enforcement officers and their family members as a second degree crime, subject to the No Early Release Act sentencing.
Requires notice prior to lapse of life insurance policy due to nonpayment of premium.
Allows military member to qualify for resident tuition rate at county college.
Prohibits soliciting or phishing for personal identifying information.
Creates first degree crime of home invasion, makes crime subject to No Early Release Act, and upgrades burglary of a residence to a second degree crime under certain circumstances.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of theft of firearm.
Requires DEP to establish "private wildlife habitat certification program"; creates affirmative defense against municipal nuisance ordinances for properties certified under the program.
Requires telemarketers to provide name, mailing address, and telephone number of person on whose behalf call is made.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a private citizen to use a tracking device to track another person without that person's consent.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to study impact of State business income taxes on business out-migration, business formation, and employment.
Clarifies circumstances in which school board member may participate in volunteer activities.
Clarifies law on ethical conduct of board of education members and school administrators and provides specific requirements for boards invoking doctrine of necessity.
Provides that Commissioner of Education rather than school districts will be responsible for implementation of nonpublic textbook and nursing services programs.
Eliminates provision in bias intimidation statute concerning victim's perception of defendant's purpose; replaces provision with language concerning a "reasonable" victim.
Tax Relief for New Jersey Families Act; provides income tax credits for property tax relief, quadruples the homestead property tax credit and increases the earned income tax credit.
Prohibits nonrenewal of homeowners insurance policies based on proximity to water or risk of windstorm related claims.

Provides that certain districts are not penalized in the calculation of State debt service aid for school facilities projects in which bonds were authorized but not issued prior to effective date of P.L.2008, c.39.
Authorizes counties to participate in property tax appeals for real property having a value of $10 million or more.
Makes all members of Legislature ineligible to participate in SHBP.
Requires persons convicted of possessing child pornography to register as sex offenders.
Requires SJTA to provide a cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Provides temporary exemption from sales and use tax for rental of certain hotel rooms.
Permits municipality to sell certain vehicles in connection with motor vehicle offenses.
Makes various changes to registration and community notification requirements under Megan's Law.
Requires certain services be prearranged before homeless person is relocated.
Provides public access to certain information received or possessed by legislators.
Establishes certain exceptions for emergency personnel operating personal watercraft while providing rescue services.
Requires disclosure of water damage prior to household appliance sales.
Requires Adjutant General to consider need for inpatient hospice care for admission to veterans' facilities; permits waiver of State residency requirement.
Provides supplemental enrollment growth aid to districts that experienced significant enrollment growth; appropriates $21,881,000 to DOE.

Requires appropriation of revenues collected in excess of amount anticipated for fiscal year for State hotel and motel occupancy fee for additional allocation among certain cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.
Establishes "County Tourism Incentive Grant Fund" within Department of Treasury to provide funding for grants to counties to support tourism advertising and promotion.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain seasonal employers.
Increases amounts municipalities may appropriate and grant for fire safety purposes.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.
Provides for involuntary commitment to treatment for substance use disorders.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement to prohibit certain deed restrictions limiting use of casino hotel facility properties.
Limits number of casino licenses issued to person.
Provides casino licensee must repay any grants received from State entity when casino hotel facility is not sold at fair market value and used for casino gambling.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to advertise and promote tours of breweries in the State.

Provides gross income tax credit for income derived from certain live performances contracted for and rendered by A-list performing artists within the Atlantic City Tourism District on a recurring basis and within the State.
Requires reimbursement of certain Casino Reinvestment Development Authority grants and payment of those grants to Atlantic County for property tax relief.
Requires certain funds paid to CRDA to be awarded to Atlantic County for property tax relief.
Authorizes establishment of regional economic development partnerships.
Requires corporations qualifying for certain State development subsidy grants to repay entire grant amount if corporation fails to uphold grant terms.
Requires oversight reporting on Hurricane Sandy recovery funds.
Lowers age of compulsory school attendance to age five and requires that all school districts establish kindergarten programs.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for employers who hire former prisoners.
Ends the estate tax and raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $350,000.
Requires notification to certain buyers of health club services of automatic renewal clauses in health club contracts.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on interacting with law enforcement as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Social Studies.

Provides that AG handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving person's death by law enforcement officer while acting in officer's official capacity or while in custody; requires trial in venue outside county where incident occurred.*

Provides for Attorney General to handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving death caused by law enforcement officer while in performance of officer's duties; requires officer indictment by State grand jury.
Establishes the "New Jersey Schedules That Work Act."
Applies local public contract bid threshold amounts to local pay to play and prevailing wage laws.
Prohibits sale of certain toy guns and imitation firearms.
Establishes "New Jersey Task Force on Abuse of Persons who are Elderly or Disabled."
Excludes from income for gross income tax and PAAD eligibility purposes victims' remuneration for involuntary internment received under judgments or settlement agreements.

Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison, Keansburg, and two joint urban enterprise zones, one in Cliffside Park and Fairview, and one in Buena Vista Township and Buena Borough.
Increases minimum wage for tipped workers.
Allows direct deposit of adoption subsidy payments.
Codifies additional options for the court to enforce court-ordered child support in certain cases.
Expands role of temporary guardian to include arranging placement of alleged incapacitated person in appropriate, less restrictive environment.
Creates the Office on Women's Research and Policy and appropriates $150,000.
Requires State Comptroller to perform compliance audit to verify municipal implementation of corrective action plan following performance audit.
Makes supplemental appropriation of up to $6.3 million to the Department of Health for certain grants to counties for women's health services.
Requires DHS to give priority to temporary rental assistance over use of hotels or motels in emergency assistance to Work First New Jersey recipients.
Establishes a partial return to work TDI program.
Concerns dissemination of wage and hour information for tipped workers.
Requires professional boards to provide for online processing of application for licensure or renewal.
Provides that school districts will present character awards to students during annual Week of Respect.

Requires institution of higher education to annually report total number of sexual assault and domestic violence allegations made by or against student to Attorney General and Secretary of Higher Education.
Prohibits disclosure of personal information pertaining to certain health care workers who are victims of assault; makes violation disorderly persons offense.
Requires combined reporting of corporation business tax by certain members of unitary business groups.
"New Jersey International Arbitration, Mediation, and Conciliation Act."
Prohibits sale of unsafe supplemental mattresses designed for children's products.
Makes humane officers for NJSPCA and county societies eligible for body armor grants.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Requires prosecutor to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Requires DEP to assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Increases personal needs allowance to $55 for low income persons residing in certain facilities.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
Extends penalties for driving under the influence to include any substance that impairs driving ability; deems driver's consent to non-invasive drug tests.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Ends the transitional energy facilities assessment, caps the State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures the balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Clarifies that harassment made anonymously or otherwise through electronic communication devices constitutes a petty disorderly offense.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Requires certain offenders to register under Megan's Law; upgrades the crimes of invasion of privacy and peering into a window of a dwelling for a second or subsequent offense.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Provides for mandatory terms of imprisonment for certain sexual assaults upon a minor; amends murder statute.
Provides for immediate driver's license suspension under certain circumstances.
Requires State to purchase certain vehicle tires and motor oils to minimize fuel usage.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.

Exempts transfer of ownership of real property between individual and business entity controlled by that individual from realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on transfer of ownership of certain real property.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Ends transitional energy facilities assessment (TEFA), caps State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Requires any individual seeking elective public office to disclose when filing petition of nomination whether he or she has been convicted of a criminal offense.
Allows CRDA to finance certain highway projects outside of Atlantic City Tourism District.
Allows certain drug dealing offenses to be graded by "units," rather than weight, of controlled dangerous substances.
Provides for payment to small municipalities, in certain cases, of certain penalty moneys assessed for violations of fish and game laws.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Exempts traffic summons records from public access under State's open public records law.
Requires private passenger automobile insurance buyer's guide to include both range of premium rate credit and actual dollar savings for coverage selections.
Excludes certain district boards of election poll workers from employee wage withholding and coverage under UI, TDI, and family disability leave insurance programs.

Authorizes AOC to assess, collect, and pay service charges and costs for electronic payment of fees and other obligations owed courts; prohibits defendants from using debit cards for bail and penalty payments for certain crimes.

Imposes oversight, cost analysis, and fee requirements for State contracts; includes State contract performance in conscientious employee protection act; limits to three years all State contracts; requires certain disclosures on State contracts.
Revises statutes governing qualifications and duties of notaries public and other notorial officers.
Requires State Comptroller to report findings of audit compliance reviews.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires State department, agency, authority, or instrumentality thereof to provide link on its website for members of public to submit complaints.
Provides for excused absences for public school students involved in election activities on day of general election under certain circumstances.
"Garden State Manufacturing Jobs Act."
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of certain compressed natural gas vehicles.
Requires each school district to annually submit interscholastic athletic opportunity report to the Commissioner of Education.
Requires pawnbrokers to file transaction reports online.
Prohibits awarding alimony to domestic violence offenders; permits termination of alimony based on conviction for crime or offense involving domestic violence.
Provides that routine foot care services covered under certain insurance policies include coverage of services provided by podiatric physicians.
Prohibits mortgage loan discrimination based on familial status.
Establishes new crime of domestic violence committed in the presence of a child.
Provides for background checks and other requirements for certain agencies providing temporary home for child or pregnant woman during crisis.
Permits a victim or witness of any age to testify by closed circuit television under certain circumstances in prosecutions for domestic violence, sexual assault, and certain other crimes.*
Revises distribution of Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Child Support Reform.
Revises criteria to establish base year for homestead property tax reimbursement after relocation.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Revises procedures concerning access to decedent's safe-deposit box.
Requires board of education to enter into agreement with law enforcement authorities regarding access to live video streams of public school buildings.
Allows for tri-weekly visits from parents or guardians of infants or toddlers under Division of Child Protection and Permanency care.
Requires DHS to use funds awarded from performance bonuses to increase staffing for processing certain applications and providing certain services.
Permits certain fire police units to appoint fire police officers.
Requires installation of grab bars in certain public restrooms.
Provides $21 minimum annual energy assistance to qualified families; qualifies families to receive additional nutritional assistance.
Revises certain laws concerning domestic violence and firearms.
Requires criminal history record background check for rifle and shotgun purchases.
Establishes Behavioral Mental Health Advisory Board in Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services in DHS.
Requires DHS to take action to raise public awareness of privacy laws that prevent disclosure of health care enrollment information to immigration authorities.
Requires DHS to create English and Spanish-language Internet websites to promote enrollment in affordable health care plans.

Makes various changes to civil service; permits institution of temporary layoffs; permits government entities to opt-out of civil service; requires civil service examinations be offered on continual basis.
Requires HIV testing for pregnant women and marriage license applicants.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Restores the death penalty for persons who commit certain murders.
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes.
Individual's status as minor may not disqualify him from bone marrow donation if medical criteria and informed consent requirements are met.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
Provides tax credits to companies contributing to loan and loan redemption program for residents who attend institutions of higher education in the State and work at such a company upon graduation.
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Increases penalties for injuring school crossing guard or student pedestrian in crosswalk.
Clarifies that crime victim has a right to make a victim impact statement directly to the defendant at sentencing.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights and Property Tax Reduction Act."
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Allows counties and municipalities to use open space trust funds for remediation of collapsed mine shafts and sinkholes on property owned by county or municipality.
Increases amount of, and income limit for eligibility to receive, senior citizens' and disabled persons' property tax deduction.
Increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $5 million over period of five years.
Prohibits existing child care subsidy recipient from being treated as a new applicant for subsidy after moving to a new county of residence.
Limits number of bills member of Legislature may introduce; requires every bill to be heard in committee; requires estimate be prepared of cost of drafting and considering each bill.
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain services performed to manufacturing equipment.
Requires MVC to accept death certificate as proof of name change.

Exempts transfers of property to Class C beneficiaries from transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount under estate tax to $5,000,000 over five-year period.
Allows municipalities to acquire and sell inactive plenary retail consumption licenses.
Establishes Class Three special law enforcement officers to provide security in public and nonpublic schools.
Establishes criminal penalties for unlawful control over weapons of any law enforcement officer and interference with equipment or duties of law enforcement officers and emergency services personnel.
Establishes Office of Economic Research in Department of State.
Requires local units to recover contributions under Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program paid in excess of statutory limit; requires annual audits.
Expands acceptable military separation forms for county veteran identification card; allows issuance to National Guard veterans of other states; allows issuance only for certain classifications.

"Save New Jersey Electric and Gas Public Utility Customer Service and Call Center Jobs Act"; requires notification by electric and gas utilities when relocating customer and call centers out of State.
"Government Energy Reliability and Savings Public-Private Partnership Act."
Allows use of master meter system in residential dwellings under certain conditions.
Revises restrictions for Internet access by sex offenders. *
"Higher Education Citizenship Equality Act;" defines domicile for dependent students for the purpose of eligibility for State student loans, grants, or scholarships and resident tuition rate.
Establishes Meadowlands Flood Advisory Task Force.
Requires State Board of Education regulations regarding school nurse certification to include certain minimum eligibility requirements.
Requires school bus transporting students using wheelchairs to be equipped with four-point securement system; requires school bus operator or aide to secure students using wheelchairs.*
Prohibits sale of prepaid and wireless telephone service and equipment unless certain buyer information is recorded.
Increases age for helmet requirement for bicycling, roller skating, and skateboarding to 17 and younger; extends helmet requirement to ice skaters and operators of non-motorized scooters.
Requires notification to Division of Child Protection and Permanency upon arrest of child's primary caregiver.
Revises grades and sentencing determinations for certain controlled dangerous substances.
Designates Black Swallowtail butterfly as State Butterfly.
Establishes per se standard for driving under influence of inhalant; designated as "Kimmie's Law."
Prohibits knowingly selling or planting certain invasive plant species.
Reestablishes crime of incest; criminalizes knowingly marrying or entering into civil union, or engaging in sexual activity, with certain family members.
Expands implied consent statute to include urine testing.
Directs the removal of certain records from domestic violence central registry.
Requires proof of ownership to register off-road vehicle.
Increases county prosecutor salaries by set amount over multiple years, and thereafter provides for annual salary cost of living adjustment.
Requires certain new residential buildings to have fire barriers in cocklofts, concrete or steel frames, and fire stops.
Permits newly created regional school districts or enlarging regional school districts to determine apportionment methodology for their boards of education on basis other than population.
"Student Digital Privacy and Parental Rights Act."
Revises penalties for certain violations of law by public movers and warehousemen.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2012"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Increases penalties for committing serious offenses while released on bail.
Requires police notification when driver license is suspended.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Recodifies offenses against animals under State criminal code; increases degree of crime for certain offenses.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Permits use of overseas absentee ballots for all elections.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on lawn fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Extends eligibility for certain veterans' benefits to members of reserve components of US Armed Forces and NJ organized militia who serve at least 180 continuous days.
Exempts senior citizens and blind or disabled persons from certain realty transfer fees.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from working in ice cream trucks and amusement parks.
Directs DHSS to adopt regulations prohibiting overcrowding of animals in kennels, pet shops and other retail establishments; establishes penalties.
Authorizes special parking insignias for passenger automobiles used to transport the developmentally disabled.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for marinas and boatyards that follow certain environmentally sound management practices.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.

Establishes bribery in official and political matters applies to person soliciting, accepting, or agreeing to accept benefit as consideration to act even though not yet in office or otherwise qualified to act.
Permits consolidation of all fire districts in a municipality; sets forth procedure for consolidation.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid via E-ZPass.
Establishes mandatory penalties for committing burglary and theft during a state of emergency.
Directs BPU to study whether State's electric distribution system meets certain standards.
Prohibits public utility from filing rate increase petition under certain circumstances.
Increases criminal penalties if leaving loaded firearm within easy access of minor results in injury or death.
Requires mortgage lenders to maintain vacant, age-restricted dwelling units during foreclosure.
Requires prescribers and pharmacists to check prescription monitoring program prior to prescribing and dispensing Schedule II drugs.
Establishes standard of review for certain juvenile waiver motions.
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Requires certain NJ Transit Corporation employees to undergo criminal history background checks and wear photo identification.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Concerns valuation of property condemned for dune construction or beach replenishment.
Excludes certain public works contracts related to Hurricane Sandy recovery from prevailing wage requirements.
Omits State Police detectives from Open Public Records Act.
Requires installation of emergency power supply systems to certain common areas of new planned real estate developments; provides related tax incentives.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Clarifies that fishing license is not required to fish at a private community lake.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.

Prohibits utility from billing customer for costs incurred for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure; allows costs for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure be recovered in utility's rate base.
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to taxpayers contributing to scholarships for low-income children.
Exempts military personnel receiving combat zone pay from the gross income tax.
Establishes penalties for manufacture, purchase or possession of certain keys.
Upgrades lewdness to fourth degree crime if committed in public rest room.
Establishes training wage.
Requires criminal history record background checks on certain volunteer sports personnel.
Clarifies powers of public safety directors.
Exempts certain volunteer emergency service organizations from charitable contribution filing fees.
Provides that person who impersonates law enforcement officer and commits crime is guilty of third degree crime.
Requires all new State buildings to have solar or geothermal energy systems, where feasible.
Designates portion of New Jersey Route No. 34 in Wall Township as the "Duncan Thecker Memorial Highway."
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Criminalizes participation in criminal street gang.

Permits municipality to use proceeds of beach access fees for areas near beach facilities that are significantly affected by beach tourism; requires municipality to provide explanation of expenditures on website.
Requires health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for diagnosis, evaluation and treatment of lymphedema.
Protects home addresses of law enforcement officers from being released by governmental entities.
Revises "Contractors' Registration Act" to include water remediation services.
Establishes fourth degree crime of possessing firearms locator application; enhances penalty if such application is used in theft of firearm.
Makes revisions to the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Prohibits administration of standardized assessments not required under State or federal law.
Allows parent, guardian, or adult student to prevent disclosure of student information to certain entities.
Requires Commissioner of Education to develop lists of approved testing vendors and commercially-developed standardized assessments for use by public school districts.
Grants full police status to special agents in the Department of the Treasury; authorizes special agents to carry firearms at all times.
Imposes conditions on drivers approaching disabled vehicles displaying warning lights.
Establishes Office of Tourism Research; requires specific measures concerning tourism advertising, marketing, research, and tourism-related business training.
Authorizes creation of Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation license plates.
Establishes "Superstorm Sandy Homeowners Protection Act."
"New Jersey Small Business Retirement Marketplace Act."
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Establishes Distressed Cemetery Maintenance and Preservation Fund.
Increases minimum wage.
Provides enhanced penalties for certain crimes when victim is 65 years of age or older, or disabled.
Requires ATM independent sales organizations to provide certain withdrawal options.
Requires criminal history record check of school district volunteers.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain reasonable and safe distance when overtaking pedestrians and certain bicycles.
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Creates self-defense justification for victims of domestic violence.
Amends law concerning application, sale, and use of fertilizer to exempt organic fertilizer from certain requirements.
Concerns regulation of solid waste, hazardous waste, and recycling industries.
Concerns combined sewer overflows; establishes Combined Sewer Overflow Solutions Fund; exempts improvements thereto from 2% property tax cap; and appropriates $5 million.
Authorizes creation of stormwater utilities for certain local government entities.
The "Green Building and Infrastructure Tax Credit Act"; provides tax credits for certain green buildings and wood utility poles.

Requires owner or operator of industrial establishment applying for de minimis exemption from "Industrial Site Recovery Act" to certify as to no actual knowledge of contamination exceeding remediation standards.
"Comprehensive Regulated Grease Recycling Act."
Provides certain exemptions from sales and use tax for hybrid electric vehicles, compressed natural gas vehicles, and equipment used for refueling or recharging certain vehicles.
Requires DEP to update Shore Protection Master Plan.

Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge expelled from a public sewer system or public sewage treatment plant are not hazardous substances for purposes of "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Requires use of constitutionally dedicated moneys to fund conversion of certain diesel vehicles to compressed natural gas, liquefied petroleum gas, or electric vehicles.
Increases penalties for careless driving when violation results in injury or death to pedestrian.
The "Preserve New Jersey Act of 2013"; implements constitutional dedication of sales tax revenue for open space, including flood prone areas, farmland, and historic preservation purposes.
Imposes water consumption and diversion user fees to fund open space and farmland preservation projects.
Concerns environmental permits in burdened communities.
Requires consideration of increased property value due to dune construction in determining compensation provided for condemned beachfront property.

Permits fifth and sixth class counties to assume control and responsibility for operation and maintenance of beaches bordering Atlantic Ocean unless control and responsibility are reserved by a municipality.
Repeals law providing CAFRA permit exemption for certain grading or excavation of a dune.

Provides exemption for commercial and institutional solid waste generators from source separation requirements of municipal recycling ordinances if recyclable materials are otherwise recycled pursuant to certain conditions and requirements.
The "Emergency Disaster Relief Act of 2013"; appropriates $100 million.
Establishes "Environmental Justice Advisory Council."
Requires PANYNJ to conduct noise and land use compatibility survey.
Requires paint producers to implement or participate in paint stewardship program.
The "Green Acres, Water Supply and Floodplain Protection, and Farmland and Historic Preservation Bond Act of 2014," authorizes bonds for $200 million; appropriates $5,000.
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.
Requires video cameras at certain ATMs.
Establishes an animal abuser registration system.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10 million to DCA for Lead Hazard Control Assistance Fund.
Makes various changes to the "Law Against Discrimination"; repeals section 4 of P.L.1985, c.73.
Provides for 30-day period for filing notice of appeal on matters adjudicated in municipal courts.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Sunsets "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" five years after date of enactment unless certain conditions are met.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Increases filing threshold and the applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Requires voter registration forms be made available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license.
Repeals the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote."

Provides municipality with affordable housing credit toward its municipal fair share housing obligation for funds transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund pursuant to P.L.2008, c.46.
Provides procedures for crediting certain dwellings used by agricultural workers in determination of municipality's fair share housing obligation.
"Property Assessment Appeal Transparency Act"; revises content of required annual notification of real property assessment.
Eliminates prohibition against purchasing more than one handgun in calendar month.
Prohibits release of illegal immigrants from correctional facilities.
Requires preschool tuition rates equal actual cost per pupil.

Allows qualifying counties and municipalities to become "agriculture development counties" and "agriculture development municipalities" and provides certain associated resulting benefits therefrom to encourage, protect, and preserve agriculture and related businesses.
Allows law enforcement agencies to utilize electronic signatures on police reports; requires Attorney General to adopt uniform guidelines.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Prohibits false or secret compartments in motor vehicles under certain circumstances.
Criminalizes purchase or possession of firearms ammunition by persons convicted of certain crimes.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Requires youth sports team organizations or cheerleading programs to implement written head injury policies.
Requires halfway house employees to complete police training course.
Transfers probation employees from Judiciary to State Parole Board.
Provides for issuance of a uniform identification card for all law enforcement officers.
Modifies powers and allocation of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Prohibits lawyers and law firms who lobby public entity from simultaneous employment or contract with that public entity.
Establishes Office of State Dental Director and New Jersey Oral Health Commission.
Grants certain employment protections to campus police officers.
Upgrades crime of assault against certain public employees to aggravated assault in certain circumstances.
Requires notification of local law enforcement prior to expungement of certain mental health records of prospective firearms purchasers.
Establishes licensure for associate marriage and family therapists.
Prohibits business receiving State development subsidies from making certain campaign contributions.
Confers civil service status on police officers employed by Rutgers University.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities by qualified business that result in net positive benefit to the State.
Provides for jurisdiction for prosecution for certain crimes against minors committed outside New Jersey.
Imposes certain requirements on telephone service contracts for inmates in certain correctional facilities.*
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to include crime victims as protected status.
Revises definition of victim in "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Prohibits victims from being charged certain costs and fees and clarifies victims' right to obtain certain interviews.
Expands rights of crime victims.
Authorizes Victims of Crime Compensation Office to make payment for relocation expenses of certain witnesses of crimes.
Modifies performance and maintenance guarantee requirements under "Municipal Land Use Law."
Establishes commission to approve personaliized handguns; requires firearm retailers to sell personalized handguns.*
Permits increase in municipal free public library tax upon voter approval.
Requires use of direct deposit and Internet for State, local government, and school district employee compensation and certain retirement payments and information.
Permits counties to charge a fee to fund infrastructure through voter approval.
Requires disclosure of original purchase price for land to be sold to a county, county agriculture development board, or municipality for farmland preservation purposes.
Authorizes Division of Travel and Tourism to accept gifts and grants to promote NJ tourism.
Authorizes NJ Historical Commission to establish program to promote developing historic projects on website and collect donations for projects on behalf of historic site or organization.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism and NJ Historical Commission to provide volunteer opportunities on Internet website.
Requires omnibus drivers to inspect bus at end of route for passengers with disabilities.
Provides that parent of nonpublic school pupil who lives more than 20 miles from school will receive payment toward transportation costs.
Prohibits local government agency from employing person on paid leave from local government agency of another county or municipality.
Prohibits sale of food and beverage packaging and containers made with bisphenol A.
Requires BPU to establish Energy Efficiency Leadership awards program.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit disadvantaged or minority men to teach in certain failing schools under alternate route program.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain expenses paid or incurred for care and support of qualifying senior family member; designated as Caregiver's Assistance Act.
Establishes public awareness campaign advising pregnant women, new parents, and women who are breast feeding about dangers of casual milk sharing.
Provides for licensure of human milk banks.
Requires coverage of medication therapy management in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare.
"Wage Transparency Act"; requires reporting of public contractor employment information.
"Unfair Wage Recovery Act"; provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected.
Concerns earned sick leave.
Expands infertility coverage under certain health insurance plans.
Establishes Council of Women in Higher Education in Department of State to study and promote women's issues within institutions of higher education.
Requires DHS to develop timeline for use by individuals with developmental disabilities to gain benefit of State and federal programs; requires posting timeline on DHS, DCF, and DOE websites.

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Permits small, women owned, or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers or planning areas to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.
"Lactation Consultants Licensing Act."

Requires each school district with middle school or high school to establish food services advisory committee to consider menu options that reflect students' cultural, traditional, and dietary preferences.
Provides for Medicaid coverage of comprehensive tobacco cessation services and prohibits certain restrictions on coverage.
Establishes "Right to Try Act" permitting terminally ill patients to access investigational drugs and treatment.
The "New Jersey Intern Protection Act"; provides legal protections and remedies for persons engaged in internships with employers.
Provides for Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare coverage and reimbursement for health care services provided through telemedicine.
Requires hospitals and birthing centers to provide parents of newborns with information on health insurance coverage for newborn children.
"The Child and Family Suicide Prevention Act;" requires training related to screening for suicide prevention for pediatricians, physician assistants, and advanced practice nurses.
Increases reporting requirements for the NJ Basic Skills Training Program for Economic Growth.
Establishes Pedestrian and Bicycle Safety Study Advisory Council.*
Establishes school breakfast kiosk pilot program.
Establishes New Jersey Caregiver Task Force to evaluate and provide recommendations on caregiver support services.
Authorizes health care practitioners to provide health care services through telemedicine.
Ensures equal rights and opportunities for pregnant students in institutions of higher education.*
Prohibits institutions of higher education from requiring students who have children to purchase meal plans, live in on-campus housing, or pay gym fees.

Prohibits institution of higher education that provides child care from charging student-parent who receives child care voucher under "New Jersey Cares for Kids Program" an amount for child care in excess of voucher amount.
Requires institutions of higher education to inquire about student's marital and parental status.
Requires health benefits coverage for juvenile depression screenings.
Requires health benefits coverage for donated human breast milk under certain conditions.
