Requires HMFA to establish "Sustainable Tiny Home Pilot Program" in three regions of State; appropriates $5 million.
Requires Division of Developmental Disabilities to make comprehensive list of its programs available to public.
Clarifies that the domestic pigeon (Rock Pigeon) is not protected by law.
Provides that, upon request of applicant, change of name would be confidential and not constitute public record.
Requires municipalities comprised within regional school districts to share certain payments received in lieu of taxes with counties and regional school districts.
Provides for establishment of publicly-funded education savings accounts for use at educational institutions other than public elementary and secondary schools.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain contributions to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) program.
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Permits developer to qualify for low-interest loan from NJEDA when building a high performance green building.
Permits water supply service and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings to promote water conservation.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
"Plastic Container Recycling Enhancement Act."
"Water Supply Open Space, Farmland and Historic Preservation Trust Fund Act."

Requires installation of operational automatic rain sensor on lawn sprinklers as condition of sale and on lawn sprinklers on commercial, retail or industrial property and in common interest communities within specified timeframes.
The "Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Bars certain officials from elective office and political activity for certain time periods.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $2,700,000 to DCA for Neighborhood Preservation Program.
The "Renewable Energy District Financing Act."
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.
"Ocean County Stormwater Management System Demonstration Act."
Provides $3,000 gross income tax deduction for certain taxpayers providing home care for an elderly relative.
Modifies requirements for local unit to dissolve certain authorities.
Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.

Increase gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable years 2011 and 2012 and expands gross income tax exclusion for pensions, annuities and other retirement income for certain taxpayers beginning in 2011.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to, or purchases of credits from, federally qualified tuition program.

Requires Governor to make temporary appointment when vacancy occurs in U.S. Senate; requires appointee be member of same political party as person vacating office since beginning of that term; eliminates special election option.
Reestablishes and revises public contract set-aside program.
Requires State to pay expenses associated with nonpartisan municipal elections.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.
Increases renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements under "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Creates Highlands Conservation Trust to preserve land in Highlands Region, and authorizes Highlands conservation license plate to raise revenue therefor.
"New Jersey Transit Villages Act."
Clarifies procedures for closing active child protective services cases.
The "Retrofitted Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Establishes forest stewardship program for State-owned lands.
Concerning the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Requires assisted living residences to have standby emergency power generators.
Requires health insurers and State Health Benefits Commission to provide coverage for posttraumatic stress disorder under same conditions as other sickness.
Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge do not constitute hazardous substances under "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Directs BPU to study feasibility of adopting certain requirements for installation of new and replacement electric distribution utility poles and transmission towers.
Establishes criteria and requirements for shore protection project priority list and funding from Shore Protection Fund.
Establishes pilot program in Edison Township requiring Attorney General to perform police internal affairs functions.
Creates a civil cause of action for stalking.
Adds conviction of unlawfully possessing weapon to list of crimes that statutorily prohibits someone from buying or owning firearm.
Limits forum of certain consumer contract disputes to New Jersey.*
Permits layoff plans as substitute for employment reconciliation plans for joint meetings or shared service agreements under certain circumstances.
Requires builders of new homes to provide owners with building plans.
Clarifies DCA's authority to ensure planned real estate development builders comply with disclosure requirements.
Requires developer under "The Planned Real Estate Full Disclosure Act" to post bond with DCA and provides for more accountability to owners in common interest community.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.

Clarifies and strengthens disclosure requirements for certain complimentary tickets received by candidates, officeholders, political party officials, political committees and continuing political committees.

Authorizes the Legislative Counsel in the Office of Legislative Services to accept proper and sufficient service of process on behalf of the State Legislature when either or both Houses are named defendants in any legal proceeding.
Changes date for election of fire district commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of general election.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.

Prohibits contributions by administrator of Type II school district to candidates for member of district's school board; restricts employment by Type II school district of contributors to election campaign of member of district's school board.
Permits tax credit against gross income tax for certain adoption expenses.
Concerns debarment of contractors for conviction of certain computer-related crimes.
Requires foreign corporations providing electronic communication services or remote computing services to comply with New Jersey subpoenas, court orders and search warrants.
Revises child pornography law.
Excuses students with conflicts of conscience from certain class requirements of public institutions of higher education.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Requires certain conditions affecting application for development or zoning variance to be recorded with municipality and county.
Allows New Jersey S corporations to elect to transfer corporation business tax credits to shareholders to apply against the shareholders' gross income tax liability.
Requires municipal governing bodies and boards of education to provide sufficient time for all requested public comment at open public meetings.
Allows victims and relatives to witness parole hearings.
Requires hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Establishes net operating loss carryback deduction under corporation business tax.
Gives Director subpoena powers in administration of Division of Pensions and Benefits.
Clarifies that first aid, ambulance or rescue squads, as entities, have immunity from civil damages in certain circumstances.
Authorizes special Support Our Veterans license plate with proceeds supporting New Jersey homeless veteran's centers.
Provides employers with various tax incentives for hiring persons with disabilities under insurance premiums tax, corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Prohibits the use of drones by law enforcement entities.
Authorizes design professionals to self-certify construction plans.
Allows person under age of 16 to operate power vessel with parental supervision.
Clarifies that electronic public records do not have to be converted to different electronic formats under the State's open public records law.
Changes records custodian liability threshold; creates natural disaster exemption.
Clarifies that chief of police or Superintendent of State Police has burden of proving applicant's disqualification for permit to purchase handgun or firearms purchaser identification card.
Upgrades domestic violence-related assault to crime of the fourth degree; upgrades second or subsequent offense to crime of the third degree.
Requires certain health care professionals to complete continuing education courses regarding issues related to prescription opioids.
Permits educational organizations to conduct bingo games with prizes for participating students under certain circumstances.
Establishes the State Debt Capacity Advisory Commission.
"Transparency in Government Act"; provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Eliminates salary for part-time members of certain boards, commissions, and independent authorities.
Provides for priority consideration, by State, of permit applications by counties and municipalities with 10 or more shared services.
Requires interpretive statements of State general obligation bond act public questions to include certain fiscal information.
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.

Prohibits legislative aide who works, or worked, directly for legislator in district office from making political contribution greater than $30 per election to that legislator; prohibits receipt of such contribution.
"The New Jersey Healthcare Choice Act"; permits health insurers licensed in other states to provide coverage in New Jersey under certain circumstances.
Allows residents of certain Highlands municipalities to designate on gross income tax returns that a portion of gross income tax paid be returned to municipality of residence.
Caps noneconomic damages in medical malpractice actions at $250,000.
Excludes overtime pay of certain employees from gross income tax.
"Prenatally and Postnatally Diagnosed Conditions Awareness Act in New Jersey."
Prohibits wrongful life/birth suits.
Establishes procedure for notification to, and review by, municipalities of certain grant and loan applications for acquisition or development of lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Re-establishes 6.37 percent as top marginal gross income tax rate.
Places restrictions on unsolicited school budget communications sent by a board of education to school district residents 90 days prior to annual school election.
"Medical Philanthropy Act"; provides physicians who provide uncompensated care with $250,000 cap on noneconomic damages in actions alleging medical malpractice.
"Education Investment Act"; establishes an equity financing for education program at certain public institutions of higher education.
Allows Governor to remove an executive county superintendent of schools at will.
Provides civil immunity to licensed health care professionals who provide care at health care facilities for no compensation.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers and additional modifications of the charter school program.
Eliminates public school district budget reduction appeals to the Commissioner of Education.

"Home-Based Jobs Creation Act"; classifies certain home businesses as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing, or retailing activities.
Prohibits dual elective office holding and holding of elective office and public office or position.
"School Children First Act"; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires principal consent for teacher placement; eliminates certain seniority rights.
The "Digital Impersonation Prevention Act."
Consolidates all categories of gross income for cross-claiming of net losses and allows 20 year loss carryforward under the New Jersey gross income tax; repeals alternate business income calculation.
Increases interest rate paid on certain overdue refunds of tax overpayments.
Prohibits terminal leave compensation for local government employees.
Restricts sale and use of remaining State-owned portion of Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital property in Morris County.
Prohibits elected local government officers from accepting employment with law firm for a period of time if officer voted to award local government contract to firm.
Excludes certain Medicaid income from gross income tax.
Limits liability for operators of buildings, facilities, or premises for certain sports, games, and amusement activities.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
Requires sex offenders to note criminal status on social network accounts.
Authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoir levels prior to certain severe weather events.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from serving on political party committees.
Simplifies the certification process for out-of-State teachers.

Removes requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal; requires certain novice drivers submit motor vehicle information to chief administrator.
Expands authority of emergency management departments in requesting assistance outside normal territorial jurisdictions.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Requires counties to fix curbs and surrounding areas when damaged during county road projects.
Upgrades burglary of a residence to a crime of the second degree; requires mandatory period of parole ineligibility if residence was occupied at time of offense.
Expands list of crimes with bail restriction to include gun related crimes with mandatory minimum terms of imprisonment under "Graves Act."
Allows courts to issue restraining orders prohibiting persons charged with firearms and gang related offenses from entering premises, locations, or areas where the offense occurred.
Establishes Office of River Maintenance in DEP; repeals P.L.1993, c.376 concerning stream cleaning activities.
Requires condominium and homeowners' associations to provide information to federal home loan insurance providers at no cost to potential buyers.
Modernizes business filing statutes to include entity conversion and domestication.
Clarifies law authorizing application of reciprocal limitations against businesses from states that give in-state preference in awarding public contracts.
Concerns proof of workers' compensation coverage with certain legally required annual reports of employers.

Permits certain individuals not appointed pursuant to will to control funeral and disposition of human remains of decedent and requires executor to provide notification of appointment and other information to appointee.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.
Makes various changes to law governing raffles; requires Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission to create online reporting system and develop single license for conducting multiple games.
Requires Passaic Valley Water Commission to obtain approval of certain municipalities before entering into certain contracts concerning open-air reservoirs.
Establishes practice driving requirements for examination and special learner's permit holders.
Bars domestic violence defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.
Stipulates that retail motor fuel dealers, when paying interchange fees, shall not be charged for costs associated with certain taxes.
Establishes the offense of incest.
Requires evaluation of appropriateness of light frame construction for multiple dwellings and imposes moratorium on light frame construction until determination and recommendations are adopted.
"Madison Holleran Proper Reporting Act"; requires institutions of higher education to post information on student suicides and attempted suicides on website.
"Madison Holleran Suicide Prevention Act"; requires institutions of higher education to have individuals who focus on reducing student suicides and attempted suicides available 24 hours a day.*
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement leak detection programs.
Makes reforms to mental health treatment; clarifies law governing purchase of firearms by persons with history of mental illness.
Authorizes use of tracking dog to search for and recover wild deer during prescribed hunting season.
Provides sales and use tax exclusion for charges for student parking provided by certain colleges and universities.
Permits police departments to donate unclaimed bicycles to nonprofit organizations.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of natural gas, and charges for transportation or transmission of natural gas, to public colleges and universities.
Requires law enforcement be notified of application to expunge mental commitment record.
Provides for notice to schools of court-ordered domestic violence restraints restricting contact in schools; increases penalty for violation of such orders.
Provides for use of alternative dispute resolution to settle disagreements between State agencies concerning public works projects.
Requires use of pervious concrete by State agencies under certain circumstances.
Restricts occupancy of dwelling unit in age-restricted community to older adults following resale.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Requires BPU to issue written decision concerning utility rate increase approvals to public via its website.
Revises requirements related to public hearings on proposed public utility rate increases.
Codifies DEP's New Jersey Recycling Awards Program to annually recognize outstanding recycling achievements.
Provides counties and municipalities with additional discretion when leasing public land for agricultural or horticultural use.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for businesses that employ apprentices in DOL registered apprenticeships.
Requires DOE to include military-connected student identifier in student-level database; requires district inform teacher when military-connected student enrolls in class taught by teacher.
Requires MVC to refund certain motor vehicle registration fees.
Revises timeframes for issuance of certain construction permits by DEP in 90 days.
Prohibits use of light frame construction in certain municipalities; establishes fire safety protocols for light frame construction projects.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and cyber-harassment under certain circumstances.
Provides for appointment to board of directors of New Jersey Automobile Insurance Risk Exchange by Commissioner of Banking and Insurance.
The "Health Care Provider Network Transparency Act"; establishes requirements for granting access to certain health care provider discounts.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million.

Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for recipients of Medicaid and Supplemental Security Income who are veterans or spouses of veterans and provides for annual cost-of-living increase in allowance.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for bond ordinances approved by counties and municipalities.
Requires electric public utilities to provide priority power restoration to certain medical facilities, assisted living facilities, and nursing homes.
Requires insurers writing homeowners insurance policies in the State to offer certain coverage for heating oil tanks.
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Permits counties to share county tax administrators.
Expands definition of "acquisition," for purposes of county and municipal open space trust funds, to include demolition, removal of debris, and restoration of lands being acquired.
Establishes Center for the Study of Health Care Billing Data.
Adds to property tax levy cap exclusions increases in flood insurance premiums.
Directs Attorney General to establish a criminal firearms recovery clearing house.
Requires local governments and authorities to obtain financing cost estimate from NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust for certain projects.*
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for State student financial aid programs.
Establishes a joint legislative and executive branch New Jersey Revenue Advisory Board to provide consensus revenue forecasting advice for State budget purposes.
Regulates deed procurement services.
Requires health care provider participating in carrier network to give notice to covered person of provider's referral to out-of-network provider.
"Uncompensated Pending Medicaid Beneficiary Payment Relief Act"; provides compensation relief to nursing facilities when resident's Medicaid eligibility determination is delayed more than 90 days.
Creates exclusion from municipal property tax levy cap for amounts necessary to provide required matching funds to qualify for grants and other funds.
Permits service of parking tickets by mail.
Establishes "breakfast after the bell" incentive fund.
Requires DCA to make information on homeless prevention programs and services available on its Internet website.
Makes changes to procedures used by medical examiners for autopsies or dissections performed over religious objections.
Expands eligibility of inmates for medical parole and requires inmate's enrollment in Medicaid under certain circumstances.
Requires development and maintenance of data dashboard report to advise of open bed availability in residential facilities providing behavioral health services.
Requires DLPS to establish and make available to law enforcement agencies cultural diversity training materials and online tutorial.*

Limits payments under health benefits plans to in-network amounts in certain circumstances; prohibits out-of-network health providers from charging carriers more than 150 percent of Medicare rate in certain circumstances.
Creates Clinical Trials Working Group.
Establishes uniform timelines for charter schools to accept applications, conduct lottery, and notify parents of students' acceptance.
Permits charter school to limit admission to single gender, students at-risk of academic failure, students with disabilities, or English language learners.
Establishes New Jersey Commission on Higher Education and Business Partnerships.
Modifies process for renewals and revocations of charters under which charter schools operate.
Establishes Office of Student Loan Ombudsman; regulates student loan servicers.
Prioritizes investment of State administered pension funds in in-state infrastructure project investments over comparable out-of-state infrastructure project investments.
Establishes "Neighborhood Solar Energy Investment Program."
Prohibits the construction of school facilities on a contaminated or remediated site.
Prohibits sale of emergency warning lights to unauthorized motorists.
Increases penalties for unauthorized display or use of emergency warning lights.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Prohibits implementation of formula-based rates for sewerage authorities and electric, gas and water public utilities.
Revises procedure for removal of municipal administrator by municipal council; provides for payment of balance of salary to municipal administrator upon removal.
Establishes crime for adult to misrepresent age in order to join youth serving organization.
Exempts sheltered workshops from disclosure and fingerprinting requirements for certain solid waste operations.
Establishes crime of using blue lights or other insignia on vehicle to impersonate law enforcement authority.
Establishes fine for committing motor vehicle offense that results in collision with bicyclist.
Requires public utilities to mail customers detailed explanation of rate settlement agreements prior to final BPU vote.
Requires public utilities to provide customers notice of request for increase in rates; revises requirements related to hearings on proposed rate increases.
Gives priority status for connection of solar photovoltaic systems for customer-generators who are public entities.
Allows New Jersey Board of Massage and Bodywork Therapy to accept alternative proof of education for licensure of current practitioners.
Requires public utilities to provide priority service to public schools, private schools, and public safety agencies.
Allows fire district elections to be moved to November; eliminates certain fire district budget referenda; and eliminates certain fire district capital purchase referenda.
Requires certain CATV companies issued system-wide franchise agreement to make CATV service available throughout its franchise area.

Prohibits expenditure of State funds through private organizations to promote patriotism and honor members of Armed Forces, including National Guard and Reserve Component, at sporting events in New Jersey.
Requires DOBI to develop system to require carriers to consult with health care providers on tiered network managed care plans.
Establishes fees for daily and annual permits to sell alcoholic beverages at farm markets.
Requires interior light of motor vehicle be turned on when stopped by law enforcement under certain circumstances.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special horse racing permit for steeplechase races; allows wagering on such races.
Establishes certain requirements for a State entity planting vegetation in certain circumstances; provides for preferences for NJ businesses providing such vegetation.
Requires certain gas companies to use existing right-of-way when constructing new transmission lines where practicable and to seek consent of municipalities prior to initiating certain projects.
Designated as "Protection of Fetuses from Dismemberment Abortion Act"; prohibits dismemberment abortions.
Requires BPU to allow public comment at public meetings; establishes requirements for public meetings concerning installation of natural gas conductors and related facilities.
Prohibits placement of certain intrastate natural gas pipelines within 100 feet of buildings.
"Pain-Capable Fetus Protection Act"; bans abortion 20 weeks or more after fertilization.
Suspends fines for certain first-time paperwork violations committed by small businesses.
Establishes criminal penalties for physicians who fail to provide certain information prior to performing abortion procedure involving donation of cadaveric fetal tissue.
Provides religious exemption for clergy and religious organizations concerning same-sex marriages and civil unions.
Prohibits municipal ordinance to create sanctuary city; Establishes State and local employee ethics violation upon noncompliance with federal immigration enforcement request.
Expands crime of bias intimidation to include law enforcement officers.
Enhances oversight of Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program; requires annual audits.
Increases criminal penalties for selling fetal tissue and requires documentation of costs associated with processing, transportation, and storage.
Permits construction of natural gas transmission lines on areas of preserved farmland already subject to existing utility easements under certain circumstances.
Deems dispute between local government and pipeline operator concerning danger posed by certain natural gas pipelines as contested case.

Requires BPU to hold public hearings on certain proposed intrastate natural gas pipelines; requires pipeline operator to provide written notice to property owners located within blast area of certain proposed intrastate natural gas pipelines.
Prioritizes applications for firearms purchaser identification cards, permits to purchase a handgun, and permits to carry a handgun under certain circumstances.
Permits Adjutant General to authorize members of NJ National Guard to carry firearm at recruiting centers.
Authorizes persons serving overseas in military to be married or enter into civil union by video conference or other electronic means.
Allows for relocation of approved residual dwelling site opportunities on preserved farmland under certain circumstances.

Clarifies protections and establishes requirements for certain activities and events hosted or conducted by limited brewery licensees on preserved farmland; requires adoption of agricultural management practices therefor.
Establishes "Local Safe Corridor Fund"; increases penalties on roadway designated as local safe corridor and dedicates funds to local safe corridor safety initiatives.
Updates corporation business tax reporting, reduces tax sheltering, and improves tax enforcement by requiring related corporations to file combined tax return using "water's edge" approach.
Establishes centralized, Statewide registry and auditing system for court-appointed guardians.
Addresses elder abuse in domestic settings under "Prevention of Domestic Violence Act of 1991."
Permits municipality to charge public utility fee to cover full cost of traffic control services that municipality deemed necessary due to emergency work performed by public utility.
Prohibits enforcement of foreign law if enforcement would violate constitutional rights or conflict with federal or State law.
Requires BPU to designate certain natural gas transmission lines as interstate natural gas transmission extension lines.
Reduces the alcoholic beverage excise tax rate on liquor, wine, vermouth, sparkling wine, and hard cider and eliminates the dedication of that tax to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Removes plenary retail distribution license limit for certain stores.
Establishes limited retail religious distribution license.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Decreases the premium receipts tax for surplus lines insurance coverage.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $2 per day.
Authorizes State constitutional convention to reform system of property taxation; makes appropriation.
Provides that the State Board of Examiners may not charge a fee for the issuance of credentials required to serve as a substitute school nurse.
Eliminates the 1% fee, and the 1% tax, on purchasers of Class 4A commercial property transferred for consideration in excess of $1 million.

Appropriates $20,000,000 from General Fund to the Department of State for travel and tourism advertising and promotion to communicate that New Jersey's tourism destinations are operational despite damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.

Requires certain public contract bid advertisements to contain certified cost estimate ranges, specifies grounds for rejection of all bids, and requires 50% guaranty on bids; designated as the Fairness in Bidding Act.
Revises statutes concerning firearms purchaser identification cards and handgun purchase permits; makes handgun purchase permit valid for four years.
Replaces NJ Wine Industry Advisory Council with NJ Wine Board and establishes new duties and authorizes revenue-producing activities.
Expands applicability of "The Truth-in-Renting Act."
Recognizes same-sex marriages entered into outside the State.
Establishes teacher recruitment grant program in DOE; appropriates $6 million to DOE.
Provides loan redemption for certain physicians who work in State 10 years.
Revises law concerning the rights and responsibilities of motor vehicle franchisees and franchisors.
Authorizes expenditures from open space trust funds to develop or maintain recreation and conservation land although the land was not acquired by the municipality.
Requires report and public hearing prior to DEP recommendation of site for inclusion on Superfund list.
Prohibits toll-free passage for SJTA employees, officers, and members except while commuting or carrying out official duties.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for full time enrollment at four year institutions of higher education, county colleges and accredited post-secondary schools in New Jersey.
Requires Treasurer and Divisions of Pensions and Benefits and Investment Directors to report on status of State-administered pension plans to Legislature by May 15 and November 15 each year.
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.
Requires DEP to submit annual financial report on status of certain fund balances.
Exempts school district employees in certain counties from requirement to reside in State as pilot project; requires DOE report.
Permits public-private partnership agreements for certain building and highway infrastructure projects; provides for EDA oversight.
Provides that cabinet-level public officials, Attorney General, and county prosecutors may serve in acting capacity for no longer than six months without nomination.
Prohibits business expense deductions for punitive damages paid in civil litigation under the corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Provides credit against ambulatory care facility assessment liability for value of unreimbursed care provided to hospital charity care patients.
Requires public institutions of higher education to waive or reimburse application fees and transcript fees for veterans and members of the military.
Reduces cigarette tax rate by 30 cents per pack and reduces revenue dedicated to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Establishes renewable energy portfolio standards.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for value of certain fruit and vegetable donations made by commercial farm operators.
Creates fencing crime involving stolen domestic companion animals.
Permits use of instant run-off voting in balloting for certain local elective public offices.
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Increases membership of Drinking Water Quality Institute and responsibilities of DEP related to institute.
Requires certain user fees for the provision of traditional municipal services to be included within the 2% municipal and county property tax levy cap.

Changes certain eligibility criteria for TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS and SPRS disability benefits; requires Attorney General to establish fraud unit; creates temporary committee to recommend accidental disability standard for systems.
Directs State agencies to take certain actions to expedite permitting through use of general permits and permits-by-rule. *

Requires wholesalers, terminal facilities, motor fuel retail dealers, grocery stores, nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and residential rehabilitation facilities to install appropriate wiring for use of generator during power outage.
Concerns rights of Delaware River and Bay Authority employees.
Prohibits boards of education from charging students a fee to participate in extracurricular activities.
Permits inclusion of volunteer firefighters and other emergency responders within municipal eligible employee group for purposes of the small employer health benefits plan statutes.
Requires lobbyists that are nonprofit organizations to report annually to Election Law Enforcement Commission estimated number of members, contributors, and supporters.
Stipulates that applicants for pawnbroker license are not required to submit CPA-certified financial statement.
The "New Jobs for New Jersey Act."
Requires assessment of administrative penalty amount by administrative law judge for environmental violations.
Prohibits requiring domed roofs on storage tanks if alternative emissions reduction method for volatile organic compound emissions can be established.
Prohibits BPU review and approval of property transactions of certain telecommunications companies.
Eliminates New Jersey Law Revision Commission.
Modifies interest rates and accrual of interest on certain unpaid water and sewer utility bills and delinquent municipal taxes, assessments, and other municipal liens and charges.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.
Requires that a teacher's evaluation take into consideration the degree of parental involvement and the impact it has on student achievement.

Increases salary of certain government officials; codifies legislative district office allowance and legislative director salary; opens PERS enrollment to certain elected officers; eliminates PERS/TPAF disability insurance.
Establishes approval process for proposed offshore wind energy projects and certain benefits to facilitate development of offshore wind energy.

Provides that students attending a choice district may only play interscholastic sports on sending district sports teams unless sending district does not offer a sport that the choice district offers.
Revises law concerning partnerships, limited partnerships, and limited liability companies.
Establishes Student Loan Lottery with winnings applying only to outstanding student loans.
Establishes Child Advocacy Center-Multidisciplinary Team Advisory Board and certification program for child advocacy centers and multidisciplinary teams; appropriates $10 million.
Permits marriage or civil union license to be obtained in any municipality in the State.
Permits counties to impose one-percent hotel tax.
Concerns calculation of net premiums on certain life insurance policies for purposes of certain DOBI assessments.

Prohibits school districts from joining associations which oversee Statewide interscholastic sports unless association limits certain student-athletes who repeat middle school grade to only six consecutive semesters of interscholastic eligibility after entering ninth grade.
Establishes "Court Security Enhancement Fund" and increases court fees, fines and penalties.

Maintains property tax exemption for certain nonprofit hospitals with on-site for-profit medical providers; requires these hospitals to pay community service contributions to host municipalities; establishes Nonprofit Hospital Community Service Contribution Study Commission.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Concerns liability, standards of care, and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Provides for expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Revises standards for expert witnesses in medical malpractice actions.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Establishes death by auto as first degree crime in certain circumstances; designated as Dirk's law.
Requires DEP to conduct vibration analysis along routes for disposal of dredged material from Delaware River.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to assess how to increase number of teaching hospitals and medical residency programs throughout State.
Requires insurance coverage in the individual and small employer markets and SHBP and SEHBP for "off-label" uses of certain drugs.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients and decision making process for patients without surrogates; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
Requires certain health care facilities to offer, and health care workers to receive, annual influenza vaccination.
Requires insurers, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to reimburse for childhood immunizations at levels specified by regulation.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics, and federally qualified health centers.
Establishes prescription drug donation repository program.
Provides post-traumatic stress disorder from military service during combat may be mitigating factor during sentencing.
Increases wholesale sales and use tax rate on tobacco products, changes tax base, and requires licenses to conduct business in tobacco products.*
"Compounding Pharmacy Quality Assurance Act"; requires accreditation of compounding pharmacies.
Permits flexible scheduling of private duty nursing services for eligible Medicaid recipients.
Prohibits insurers from increasing premiums or making other adverse underwriting decisions with respect to medical malpractice liability insurance under certain circumstances.
Establishes Medicaid Smart Card Pilot Program.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."

Requires 9-1-1 service facilities be equipped with Next Generation 9-1-1 system and provides funding for that purpose; makes texting the 9-1-1 emergency system without purpose of reporting need for 9-1-1 service a fourth degree crime.
Enters New Jersey in Nurse Multistate Licensure Compact.
Requires health insurers, group health plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to share certain health benefits information with Medicaid and other State programs.
Requires health care practitioners to inform patients of addiction potential of controlled dangerous substances prior to issuing prescription.

Directs poison control and drug information program to establish clearinghouse of drug overdose information, report on trends, and provide education on safe storage and disposal of medications; appropriates $500,000.
Authorizes Drinking Water Quality Institute to study and recommend maximum contaminant level for 1,2,3-trichloropropane to DEP.
Requires pharmacies to install and maintain secure prescription medication drop-off receptacles, and Division of Consumer Affairs to post receptacle location information online.
Makes provisions of the "New Jersey False Claims Act" retroactive under certain circumstances.
Requires health insurance carriers to reimburse network providers of diagnostic radiologic services at the same rate.
Directs DOT to add certain portion of Rising Sun Road in Bordentown Township to State highway system.
Imposes a wholesale sales tax on electronic cigarettes and similar nicotine delivery products, changes tax base and requires licenses to conduct business in tobacco products.
Mandates health benefits coverage for opioid analgesics with abuse-deterrent properties.
Requires DOH license additional angioplasty facilities, with at least one facility in each county.
Exempts intraoperative monitoring services rendered during certain neurosurgical, neurological, and neuro-radiological surgical procedures from physician self-referral restrictions.*
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA.
Requires restaurants to post notice about food allergy and anaphylaxis and provide food allergy information to customers.
Establishes special license plates to bring awareness to breast cancer.
Revises statutes regarding practice of physical therapy.
Requires county colleges to develop plan to achieve three-year graduation rate of at least 33 percent for full-time degree-program students by 2019-2020 academic year.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to study prevalence, cost, and quality of certain on-line courses compared to traditional classroom courses offered by institutions of higher education.
Concerns occupational safety and health for public employees of certain interstate authorities.
Prohibits sale of certain mobile telecommunications devices unless device includes technology to remotely render device inoperable.
The "Full Marriage Recognition for Civil Union Couples Act"; recognizes certain civil unions as marriages dating back to inception of such civil unions.
Permits group self-insurance plans for, and collective bargaining agreements improving the provision of, workers' compensation.
Requires boards of education to adopt policies to make schools asthma-friendly.
Eliminates certain prohibitions to expungements of criminal records.
Revises laws concerning real estate licensees.
Extends by two months seasonal retail consumption alcoholic beverage license.
Provides for lower speed limits on certain residential access streets.
Allows a gross income tax deduction for certain higher education tuition and fee expenses.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Concerns repayment of unemployment compensation overpayments.
Concerns outreach and training for minorities and women in the construction industry.
Makes certain veterans eligible for certificates of registration under Security Officer Registration Act.
Requires notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of automobile and homeowners insurance policies to be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested.
"State Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."
Permits exterior-based property reassessments within eight years of last municipal-wide revaluation.
Clarifies procedures for restoration of driver's license after suspension; authorizes the court to waive imprisonment under certain circumstances.
Enacts the "Reader Privacy Act."
Permits payment of only one co-payment or deductible for follow-up care or treatment after surgery or illness under certain health benefits plans.
Changes types of development requiring CAFRA permit from DEP.
Addresses various concerns affecting post-release employment.
Provides that child study team members may be employees of the school district or of a DOE approved agency or clinic.
Requires blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death; designated as "Michelle Sous' Law."
Prohibits certain employment actions against employees affected by a declared state of emergency.

Requires Commissioner of Transportation to publish notice of certain transportation-related infrastructure projects and activities on Internet website, and directs State Comptroller to monitor publication of those notifications.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.

Requires Division of Purchase and Property to provide additional notification of contracting opportunities to vendors or potential vendors providing or interested in providing home health care services to State agencies.

Requires safeguards for anonymity and confidentiality with respect to communications presented through phone lines, electronic communication systems, or websites dedicated to accepting anonymous tips for use by law enforcement in criminal investigations.
Imposes $0.25 surcharge on alcoholic beverages to be dedicated to Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund.
Allows person on police officer or firefighter eligible list who is unable to complete requirements for employment due to certain military service to have name placed on subsequent eligible list.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
"HOPE Initiative Act;" requires establishment of public awareness campaign to educate citizens about dangers and causes of, and appropriate responses to, heroin and opioid addiction.
"Responsible Dog Ownership Act."
"Healthy Small Food Retailer Act"; provides funding to small food retailers to sell fresh and nutritious food.
Increases to under $15,000 from under $10,000 amount of permitted annual compensation paid to TPAF retiree reemployed as athletic coach by former school district within 180 days of retirement.
Expands cities permitted to regulate days and hours when packaged goods may be sold.
Imposes certain requirements on use of automated license plate readers by law enforcement agencies.
Establishes pilot program in Paterson authorizing non-disclosure of records of certain expungements.
Prohibits certain school districts under State intervention from leasing building if purchase price would be less than total costs of lease.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $25,000,000 to DOE to provide additional State school aid to Paterson School District.
Requires State to pay its pension contributions on quarterly basis by August 1, November 1, February 1 and May 1 of each year.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $3,100,000 to DOE to provide additional State school aid to Manchester Regional School District.
Establishes "Court Security Enhancement Fund" and increases court fees.
Requires law enforcement agencies in this State to establish minority recruitment and selection programs; establishes reporting requirement.
Restricts use of motorized skateboards.
Requires written security plan when school is polling place and open to students; provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances; makes an appropriation.

Requires school districts to take all steps to ensure adequate security for students when school is open as a polling place and provides that school district costs shall be deducted from the itemized list of expenses submitted by the county board of elections.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.
Requires causes of driver inattention to be noted in traffic accidents.
Concerns eligible municipalities under the urban transit hub credit.
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Establishes certain procedures for awarding design-build contracts.
Requires health insurers to disclose broker commissions to purchasers.
Provides for appointment of certain municipal court judges at the local or county level.
Allows State agency to pay subcontractor directly for work performed in certain situations.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in certain portfield sites.
Requires fire suppression systems in new single and two family homes.
Expands education requirements for special learner's and examination permits.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities and pay costs thereof when necessary for infrastructure projects.
Requires party bidding on, or performing, a State contract to provide employee health care benefits.
Requires owner of autocab to provide proof of financial responsibility.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities when necessary for transportation infrastructure projects at direction of DOT.
Requires Commissioner of Banking and Insurance to develop standard prior authorization form for prescription drug benefits for use by network providers.
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.
Prohibits operator of motor vehicle from engaging in distracted driving.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank Fund and Clean Energy and Infrastructure Modernization Fund within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.
Requires use of headlights on motor vehicles when motor vehicle is operated in an area of highway construction or repair.
Establishes right to immediate interlocutory appeal from determinations as to class certification in class action lawsuits.
Concerns employment status of certain truck operators.*
Allows gross income tax deduction for certain donations to the Rutgers University Foundation.
Amends State construction code for fire safety reasons.
Reforms PANYNJ.
Increases petroleum products gross receipts tax rate; dedicates revenue generated from tax to Transportation Trust Fund; provides gross income tax deduction for certain taxes paid on motor fuel.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank Fund within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.
Concerns temporary registration certificates for automobiles.
Adds two public members to NJT board and provides that all NJT board members are voting members.*
Establishes insurance and other requirements for transportation network companies and their drivers.
Requires DEP to offer to purchase and demolish certain contaminated residential property.
Enhances consideration of fire safety issues during review of development applications.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.
Authorizes special license plates for members of United States Coast Guard.
Authorizes proportional property tax exemption for honorably discharged veterans having a service-connected permanent disability.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Authorizes immediate euthanasia of impounded stray animals that are injured or ill beyond hope of recovery.
Requires health insurers and SHBP to provide certain mental health benefits for eating disorders under same terms and conditions as for other illnesses and diseases.
Allows certain State agencies to sell Internet advertisements on agencies' websites as pilot program.
Authorizes development and operation of computer system which would allow electronic access to outstanding arrest warrant information.
Permits health care providers to report certain patient health problems to MVC.
Requires managed care plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide for reasonable accommodation in accessing providers for persons with physical disabilities.
Exempts veterans' organizations from nonprofit corporation annual report filing fee.
Permits municipalities to hold certain inactive liquor licenses reserved for smart growth developments for an additional five years.
Requires local governments and school boards in SHBP/SEHBP to certify savings based on three bids from non-SHBP/SEHBP plans before continuing SHBP/SEHBP in new collective negotiations agreements.
"Naturopathic Doctors Licensing Act."

Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization, and expansion, or hiring and training of new employees for manufacturing purposes.
Requires DEP to send notice of decision on certain freshwater wetlands permit applications to certain individuals via postcard.
Permits county resident to volunteer for jury service.
Expands definition of "public building" for purposes of the CDS distribution laws.
Establishes strategic road salt reserve fund and strategic road salt reserve within DOT.
Establishes electronic lien and titling system for New Jersey motor vehicles.
Automatically registers or updates voter registration as part of driver's license application or renewal.
Requires AG and county prosecutor to provide notification on website concerning persons indicted or prosecuted for crimes under certain circumstances.*
Adds cyber-harassment to the domestic violence statutes.
Exempts local public contracts with start-up manufacturers that invest in redevelopment areas from bidding requirements.
Permits certain breweries to sell beer at community farm markets.
Allows consumption of food on limited brewery premises.
Authorizes restricted breweries to annually sell up to 1,000 barrels of beer to in-State and out-of-state retailers.
"Out-of-network Consumer Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act."
Allows installment payments for senior and disabled property taxpayers to repay overpayments of homestead credits and homestead property tax reimbursements.
Makes changes to funding provisions for financial assistance and grants from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Updates process by which a fiduciary may be discharged.
Prohibits administration of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers.
Expands the Address Confidentiality Program to include victims of sexual assault and stalking.
Requires State to use certain energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements.
Authorizes water supply public-private partnerships.
"Port Support Zone Act of 2015.

Requires that school district's request for permission to use unrecognized position title include list of abolished positions and positions in which there have been layoffs and detailed job descriptions for them.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.
Requires registration, inspection, testing, cleaning, and disinfection of cooling towers to control outbreaks of Legionnaire's Disease.
Requires State to reimburse counties for portion of holiday pay to county employees performing State services on certain holidays.
Eliminates requirement for forensic laboratory analysis of substance in cases involving distribution of, or possession with intent to distribute, imitation CDS.
Requires youth baseball league coaches to comply with pitch count standards to minimize injury to youth baseball pitchers.
Creates Construction Trades Licensing Board for licensing and regulation of several construction professions; creates new division for homeowner protection in Department of Law and Public Safety.
Imposes a four percent gross revenues tax on providers of direct-to-home satellite services.
Prohibits retail sales establishment from storing certain magnetic-stripe data; requires reimbursement for costs incurred by financial institution due to breach of security.
Permits landscape irrigation contractors to install backflow prevention devices under certain circumstances.
Revises law concerning alarm business licensees.
"Appraisal Management Company Registration and Regulation Act." *
Permits sale of home-baked goods under certain circumstances.
Increases income eligibility limits for PAAD program and Senior Gold Prescription Discount Program.
Requires Medicaid program to increase reimbursement for ambulance services provided to Medicaid recipients who are also Medicare eligible to Medicare rate.
Requires health benefits coverage for mammograms for women under 40 who lack access to family medical history due to their or their parent's adoption.
Requires costs of contract for construction be revealed to municipal construction office for construction permit.
Authorizes certain municipalities to establish safety requirements for certain bars and taverns.
Provides certified municipal fire inspectors and fire officials having more than four consecutive years service with tenure in office.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Requires certain civil actions against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Eliminates the board of trustees of Rutgers University and provides that its powers will be exercised by the board of governors of the university.
Permits certain officials to possess pepper spray in quantity carried by law enforcement officers.
"Common Interest Community Manager Licensing Act."
Increases number of commissioners on Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor to six; changes process for appointment of commissioners.

Authorizes the EDA to issue additional $50,000,000 in bonds to provide grants for certain county vocational school district facilities projects and increases debt service district aid percentage for such projects.
Provides additional State school aid to county vocational school districts in which enrollment increases by more than 10%.
Provides State aid for certain adult education programs.
Establishes brain injury screening and education program in DCF.
Provides two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employees' Pension Fund may be active or retired county employees.

Raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1,000,000 to 10.75 percent for a temporary three-year-period and restores the State earned income tax credit to 25 percent of the federal credit.
"Jade and Michael's Law"; establishes additional protections and enforcement related to child abduction by a parent.
Provides additional State aid to county colleges for students enrolled in certain postsecondary career and technical education certificate programs.
Entitles nursing home residents to monitor and record in-room treatment, care, and living conditions using electronic monitoring devices, upon notice to nursing home.
Dedicates 30 percent of all UEZ sales tax revenues to respective UEZ account and 70 percent of UEZ sales tax revenues to General Fund.
Prohibits tourist helicopter operations in New Jersey.
Concerns enterprise zone assistance fund project approval; dedicates certain revenues to UEZs or UEZ municipalities.

Makes FY 2015 supplemental State appropriations totaling $300,000,000 for prepayment of portion of FY 2016 employer contributions to State-administered public employee defined benefit retirement systems.
Establishes "The Democracy Act" to modify various voter registration and voting procedures.
Concerns return of development fees to municipalities for transportation related projects.
Establishes certain penalties for operating or participating in pyramid promotional schemes.*
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Permits eviction for good cause of tenants who are creating nuisance; requires court to notify landlord when restraining order has been issued barring tenant from residential rental property.
Restricts bail options for second and subsequent offenses occurring while released.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance to curb gang related loitering and criminal activity.
Permits master deed of condominium to reflect proportional common and limited common elements interests of each owner as fractions.
Establishes professional standards for county sheriffs and their employees.
Clarifies that using animal to cause bodily injury to another constitutes assault with a deadly weapon; grants immunity to police officers who use police dog as deadly weapon.
Authorizes designation of joint urban enterprise zone by Urban Enterprize Zone Authority.
Requires health care facilities to report certain information about their health care staff to their respective professional boards or DHSS.
Modifies intent, purpose and standard of construction of "Municipal Land Use Law."
Prohibits BPU from exercising authority over utility service extensions in manner which creates cost differentials that distinguish among persons or localities based on location of such extensions.
Requires appointed board of education members and candidates for an elected board to reveal criminal convictions prior to assuming or running for office.
Decreases membership of county boards of taxation to 2004 level.
Amends the "Fair Housing Act" to change details of regional contribution agreements.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
Concerns urban enterprise zones.

Extends requirement of wastewater management planning agencies to establish or update wastewater management plans, and extends validity of sewer service areas and wastewater service areas until April 7, 2011.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing; abolishes Council on Affordable Housing.
Requires contracting units and boards of education to credit contractors with interest earned on certain funds withheld from payment to contractors.
Concerns membership and management of homeowners associations.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Extends time municipalities have to commit fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units to six years.
Allows corporation business tax or gross income tax credits to developers for certain capital investments for repurposing qualified health care facilities.
Eliminates duplication and redundancy in registration of certain apartments.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Establishes compensation limits for licensed public adjusters during certain emergencies.
Permits liens in favor of planned real estate development associations for unpaid assessments in planned real estate developments.
Permits charter school to limit admission to students with a substance abuse or dependence disorder.
Creates Foreclosure Prevention and Neighborhood Stabilization Revolving Trust Fund; places temporary surcharge on mortgage foreclosure complaints.
Concerns payment of certain TDI and family temporary disability leave benefits.
"Economic Opportunity Act of 2014, Part 1."
Expands financing opportunities for low and moderate income housing.
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Requires court to issue animal protective orders against persons found guilty of abusing animals.
Amends RICO to add certain crimes involving public servants.
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program; appropriates $250,000.
Eliminates awarding of attorneys' fees, filing fees, and costs of suit for certain technical violations of consumer fraud act.
Provides public servant is guilty of official misconduct if he knowingly obtains, arranges or provides "no-show" job for himself or another.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Consolidates all "doughnut municipalities" and "doughnut-hole municipalities" within 10 years.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter, Public School Teacher, Corrections Officer, and Sanitation Worker Home-buyer Assistance Act"; appropriates $5 million.
Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Decriminalizes possession of 15 grams or less of marijuana, imposes civil penalties, and establishes fund for drug education.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Revises definition of "necessary care" in the State's animal cruelty law to include more specific requirements.
Establishes that payment plan for motor vehicle surcharges is mandatory upon request; extends payment period.
Creates Voluntary Registry for Individuals with a Mental Illness or Developmental Disability.
Requires Adjutant General of DMVA to issue State flag to resident enrolling in federal service academy.
Requires posting of information about availability of services from substance abuse treatment facilities on county and DHS websites.
Permits new cigar lounges to be opened under certain circumstances.
Expands implied consent statute to include blood and urine testing.
Provides for private cause of action for bad faith in settlement of certain insurance claims.
Establishes process for consideration of offers from short sale buyers during residential mortgage foreclosures.
Provides that strangulation of victim resulting in bodily injury during commission of act of domestic violence constitutes aggravated assault.
Authorizes Attorney General to impose fine against institution of higher education that fails to appropriately respond to a student's allegation of sexual assault by another student.

Requires State to pay full contribution to State-administered pension systems plus $300 million annually until systems are fully funded; provides members of systems with contractual right to financially sound funding of systems.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2014.
Directs NJEDA to establish pilot program to assist with permit and approval process related to redevelopment of certain properties.
Establishes publicly accessible domestic violence Internet registry.
Permits court to order involuntary outpatient treatment in any county; concerns patient compliance with taking medication.
Legalizes possession and personal use of small amounts of marijuana for persons age 21 and over.
Permits municipalities to issue retail liquor licenses for use in certain historic taverns.
Allows expungement of multiple crimes and offenses resulting from one-time spree under certain circumstances.
Establishes artist bank to provide interest-free loans to artist colonies in development.
Requires DOBI to obtain and consider certain information from Commissioner of Health concerning provider network adequacy requirements for managed care plans.
Exempts certain health information contained in 9-1-1 calls from definition of government record.
Requires State Police to produce brochure summarizing law governing transport and possession of firearms; requires MVC to make brochure available to new State residents registering vehicles.
Directs Rutgers Discovery Informatics Institute, Office of Information Technology, and New Jersey Big Data Alliance to develop advanced cyberinfrastructure strategic plan; appropriates $150,000.*
Establishes de minimus levels for regulation of air contaminants and hazardous air pollutants, and directs DEP to establish de minimus levels for regulation of hazardous substances.
Prohibits unilateral changing of terms and conditions of employment by public employers.
Establishes Rail Passenger Bill of Rights and authorizes Division of Consumer Affairs to enforce provisions.
Requires nursing homes to permit use of electronic monitoring devices at request of resident.

Authorizes municipalities to establish program for public or private financing of certain renewable and energy efficiency, microgrid,conservation, and storm resiliency projects through the use of voluntary special assessments for certain property owners.*
Provides for priority consideration, by DCA, DEP, DOT, and municipalities, of permit applications for green building projects.
Requires OAL to maintain Internet database summarizing all State rule-making actions.

Authorizes Judiciary to revise or supplement filing and other fees, subject to limitations, to fund Legal Services of New Jersey and e-court information system; requires review and reporting on fees and expenditures of such fees.
Requires electric public utilities to implement flood mitigation plans for electric distribution substations and transfer stations in certain flood zones.
Prohibits a person from charging a fee to stop publishing personal identifying information obtained through the criminal justice system.
Allows firms, designated as qualified UEZ businesses, that experience economic hardship to lower employment levels without losing that designation.
Grants drivers additional time to resolve parking violations prior to license or registration suspension.*
Requires Commissioner of DCA to promulgate rules and regulations providing for veterans' affordable housing assistance preference.
Categorizes "knockout game" assault as third-degree aggravated assault; eliminates presumption of nonimprisonment for such assault.
Clarifies that definition of mental illness in law governing involuntary commitment to treatment includes substance use disorder if dangerous standard met.
Clarifies that piercing or tattooing animals constitutes needless mutilation and animal cruelty.
Provides for issuance of certificate of rehabilitation to certain offenders with substance abuse disorders.
Authorizes grandparents to obtain certified copies of death certificates of grandchildren.
Requires posting of signs warning of presence of, and potential danger caused by, duckweed on water bodies in public parks.
Sets criteria for online learning provided to public school students.
"Digital Currency Jobs Creation Act."
Establishes "Veterans Affordable Housing Section 8 Voucher Pilot Program."
"Nail Salon Worker Protection Act."
Permits dogs in outdoor seating areas of restaurants under certain circumstances; codifies current requirements concerning live animals in food establishments.

Provides that teacher, school bus driver, other school employee, or school volunteer who commits act of sexual penetration with student age 18 or older and less than age 20 is guilty of sexual assault under certain circumstances. *

Appropriates $12 million in constitutionally dedicated CBT revenues for preservation, restoration, and revitalization of Jersey City Reservoir property for recreation and conservation and historic preservation purposes.

Clarifies DHS authority to regulate sober living homes and halfway houses as residential substance abuse aftercare facilities; requires background checks and other protections for residents of residential substance abuse facilities.

Revises court filing fees, assessments, penalties, fines, and certain firearms licensing fees to fund Pretrial Services Program, e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; repeals certain statutory provisions concerning court fees.
Requires hospitals to establish sepsis recognition and treatment protocols.
Permits homeless to receive certified copy of birth certificate without fee.
Exempts homeless from fee for non-driver identification cards.
Prohibits certain steering and marketing practices involving dispensing of prescription drugs and drug samples.
Allows pension calculation to be based on compensation increase in excess of actuarially assumed experience only if employer pays unfunded liability.

Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each housing unit occupied by a veteran; permits municipalities to satisfy fair share affordable housing obligation through 35 percent set aside for veterans.
Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each unit of transitional housing occupied by a veteran.
Prohibits for ten years after compliance with penalty or sentence imposed by court elected or appointed officials convicted of certain crimes from serving as governmental affairs agents.
Repeals law requiring prevailing wage be paid to workers employed in construction undertaken with Board of Public Utilities financial assistance.
Requires that police obtain warrant to seize cell phone data.
Requires that police obtain warrant to attach GPS device to suspect's motor vehicle.

Extends "Right to Farm" protections to cultivation or production of marijuana for medical use; permits such activity on preserved farmland; prohibits county or municipal interference with such activity.
Excludes certain institutions of higher education from prevailing wage requirements.
Expands definitions of "abused child" or "abused or neglected child" to include prenatal exposure of child to controlled substances.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Repeals statutory requirement of annual or biennial dog census.
Requires municipal court judge to dismiss motor vehicle charges if accident was caused by medical condition of driver.
Repeals all prevailing wage laws.
Makes various changes to interest arbitration procedures; repeals sunset provision.

Reauthorizes use of regional contribution agreements between nine most Superstorm Sandy-impacted counties; permits units transferred to be counted toward recipient municipality's fair share obligation.
Prohibits immobilization of motor vehicle under certain circumstances.
Prohibits law enforcement agencies from considering number of arrests made and citations issued when evaluating police officer's professional performance.
Prohibits submission of New Jersey license plate information to national photo ticketing system or other states for certain purposes.
Concerns Superstorm Sandy recovery.
Permits use of electronic smoking devices in vapor retail establishments.
Permits 15 liquor licenses to be issued in three municipalities located in Fort Monmouth redevelopment area.
Requires insurance coverage for magnetic resonance imaging for women at high risk for breast cancer.
Increases from $15,000 to $25,000 annual compensation PERS retiree may earn in PERS-covered employment without reenrollment.
Adds two employees to the boards of trustees of the State colleges and the county colleges.
Adds two student representatives to board of governors of Rutgers University.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warnings."
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for certain infant formulas.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Requires State Treasurer to follow usual procurement process prior to entering into cooperative purchasing agreements.
Requires health insurance carriers to use standard explanation of benefits form.
Provides for compensation of teachers on appropriate salary guide and schedule after withholding of an increment.
Requires binding arbitration for certain matters relating to dismissals or reductions in salary of tenured persons employed in a teaching capacity at a county college.
Provides for the removal of a State Board of Education member for failure to attend three consecutive board meetings without good cause.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation for public adjusters.
Permits municipality to pay tax refund in equal installments over period of three years.
Requires taxpayer to provide certificate of merit setting forth estimated true value of certain property which is subject to county tax appeal.
Authorizes mechanism for independent determination of legal sufficiency of initiated ordinances and referendum petitions.
Establishes certain consumer protections related to arbitration organizations.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.

Provides that settlement agents are not responsible for transmitting estimated gross income tax payment and forms for certain nonresident real estate transactions unless so responsible pursuant to contract.
Reduces maximum rate of interest to be charged for delinquent taxes from 18% to 12%.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax.

Permits school districts to provide transportation to nonpublic school pupils and charge parents when the per pupil amount of the route exceeds the maximum nonpublic school transportation costs per pupil.
Eliminates requirement that notice of elections list polling place locations; requires notice include Division of Elections Internet site providing polling place locations.
Requires certain community residential facilities have standby emergency power generators.
