Authorizes use of emergency reserve fund or proceeds from bonds issued by EDA to finance school security improvements.
Prohibits use of anti-concurrent causation clauses in homeowners insurance policies.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey and one additional public member serve as members of Government Records Council.
Clarifies that corporation may adopt "force the vote" provision in plan of merger or consolidation; allows directors to amend plan of merger or consolidation prior to effectiveness of plan.
Clarifies scope of corporate by-laws; provides that by-laws may include forum selection clause.
Pertains to certain review and approval responsibilities of land surveyors.
Establishes standards regarding the disqualification of claimants for unemployment compensation for misconduct.
Imposes limits on fees charged for discovery in municipal court matters.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs harbored on insured property.
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Requires each county to establish and maintain veterans' service office.
Eliminates school district budget per pupil administrative cost limits.
Grants prescriptive authority to certain psychologists.
Permits wineries to produce hard cider.
Exempts certain plenary winery licensees from filing requirements imposed on retail sellers of litter-generating products.
Establishes "Jersey Canned Goods Program."
Establishes "Jersey Frozen Foods Program."
"Linnette Lebron's Law" modifies procedures for marriage or civil union where a party is terminally ill.
Criminalizes possession and sale of alpha-pyrrolidinopentiophenone (alpha-PVP) commonly known as "flakka," or "flocka."
Authorizes impoundment of all-terrain vehicles and dirt bikes for certain crimes and offenses.
Authorizes State Fish and Game Council to establish number of beaver trapping permits issued annually.*
Directs Governor to withdraw from compact establishing Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor; dissolves compact and commission; transfers commission's NJ operations to State Police.
Requires provisions regarding sellers' obligation to deliver marketable and insurable title in certain residential real estate contracts of sale.
Prohibits NJTA from requiring county guarantee to provide maintenance of pedestrian bridge under certain circumstances when determining approval for construction of pedestrian bridge.

Transfers Division of Release employees to DOC; requires DOC to develop reentry plan for each inmate; establishes administrative parole release for certain inmates; provides parole compliance credits; establishes inmate disciplinary database.
Requires county health departments to maintain reserve stock of opioid antidotes to dispense to certain entities on interim basis to ensure uninterrupted supply.*
Provides transparency and accountability reforms at PANYNJ; modifies governance structure; provides legislative oversight of PANYNJ; and regulates capital planning process.
Establishes mandatory domestic violence training for municipal prosecutors.
Allows school districts to enter into school construction public-private partnership agreements with private entities.
Establishes green infrastructure financing program.
Permits landlords to take actions after death of tenant in certain situations.
Concerns standard for involuntary commitment to outpatient treatment.*

Directs Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to establish a pilot program to assist certain unemployed and underemployed individuals to complete a career and technical education certificate program in 12 months.
Establishes Flexible Pathways Initiative in the Department of Education.
Establishes a loan redemption program for public school teachers who meet certain academic requirements and teach Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics subjects or special education.

Requires Secretary of Higher Education, in consultation with various entities, to design a manufacturing career pathway to provide students with skills necessary to gain employment in manufacturing sector.
Creates corporate business tax and gross income tax credits to fund education enrichment demonstration program.
Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) programs.
Establishes "New Jersey Community Health Worker Program" in DOH to facilitate linking medically underserved communities with health care resources.
Expands exemption to wage and hour requirements for certain summer camp workers.
Requires 90 days' notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of stop loss insurance for small employer health benefits plans.
Establishes veterans' preference for affordable housing in certain housing projects.
Creates the crime of victimization of a senior citizen or a person with a disability.
Requires local contracting units, boards of education, and county colleges to purchase hybrid electric vehicles or electric vehicles when purchasing vehicles.
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
Establishes requirements for provision of energy from Class I renewable energy sources.
Authorizes virtual net metering for certain electric public utility customers who are connected to certain hydropower facilities.
Requires NJT to provide locations at bus terminals and rail stations where bicycles may be safely secured.

Directs NJTA and SJTA to apply 10 percent discount to toll payments made by customers having New Jersey electronic toll collection system account in event of motor fuel tax increase; sunsets two years from increase.
Extends certain employment protections to professional cheerleaders.
Defines information required to be included in death certificates.
Permits pharmacists to dispense certain drugs in emergency without prescription.
Designated the Equitable Disclosure Act of 2010, modifies provisions of MLUL concerning objectors to applications for development.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Provides gross income tax deduction for costs of certain green home improvements that increase building systems resiliency.
Establishes a small business job creation and preservation account program to incentivize small business workforce expansion in New Jersey with income tax exclusions for interest.
Permits construction of electric transmission and distribution lines on certain areas of preserved farmland under certain circumstances.
Requires electric public utilities to enter into long-term contracts for certain forms of Class I renewable energy.
Requires certain CATV companies to make CATV service available throughout residential areas of municipality within specified number of years after CATV company first provides service to municipality.
Supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,560,000 for anti-tobacco programs.
Authorizes local units of government subject to "Local Public Contracts Law." and "Public School Contracts Law" to use electronic procurement technologies.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use returns to make voluntary contributions to the Boy Scouts of America Councils in New Jersey.
Requires insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for ovarian cancer.
Establishes Main Street Economic Growth Program to encourage business development in small, highly developed municipalities.
Establishes "Secondhand Valuables Transaction Reporting Task Force."
Requires Governor's annual budget message to include description and fiscal analyses of recommendations to raise State revenue estimated at $1 million or more.
Establishes a manufacturing reinvestment account program to incentivize capital investment and workforce training in New Jersey with income tax rate reductions, deferrals, and accelerated deductions.
Makes a $3 million supplemental appropriation for increased Per Capita Library Aid.
Includes all disabled veterans in NJT discount program for senior citizens and persons with disabilities.
Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in broadband infrastructure in underserved communities.
Establishes liability for harm caused by defective trees.
Permits local unit to contract with private entities to lease advertising space on local unit's official Internet website.
Establishes procedures for nomination and election of members of New Jersey Hall of Fame; directs principal location of hall to be in or adjacent to New Jersey State Museum.
Permits State employment on temporary basis of workers with certain skills to perform routine maintenance in State facilities.
Requires requestor pick up government records within 10 business days of availability.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credits for purchase and installation of certain electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes "Solar Equipment Purchase and Installation Assistance Program" in NJ EDA.
Requires MVC to check Social Security Administration records and mark deceased individuals in MVC database once per month.

Requires telephone utility to temporarily suspend local exchange telephone service for up to six continuous months when requested by residential customer; allows customer to keep telephone number when resuming service.
Provides consumer protections under certain telecommunications service provider contracts.
Requires certain CATV companies to provide free Internet access to public libraries.
Limits job creation estimation under previous COAH regulations for warehousing activities.
"Vegetation Management Response Act"; concerns vegetation management related to electric public utility infrastructure.
Requires certain CATV companies to provide Internet service at public libraries with business customer class Internet access bandwidth and circuit capacity proportional to public libraries' needs.
Removes decal requirement from graduated driver's license law; establishes new system for law enforcement to identify novice drivers.
Requires BPU to conduct biennial rate cases for public utilities; increases penalties for public utilities failing to comply with BPU orders.
Exempts from real property taxation during construction any building, or portion thereof, to be used for a property tax-exempt purpose.
Requires State Building Authority to make certain payments in lieu of taxes for public safety facilities to municipalities; makes appropriation.
Requires Council on Affordable Housing to adjust municipal fair share to reflect job loss in a municipality.
Increases State hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues required to be annually appropriated to fund certain arts and cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.
Eliminates exception to public advertising and bidding requirements for certain public contracts involving insurance coverage and consulting services.
Requires builders to provide information about fire suppression system to new homebuyers.
Appropriates $1,886,375 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund to NJ Historic Trust for grant to Proprietary House Association for historic preservation purposes.
Allows for sale of municipally owned preserved open space under certain circumstances to homeowners displaced as a result of severe repetitive loss events.
Concerns hospital asset transformation program.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use their gross income tax returns to make voluntary contributions to the Rutgers Oral History Archives.
Establishes the New Jersey Film and Television Project and Employment Incentive Program.
Excludes certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring from sales and use tax.
Requires employers to pay their employees when serving on a jury.
Establishes Nursing Student Support Program.
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DOH.
Requires DOH to develop New Jersey Report Card of Hospital Maternity Care.
Requires hepatitis B to be considered a priority under "Eliminating Health Disparities Initiative."
Requires first responders to transport persons treated for drug overdose to hospital emergency department.
Creates NJ Cybersecurity Commission; appropriates $50,000.
Provides for oversight of DHS contracts with providers serving persons with developmental disabilities.
Requires forms and materials for individuals with developmental disabilities to be available in languages other than English.
Prohibits person from serving as officer of more than two political campaign committees.
Requires nursing homes to provide training to staff in behavioral health issues.
Permits change in case manager for persons with developmental disabilities under certain circumstances.
Requires institutions of higher education to adopt affirmative consent standard and other policies regarding sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence, and stalking.
Eliminates restriction on placement of special education students in sectarian schools.
Requires State Auditor to report on finances of public institutions of higher education.
Establishes maximum payment to virtual charter schools and requires State to pay portion of costs for first five years.
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Requires students enrolled in public institutions of higher education to complete course on financial literacy.
Requires DOT to issue guidance on certain aspects of red light camera pilot program.
Prohibits distribution of images and information produced by red light cameras.
Requires State contracts for internet software to include indefinite support from software manufacturer.
Increases from 17 to 21 public members of New Jersey State Council on the Arts; requires members to be residents of NJ; imposes specific criteria for four new members initially appointed.
The "Smart Container Act."
Limits easement, acquired by the State or local government unit, for use of beachfront property to dune construction or beach replenishment except under certain circumstances.
Imposes tax on petroleum received by rail at marine terminals, storage or transfer terminals, and refineries, to fund local emergency preparedness and response to spills.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson in the Division of Consumer Affairs.
Creates pilot program concerning domestic violence; creates additional Superior Court judgeships.
Bars domestic violence defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.
Establishes the "Sexual Assault Victim's Bill of Rights."
Exempts nursing mothers from jury duty.
Requires DHS to develop specific criteria for eligibility of individuals with developmental disabilities for services from adult day health services facilities.
Authorizes board of education to establish community service credit program for high school students.
Requires an application fee to be paid to the DOE when applying to establish a charter school.

Requires review of Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure guidence for substance abuse instruction provided to public school students incorporates most recent evidence-based standards and practices.
Requires AG to study use of stun guns by Human Services police officers.
Expands civil rights protections to include breastfeeding; requires employers to provide reasonable accommodations for breastfeeding mothers.
Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.
Permits pharmacists to prescribe self-administered hormonal contraceptives under certain circumstances; clarifies certain health insurance coverage requirements for contraceptive prescriptions.
Requires health insurance coverage for contraceptives to include prescriptions for 12 months.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide treatment for behavioral health care services when determined medically necessary.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public services privatization contracts.
Imposes moratorium on DHS transitions and transfers of residents of State developmental centers until certain conditions are met.
Requires at least one State developmental center in each region of State; requires certain factors to be considered for transfer of residents between developmental centers.

Transfers Division of Mental Health Advocacy to DHS; re-titles director as Mental Health Advocate; provides diversion for mental health treatment for persons subject to prosecution in municipal court; appropriates $15,000,000.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Expands crime of invasion of privacy to include "upskirting"; photographing or filming the image of the undergarment-clad intimate parts of another.
Authorizes issuance of restraining orders for situtations in which domestic violence statutes do not apply.
Authorizes court to include in domestic violence restraining orders a provision making the order applicable to a pregnant victim's child upon birth of the child.
Directs portion of Unclaimed Child Support Trust Fund be used to balance certain unpaid receivables of State agency responsible for disbursement of child support.
Establishes the authority of the court to order electronic monitoring of certain convicted domestic violence offenders.
Provides that will is not valid unless signed by testator or substantially written in testator's handwriting.
Requires all personal audio players distributed in New Jersey to contain warning about volume and hearing loss.
Requires health insurers, SHBP, and SEHBP health benefits coverage for eating disorders.
Establishes right of sexual assault victim to notification of certain developments in criminal case.
Requires certain parking garages to have on-site emergency vehicle capable of accessing low-clearance areas.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act;" requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Establishes Become A Nurse license plates and dedicates fees for nursing scholarships.
Allows municipality to establish reserved parking zone on property adjacent to disabled person's residence.
Clarifies juvenile's right to attorney representation; requires 12-month judicial review hearing when juvenile is placed out-of-home.
Raises minimum age for purchase and sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices from 19 to 21.
Prohibits certain elected public office holders from simultaneously holding more than one elective office.
Requires DCPP to implement policies and procedures to ensure caseworker safety; "Leah's Law."
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.
Authorizes special "We Support the Arts" license plates with proceeds to the New Jersey State Council on the Arts.
Clarifies hoverboards are motorized skateboards.
Designates cheerleading as interscholastic sport; requires safety harness at health clubs with members who are cheerleaders.
Places moratorium on implementation of certain tiered network health benefits plans until January 1, 2017.
Requires health insurance carriers to comply with certain network adequacy requirements.
Establishes certain standards for health benefits plans with tiered network.
Permits use of virtual instruction to meet minimum 180-day school year requirement under certain circumstances.
Requires health insurance coverage for hair headpieces for patients receiving chemotherapy treatment for cancer.
Requires Public Health Council to promulgate rules and regulations for use of quality control programs in bio-analytical and clinical laboratories.
Establishes one-year moratorium on replacement of copper-based landline telephone service with wireless telephone service; requires BPU to report to Governor and Legislature.
Authorizes pharmacists to provide opioid antidotes to patients without individual prescriptions, in accordance with standardized protocols to be adopted by Board of Pharmacy.
Establishes the "Mental Health Court Pilot Program" in several vicinages.
Prohibits health insurance carriers from requiring optometrists to become providers with vision care plans as condition of becoming providers in carriers' panel of providers.
Requires health insurers to limit patient cost-sharing and provide appeal process concerning certain prescription drug coverage.
Prohibits sight-unseen sale of cats and dogs; requires pet shops to sell cats and dogs only from specified sources; repeals "Pet Purchase Protection Act."
Provides corporation business tax credit and allows gross income tax deduction for purchase and installation of electric vehicle charging stations.
Authorizes students in State schools to operate State vehicles for driver education and provides protection for such activity under tort claims act.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Provides that certain personal identifying information may be redacted from certain public records in certain circumstances.
Provides that Good Samaritans are not required to pay for ambulance service if injured while rendering emergency care.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Debars permanently from government contracting any person convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Provides for fair notice and opportunity to contest, or obtain waiver of a repayment of, overpayment of homestead rebate or credit and homestead property tax reimbursement.
Establishes compensation program for State and juvenile corrections officers and parole officers injured while performing official duties.
Allows identity theft victims to petition for judicial determination of factual innocence.
Provides that toll revenue generated from PANYNJ bridges shall not exceed cost of maintenance, operation, and debt service of those bridges.
Requires DHS to develop or purchase electronic health record system for use by certain agencies providing services to individuals with developmental disabilities.
Requires institution of higher education to provide victim-centered training to employees who assist student victims of sexual assault.

Requires Commissioner of Education to include data on chronic absenteeism and disciplinary suspensions on School Report Card and requires public schools to make certain efforts to combat chronic absenteeism.

Establishes measures to deter steroid use among students; appropriates $45,000 to DOE for New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association testing of student-athletes for steroids and other performance enhancing substances.
Requires public institutions of higher education to submit proposed tuition and fees for upcoming academic year to Secretary of Higher Education for review.
Authorizes public institution of higher education to establish in-municipality tuition rate for students who graduate from public high schools located in the same municipality as the institution.
Requires medical examination and submission of student work portfolios for home-schooled children; provides that children under supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Designates four State songs.
Removes monk parakeet from list of potentially dangerous species.
Requires funds collected through societal benefits charge not allocated be credited to electric and gas public utility customers.
Requires owner of railroad bridge to submit bridge inspection records to DOT.
Prohibits snowplow operators from depositing snow in front of certain access points used by persons with disabilities.
Establishes Developmental Disability Awareness license plates; dedicates fees to Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.

Requires NJT to remove snow from certain stops, stations, and stands for motorbus regular route service and to make name and contact information of entities responsible for snow removal publicly available.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Creates gallery space on State House grounds for display of certain art works.

Establishes animal importer registration, and animal grooming facility and animal training facility licenses; establishes requirements for animal importers, animal grooming facilities, and animal training facilities and penalties for certain violations.
Requires mental health evaluation for all animal cruelty offenders; designated as "Shyanne's Law."
Permits municipality to establish civil penalty for smoking in public places.
Requires retail pharmacies to stock and dispense emergency contraception.
Requires carbon monoxide detectors in school buildings.
Requires installation of baby-changing stations in certain public restrooms.
"Red Mascara Act;" designates five State songs.*
Enacts new "Uniform Interstate Family Support Act"; repeals previous uniform law.
Requires Attorney General to establish Statewide gun buyback program.
Revises "Electronic Waste Management Act."
Establishes criminal background check and judgement search requirement for name change; prohibits name change in certain circumstances.*
Increases mandatory retirement age for Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and county prosecutors from 70 to 75.
Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for Superior Court and Tax Court judges from 70 to 75.
Requires court appearance for certain motor vehicle offenses that occur in school zone.
Providing for AG representation of employees of county prosecutors' offices in certain civil actions and providing for State indemnification in certain cases.
Requires certain retailers to provide notice of FAA safety guidelines for flying drones to consumers.
Requires suspension of driver's license for gross income tax deficiency under certain circumstances.
Requires certain drones to contain geo-fencing technology; makes violation a fourth degree crime.
Requires local law enforcement officer or firefighter prescribed anabolic steroids or human growth hormone to report to designated physician for evaluation of fitness for duty.
Permits municipalities to purchase and issue certain surplus retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Provides grants and tax credits for school districts and private contractors for installing cameras on school buses.
Requires driver safety classes for certain drivers with suspended license.
Enhances penalties imposed on drivers who have never been issued a driver's license.
Creates Witnesses of Crime Protection Program Fund and assess $25 penalty on persons convicted of crimes.
Authorizes gun violence restraining orders and firearm seizure warrants.
Raises allowable speed for low-speed vehicles to 35 miles per hour.
Requires criminal history background check for owners and employees of home service enterprises.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Dedicates up to $150,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach State Park to special fund to be used to support certain park programs, and makes an appropriation from the fund.
Provides for decrease and eventual ban on use of non-compostable plastic grocery bags.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of fuel cell vehicles.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes the Renewable Energy Infrastructure and Advanced Technology Vehicle Task Force.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.
Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
"Stormwater Management and Combined Sewer Overflow Abatement Bond Act of 2016," authorizes bonds for $50,000,000, and appropriates $5,000.
Provides purchasing preference to local and environmentally responsible businesses in awarding of State contracts.
Requires, after study, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem, and requires DEP to adopt nutrient standards for NJ marine waters.
Establishes notification, signage, and monitoring requirements related to combined sewer overflows.
Establishes forest harvest demonstration program in pinelands area.
Requires, after assessment, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem.

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Authorizes Ocean County Planning Board and municipal planning boards in Ocean County to take certain measures to control stormwater runoff and nonpoint source pollution in Barnegat Bay watershed.
Prohibits development over 35 feet in height in Hudson River Palisades viewshed.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits and approvals for development related to drilling for oil and natural gas off NJ coast.
Allows installation of solar arrays by municipalities on preserved open space in certain circumstances.
Clarifies that the implementation of a municipal court security plan, shall be at the discretion of the municipal governing body.
Establishes certain minimum and maximum temperatures in emergency shelters, rooming and boarding houses, dementia care homes, and certain nursing homes and residential health care facilities.
Establishes uniform standard for identifying and accessing fire hydrants.
Expands One-Call Damage Prevention System to include underground contamination with engineering or institutional controls.
Requires large food waste generators to separate and recycle food waste and amends definition of "Class I renewable energy."
Requires certain child care center staff members to be tested for tuberculosis every five years as condition of continued employment.
Establishes hours during which alcoholic beverages may be sold on international airport property.
Authorizes court to impose rescue operation costs of public entity under certain circumstances.
Makes fiscal year 2016 State supplemental appropriation and reduces State appropriation to transfer appropriation from preschool education aid to TPAF.
Directs Commissioner of Education to implement Natural High Drug Prevention Program in school districts; appropriates $40,000.
Provides that crimes committed outside the State under certain circumstances may be prosecuted in New Jersey.
Expands statute authorizing temporary restraining orders for certain alleged stalking victims to include victims of any age or mental capacity.
Increases penalties for unlawfully manufacturing, distributing, or dispensing fentanyl.
Regulates tethering and confinement of, and proper shelter for, dogs.
Establishes animal cruelty offenses pertaining to chaining or other restraint of animals.
Prohibits smoking at State-owned beaches.
Terminates imposition of general purpose fee under realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on purchases of residential real property selling for more than $1,000,000.
Requires anyone receiving opioid antidote to treat drug overdose be provided with information concerning substance treatment programs and resources.
Establishes electronic database of occupants of hotels and multiple dwellings for use by fire safety and emergency service providers.
Authorizes municipalities to require subdivision approval prior to or as condition of creation or conveyance of certain condominiums or units thereof.
Prohibits local governments from requiring private employers to provide paid sick leave.
Establishes affirmative defense against builder's remedy lawsuits.
Reforms PANYNJ; requires appearance by PANYNJ before legislative committees.
Clarifies law concerning conduct of certain legislative investigations.
Provides that certain ethical standards will apply to Governor.
Permits voter registration at polling place on days of municipal, primary, and general elections.
Requires DOT Commissioner to develop public awareness programs and use variable message signs to inform motorists about State's "move over" law.
Authorizes special Ancient Order of Hibernians license plate.
Authorizes the Unclaimed Property Administrator to verify certain governmental debts before delivering abandoned property.
Establishes Capture, Control, and Conserve Reward Rebate Program in DEP to encourage property owners to implement certain techniques to conserve water or control stormwater runoff.
Prohibits firearm possession by persons convicted of certain offenses.*
Requires online parking ticket payment system, NJMCDirect, to process payments 24 hours per day.
Creates Office of Clean Energy in BPU.
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in EDA and transfers $2 million from societal benefits charge to initially fund program.
Prohibits possession, transport, import, export, processing, sale, or shipment of parts and products of certain animal species threatened with extinction.
Establishes "Milkweed for Monarchs" program.
Establishes "Adopt a Monarch Butterfly Waystation" program.
Establishes notification standards for certain service contracts with automatic renewal.*
"Aid in Dying for the Terminally Ill Act"; permits qualified terminally ill patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner.

Creates new liquor licenses for certain restaurants and permits the issuance of additional liquor licenses; provides tax credit under corporate business tax and gross income tax for fair market value of certain alcoholic beverage licenses.
Permits restaurants without a liquor license to advertise that they are BYOB or a winery salesroom.
Clarifies provisions with regard to pet trusts.
Requires patient to receive notification of abnormality in chest x-ray; designated as Claudia's Law.
Reduces ambulatory care facility assessment.
Allows deduction against gross income for unreimbursed expenses incurred by organ donor.
Authorizes deer hunting with firearm on Sundays on private property.
Requires DEP to obtain approval from Secretary of Agriculture prior to levying penalties against farmers.
Establishes certain requirements for trapping of snapping turtles.
Concerns reviews of State's economic development incentives.
Extends post-military service protection against mortgage foreclosure.

Requires owner or operator of certain trains to have discharge response, cleanup, and contingency plans to transport certain hazardous materials by rail; requires NJ DOT to request bridge inspection reports from US DOT.*
Establishes State park passport to promote outdoor recreation, education, and visitation to State parks, forests, and historic sites.
Creates Office of Sustainability.
Designates month of November as "Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy Syndrome Awareness Month" in NJ.
Clarifies that licensed dealers may provide firearms for display at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Requires certain contractors to verify work authorization of newly hired employees.
Requires a public school district to provide a daily recess period for students in grades kindergarten through 5.
"Equitable Permit Extension Act of 2014."
Revises "New Jersey Money Transmitters Act"; provides consumer protections; increases reporting and record keeping requirements.
Expands scope of claims subject to "Health Claims Authorization, Processing and Payment Act," and modifies certain claims procedures.
"Consumer Litigation Funding Act."
Applies prevailing wage to work on Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital grounds and facilities.
Requires financial institution to notify account holder when information relative to an electronic fund transfer is shared with third party.
Regulates sale of olive oil.
"Drama Therapists and Dance/Movement Therapists Licensing Act."
Regulates Internet pharmacies and electronic prescriptions.
The "New Jersey Homeowners' Equity Protection Act."
Permits pharmacists to provide self-administered hormonal contraceptives to patients over the counter.

Requires public school students with concussion to be evaluated by licensed health care professionals before return to school; requires school districts to provide restrictions or limitations to student as needed.
Establishes protection from adverse employment action for authorized medical marijuana patients.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of certain entities from using title of psychologist.

Establishes loan redemption program for certain teachers under which they are permitted to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public schools.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Establishes separate class of claims against insolvent estates for child support judgments; modifies order for payment of claims by representative of insolvent estate.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance regulating where sex offenders may reside; restricts locations of certain child care centers and school bus stops.
Directs certain recoveries of federal funds for services to persons with developmental disabilities be used for grants to support community infrastructure purposes.
Allows person with implanted medical device to voluntarily make notation on driver's license.
Encourages local unit sharing of services; makes appropriations.
Authorizes DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to permit BPU-certified persons to install and maintain solar photovoltaic panels on noise barriers erected on roads and highways.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Establishes central registry for background checks of youth serving organization employees and volunteers.
Creates grant program for newly established small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Allows termination of motor vehicle lease in event of death; prohibits imposition of fee for early termination.
Provides veterans with up to 60 credits tuition-free at county college serving county of residence.
Requires New Jersey Transit to offer discount passes to all New Jersey higher education students.
Requires each public institution of higher education to post its budget on the institution's website.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to address school climate issues related to harassment, intimidation, and bullying in public schools.

Requires public institution of higher education to notify the parents of certain dependent students, without prior consent of the student, when student receives mental health treatment at the institution.
Requires school district that includes any of grades 9 through 12 to biannually provide to local Workforce Investment Board list of students who left school prior to graduation.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; designated as "Stephen Komninos' Law."
"Innovative Services for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act."
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Requires that certain motor vehicle surcharge revenues be dedicated to the Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.

Requires establishment of processes to identify Medicaid eligible incarcerated individuals who are awaiting pre-trail release determinations, are being released following period of incarceration, or are undergoing inpatient hospital treatment.
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Revises procedure for issuance of amended birth certificate for person who has undergone change in sex.
Prohibits possession and transport of parts and products of certain animals at PANYNJ airports and port facilities.
Requires life insurers to use federal death master file to identify potential matches.
Requires BPU to render decision on case within 12 months of final public hearing or hold another public hearing prior to deciding case.
Establishes Military and Defense Economic Ombudsman in Department of State.
Permits local units of government to enter into shared services agreements with federal military installations located in the State.
Establishes New Jersey Military Skills Council.
Provides incentives for certain businesses associated with military installations.
Provides preference to certain employers applying for workforce development grants.
Facilitates coordination of land use planning between civilian and military interests to preserve viability of federal military installations within State.
Directs Attorney General to develop plan to disseminate Amber and Silver Alert information through social media.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for attendance at New Jersey county colleges.
Concerns prompt payment of construction contracts.
Permits students who are eligible for special education services to enroll in noncustodial parent's school district of residence under certain circumstances.
Establishes an apprenticeship requirement to qualify for an electrical contractor's license.
Provides that probationary license holder may transport siblings in addition to dependents and one additional passenger.
Requires State to offer surplus State Police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.
Provides general election, primary, and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Limits caseload of parole officers who monitor sex offenders to 40.
Revises sales and use tax treatment of garbage removal services.
Provides for replacement of incandescent light bulbs in public school buildings with energy-efficient light bulbs.
Directs the Division of Taxation to produce instructional materials on the appropriate gross income tax treatment of certain deferred compensation plans.
Requires MVC to issue motor vehicle placard to certain veterans and waives meter fees.
Requires Division of Rate Counsel to evaluate NJT fare increases and determine whether increases are necessary and fair to NJT customers.
Establishes certain requirements for 9-1-1 public safety answering points and public safety dispatch points.
Concerns certain employer reporting requirements.
Revises definition of volunteer first aid, rescue, and ambulance squad under New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987.
Requires Department of the Treasury to collect for overpayment of UI benefits.
Clarifies that members of volunteer first aid squads that bill third parties do not lose right to use emergency warning lights.
Allows parent or guardian to be present during behind-the-wheel instruction of minor.
Concerns apprenticeship programs and other standards for public works contractors.
Limits rescheduling, cancelation, and no-show fees providers of health care services may charge in certain instances.
Provides exclusive jurisdiction to PERC for certain unfair labor practice claims.
Requires cell phone warranties to last throughout initial service contract.
Extends prevailing wage requirements to certain for-sale housing projects.
Bars sex offenders from jobs which primarily consist of contact with children.
Permits construction workers to file a lien against the owner of real property under "Construction Lien Law."
Prohibits awarding of economic development subsidy to business if payment of principal and interest on previously awarded loan or loan guarantee is greater than 24 months overdue.
Permits small businesses to qualify for loans from NJEDA for costs of energy audit and making energy efficiency or conservation improvements.
Requires hospitals to maintain passive audio or visual mechanism for alerting emergency department staff to presence of non-ambulance vehicles containing patients.
Prohibits insurers from raising medical malpractice liability insurance premiums under certain circumstances.
Requires assisted living residences and certain facilities under DCA, DCF, and DHS to be equipped with standby emergency power generators.
Exempts homestead from attachment in medical malpractice judgment.
Prohibits service repair contractors from charging hourly rates for travel time.
Removes license suspension penalty for persons with only one outstanding parking fine; permits Motor Vehicle Commission to refuse registration to persons with outstanding parking fine.
Requires sellers of used motor vehicles to complete and submit form.
Requires recalls on motor vehicles to be repaired prior to sale.
Imposes surcharge on motor vehicle offenses to fund upgraded electronic systems for police vehicles.
Provides exemption from 3-day cancellation provision of home improvement contract in case of bona fide emergency.
Establishes 24-hour hotline and educational program concerning State and federal crimes of human trafficking; appropriates $75,000.
Restricts access to motor vehicle accident reports under certain circumstances.
Creates housing purchase matching grant program for reserve component of U.S. Armed Forces and the New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations; appropriates $2,000,000.
Provides for screening newborn infants for genetic mutations associated with hereditary hemochromatosis.

"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; enhances film and digital media tax credits, revises and expands tax credit eligibility requirements, and requires EDA to study development of film studio at North Jersey location.

Directs institutions of higher education and proprietary degree-granting institutions to provide Higher Education Student Assistance Authority with graduation and transfer rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.
Requires certain undergraduate students to file degree plan and requires public institutions of higher education to develop pathway systems to graduation.

Allows NJ STARS and NJ STARS II scholarship recipients to maintain program eligibility in the event that medical condition or recent death of parent or spouse prevents enrollment as full-time student.
Establishes Response to Intervention initiative in DOE to support and encourage school districts in implementation of Response to Intervention framework.
Requires school districts and DOE to post on their websites information regarding student participation in certain assessments.
Extends eligibility for certain individuals for emergency assistance.
The "Municipal Stabilization and Recovery Act."
Concerns taxation of casino gaming property; redirects investment alternative tax proceeds; abolishes Atlantic City Alliance.
Authorizes public financing of primary election campaigns to fill gubernatorial vacancy and general election campaigns to fill vacancy in offices of Governor and Lieutenant Governor.
Provides for implementation of full-day preschool programs in additional school districts; appropriates $110,000,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE.
Permits levy cap exclusion for certain monies expended by local units for shared services.
Clarifies stadiums and arenas owned by local government entities are exempt from property taxation.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid.
Extends duration of urban enterprise zones for 10 additional years; specifies permissable use of funds.*

Requires disclosure of contributions received and expenditures made by committees or organizations not affiliated or coordinated with any candidate, or committee organized to support or oppose public questions.
Requires replacement of all electronic voting machines used in State by district-based optical scan voting systems by June 7, 2016; makes appropriation.
Creates nine-member New Jersey Legislative Elections Public Financing Study Commission.
The "Seaside Lodging and Rental District Act"; imposes tax on certain lodging properties for tourism promotion therein.
Concerns establishment of wage standards by political subdivisions.
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Prohibits purchase of certain items by scrap metal businesses.
Requires health insurance carriers offering tiered network health benefits plans to protect covered persons from excess cost sharing in certain circumstances.
Establishes up to four-month extension for expiring carrier contracts with acute care hospitals while parties engage in contract renegotiation.
Revises licensing provisions for orthotists and prosthetists and assistants.
Requires shareholder approval of campaign contributions and certain independent expenditures made by New Jersey corporations.
Consolidates various municipalities into the new municipalities of Seaside Township and Long Beach Island Township, or alternatively requires shared services agreements for all major services.
Grants EDA broader discretion to approve applications for corporation business tax certificate transfer program.
Imposes civil penalty for the exhibition or use in performance of a living bear, elephant, lion or tiger.
Requires sharing of revenues derived from major developments situated near municipal borders under certain circumstances.
Creates Electric Power Production Siting Commission.
Establishes animal cruelty offense concerning certain use of exotic, non-domestic, or wild animals in traveling performances and exhibitions.

Prohibits feeding of black bears and requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in bear habitat and under certain circumstances, including garbage collection.
The " Responsible Pesticide Use Reduction Recognition Act."
Permits municipality to establish restricted parking spaces for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes penalty for unlawfully using parking placard issued to person with qualifying disability.
Clarifies authority of municipal court to suspend driver's licenses; establishes that the terms revoke and suspend are to have the same meaning under Title 39 of the Revised Statutes.
Requires DEP to establish regulations for approval to install and operate certain solar facilities.
Requires ignition interlock device to be installed on vehicle owned or leased by drunk driver only after period of driver's license suspension.
Requires prosecutorial or law enforcement review of fatal incidents involving police officers or State Police.
Requires hotels to upgrade phone systems to allow guests to dial 9-1-1 without first dialing any other digit.
Requires MVC to issue driving privilege cards to persons who cannot prove lawful presence in the country.
Eliminates presumption of non-imprisonment for theft of a firearm.
Enhances penalties for committing improper behavior in place of public accommodation.
Enacts "Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act."
Concerns organ and tissue donation.
Permits craft distillery licensee in Garden State Growth Zone to operate restaurant on licensed premises.
Establishes a computers for schools program in DOC.
Authorizes donation of forfeited bicycles to charities.
Requires consumer notification of vehicle warranty for aftermarket and recycled parts.
Establishes the "Municipal Court Prosecutors' Automated System."
Legalizes possession of one ounce or less of marijuana, subject to voter approval.
Permits expungement for one-time disorderly persons offense after a period of two years.
Authorizes issuance of certificate for additional persons to solemnize marriage.

Requires immediate forfeiture of public office, position or employment, without application by the prosecutor, for public officials and employees convicted under federal law of certain public corruption offenses.
Establishes civil penalty for certain unlawful conduct.
Requires that certain inmates with detainers be provided access to drug treatment programs.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Requires legislators to certify in writing, upon introduction of legislation, that no monetary benefit will be derived from it; requires certification be filed with the Legislative Ethics Commission.
Provides that preserved farmland may be sold by the State or a local government unit only to established farmers and restricts size of farmer residence which may be built thereon.
Requires DEP to designate smoke-free sections of State beaches, parks, and forests.
Increases penalties for violations of certain pet shop laws and regulations.
Prohibits drilling technique of hydraulic fracturing.
Provides for sales tax exemption for advanced technology partial zero emission vehicles, imposes surcharge on certain automobiles, and deletes surcharge on certain automobiles.

Prohibits treatment, discharge, disposal, application to roadway, or storage of wastewater, wastewater solids, sludge, drill cuttings or other byproducts from natural gas exploration or production using hydraulic fracturing.
Allows industrial hemp farming; establishes industrial hemp license.
Provides State, county, municipal, and school district contracts for professional services will be awarded pursuant to competitive contracting process.
Permits persons convicted of driving with suspended license to be sentenced to labor assistance program.
Requires boil water notices be provided to mayor and municipal clerk within one hour.
Requires DOE to adopt green cleaning policy for schools and child care centers with 50 or more students.
Increases fine for student truancy and requires truant student to attend court-ordered truancy counseling program or other appropriate program.

Limits tuition increase in school district sending-receiving relationships to percentage increase in State aid and tax levy of sending school district and prohibits severance of such relationships currently in effect.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide advocates for victims of sexual assault.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on awareness of eating disorders as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Requires institutions of higher education to post information on sexual assaults on website and provide the information to prospective students.
Authorizes law enforcement agency to inform the president of a public or independent institution of higher education when a student is charged or convicted of certain crimes.
Requires design of new public schools to incorporate green building practices.
Requires the incorporation of solar panels in design and construction of new public school facilities.

Provides that a school business administrator appointed by a school district after a certain date will not be eligible for tenure and may be dismissed pursuant to the terms of the employment contract.
Creates New Jersey Coastal Commission; reallocates certain funds from DEP to commission; and appropriates $20 million.
Permits wineries to operate salesrooms in certain municipalities with restrictions on the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Expands municipal authority to license and inspect residential rental property.

Prohibits enforcement, for a period of 12 months, of homeowners' association bylaws prohibiting domesticated animals if owner is FEMA designated displaced individual following emergency declaration by President or Governor.
Concerns discrimination because of familial status.
Requires human papillomavirus vaccinations for students in grades six through 12.
Requires DHS to establish training, educational assessment, and remedial instruction programs, and minimum educational standards for staff at State psychiatric hospitals.
Concerns practice of funeral directing.

Requires high school students to be assessed using college placement cut scores to determine readiness for college-level course work, and Commissioner of Education to develop plan to improve college and career counseling for students.

Requires independent colleges report certain consumer information on their websites; requires information on remedial instruction to be provided by certain colleges; directs how remedial education is delivered at four-year public and independent colleges.

Prohibits four-year public and independent institutions of higher education from requiring students to purchase meal plans and permits the institutions to only offer meal plans in the form of a spending allowance.
Requires institutions of higher education to develop open textbooks available to students at no charge and requires buyback of used textbooks at 50 percent of purchase price.

Prohibits four-year public and independent institutions of higher education from increasing New Jersey resident undergraduate tuition and fees for nine continuous semesters following student's initial enrollment.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to revoke proprietary school's license to award academic degrees if school fails to achieve certain minimum graduation rates.
Requires closure of a four-year public institution of higher education that fails to achieve a six-year graduation rate of at least 50% for full-time undergraduate students.
Directs the development and posting of notices containing information for victims of human trafficking.
Requires AG to defend challenges to certain municipal ordinances that establish residency requirements for convicted sex offenders.
Eliminates statute of limitations in civil cases involving certain sexual offenses.
Requires State agencies to post Internet links to programs and services for women as applicable.
Prohibits home-schooling of children under DCPP care, custody, or supervision without DCPP approval.
Requires informational posters about safe placement alternatives for newborn infants be posted in public restrooms used by females.
Establishes grant program for constructing kitchen facilities in licensed child care centers; appropriates $1,000,000.
Transfers administration of programs for certain individuals with developmental disabilities from DHS to DCF.
Extends health benefits coverage of a newborn infant.
Concerns unlawful employment practices based on provision of health benefits plans.
Concerns eligibility requirements for licensed professional counselors and associate counselors.
Requires health insurance carriers, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide coverage for telemedicine.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for construction of buildings in accordance with certain energy and environmental performance standards.
Clarifies that certain offenders who drive during periods of license suspension are eligible for certain alternatives to incarceration.
Requires training for constables.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Requires printed advertisements to bear the word "advertisement."
Establishes "Blue Alert System."*
Prohibits public school fund-raising activities which include unsupervised door-to-door sales by students.
Provides for notification of next-of-kin in event of death of senior citizen in senior housing facility.
Increases penalty for operating motor vehicle equipped with television located or positioned so screen is visible to the driver.
Authorizes waiver of license revocation process for certain child support obligors.
Requires certain school buses to be equipped with lap and shoulder seat belts.
Concerns conveyance of certain State-owned lands.
Prohibits contribution action against local public entity for cleanup and removal costs or any other damages associated with discharge of hazardous substances.
The "Adopt a Stormwater Management Basin Act."
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Authorizes educational service providers to provide in-district special education instructional programs.
Establishes Study Commission on Gender Pay Discrimination.
Requires composting or recycling of food waste by large volume generators.

Removes anhydrous ammonia used for refrigeration as substance regulated by "Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act"; eliminates DOLWD licensing for operators of refrigerating plants using anhydrous ammonia.
Exempts person who remediates property in environmental opportunity zone from remediation funding source requirement.
"Secure Schools for All Children Act"; establishes State aid program for security services, equipment, or technology to ensure safe and secure school environment for nonpublic school students.
Expands list of retired law enforcement officers eligible to carry handgun.
Requires criminal history background check for certain persons working at schools.
Establishes a permanent Gang Land Security Task Force.
Establishes the "Office of the Gang Member Relocation Coordinator."
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Requires DOC employees who recruit, interview, and hire corrections officers to have gang awareness training.
Regulates autocycles as motorcycles.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites; makes appropriation.
Limits rent increases for certain senior citizens.
Makes various changes to law addressing meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings.
Establishes award of attorney's fees to prevailing party in municipal services dispute.

Designated Kevin Apuzzio's Law; allows municipalities to provide increased survivor pensions for certain volunteer emergency workers and requires municipalities to provide health and life insurance coverage to volunteer firefighters.
Increases juror compensation.
Extends from one to two years after leaving employment period during which Executive Branch department heads cannot act as governmental affairs agent.
Establishes young entrepreneurs program in EDA.
Provides that 20% of fee charged for initial certified copy of birth certificate shall be used to support certain activities of NJ Cord Blood Bank.
Requires board of education to unseal and announce contents of bids for certain subcontracting only at regularly scheduled, public meetings of the board.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.
Provides that labor union representatives cannot be compelled to disclose certain information.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situtations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply; repeals section 2 of P.L.1999, c.47.
Permits certain health clubs to offer swimming lessons and otherwise remain exempt from first aid personnel and lifeguarding requirements.
Requires SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for prostate cancer.
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.
Requires bi-state transportation authorities to make advance notification of certain projects or operations expected to impede traffic.
Permits eligible claimant who is proportionate owner paying entire property tax bill to collect entire homestead property tax reimbursement amount.
Requires annual evaluation reports by Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development on survey responses to be obtained from certain employers that end operations in this State.
Appropriates $5 million to Cranford Township for flood control projects.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
Reduces number of manufacturing jobs required to qualify for NJEDA financing and incentive programs.
Establishes "New Jersey Business Advisory Council" in Business Action Center.
Prohibits using cadaveric fetal tissue obtained from elective abortion procedure for research purposes and using any cadaveric fetal tissue to research cosmetic treatments.
Requires public institution of higher education to annually submit capital projects report to Secretary of Higher Education; requires secretary to post reports on website.
Requires public schools to allow certain students not enrolled in the school to participate in interscholastic athletics.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students to participate in school-sponsored extracurricular activities in the student's resident district.
Creates special license plates supporting Autism Awareness.
Allows planning and zoning board members to satisfy training requirements on Internet.
Requires school districts to provide listing of bus stops near residence of sex offender to law enforcement.
Provides for conscientious exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Permits municipalities to charge a fee to cover ancillary costs of traffic control; limits fee.
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Allows county sheriffs to issue firearms identification cards and permits to purchase handguns; authorizes county sheriffs to accept applications for permits to carry handguns.
Requires State to recognize permits to carry handguns issued to certain New Jersey residents by other states.
Requires Commissioner of Education to declare educational state of emergency for certain districts with low proficiency rates in language arts and literacy and provides for corrective measures.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to make payment to school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing upon adoption of resolution by municipal governing body.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to reimburse school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing and adjusts recipient districts' tax levy growth limit.
Directs Commissioner of Education to establish full-day kindergarten through grade three school in Trenton modeled on Princeton Day School, for Mercer County residents.
Requires filing of report comparing investment returns earned by private money managers and by State employees for public employee retirement funds and State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund.
Expands acts of animal cruelty to include theft or release of animal during burglary.

Requires boards of education to include instruction, and adopt instructional materials, that accurately portray political, economic, and social contributions of persons with disabilities and lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people.
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Authorizes municipal governing body to create and maintain list of municipal residents in need of special assistance in case of emergency for public safety purposes.
Revises "Local Bond Law" provisions to exempt certain energy projects from appropriation requirement for five percent down payment.
Authorizes municipality to provide for imposition and collection of special assessment to secure developer's recovery of cost of certain improvements in connection with redevelopment project.
Provides tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain costs incurred in purchase of equipment used by private facilities to conduct motor vehicle safety inspections.
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 20 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail, or 20 days past sent date if sent electronically.
Makes technical corrections to individual health coverage and small employer health benefits programs and to NJ FamilyCare.
Defines "mobile home park" as "multiple dwelling" for inspection purposes.
Establishes rights related to property appraisals following natural disasters.

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
Concerns equal pay for women and employment discrimination.
Requires MVC to provide Gold Star Family decals to certain family members of armed services members who died while on active duty.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish a communication and incentive plan to encourage re-enrollment in college; requires Statewide reverse transfer agreement.
Allows NJ gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions of food made from business inventory.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law;" criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Requires developers constructing certain renewable energy generation systems to ensure that such systems would be functionally integrated to electric grid prior to commencement of construction.
Establishes microgrid pilot program.
Clarifies that persons unable to write because of disability may execute legal signatures using fingerprint or other identifying mark.
Permits primary care physicians to waive health insurance copayments for members of military serving on active duty.

Requires tuition bills of public institutions of higher education to include details on student fees and opt-out provision for student-managed entertainment fees, and requires certain institutions' websites to include student fee information.
Provides explicit authorization for the Schools Development Authority to use the design/build/operate/maintain procurement model for school facilities projects.

Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of student borrower's death or total and permanent disability and grant deferment for temporary total disability.*
Extends eligibility to participate in Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program to areas located in municipality in which casino gaming is authorized.
Enters NJ in Interstate Wildlife Violator Compact.
Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess appropriate endorsement to instructional certificate.
Imposes three-year moratorium on use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers for certain purposes.
Directs State Board of Education to authorize computer science education endorsement to instructional certificate.
Prohibits the DOE from regulating the maximum salary amount a school district may pay its superintendent of schools.

Extends immunity from liability to nonprofit associations engaged in organizing, teaching, refereeing, or coaching sports activity under State law requiring protective eyewear for children who participate in certain sports.
Requires fire suppression and alarm systems in certain group homes.
Authorizes Commissioner of Corrections to establish program to operate managed cellular access system within State correctional facilities.
Establishes asset forfeiture reporting requirements.

Makes total property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans retroactive to effective date of determination of total disability; requires State to reimburse municipalities for reimbursement of property taxes paid to veteran.
Extends from 60 days to 120 days amount of time for municipality to refund excess property taxes paid following successful property assessment appeal.
Requires pharmaceutical manufacturers and wholesale distributors accept and provide a rebate for certain returned drugs.
Allows primary caregiver of handicapped person and person with autism to apply for and use handicapped parking.
Allows municipality to authorize parking authority as redevelopment entity.
Requires DHS to request waiver of time limits for certain Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program recipients under certain circumstances.
Requires municipalities to conduct lead paint inspections in single- and two-family dwellings.
Creates advisory council to oversee revision of core curriculum content standards.
Assigns financial responsibility of educating homeless student to district of attendance.
Establishes "Victim-Witness Scholarship Fund;" establishes "Witness Protection Fund;" and concerns State forfeiture funds.
Establishes a Gun Court Pilot Program in Passaic County.
Concerns exclusion of individuals with certain employment history in advertisements for job vacancies.
Establishes special parking for hybrid, electric, and alternative fuel vehicles.
Requires earned sick leave for certain employees.

Requires teacher preparation program for instuctional certificate to include certain amount of instruction or clinical experience in special education and for students with disabilities endorsement to include credit hours in autism spectrum disorder.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Provides that solar and photovoltaic energy facilities and structures on farmland are not an inherently beneficial use, per se, for purposes of zoning approvals.
Allows use of rear view backup camera and parking sensors during road test.
"Used Car Buyers' Bill of Rights"; prohibits "as is" sales of used motor vehicles.
"Used Motor Vehicle Dealer Licensing Act."
Establishes third degree crime for certain trespasses involving victim of domestic violence.
Requires prison host benefit payments to certain municipalities.
"Personal Information and Privacy Protection Act"; restricts collection and use of personal information by retail establishments for certain purposes.
Upgrades and expands crime of criminal mischief under certain circumstances.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act.
Establishes air quality standards and requires certificate from Commissioner of Health for operation of indoor ice arenas, indoor motorsports arenas, and special indoor motorsports events.
Requires Internet gaming affiliates to be licensed as casinos; prohibits waiver of licensing requirements.
Establishes "New Jersey Colorectal Cancer Research Fund"; provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns.
Directs the State Treasurer to establish State Government Electronic Payment Security Standards.
Requires NJ State Council on Arts to establish "Artist District" designation and select certain municipalities or areas within municipalities for such designation.

Prohibits attorney spouse or domestic partner of elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Requires casino licensee to apply every five years for casino license renewal.
Allows for five years corporation business tax and gross income tax deductions for net interest amount received on loans to certain qualified UEZ businesses.
Requires DMVA to develop online historic tour identifying locations of war battles and places of significance to war efforts in State.
Imposes 66% tax on gross gaming revenue from wagering at casino outside Atlantic City; provides distributions to State General Fund and CRDA.
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
"Safe Motor Vehicle Rental Act"; prohibits rental companies from renting, leasing, or selling unrepaired motor vehicles which are subject to safety recall.
Imposes 66% tax on gross gaming revenue from wagering at Meadowlands Complex casino; provides distributions to State General Fund, CRDA, and Hackensack Meadowlands Tax Sharing Stabilization Fund.
Requires green building standards for affordable housing construction.
Requires each casino licensee conducting Internet gaming in this State to prominently advertise name of its Atlantic City casino on its Internet gaming websites and advertisements.
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Requires persons to report incidents of domestic violence to law enforcement and makes it a disorderly persons offense to fail to report.
Establishes the "Domestic Violence Tuition Waiver Program."

Revises "Overseas Residents Absentee Voting Law" to mirror federal law; permits overseas voters to vote in any election; permits use of federal write-in absentee ballot to vote, register or request ballot for all elections.
Requires Secretary of State to establish secure Internet website for online voter registration; authorizes use of digitized signatures from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's database.
Restricts use of eminent domain by private pipeline companies to those demonstrating pipeline is in the public interest and that agree to certain regulation by BPU.
Prohibits imposition of the corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations that only store personal property in this State incident to its importation.
Establishes requirements for newly installed and replacement electric utility poles and transmission towers.
Makes various revisions to operations of local tax collector's and assessor's offices.
Requires BPU financial incentives for photovoltaic equipment for residences that are Energy Star compliant receive preferred treatment.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Allows local government deferred compensation plans to invest in collective investment trusts.
Authorizes local option tax on seller of billboard advertising space.
Permits public records custodian to require deposit for OPRA record requests exceeding $15.
Provides for voluntary contributions to the "Homelessness Prevention Program" through real estate sales.
Upgrades penalties for eluding police officer if stolen vehicle involved.
Establishes financial incentives for certain energy providers to conduct energy audits.
Allows for 75 percent of costs of energy audits undertaken for commercial buildings be paid for by societal benefits charge.
Requires DCA to adopt energy inspection code, and requires licensed home inspector to report energy analysis for each home inspected for buyer in contemplation of purchase.

Disallows tax deduction under corporation business tax and gross income tax for punitive damages paid in connection with legal action; includes amount paid as punitive damages on behalf of taxpayer in income for tax purposes.
Permits establishment of municipal employee early retirement incentive programs.
