Requires Site Improvement Advisory Board to offer recommendations to encourage sustainable development.
Requires DCA to promulgate certain fire safety regulations concerning upholstered furniture and furnishings purchased for use in residential premises and public buildings.
Exempts various local units of government from State permitting fees and permits the reimbursement of violation fines under certain circumstances.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Provides an adjustment to school district tax levy cap for increases in special education costs per pupil in excess of $40,000 that exceed such prior year costs by more than 2%.
Exempts carsharing rentals from State imposed $5 per day motor vehicle rental fee.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJ QSAC) every seven years rather than every three years.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Increases campus security by allowing institutions of higher education to offer partial tuition credit to police officers enrolled at the institution who agree to be on duty while attending classes.
Permits municipalities and counties to issue bonds to fund buy-out of accumulated leave time in order to reduce future terminal leave expenses.
Amends Fiscal Year 2016 budget to provide one-half of certain environmental damage amounts recovered are appropriated for costs of remediation, restoration, and clean up.

Permits municipal, county, and regional police and fire forces to establish five-year residency requirement for police officers and firefighters; allows exceptions to requirement under certain circumstances.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Appropriates $250,000 to Department of Children and Families for grants to rape care crisis centers.

Prohibits payment for unused sick leave earned after effective date by public officers and employees not represented by union; for all public employees, limits vacation leave carry-forward and requires suspension and forfeiture of certain supplemental compensation.

Permits electric public utilities, electric power suppliers, and basic generation service providers to enter into certain agreements with building owners for use of solar electric systems at owners; buildings.

Limits payments for unused sick leave earned after effective date by public officers or employees represented by union; for all public employees, limits vacation leave carry-forward and requires suspension and forfeiture of certain supplemental compensation.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave; limits employment for certain public employees.
Upgrades crime of manslaughter to aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish performance-based funding plan for public institutions of higher education.
Requires electric public utilities to file with BPU and implement distribution infrastructure protection plans; prohibits rate increase pending implementation of plans.
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.

Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for Supreme Court Justices, Superior Court Judges, Tax Court Judges, Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and county prosecutors from 70 to 72.
Clarifies procedures for resignation, removal, and succession of fiduciaries.
Establishes $2 surcharge upon building permits for payments to Community Health Law Project.
Increases fees charged for marriage or civil union licenses and dedicates monies to Displaced Homemakers Trust Fund.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Establishes registry of stroke cases in State.
Requires law enforcement agency to issue retired law enforcement officer identification card to certain qualified retirees.
Requires certain workers subject to prevailing wage requirements to be enrolled in, or have completed, registered apprenticeship.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Establishes Statewide database of beds in shelters for the homeless.
"Health Care Consumer Cost Transparency Act"
Provides advance care planning coverage for Medicaid recipients.
Expands duties and responsibilities of Lieutenant Governor; includes Lieutenant Governor in existing laws governing recall and ethics; establishes Lieutenant Governor's salary and budget.
Repeals law that established optional will registry.
Establishes pilot program in Camden County directing MVC to automatically transmit applicant information to Secretary of State for automatic voter registration.
Requires insurers to provide minimum of 30 days inpatient treatment for substance abuse when physician determines treatment is medically necessary.
Increases sheriffs' fees for executing arrest warrants in Special Civil Part.
Requires completion of a computer science class as part of the high school graduation requirements.
Allows gross income tax deduction for certain student loan interest.
Prohibits local units of government from adopting increased minimum wage and mandatory paid sick leave for private employers.
Limits upfront costs for oral anticancer medications for persons covered under certain health benefits plans.
Requires insurers that sell flood insurance to provide certain policyholders with certain information.
Requires fire suppression systems in all elementary and secondary schools 12,000 square feet or larger.
Requires public utility to reimburse business customer during period when business ceases operations due to utility repairing or replacing its equipment on business customer's property.
Permits certain oaths, affirmations, and affidavits to be taken before township and village mayors.
Imposes residency requirements on newly appointed members of sewerage and utility authorities.
Directs the collection by the Administrative Office of the Courts of data about crimes committed by persons released on bail.
Eliminates statute of limitations for prosecution of human trafficking crimes.
Eliminates applicable court costs in certain medical event-related motor vehicle accidents.
Extends and expands the scope of the "Local Unit Electronic Technology Pilot Program and Study Act."
Clarifies law concerning local unit purchases of fuel from private service station by fuel credit card.
Facilitates widespread establishment of electronic tax sales.
Exempts disabled persons from the payment of municipal parking meter fees unless otherwise posted.
Prohibits school districts from declaring as absent child performers who meet certain criteria.
Bars judicially sanctioned name change to persons required to register as sex offender.
Requires public institution of higher education to provide information on Selective Service registration and inquire on Selective Service registration of prospective students.
Permits municipalities and school districts to agree on payment dates and amounts for transfer of school purposes tax collections.
Excludes veterans' benefits from calculation of financial obligation for care at psychiatric facility.
Requires certain persons licensed or appointed to inspect homes to pass criminal history background check.
Requires anticipation of parking fees in county and municipal budgets.
Clarifies the effect of abstention by a member of a public body.
Authorizes municipalities to deposit payments from recovered demolition costs into municipal "Emergency Demolition Fund."
Concerns government records requests for communications covered by attorney-client privilege.
Permits county governing bodies, by resolution, to revise real property assessment calendar.
Revises requirements for signage indicating accessible facilities for people with disabilities.
Permits municipalities to authorize property tax reward programs; validates actions of municipalities that have created them.

Authorizes municipalities, by resolution, to require tax collector to remove parcel of real property from accelerated tax sale list if fourth quarter property taxes not paid but property materially depreciated following severe weather event.
Permits taxing districts to credit amount of excess taxes paid to first two quarterly payments of local budget year next following date of final judgment, after successful appeal.
Authorizes penalties for failure to file certain public employment contracts; clarifies requirement for electronic posting of public employment contracts and interest arbitration awards.
Requires signage indicating when parking kiosk receipt must be displayed in vehicle to avoid citation.
Provides for termination of parental rights under certain circumstances; expands definition of "abused child."
Maintains property tax exemption for certain non-profit hospitals with on-site for-profit medical providers.
Authorizes wiretapping to investigate crimes involving human trafficking or certain prostitution activities.
Requires State to reimburse counties for costs paid for maintenance of county patients in State psychiatric hospitals who are eligible for federal Medicare or Medicaid coverage.
Schedules the termination of the realty transfer fees.
Prohibits State from billing counties for cost of psychiatric hospitalization when the patient or legally responsible relative is responsible for costs by court order.
Provides for Medicaid coverage and reimbursement for mental health services provided through telepsychiatry.
Requires public release of photographs of arrestees under State's open public records law.
Requires State personal income tax materials to include notice of certain property tax relief programs.
Clarifies law governing appointment of freeholder as county counsel or county treasurer.
Establishes right to contest accuracy of parking meter.
Clarifies that county sheriff provides security for judges at civil commitment proceedings.
Prohibits posting, publishing on the Internet, or disclosing certain information regarding military personnel.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amounts under New Jersey estate tax in accordance with provisions of federal tax law.
Allows certain on-site generation facilities to deliver electricity without utilizing electric public utility infrastructure.
Increases flexibility, clarity, and available tools of optional municipal consolidation process.
Requires environmental sustainability plan for State House Complex.
Authorizes Sunday bow hunting on federal military installations and William J. Hughes Technical Center.
Permits county correctional facilities to seek reimbursement from inmate welfare fund for certain medical services provided in county jails.

Requires State Board of Education high school graduation requirements include instruction on tuition assistance programs and student loan debt; requires high school students to meet with guidance counselor to discuss tuition assistance and dual enrollment.
Repeals law suspending certain licenses, registrations and certifications for failure to repay student loans.
Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to send monthly loan statement to each student who has outstanding loan under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students loan program.

Requires institutions of higher education to send out annual student debt letters; requires students enrolled in public institutions of higher education to complete course on student loan debt repayment.
Establishes "Einstein Scholars Program."
Revises and renames NJSTARS; repeals NJSTARS II; establishes NJ HonorScholars Program.
Realigns the transfer inheritance tax payment due date to coincide with the payment due dates for State and federal estate taxes.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years.
Prohibits use of State funds to lease or purchase certain motor vehicles.
Requires in-network hospitals to notify patients of out-of-network health care professionals who provide services in hospital.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Requires incarcerated individual from State to be counted at residential address for legislative redistricting purposes.
Requires firearms seizure when mental health professional determines patient poses threat of harm to self or others.
Authorizes all county sheriffs to appoint Class Two special law enforcement officers to perform court security duties.
Prohibits State appropriations from being expended by entity that adopts anti-Israel policy.
Establishes home elevation fund and dedicates up to $5 million of realty transfer fee revenue annually for this purpose.
Allows pharmacies to make self-administered hormonal contraceptives available over the counter.
Revises certain aspects of the New Jersey Individual Development Account Program.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program," in two vicinages including Burlington County.
"Free Means Free Act"; prohibits misleading advertising of free products.
Criminalizes using drones to conduct surveillance of or fly over critical infrastructures; requires certain drones to be registered and insured.
Excludes certain health care service firms from certain requirements.
Permits local health boards to require minimum temperature of 70 degrees from October through April in certain buildings occupied by seniors and disabled persons.
Provides diamondback terrapins protection as nongame indigenous species.
"Combat to College Act"; grants priority course registration to military service members and veterans attending public institutions of higher education.
Requires public institutions of higher education to grant academic credit to certain veterans.
Requires creditors to maintain vacant and abandoned non-residential properties under foreclosure.
Requires creditors to maintain interior of vacant and abandoned residential property under foreclosure.
Increases amount annually credited to Shore Protection Fund to $50 million.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Sets fees for DEP permits and approvals for repair or reconstruction of Sandy-damaged structures at no more than amount in effect on October 28, 2012.
Establishes telemarketing fraud investigation unit.
Requires taxpayer appealing assessment of real property assessed at more than $1 million to file an appraisal within 90 days of filing the appeal.
Permits certain audiologists to dispense and fit hearing aids.
Requires that definition of occurrence in certain property damage liability insurance policies include coverage for faulty workmanship.
Concerns victim's right to rape care advocate under certain circumstances.
Removes certain requirements for professional engineers to take examination to operate water supply and wastewater treatment systems.
"Protection for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities in Institutional and Community Settings Act."
Places limit on liens filed by condominium associations for unpaid assessments on timeshares.
Requires DOH to establish "New Jersey Autism Website."
Creates civil service preference for peacetime veterans.
Permits up to 10 children to be cared for by a registered family day care provider.
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for restricted use license.
Requires adoption agency, court, or DCPP to maintain child's religious upbringing when placing child in adoptive or resource family home.
Revises applicability of law concerning derivative proceedings and shareholder class actions.
Clarifies that corporate directors may approve actions without a meeting by electronic transmission.
Imposes requirements on certain pediatric emergency departments; requires DOH to include information on pediatric emergency departments in its annual hospital performance report.
Allows certain materials to be included in corporation's proxy solicitation materials.
Requires child's religion not be changed due to foster care or adoption.
Permits corporation to impose reasonable limitations or conditions on use or distribution of books and records by shareholders.
Requires practitioners to disclose business relationship with out-of-State facilities when making patient referrals to those facilities.
Revises law concerning foreign country money-judgment recognition.
Eliminates 15% fee charged by cemetery company on transfer of graves, crypts and niches.
Requires certain disclosures by non-fiduciary investment advisors.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from imposing surcharges on consumer credit card purchases.
Allows parent or guardian to exclude student from administration of certain assessments.
Requires State to provide recipients of State tax refunds, unemployment insurance benefits and State employee compensation certain payment options.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to award pupil transportation contracts that exceed bid threshold through request for proposals.
Establishes waiver, rebate or payment of insured's deductible, copayment, or coinsurance by health care practitioner as a form of insurance fraud subject to criminal and civil penalties.
Requires DOE to review Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure they incorporate standards regarding engineering where appropriate.
Renames "county vocational school districts" as "county career academies."
Requires certain arbitrators to file financial disclosure statements.
"Healthcare Disclosure and Transparency Act."
Provides county vocational school districts with the authority to name themselves in a manner that more accurately reflects their mission.
Requires carriers to classify medically necessary procedures as covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.
Requires Attorney General to provide identity theft passport to certain victims of identity theft.
Permits conversion of life insurance policies to pay for Medicaid long-term care.
Requires Medicaid coverage for diabetes self-management education, training, services, and equipment for patients diagnosed with diabetes, gestational diabetes, and pre-diabetes.
Increases reimbursement rate for providers of adult medical day care services.
Establishes central registry for sickle cell trait diagnoses; provides for informational outreach and genetic counseling.
Establishes that only non-violent offenders should have their cases reviewed by the parole board every three years.

Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to publish list of certain tamper-resistant opioid drugs; establishes that certain conditions be met for pharmacist to substitute for tamper-resistant opioid drug.
Establishes procedures for determining enforceability of standard form contracts; invalidates certain indemnification clauses.
Makes permanent certain temporary authorizations that expanded permitted investment by Director of Division of Investment of State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund and State pension funds.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
Requires State Board of Medical Examiners to conduct international criminal history background checks and check employer references for licensees.
Concerns NJ Transit's treatment of people with guide or service dogs; establishes Access Link Customer Service Group.
Establishes remote medical consultation assistance grant program in DOH.
Requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.
Establishes certain requirements, including allowable fees, for provision of medical records to patients, legally authorized representatives, and authorized third parties.
Deletes prior authorization requirements by certain insurers for accessing certain health care services.
"Santiago/Ramos/Liu Police Protection Act"; requires certain law enforcement vehicles to have tinted windows.

Prohibits permanent change of child custody during period of active military service; provides that absence due to active military duty, by itself, is insufficient justification to modify a child custody or visitation order.
Requires sex offenders to report internet identifiers and name changes.
Modifies charter of Board of Island Managers of Burlington Island to move elections to November.
Requires sharing of incarceration information between government agencies; prohibits certain benefits program payments to incarcerated individuals.
Clarifies use of motor vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic of certain road conditions is permissible.
Allows gross income tax deduction for first $200,000 earned by certain new physicians in their first seven taxable years of practice in New Jersey.
Requires law enforcement agencies to obtain search warrant prior to accessing telecommunications subscriber's personal information.
Establishes time limit for execution of arrest warrant for non-moving motor vehicle violations.
Eliminates duplicative requirements for notification to counties of admissions for Division of Developmental Disabilities residential services and for maintenance of those records.
Establishes time limit for issuance of warrant for certain motor vehicle violations.
Requires DOE to establish NJ Dyslexia website.
Concerns financial responsibility for inmates and certain legally charged patients transferred to psychiatric hospitals.
Codifies standard for rehospitalization after conditional discharge from psychiatric facitlity.
Requires court order to transfer person awaiting hearing for involuntary commitment from private hospital to State psychiatric hospital.
Provides alternate standard for involuntary commitment to treatment in out patient setting.
Requires reporting of Clostridium difficile infections in hospitals and nursing homes.
Requires Commissioner of Health to examine certain records of nursing home residents' personal funds, and provides that misappropriation of funds is grounds for cause of action.
Requires DHS to verify level of severity of reports received about incidents involving individuals with developmental disabilities.
Directs BPU to undertake public awareness campaign concerning telecommunications carriers, including mobile and Voice over Internet Protocol service providers, and disclosure of customer information.
Prohibits certain public utilities from sending residential customers redundant written notice of enrollment in government energy aggregation programs.
Requires designation of certain intersections for alternative emergency power generator in event of Statewide emergency.
Establishes exemption for solar panel installation in certain wetland areas on farmland.
Prohibits NJ State Forest Nursery from undercutting private nurseries by selling forestation stock below average market price.
Authorizes subdivision of certain preserved farms into smaller preserved farms under certain circumstances.
Directs State Agriculture Development Committee to establish limited transfer of development rights program for permanent retirement of certain residential development rights on preserved farmland.
Establishes procedures for registering equivalent of vicious or potentially dangerous dog relocated into State from out of State.
Exempts parking spaces reserved for persons with a disability from meters or fees.
Prohibits electric and gas public utilities from collecting payment from residential budget billing plan customers whose service was interrupted as a result of major emergency event.
Increases fees for licensing and renewal of bail-bond agents to defray taxpayer costs per SCI recommendations.
Prohibits electric and gas public utilities from disqualifying certain residential customers if enrolled in government energy aggregation program.
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization before increasing a fee or imposing a new fee, but retains DEP authority to use ordinary administrative procedure when decreasing a fee.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Clarifies sales tax collection responsibilities of horse boarding businesses in New Jersey.
Requires public schools to include instruction on cursive handwriting.
Excludes from gross income tax value of prizes or awards won in athletic competition in Olympic Games.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain game birds to certain persons licensed to operate semiwild shooting preserves.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Authorizes special plate for holders of "Combat Action Ribbon."
Creates viticulture trail tourist directional signs.
Authorizes issuance of multi-species depredation permit for wildlife control on farmland.
Authorizes free State park and forest admission and free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for persons with certain types of military service.
Permits farm wineries to create alternating proprietorship for production of wine.
Establishes farmland preservation inheritance tax deduction program within Department of Agriculture.
Establishes Dept. of Agriculture cooking contest.
Directs the Div. of Travel and Tourism to publish on its website information of farm-to-table restaurants.
Establishes NJ "Farm-to-Table Restaurant" awards program.*
Authorizes counties to issue promotional labeling for county agricultural products.

Requires Dept. of Agriculture to develop voluntary guidelines to encourage school districts and institutions of higher education to donate excess food; extends "Food Bank Good Samaritan Act" protections to school districts.
Requires NJEDA to establish loan program for certain farming operation equipment purchases.
Establishes Farm to School Coordinating Council.
Establishes "New Jersey Farm to Public Institution of Higher Education Program."
Allows qualified school to be called "New Jersey Farm Fresh School."
Permits school participating in NJ "Farm to School" program to submit recipe for posting on Dept. of Agriculture website.
Provides tax credit to developers for affordable housing projects in certain neighborhoods.
Permits entry on adjoining property to make improvements or repairs in certain situations.
Provides State agencies will not enter into contracts with business entities that require persons or public entities to give up rights or remedies provided by State law.
Prohibits retailers from scanning consumer's identification card for return of merchandise.
Requires DCA to provide accounting of monies remitted to the "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund" by municipality and allows for municipal affordable housing credit for funds remitted.
Requires condemnor to acquire road access easement for property owner if condemnation eliminates road access.
Revises application and issuance procedures for employment certificates for minors.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations and partnerships.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program.
Requires establishment of regulations for solar panel installation, maintenance, and education.
Prohibits residential development fees on reconstruction after natural disasters.

Requires certain common interest community associations to publish certain information; requires that homeowners' association contracts for management and maintenance include 24-hour emergency services.
Requires boil water notices to be provided by certain public water systems via telephone, email or text message.

Requires NJT to limit fare increases under its discount program for senior citizens, persons with disabilities, and college students; designated as "Fare Affordability and Ridership Empowerment (FARE) Act."
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Revises procedures for processing incomplete Medicaid applications; exempts asset transfers of up to $500 per month during look back period for determining eligibility for long-term care services.
Provides for receipts for applications for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
Requires certain coaches to successfully complete youth football league training course; requires DOH to approve course.
Requires DHS to ensure that expedited benefits under Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) are made available to certain households.
Allows defendant to apply for expungement of more than one crime under certain circumstances.
Establishes Medicaid program to provide housing-related services to individuals experiencing chromic homelessness.
Establishes Mike Adler Aphasia Task Force to assess needs of persons with aphasia, and their families, and ensure adequate provision of support services and information thereto.
Provides that county prosecutors receive annual salaries in amount equal to annual salary of full time Superior Court Assignment Judge.
Concerns random drug testing of certain inmates.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for enrollment at a New Jersey college or university.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
Includes boarding of guard dogs in definition of kennel; increases license fees for kennels and pet shops.
Provides for a mandatory term of imprisonment for assault involving domestic violence.
Expands types of abusive acts that constitute domestic violence under "Prevention of Domestic Violence Act of 1991."
Bars persons under age 18 from marrying or entering into a civil union.
Exempts electric vehicle charging systems from real property taxation.
Permits BPU to approve qualified wind energy project; requires BPU to provide application periods for those projects.
Amends the "Public Corruption Profiteering Penalty Act."
Establishes the New Jersey School Counts County College Scholarship Program.
Requires development of longitudinal data system that maintains individuals' data from preschool through entry into workforce.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish performance-based funding plans for public institutions of higher education.
Modifies education requirement for licensure by the NJ State Board of Cosmetology and Hairstyling.
"New Jersey Secure Choice Savings Program Act"; establishes retirement savings program for certain workers.
Requires State agencies, when developing and proposing rules, to utilize approaches that will accomplish objectives of statutory law while minimizing adverse economic impact on municipalities.

Permits registered surgical practices to convert to or combine with ambulatory care facilities; provides for phased-in gross receipts assessment; authorizes non-profit hospitals to acquire joint ownership interest in practices.
Permits municipalities to provide information on property tax bills concerning amount of local tax dollars saved through shared services.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Requires testing for infectious disease for certain persons who have been administered opioid antidote by first responder.
Provides that limitation on hours of retail sale of alcohol be consistent throughout licensed premises.
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund, dedicates $500,000 annually from certain power vessel operator license fees to the fund, and appropriates $500,000.
Clarifies "knockout game" assault as third-degree aggravated assault; provides mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for such assault.
Expands registration requirements under Megan's Law to include persons committing human trafficking crimes or engaging in prostitution, when crimes involve minors.
Makes various revisions to scrap metal law.
Provides for shops offering a combination of skin care specialty services and manicuring services.

Requires consideration of ecotourism when evaluating and ranking applications by local government units or qualifying tax exempt nonprofit organizations for acquisition or development of lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Authorizes recitation of Pledge of Allegiance by public body at public meeting; permits discretionary court award of certain fees and costs to public body.
Establishes new crimes concerning commercial exploitation of a child.
Preserves judicial duty of impartiality by prohibiting certain communications by local government officers or employees with municipal court judges or candidates for municipal court judgeships.
Requires electric public utilities to obtain written consent and provide written disclosure prior to installing smart meters.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Concerns human trafficking of a minor.
Requires BPU to consider certain revenue-raising limitations when determining whether to approve increases in public utility rates, fares or charges that may be assessed to municipalities.

Prohibits DEP from charging fee for mobile sportfishing vehicle permit to any NJ resident who is a veteran, active military member, former or current member of the NJ National Guard or Reserve, or a volunteer emergency worker.
Provides that certain nonprofit organizations would not be assessed a civil administrative penalty under the "Water Supply Management Act" for exceeding permitted water allocations.
Permits extension of deadline for notification of depreciation of value of real property to tax assessor and allows Division of Taxation to extend certain statutory dates.
Requires Secretary of State to promulgate rules and regulations governing use of official seal of local unit.
Permits reassessment of real property when municipal assessor has not received notice of material depreciation from property owner and allows Division of Taxation to extend certain statutory dates.
Requiring municipal auditors to test whether tax exempt properties remain eligible for exemption.
Establishes New Jersey Eco-Ag Tourism Council.
Requires certain financial institutions to provide schedule of fees, charges, and penalties for deposit accounts.
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Permits municipalities to dedicate revenues from storage of motor vehicles for maintenance, surveillance, construction expenses, and salaries related to municipal impound lots.
Requires additional notices to governmental agencies upon termination of utility services to residential customers.
Increases penalties for energy "slamming" practices.
Prohibits use of certain technology for unauthorized electronic surveillance of cellular telephones.

Increases penalties for crime of false public alarm when false alarm impacts school operations; adds response costs incurred by school to total costs imposed upon responsible person under certain circumstances.
Upgrades crime of false public alarm whenever response to alarm results in law enforcement's use of forcible entry into any place, or use of force or threat of use of force on another person.
Removes outdated reference to kissing Bible formerly associated with administration and solemnity of oaths in court or any legal proceeding.

Requires certain psychiatric facilities to contact Division of Child Protection and Permanency if minor is to be discharged and parent or guardian is unable or unwilling to remove minor from facility.
Clarifies factors currently used by courts to determine when child support orders can be terminated.
Establishes the New Jersey Rare Disease Advisory Council.
Requires psychiatrists to complete screening certificates no later than 12 hours after completion of screening documents.
Clarifies manner of public disclosure of findings or information about child abuse or neglect cases resulting in child fatalities or near fatalities.

Requires elected public officials and candidates for elective public office to disclose if they ever filed for bankruptcy; requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Prohibits provisions in consumer contracts which penalize a consumer for commenting negatively about goods or services rendered.
Limits payment to any public officer or employee terminated prior to expiration of individual contract of employment.
Requires any candidate convicted of crimes or offenses to return campaign contributions to donors; freezes most campaign funds of candidates indicted for crimes or offenses.
Requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Permits human trafficking victims to testify by closed circuit television under certain circumstances.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Authorizes school district hiring preference for veterans.
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
Establishes requirements concerning necessary care of dogs, domestic companion animals, and service animals, and for tethering of dogs.***
Revises animal cruelty offenses involving neglect and abuse, and the penalties therefor; repeals appropriate sections of law.
Establishes cruelly restraining a dog as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Increases penalties for failing to yield when violation results in death to pedestrian.
Establishes minimum criminal penalties for animal cruelty offenses.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.
Concerns UEZ program funding to qualifying municipalities.
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
Provides that organ donor designation on driver's license or identification card remains upon renewal of license or card under certain circumstances.

Revises animal cruelty offenses concerning abuse, abandonment, neglect, and improper euthanizing of animals, increases criminal and civil penalties therefor; establishes such penalties for new offenses; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Revises animal cruelty offenses involving neglect, care and euthanasia of impounded animals, and the penalties therefor.
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.

Revises animal cruelty offenses and penalties concerning animal abandonment and failure to report injuring certain animals with a motor vehicle; increases civil penalties for certain other animal cruelty offenses.
Designates Dept. of Agriculture as sole agency to administer "Seniors Farmers' Market Nutrition Program."
Transfers administration of certain nutrition programs to Department of Agriculture.
Enacts the "NJ Family First Employer Act"; establishes award for certain employers.
Establishes supervised community reintegration program for certain victims of domestic abuse.
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Establishes "New Jersey Works Dual Enrollment Option Program."
Requires school districts to pay advanced placement examination fees for certain students and the State to reimburse school districts for the cost.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain moving expenses for taxpayer moving to New Jersey to commence work in State.
Provides family leave insurance for certain first responders.
Authorizes special striped bass license plate.
Establishes Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers Task Force.
Requires debt collectors, in certain circumstances, to cease debt collections against certain victims of identity theft.
Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring maintenance and repair of certain wharves, piers, docks and bulkheads.
Authorizes "100 percent Disabled Veteran" license plates for qualified veterans; entitles holders to handicapped parking privileges.
Establishes entrepreneur-in-residence pilot program.
Prohibits use of hands-free wireless telephones and electronic communication devices while providing instruction in operation of a motor vehicle.
Authorizes EDA to provide financial assistance to certain business incubator facilities.
"Invest in New Jersey First Act;" requires preference in awarding certain contracts for critical infrastructure projects.
"Innovate New Jersey Act"; establishes tax-free business incubators at institutions of higher education.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Establishes New Jersey Business Action Center in Department of State.
Provides that trespassing in nuclear power plant is third degree crime.
Establishes technology transfer assistance program in EDA.
Makes escapees responsible for apprehension costs.
Prohibits annual bonuses for perfect attendance and the non-use of sick leave.
Caps State use portion of energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Prohibits certain political subdivisions from awarding longevity-based benefits to their employees.
Prohibits seller of real estate to transfer realty transfer fee liability to buyer.

Requires certain political subdivisions to grant employees only those holidays granted to State employees and standardizes amount of paid vacation and sick leave granted to employees of certain political subdivisions.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Allows "Coastal Protection Trust Fund" monies to be used to separate combined sewer systems.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault if committed against county or municipal official in certain circumstances.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Directs Office of Emergency Management to develop and undertake annual public awareness campaign concerning State's emergency coastal evacuation plan.
Authorizes veterans to deduct two years military service from age requirement for police officer under certain circumstances.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Requires explosive gas detectors to be installed in certain residential properties.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Increases annual income limits for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Provides that PFRS definitions of widow, widower and spouse will include domestic partners of all PFRS members.
Requires health care facility staff to provide certain counseling following miscarriages and State registrar to establish certificate of birth.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Concerns taxation of casino gaming property; redirects investment alternative tax proceeds; abolishes Atlantic City Alliance.
Revises legal drinking age from 21 to 18 years of age.
Clarifies law concerning the advertising and promoting of NJ farm products.
Increases minimum civil fine for harassing person taking wildlife and increases criminal penalty for subsequent offenses.
Codifies AG recommendations for issuing Amber Alert when family member abducts child.
Prohibits harassment of farmers engaged in farming operations.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Establishes "New Jersey Commission on Government Efficiency and Cost Control" to recommend measures for efficiency and cost reduction in State government.
Exempts experienced firefighters from certain requirements.
Prohibits nonwoven disposable products from being advertised, packaged, or labeled as flushable unless they pass third party test approved by DEP.
"The Peter Falk Act"; establishes certain requirements concerning access to persons subject to order of guardianship.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Monmouth Park racetrack, upon voter approval; dedicates one-third net proceeds to General Fund, one-third to State education aid, and one-third to horse racing industry.
Revises definition of "antique firearm" to include handguns.
Provides that healthcare benefits plan, fully or partly paid by public employer, cannot cover public employee's spouse who is subject of divorce from bed and board.

Provides public employee in State-administered retirement system who continues preexisting volunteer relationship with employer from whom employee retires has bona fide severance from employment for compliance with NJ and federal regulations.
Establishes the "Mental Health Treatment Reform and Violence Prevention Act."
Designates Killed in Action flag as an official State flag; mandates it be displayed at certain public buildings.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement, in consultation with New Jersey Racing Commission, to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks.
Increases penalties for underage drivers who have consumed alcohol.

Allows permitholder that leases Meadowlands Racetrack from New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct wagering on simulcast horse races at sports, retail, and entertainment development at Meadowlands Complex, subject to agreement and approvals.
Enhances penalties for drivers without motor vehicle insurance involved in accident with pedestrian; requires public awareness campaign concerning importance of this insurance.
Provides for life imprisonment without parole for killing an emergency responder.
Transfers all probation functions and employees to Bureau of Probation in State Parole Board.
Alexandra's Law; prohibits operation of motor vehicle with detectable amount of CDS in blood.
Governs premium for executing bail bonds, per SCI recommendations.
Provides law enforcement officers option to obtain handgun permit or firearms identification card from municipality where they are employed.
Permits juveniles to be admitted to drug court program under certain circumstances.
Increases from 3.2% to 5% percentage of certain dedicated purse moneys used for horsemen aid programs and the association from Standardbred racing at private racetracks.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting licensed bounty hunters.
Permits volunteer fire company or volunteer first aid or rescue squad licensed to conduct bingo games to use public building for operation of bingo games under certain circumstances.
Requires certain elected officials and appointed officers eligible for dual health benefits coverage to choose coverage by one public entity.
Requires certain employees and candidates for public school employment or service and youth camp employees to undergo child abuse record information check.
Provides exceptions to garnish exemption against benefits from State-administered pension systems for certain financial claims under State law.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Freehold Raceway, upon voter approval; dedicates one-third net proceeds to General Fund, one-third to State education aid, and one-third to horse racing industry.
Provides for three year retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to provide assistive technology to elementary and middle school students with dyslexia.
Authorizes placement of patron-operated lottery terminals at running and harness horse racetracks.
Prohibits payment of public employee bonuses not directly contingent upon achieving certain performance goals.
Eliminates unemployment tax for certain workers ineligible to receive unemployment benefits.

Directs Attorney General to establish "Student-Athlete's Bill of Rights" for interscholastic sports teams similar to requirement that Attorney General establish "Pledge's Bill of Rights" for fraternities and sororities at institutions of higher education.
Prohibits the employment of unauthorized aliens and requires employers to use E-Verify program.
Requires transfer of certain incarceration records to DOLWD.
Authorizes slot machine gambling to be conducted at horse racetracks; dedicates State's share of revenues for open space preservation.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks; dedicates revenues derived therefrom as State aid for education.
Provides that public school used as polling place may not be open for classes on day of election.

Requires school districts to incorporate age-appropriate sexual abuse and assault awareness and prevention education in grades preschool through 12 as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Requires employees of private entity with access to student information under contract with DOE, school districts, or charter schools to undergo criminal background check.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain county corrections officers.
Requires nonpublic school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to a local law enforcement.
Requires public and nonpublic school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
Prohibits certain violations of terms of service for Internet ticket sales.
Exempts cable television subscriber from notifying cable television company, Office of Cable Television, or other complaint officer of cable television service outage to receive credit or rebate.
Concerns contributions to special funds made through the gross income tax return.
Establishes gross income tax credit for cost of certain postage for sending goods to members of United States Armed Forces and National Guard who are serving their country away from home.
Establishes pilot program allowing municipality and engineering firm to contract to serve as construction code enforcing agency.
Exempts homeless student or student in resource family home who transfers between school districts after second year of high school from local graduation requirements.
Creates the New Jersey Advanced Manufacturing Council.
Prohibits anti-tiering clauses in managed care health benefits plans.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support autism programs.
Prohibits cloud computing service providers from disclosing data collected from public, private, or charter schools.
Provides corporation business tax and the gross income tax credits for insourcing business to New Jersey.
Establishes employment goals and requirements for development subsidies.
Concerning development subsidies and certain employment practices.
Requires repayment of development subsidies in certain cases of failure to meet job creation or retention requirements.
Establishes manufacturing machine and metal trade apprenticeships tax credit program.
Requires identification cards for bail agent, per SCI recommendations.

Prohibits certain communication with or solicitation of incarcerated individuals; provides license revocation for certain bail agents and agencies; creates fourth degree crime, per SCI recommendations.
Increases the penalty for hindering the apprehension or prosecution of offender.
Transfers authority to regulate bail agents from DOBI to DLPS; establishes Bail Agent Enforcement Unit, per SCI recommendations.
Decriminalizes manufacture and certain possession of slingshots.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.

Requires county and municipal welfare agencies to determine if person is sex offender within a certain time after initial placement in emergency shelter and to provide notification of placement to law enforcement.
Criminalizes manufacture, sale, and possession of substances containing kratom.
Prohibits award of custody or visitation rights to persons convicted of certain sex crimes against minors.
Implements reporting requirements for agricultural tourism pilot program; creates task force.
Establishes security standards for judicial hearings at mental health facilities.
Requires State Police's website to provide a link to report reckless or aggressive driving by school bus driver.
Requires certain accuracy standards for child support wage garnishments.
Provides that records of convictions for carjacking and promoting prostitution of child shall not be expunged.

Requires Attorney General to develop written guidelines concerning communication between bail agents and inmates; requires county correctional facilities to adopt policies in compliance, per SCI recommendations.
Requires disclosure of all campaign contributions received and expenditures made by school board candidates.
Increases threshold value of surplus State-owned real property and easements above which legislative review and approval is required before sale.
Provides that videotaping of aggravated assault is a third degree crime.
Requires incarcerated individual be counted for redistricting purposes at previous address if State resident and not counted if incarcerated and not State resident.
Permits charging late fee for rental payments due on self-service storage units and authorizes sale of property via website.
Encourages sharing of services; makes appropriations.
Concerns low emission and zero emission vehicles; establishes Clean Vehicle Task Force.

Credits increases in employee contributions required by P.L.2011, c.78 as additional contributions to TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS, and SPRS unavailable to reduce normal contributions of State and local employers for actuarial valuations beginning July 1, 2015.
Establishes independent Office of Comptroller of Education and removes authority of State Comptroller with regard to oversight of boards of education.
Increases fine for violation of certain laws concerning pedestrian safety and traffic control; dedicates funds to certain roadways.
Increases penalties for motor vehicle violations resulting in serious bodily injury or death to certain persons in highway.
Requires percentage of motor vehicle fines be used to support safe routes to school initiatives.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide to prospective students certain cost, loan, and debt information in financial aid shopping sheet.
Increases Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain evidence-based behavioral health services; designated as the Mental Health Access Act.
Establishes three-year Medicaid home visitation demonstration project.
Reduces residency requirement for resident hunting licenses from six months to 60 days.
Establishes construction workforce recruitment and training program in DOLWD.
Allows school district to teach about traditional winter celebrations, display holiday symbols on school property, and include musical selections with religious themes.
Prohibits placing primary election candidates into political party lines on primary ballot.

Provides 50% State matching funds to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient pupil transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.

Provides State transportation aid incentive to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.
Permits certain qualified nonprofit organizations to participate in State purchasing contracts.
Allows State residents who are outside of New Jersey to place wagers on horse races using account wagering system.
Requires law enforcement officers to search domestic violence restraining order registry upon conducting an arrest.

Requires State, counties, municipalities, and instrumentalities thereof to post public employee contracts on respective websites; requires posting on Civil Service Commission's website when local unit does not maintain own website.

Extends "Right to Farm" protection to certain agricultural tourism activities and events; requires adoption of agricultural management practices therefor; and permits special occasion events that promote agricultural tourism to be conducted under certain circumstances.
Establishes trunk fighting as animal cruelty offense and crime of the third degree.

Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in urban enterprise zone program; allow zone funds to pay for storm related recovery costs for five years.
Designates New Jersey Route 47 from Wildwood City to Maurice River Township as "Veterans Memorial Highway at Delsea Drive."
Directs DOT to establish roadside accident memorial program.
Requires breath or blood test in motor vehicle accidents involving pedestrians.
"Empower the Principal Act"; eliminates local school superintendents and prohibits schools from having more than one assitant or vice-principal.
Creates offense of making false child abuse report; permits assessment of penalty.
Criminalizes mental or emotional hazing.

Requires public institutions of higher education to provide student-athletes who lose athletic scholarships because of injuries sustained while participating in the athletic program with equivalent scholarships.
Renames Mountainview Youth Correctional Facility as "William H. Fauver Youth Correctional Facility."
The "Municipal Stabilization and Recovery Act."
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds; exempts firearms with .22 caliber tubular magazines from 10 round limitation.
Conditions appropriation for State professional boards on expenditure of budget allocation to Board of Nursing to process and eliminate home health aide application backlog.
Requires issuance of conditional certifications for homemaker-home health aides within seven days and issuance of final certification within 120 days.
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Requires school districts and charter schools to provide educationally appropriate alternative activities to students not participating in administration of certain standardized assessments.

Requires county elections board give notice by Internet posting or mail when polling place location changes unexpectedly before election; requires board develop plan for polling place change notification.
Establishes microenterprise training program and assistance for microentrepreneurs; gives priority status to projects involving microenterprises under Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program.
Requires fire suppression systems in new single and two family homes.
Establishes program allowing certain applicants to perform community service in lieu of paying motor vehicle surcharges.
Excludes paraffin used in manufacture of candles from petroleum products gross receipts tax.
Requires hospitals and health care professionals to offer hepatitis C testing to certain individuals.
Dedicates one percent of cigarette and other tobacco products tax revenues to anti-smoking initiatives.*
Increases the personal income tax's pension and retirement income exclusion fivefold over three years.

Provides parties offering public remarks before Senate committee concerning qualifications of Superior Court judge nominees, upon motion, change of venue on family actions, to vicinage other than vicinage where nominee is assigned if confirmed.
Revises procedure for determining real property tax appeal outcomes.
Designates striped bass as New Jersey Saltwater Fish and redesignates brook trout as NJ State Freshwater Fish.*
Amends and repeals sections of "Respiratory Care Practitioner Licensing Act."
Requires creditor to provide mortgage payoff balance on home loan within five business days after notification of request.
Provides procedure to cancel mortgage of record by affidavit of entitled person under certain circumstances.
Revises residential property mortgage foreclosure process.
Establishes New Jersey School Safety Specialist Academy in Department of Education and requires school districts to designate school safety specialist.
Requires certain school security measures to be incorporated in architectural design of new school construction and certain school security measures for existing buildings.

Requires annual school security training for school employees to be conducted collaboratively with emergency responders; requires law enforcement officer to annually attend at least one school security drill.

Establishes a charter school review board in DOE to review charter school applications and modifies aspects of the charter school program including approval, monitoring, and evaluation of charter schools.
Creates license to manufacture and sell hard cider and mead.*
Requires parents of children receiving subsidized child care services or enrolled in preschool to complete nutrition education classes.
Authorizes court to waive certain fees, offer mediation as sentence; authorizes defendant information in presentence report; requires benefits be considered in juvenile plan.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employer-provided child care expenditures.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment, facility renovation, modernization, and expansion.

Establishes additional ethical requirements concerning sale or conveyance of property or development rights to the State or other public entities by elected public official or immediate family member thereof.
Requires public hearings concerning public utility rate increase to be conducted within two years of public utility's application for rate increase.
Prohibits sex offenders from holding any job, position, or type of employment that primarily consists of contact with children.
Clarifies DHS authority to license and regulate sober living homes.
Prohibits plea bargain if sex offender who committed Megan's Law offense would not be required to register.
Establishes time limit for retention of automated license plate reader data by law enforcement agency.
Establishes Children's Health Promotion Fund.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.

Requires comparable level of services and supports to be provided to former residents of developmental centers transitioning to community placements and for placements to be located within 30 miles of closed centers.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to provide every person engaged in raising a dog for guide or service the right to access public facilities.
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Provides that children under care, custody or supervision of DCPP may not be home-schooled.
Establishes Department of Early Childhood.
Extends voting rights of representatives of sending districts on receiving district board of education.

Eliminates requirement that at least one of two licenses issued under small-scale and staged casino facility pilot program must be staged casino facility license; permits these facilities to be located in renovated buildings.
Establishes Main Street Assistance Program to encourage business development in small municipalities.
Establishes "Art in Storefronts" initiative within the Main Street New Jersey program.
Permits persons at racetracks, off-track wagering facilities, and casino simulcasting facilities to place instant racing wagers.
Authorizes notaries public to take oath of office before any official generally authorized to take oaths.
Requires municipal court judge to disclose to governing body of municipality information concerning certain decisions by the Advisory Committee on Judicial Conduct.
The "Motherhood Violence Act;" creates the offense of fetal homicide.
Imposes criminal penalties for leaving child unattended and unsupervised in motor vehicle.
Harmonizes the disqualifying offenses and certain other criminal history record background check requirements applicable to home instructors employed under DOE or DHS authority.
Requires Silver Alert System receive same broadcast alerts as Amber Alert System.
Authorizes municipal volunteer programs for free removal of snow from certain residential properties occupied byseniors or disabled persons.*
Requires greater disclosure of substantive contacts between government officials and governmental affairs agents.
Requires certain places of public assembly to have automated external defibrillator on-site.
Decreases from 55 days to 21 days minimum time required to change political party affiliation prior to primary.
Provides courts with sentencing discretion for certain convictions concerning possession of a firearm.

Provides protections for children under the age of 18 with developmental disabilities and individuals with developmental disabilities ages 18-21 receiving services from Division of Children's System of Care.
Supplemental appropriation of $50 million from General Fund to DHS for substance abuse treatment and prevention.
Allows gross income tax deductions totaling $300,000 over five taxable years for certain primary care physicians.
Sets forth certain standards to be followed by law enforcement agencies and fire departments when utilizing drones.
Establishes minimum level of domestic violence training for judges and judicial personnel.
Authorizes account wagering licensee to accept wagers from residents of eligible United States jurisdictions through account wagering system via electronic means such as internet.
Prohibits multiple coverage for public employer health care benefits as employee, dependent, or retiree.
Prohibits person with foreign criminal conviction from seeking and holding elective public office in this State under certain circumstances; increases penalty for election bribery offense.
Confers title of Acting Associate Justice of the Supreme Court on certain judges of the Superior Court, Appellate Division, temporarily assigned to the Supreme Court.

Revises court filing fees, assessments, penalties, fines, and certain licensing fees to fund Pretrial Services Program, e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; repeals certain statutory provisions concerning court fees.
Requires financial literacy instruction to pupils enrolled in grades kindergarten through eight.
Directs DEP to classify neonicotinoid pesticides as restricted use pesticides.
Requires pesticide applicator to notify beekeeper when applying pesticide within three miles of registered honey or native beehive or beeyard.
Establishes two-year innovative drinking water supply and wastewater infrastructure grant program in DEP; appropriates up to $20 million from societal benefits charge therefor.
Requires training for pesticide applicators and operators concerning pollinating bees.
Concerns electronic medical bills for workers' compensation claims.*
Concerns electronic submission of certain automobile insurance claims.
Designates Common Eastern Bumble Bee as New Jersey State Native Pollinator.
Permits hospitals to establish system for making performance-based incentive payments to physicians.

Permits certain public institutions of higher education to make purchases and contract for services as participating contracting units in cooperative pricing systems and through use of nationally-recognized and accepted cooperative purchasing agreements.
Establishes teen driver orientation program.
Establishes certain additional examination and special learner's permit requirements.
Repeals family cap in Work First New Jersey program.
Requires DOH regulations regarding elevated blood lead levels in children, and appropriate responses thereto, to be consistent with latest Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommendations.
Requires depository institutions to provide paper account statements to elder adults.
Requires certain providers of transportation services to develop and publish route schedules.
Requires Dept. of Agriculture to create clearinghouse website for vendors to provide surplus food to charities in State.
Revises 20% affordable housing set-aside requirement for newly-constructed housing developments within regional planning entities.
Requires COAH to subtract affordable units from municipality's fair share affordable housing obligation to reflect job loss upon closure of federal military installation.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 21 as "Roberto Clemente Memorial Highway."*
Requires State agencies to vacate certain property in Trenton; allows EDA to offer incentives to private entities to locate to that property.
Prohibits advertising of certain products to minors on websites; requires website operators to allow minors to delete posts.

Makes supplemental appropriation of $122,200,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide additional State school aid to school districts with equalized school tax rate greater than specified threshold.
Establishes an animal abuser registry.
Establishes compensation program for law enforcement officers and certain other employees injured while performing official duties. *

Provides for designation of acute stroke ready hospitals; establishes Stroke Care Advisory Panel and Statewide stroke database; requires development of emergency services stroke care protocols; and mandates insurance coverage for telemedicine for stroke care.
Requires prescribers to discuss addiction risk associated with certain drugs prior to issuing prescription to minor patient.
Requires public and nonpublic schools, local recreation departments, and youth serving organizations to have licensed athletic trainer present at youth athletic events.
Concerns attorney fees for workers' compensation awards.
Requires DOBI to provide notification of suspension or revocation of license or registration of third party administrators.
Upgrades certain types of assault against sports officials to aggravated assault.
Clarifies police powers of railroad police officers and imposes training requirements.
Directs Commissioner of Education to study safety of school bus passengers in emergencies.
Requires lobby security for certain senior citizen high-rise buildings in areas with high violent crime rates.
Establishes task force to study and make recommendations concerning mobility and support services needs of NJ adults with autism spectrum disorder.

"Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act"; authorizes executor, agent, guardian, or trustee, under certain circumstances, to manage electronic records of decedent, principal, incapacitated person, or trust creator.
Permits abandoned prescription medication to be re-dispensed up to one year after original preparation.
Imposes prevailing wage for public work on properties receiving tax abatements or exemptions.
Requires mandatory imprisonment for child luring and requires certain information about Megan's Law to be provided to sex offenders annually.
Designates "Garden State" as State Slogan.
Requires initial determination of unemployment benefits to be made within three weeks of filing of claim.
Creates cigar night smoking ban exemption at racetracks and off-track wagering facilities.
Prohibits employment discrimination based on applicant employment status.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Prohibits sale and possession of undetectable firearms manufactured using three dimensional printing technology.
Authorizes transfer of excess medical marijuana inventory between alternative treatment centers.
"The Smarter Lunchroom Act;" promotes healthy food choices in school cafeterias.
Upgrades certain penalties for resisting arrest; prohibits merger of resisting arrest with other criminal convictions.

Clarifies that Division of Mental Health Advocacy in Office of Public Defender is required to represent indigent patients in all mental health commitment proceedings, whether related to inpatient or outpatient treatment.
Updates certain provisions concerning legal settlements and persons in mental health facilities to reflect changes in civil union, same sex marriage, and parentage laws.
Requires any State entity administering State or federal public benefit programs to verify recipient's personal information against death records to prevent payment to deceased individual.
Provides excused absence for student who participates in State Agricultural Convention to receive recognition award.
Prohibits any entity receiving public funds from banning display of United States flag under certain circumstances.
Eliminates dual governmental pay to members of Legislature for legislative duties.
"Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act"; bans abortion 20 weeks or more after fertilization.
Requires public bodies to allow public comment at every meeting.
Requires any POW-MIA flag purchased with State funds be manufactured in United States.
Allows certain State Lottery functions to be conducted for seven days during state of emergency due to failure to enact general appropriation law.
Establishes resisting arrest public awareness campaign.
Establishes second degree crime for threatening to kill law enforcement officers.
Upgrades penalties for crimes committed with aid of firearms locator application.
Requires State to lower compensation rate of civilly committed sexually violent predators to same level as State inmates for institutional work.
Authorizes issuance of duplicate firearms purchaser identification cards for change of address with certain proof.
Creates penalties for using mobile applications to aid in commission of crime.
Requires persons convicted of sex offense in foreign countries to comply with Megan's Law.
Updates references to DOC and DHS and refers to persons receiving services from DHS.

Requires EDA to establish program offering low-interest loan to certain financial institutions and personal data businesses to protect business's information technology system from customer personal information disclosure.
Requires boards of education to conduct student vision screenings that include evaluation of visual acuity and binocular vision.
Revises application deadline for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Expands military leave benefits for certain public officers and employees subject to proof of service.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.
Establishes compensation program for certain injured probation officers.
Requires correctional facilities to provide inmates with prescription medication that was prescribed for chronic conditions existing prior to incarceration.
Increases minimum wage in Essex, Hudson, Camden, Mercer, and Middlesex counties to $20 per hour for five years.
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.
Establishes temporary mortgage relief programs for certain owners of real property impacted by "Superstorm Sandy."
Dedicates one percent of cigarette tax revenue to anti-smoking initiatives.
Provides for licensure of ambulatory care facilities to provide integrated primary care services including behavioral health care.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers in certain fields to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in certain failing schools.
Prohibits for 10 years applicability of new State and local rules and regulations to certain manufacturing facilities.

Establishes procedures for consolidating fire districts and for moving annual fire district election to November; eliminates vote on fire district budgets, except for proposals to raise revenue above the permissible levy cap.
Concerns employer inquiries about worker's wage and salary experience.*
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.
"Permit Transparency Act"; requires State entity to post on official website number of permits applied for and issued, revenue derived, number of employees involved, and salary of such employees.
Directs board of trustees of county college to post information on the compensation paid to college president on its website.
Removes expiration of required payment by public employees of percentage of cost of health care coverage provided by public employers.

Permits school boards and contracting units to disqualify public contract bidder with whom any school board or local contracting unit had prior negative experience; establishes prior negative experience database.
Requires certain public contracts for insurance coverage and consulting services to be awarded through competitive contracting process.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Authorizes additional $90 million worth of Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program tax credits.*
Provides for notification of emergency contact in event of death of senior citizen in senior citizen housing facility.
Establishes restricted use driver's license endorsement for certain motor vehicle offenders with suspended license.
Establishes "County Government Criminal Justice Reform Administration Fund"; increases certain fees and assessments.
Makes FY 2017 supplemental appropriation of $7,453,000 to DOH for family planning services.*
Eliminates newspaper publication requirement for unclaimed property and requires electronic notice of unclaimed property online.

Requires tenure charges be filed against any public school employee found to have bullied a student and requires the employment of any nontenured public school employee be terminated for such activity.
Provides for inclusion of students who receive equivalent instruction elsewhere than at school in NJ STARS Program.
Requires special paratransit vehicles to display flashing warning lights while discharging or receiving passengers.
Reduces number of and establishes usage requirements for State vehicles.
Includes adjustment aid in calculation of districts' payments to charter schools under certain circumstances.
Prohibits public employers from reimbursing tuition or awarding promotions or compensation based on degrees or certifications obtained from unaccredited institutions.
Creates motor vehicle offenses related to special paratransit vehicles.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in certain portfield sites.
Provides a sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain high-efficiency home heating equipment.
"Pedestrian Safety Act"; establishes motor vehicle offense of unlawful use of hand-held wireless telephone by pedestrians on roadways.
Clarifies liability for discharges of hazardous substances from drilling platforms that enter NJ waters.
Prohibits baiting for black bear during authorized bear hunt and requires use of bear-resistant dumpsters and food boxes at certain campgrounds and camping facilities.
