Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinance regulating storage or disposal of food waste or other bear-attractant refuse.
Transfers authority to regulate bail agents from DOBI to DLPS; requires certain defendants to be eligible for monetary bail upon issuance of compliant-warrant.

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.
Increases number of PANYNJ commissioners to 14; requires one commissioner from each state be appointed upon recommendation of American Automobile Association.
Requires county welfare agencies to be open on Saturday mornings.
Restores parity among public utilities with regard to formula used to calculate amount of refund given to developers for extension of public utility infrastructure.
Requires video camera on certain school buses with crossing control arms.
Permits certain off-duty law enforcement officers to carry firearms on State property.
Requires DNA sample be taken from certain arrestees.
Clarifies that handgun ammunition may be sold to retired law enforcement officers with certain identification.
Authorizes courts to assess costs of prosecution against certain drug defendants.
Requires Alan M. Voorhees Transportation Center to study potential rail passenger service ridership along New York, Susquehanna and Western Railway right-of-way; appropriates $50,000.
Establishes bi-state commission to study and make recommendations to address rail passenger service needs of certain New Jersey and New York commuters.
Permits patients to indicate that they should not be prescribed opiates and certain other controlled substances in prescription monitoring program information.
Requires NJTA to study impact of constructing rail stations at certain park and ride facilities.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to provide supplemental reading instruction to students in grades K through 3.
Provides for automatic expungement of records of certain juveniles adjudicated delinquent for engaging in prostitution.
Requires Division of Parole to offer parole services to certain defendants who have served their maximum sentence.

"Transparency, Responsibility, and Accountability for New Surcharges and Increases in Ticketing (T.R.A.N.S.I.T.) Act"; increases number of public hearings NJT is required to hold prior and subsequent to fare increase or change or abandonment of service.
Establishes "New Jersey Electromagnetic Infrastructure Advisory Commission."
Permits municipalities impacted by Hurricane Sandy to borrow for current expenses through December 31, 2017, and repay special emergency notes over a 10-year period.
Removes black bear from list of game species.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $103,000,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide preschool expansion aid to certain school districts.
Clarifies that retired campus police officers are eligible for handgun carry permit.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
"Early Childhood Innovation Act"; establishes early childhood innovation loan pilot program and study commission within EDA.
Provides for regulation of daily fantasy sports games in New Jersey by DLPS.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squads and fire companies.
Permits authorities and local units operating water supply or sewerage facilities to waive, reduce, or defer sewerage and water service fees for deployed military personnel.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $30,482,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide additional State school aid to certain school districts affected by State aid growth limit.
Indexes for inflation taxable income brackets under New Jersey gross income tax.
Authorizes municipalities to accept donations to fund police equipment and salary enhancements.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to establish Internet webpage promoting and advertising ecological and agricultural tourist attractions on division's website.
Requires public and nonpublic schools to test for and remediate lead in drinking water, and disclose test results.

Provides that certain corporations bidding for public contracts may submit federal Securities and Exchange Commission filings to comply with requirement to disclose certain interest holders; requires submission by limited liability companies.*
Requires public utilities to meet with county emergency management coordinators during major catastrophic event.
Requires health benefits coverage of hearing aids for children 17 years of age and younger.
Requires State agencies to periodically review administrative rules and regulations to ensure continued efficacy.
Requires explanatory statement on ballot question for school district capital projects to include certain information.

Establishes certain practices as animal cruelty; prohibits animal cruelty violators from working with animals; requires registry and operating requirements for cat and dog breeders and animal rescue organizations.
Creates exemption from certain MVC fees for prisoners of war.
Authorizes disclosure by DCF of child abuse and neglect information to religious institutions.
Increases annual income limitation for senior and disabled citizens' eligibility for $250 property tax deduction and bases future annual income limitations on annual CPI changes.
Exempts hydrogen fuel cell-powered vehicles from certain labeling requirements.
Requires NJT to offer three-month bus and rail passes at discounted rates.
Provides tax credits to developers for certain affordable housing projects.
Requires certain school board vacancies to be filled by special election within 90 days of annual school election.
Requires Governor, certain State officers and employees, and legislators to file annual report disclosing certain expenditures; requires reimbursement from such persons under certain circumstances.
Requires physicians to inform consumers of pharmacy dispensing procedures for different brand or nonbrand drug products prior to prescribing drug products.
Increases minimum annual amounts for appropriation for certain arts, historical heritage, and tourism purposes from hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Concerns real estate licensees.
Places freeze on future enrollment in tiered network health benefits plans until new legislation and regulations governing those plans are in effect.
Establishes "Small Business Bonding Readiness Assistance Program" in EDA to assist certain small businesses meet State or federal contract surety bond requirements.*
Enhances eligibility for State Aid for municipalities co-extensive with historic districts.
Clarifies cosmetology and hairstyling licensee's ability to hold multiple practicing licenses simultaneously.
Increases exclusion amount under New Jersey estate tax; phases out estate tax over five years.
Establishes "Green Fund" in BPU to provide funding for energy reliability, resilience, and sustainability programs.
Authorizes installation of automatic standby generators in certain residences without zoning or planning board approval.
Permits water and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings.
Increases membership of State Police Retirement System Board of Trustees; requires membership to include two active and two retired members.
Authorizes appointment of part-time county tax administrators.
Provides that actions brought under the "Survivor's Act" must commence within two years of the act, omission, neglect, or occurrence that is the basis for the action.
Amends definition of "harassment, intimidation, or bullying" in Anti-Bullying Bill of Rights Act."
Requires personnel at gated communities and multi-unit complexes to allow service of process.
Provides that unlawful use, manufacture, or distribution of controlled dangerous substance by parent or caregiver in presence of child constitutes crime of endangering welfare of that child.
Permits private citizens to employ homemaker-home health aides.
Establishes "County Career Technical Education Annual Recognition Awards" to annually recognize best programs implemented by county vocational school districts.
Regulates assignment and use of State vehicles.
Regulates installation, maintenance, and repair of low-voltage alarm systems.
Requires criminal background check for name change and prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from changing their name.
Provides mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain crimes of domestic violence.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in all counties.
Clarifies definition of reasonably necessary deviation when legally transporting firearm or weapon in motor vehicle.
Requires baby monitors with Internet connection to include security features and warning.
Creates public awareness campaign concerning risks associated with unsecured, Internet-connected baby monitors.
Appropriates $20 million from societal benefits charge to DEP for drinking water infrastructure improvements and lead abatement in City of Newark.
Eliminates three year renewal requirement for disability parking identification cards and placards.
Requires municipalities to conduct lead paint inspections in single- and two-family dwellings; requires reporting of inspection results to State.
Establishes procedure for removal of certain abandoned flood control structures causing property erosion.
Enhances PFRS accidental death pension for surviving spouse by providing for minimum of $50,000 annually.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for 50% of purchase cost of diesel engine conversion devices.
Establishes procedures for admitting into evidence blood sample certificates and related lab reports in drunk driving cases.
Provides for reimbursement of security officer application and registration fees for applicants who meet certification requirements.
"New Voter Empowerment Act"; permits 17 year olds to vote in primary election if they turn 18 years old before next succeeding general election.
Revises law governing testifying via closed circuit television in certain criminal cases.*
Clarifies that civilian public safety directors of municipal, county, and State police departments do not have police powers.
Expands domestic violence protection for adoptive parents.
Clarifies that certain drunk driving offenders who drive with suspended driver's license are guilty of fourth degree crime.
Clarifies that municipalities that failed to fill police vacancies created by retirements are eligible for "Safe and Secure Communities" grants.
Requires certain contractors to register under "The Public Works Contractor Registration Act."
Authorizes executor or administrator to access digital assets of account holder.
Requires cost-benefit analyses and local government financial impact findings for approval of long term property tax exemption.
Codifies donated leave program for State employees in career, senior executive, and unclassified service.
Concerns regulation of guaranteed asset protection waivers by DOBI.**
Changes filing deadline for nominating petitions by school board candidates at general election from last Monday in July to 64th day preceding general election.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from holding position or participating in youth ministry.
Establishes "Integrated Roadside Vegetation Management Program."
Requires airport operators to provide notice and hold public hearings prior to implementation of changes in flight paths.
Requires DOLWD to permit veterans and other groups to apply for UI benefits online.
Establishes "New Jersey Investing in You Promise Neighborhood Commission"; appropriates $2 million.
Permits historic motor vehicles to be used for pleasure driving one day per week.
Requires all school and nonpartisan municipal elections, and permits fire district elections, to be conducted on day of general election in November.
Increases accidental death benefit to 70 % of final compensation for surviving children of SPRS or PFRS member; redefines child in SPRS.*
Requires lead paint inspection prior to home purchases and tenant turnover; establishes educational program on lead hazards.
Jake's Law; Incentivizes counties to design and construct completely inclusive playgrounds as a priority for State funding for recreational and conservation purposes.*
Prohibits State-sponsored travel to certain states without protections against discrimination based on sex, gender identity or expression, and affectional or sexual orientation.*

Establishes "Atlantic City Plan for Implementing Economic Recovery Act"; exempts casino gaming property from local taxation and establishes payment in lieu of taxation; creates Atlantic City Planning Committee.
Upgrades assault on victims who are elderly or disabled.
Establishes performance and training standards for certain Medicaid transportation services and requires DHS to report compliance with standards.
Extends expiration date of certain permits for one year in Superstorm Sandy-impacted counties.
Establishes requirements for sale of home baked goods.
Clarifies situations in which persons legally transporting firearm may deviate from course of travel.
Revises affidavit of merit requirement in professional malpractice cases.
Prohibits attachment of homestead in medical malpractice judgment.
Requires State to pledge to ensure availability of job training or similar activities to certain Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program recipients to prevent loss of benefits.
Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to make certain consumer reviews and complaints publically available.
Allows operators of motorcycles, motorized bicycles, and bicycles to proceed through malfunctioning steady red light under certain circumstances.
Requires DOH to authorize Jersey City to issue certified copies of birth certificates by September 1, 2015.
Prohibits release of personal identifying information of violent crime victims and witnesses under State's open public records law.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for purchases of certain replacement goods and services made by certain persons affected by natural disasters.
Requires telemarketers making sales calls to display their name and telephone number on any caller identification service.
Establishes Class Three special law enforcement officers to provide security in public and nonpublic schools and county colleges.
Appropriates $110,000 from General Fund to DOE for Commission on Italian and Americans of Italian Heritage Cultural and Educational Programs.
Permits holding companies of eligible New Jersey emerging technology companies to receive investments under "New Jersey Angel Investor Tax Credit Act."
Requires members of unitary business groups to file combined reports of corporation business tax.
Establishes credit protections for juveniles in foster care system or receiving services from DCPP.
Requires one member of board in charge of institution for persons with mental illness or developmental disability to be family member of resident.
Temporarily maintains property tax exemption for previously exempt non-profit hospital properties; establishes "Non-Profit Hospital Property Tax Exemption Study Commission."
Provides immunity from civil and criminal liability for rescue of animal from parked vehicle under inhumane conditions.
Eliminates partial and full State intervention under New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum.
Establishes animal cruelty offense of animal hoarding; requires mental health counseling for all animal cruelty offenders.

Requires disclosure by independent expenditure groups; limits contributions to certain groups and committees performing public contracts; increases limits on contributions to political parties and candidates.

Clarifies effective date of P.L.2014, c.42, concerning forms of alimony and alimony awards, so that P.L.2014, c.42 provisions apply to all actions filed but not finally adjudicated when that act took effect.
Requires retail establishments to refund consumer after failed vending machine transaction.
Prohibits transport of certain child passengers in front seat of motor vehicle.

"The Highway Worker Safety Act"; increases penalties for vehicular homicide and assault by auto of highway workers; increases fines for certain highway maintenance, construction, or incident zone violations.

Requires anti-bullying policy of public schools to include provision requiring principal to make preliminary determination and meet with parents of students involved in alleged bullying incident for that determination; extends time for investigating incident.

Requires breeders or other providers of dogs to pet shops to certify compliance with DOH breeding and care regulations; prohibits pet shop sale of dogs without certification; requires inspections and reallocation of dog license revenues to fund enforcement.
Revises time period at which unit owners assume control of homeowners' associations.

Prohibits public institutions of higher education from establishing scholarship, grant, or loan programs designed to solely benefit students in particular municipality or group of municipalities, except under certain circumstances.
Creates license to produce and sell hard cider.
Allows filing of birth certificate to be delayed for religious reasons, for up to 15 days after birth, in order to allow for naming of child.
Establishes "Career and Technical Education Scholar Awards" to annually recognize outstanding career and technical education students.
Requires school district that includes grades kindergarten through six to offer Eddie Eagle Gunsafe Program.

Establishes three-year nonpublic school pupil transportation pilot program in Lakewood School District to provide funding to consortium of nonpublic schools that will assume responsibility for district's mandated nonpublic school busing.
Extends certain benefits to family members of military members who died while in service.
Provides for automatic appointment of State legislators as notaries public.
Requires board of education to display information about child abuse hotline in each school.
Prohibits snowplow or de-icing service contract from indemnifying promisee against liability for loss or damage in certain instances.
Establishes certain benefits for Class Two special law enforcement officers; allows arson investigators to carry a firearm at all times.
Requires personal service of notice of unpaid parking ticket before issuing arrest warrant or suspending license.
Upgrades assault on school personnel to crime of the third degree in all instances.
Requires certain law enforcement officers to present identification while on-duty.
Establishes pilot program for incentive-based value payment system for home health agencies and health care service firms.
"Rosa-Bonilla Family Act"; concerns development of carbon monoxide poisoning educational program for drivers.
Establishes pilot program for incentive-based value payment system for nursing homes.
Authorizes medical marijuana for treatment of dysmenorrhea.

Changes statutory reference to pejorative terminology referring to person of certain ethnic background and requires government entities to remove and replace pejorative language in official documents.*
Designates pork roll, egg, and cheese as New Jersey State Sandwich.
Designates Taylor Ham, egg, and cheese as New Jersey State Sandwich.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for volunteer emergency workers and persons with certain types of military service.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain home elevation expenses.
Allows State-owned, municipally-managed Blue Acres lands to be used for freshwater wetlands mitigation projects.
Establishes fee on single-use carryout bags used in certain stores and dedicates fee revenue to "Healthy Schools and Community Lead Abatement Fund."*
Criminalizes fourth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Excludes bonuses for reenlistment or voluntary extension of enlistment in armed forces from gross income.
Prohibits employment of illegal aliens and requires use of E-Verify program in public contracts.
Establishes certain hiring preferences for Class Two special law enforcement officers seeking position with municipal law enforcement agency.
Prohibits juror disqualification based on gender identity or sexual orientation; codifies procedures when discriminatory use of peremptory challenges is alleged.*
Requires racial and ethnic impact statement for certain bills and regulations affecting sentencing.
Regulates certain servicing activities provided by mortgage servicing organizations for residential mortgage loans.
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all elections under certain conditions.
Requires public and nonpublic schools to test drinking water for lead and install lead filters or treatment devices on drinking fountains and food preparation sinks; appropriates funds therefor.
Establishes excessive speeding in certain areas as reckless under vehicular homicide and assault by auto statutes.
Permits animal facilities to use artificial turf in outdoor enclosures.
Prohibits condominium associations from assessing insurance deductibles to individual unit owners or groups of unit owners.
Requires Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services to facilitate establishment of four new recovery community centers.
Establishes reasonableness standard for persons lawfully transporting firearm who deviate from course of travel.
Establishes new crime of strict liability vehicular homicide; renames existing vehicular homicide as reckless vehicular homicide; designated as Ralph and David's Law.
Provides for order of placement of certain positions on primary election ballot.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."
Codifies regulations defining justifiable need to carry handgun.
Concerns assessment of real property; requires cessation of all State aid to municipality under certain circumstances when assessments not kept current.
Requires Governor and legislative leaders to meet together quarterly.
Concerns public employee union elections for recertification of majority representative.
Revises laws concerning landlords and tenants.
Revises exemption from "unemployment compensation law" for operators of certain motor vehicles.
Regulates transportation network companies.
Reduces required limousine insurance in certain circumstances; eliminates sales and use tax on limousine service.
Increases autocab liability insurance.
Establishes NJ Water Supply and Pharmaceutical Product Study Commission.
Directs DOT and NJT to construct rail station at Atlantic City International Airport.*
Appropriates $5 million from General Fund to DOE for Bullying Prevention Fund.
Amends and repeals sections of "Respiratory Care Practitioner Licensing Act."
Allows parent or guardian to exclude student from administration of State assessment.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Prohibits the sale or distribution of flavored electronic smoking devices.
Authorizes expedited partner therapy, under which sexual partners or patients diagnosed with sexually transmitted disease are treated without prior clinical examination.
Requires owners of residential rental property to conduct lead hazard inspections in certain situations.
Authorizes current and retired administrative law judges to solemnize marriages and civil unions.*
Requires health insurance carriers to provide notice of termination of coverage to covered persons in certain circumstances.
Concerns access to certain job training courses for employees affected by plant closings, mass layoffs or transfer of operations.
Prohibits persons under 19 from smoking in public and purchasing tobacco products.
Eliminates statute of limitations for kidnapping and increases statute of limitations for other serious crimes to 10 years.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide treatment for substance abuse and dependency when determined medically necessary by physician or psychologist.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
Prohibits sale of municipally-owned sewer or water plant to private entity.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts and higher education institutions.
Updates administrative requirements and processes for unclaimed property held by State.
Establishes Women's Vocational Training Pilot Program to promote economic self-sufficiency of low-income women through increased participation in high-wage, high-demand occupations.
Authorizes protective order for certain witnesses or victims against actor who attempted to prevent or obstruct them from reporting crime to police.
Requires public bodies upon request to provide American Sign Language interpreter at public meetings.
Authorizes municipalities to regulate Internet-organized events.
Prohibits use of gap in automobile insurance coverage as rating factor in automobile insurance underwriting under certain circumstances.
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct motor vehicle operator's vision.
Permits certain municipalities to impose and collect payroll tax of up to 1 percent of employer's payroll.
Establishes bed bug inspection requirements for certain residential rental property.
Requires DCA to issue regulations and conduct inspections for bed bugs; provides loan forgiveness for remediation of bed bug infestations in certain properties.
Establishes automatic voter registration process using MVC applicant information to be transmitted to Secretary of State; permits applicant to decline voter registration.
Offers municipality with life guard pension fund choice in providing pension benefits to life guards.
Places two-year moratorium on moving date of Type II school district's annual school election from day of general election in November back to third Tuesday in April; creates study commission.*
Requires course in civics or U.S. government as part of high school graduation requirements; requires school districts to use DOE's curriculum guidelines for civics.
Allows gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions to certain New Jersey-based charitable organizations.
Establishes certain exclusions and credits under the gross income and corporation business taxes for contributions to lifelong learning accounts.
Directs Dept. of Agriculture to authorize and advise food hubs.
Concerns alternate methods of wage payment.
Designates "Franklinite" as official mineral of State of NJ.
Establishes requirements for sale and planting of running bamboo.
Requires DHS to maintain Statewide registry of registered professional guardians.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Increases certain penalties for violations of wage and hour law.
Requires public institutions of higher education to allow students, faculty, and other staff to identify sexual orientation and gender identity on any forms used to collect certain demographic data.
Requires DMVA provide central website registry of unclaimed veteran cremains for veteran organization locating services; Requires funeral director report possession of unclaimed veteran cremains.

Provides local government exclusive jurisdiction to decide appeal brought by public utility regarding denial of permit for excavation work and certain municipal zoning actions with provision for Superior Court review.
Makes various revisions to "Uniform Fraudulent Transfer Act"; renames act to "Uniform Voidable Transactions Act."
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide coverage for behavioral health care services determined to be medically necessary, including 90 days per year of inpatient residential care.
Establishes law enforcement assisted addiction and recovery referral programs.*
Permits testing and use of autonomous vehicles on State roadways under certain circumstances.
Expands net metering aggregation to all customers and provides credit for excess electric generation at full retail electricity rate to net metering aggregation customers.

Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research institutions; allows certain technology businesses located in certain innovation zones to receive certain tax credits under Grow New Jersey Assistance Program.
Requires DMVA to create registry for organizations providing services to veterans.
Allows "100 percent Disabled Veterans" to receive parking privileges reserved for persons with disability.
Authorizes installation of automatic standby generators in certain residences without zoning or planning board approval.

Permits candidates for school board to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot; permits short nonpolitical designation of principles on petitions and ballots; provides for study of impact of changes.
Requires Commissioner of Education to develop best practices guidelines concerning student preparation for State assessments.
Exempts storage facility space furnished to active duty military personnel from sales and use tax.
Provides procedures for attorney notarized documents.
Requires law enforcement agencies, correctional facilities, and State Parole Board to adopt maternity policies.
Increases amount of allowable temporary appropriations by a local unit prior to adoption of its budget from 26.25 percent to 35 percent of its total of appropriations in preceding fiscal year.
Creates rights of action for pecuniary damages against person committing certain harm to domestic companion animal.

Requires public utility holding companies owning electric generation and electric transmission facility assets to divest either all electric generation or all electric transmission facility assets to unaffiliated companies.
Provides additional State aid to county colleges for students enrolled in postsecondary career and technical education certificate programs.

Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Early Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics programs for students in grades K through 8.
Directs BPU to promulgate rules and regulations concerning gas public utilities' response to public reporting of suspected natural gas leaks.
Requires certain notifications and free credit reports for customers following breach of security of personal information within business or public entity.
Authorizes affordable housing obligation reduction in exchange for lead hazard remediation fund deposit.
"Addi's Law"; makes parent's conviction for murder of child's other parent grounds for termination of parental rights.
Eliminates peremptory challenges in jury selection.
Provides list of various assessments to satisfy State high school graduation proficiency test requirement.
Concerns arrest warrants for failing to pay parking tickets.
Revises and clarifies law concerning permissible motor vehicle window tint.
Requires DOH to ensure that fetal death certification and reporting requirements are consistent with current federal standards.

Prohibits certain light frame residential construction in densely populated census tracts; establishes construction requirements for certain light frame residential construction in other census tracts.
Increases monetary thresholds for certain theft and shoplifting offenses.
Establishes no-interest loan program in EDA for businesses to construct unisex restrooms.
Provides that cigar bars and lounges may renew lapsed registration to permit indoor smoking under certain circumstances.
Concerns excessive price increases during state of emergency.
Makes it a fourth degree crime to operate as unlicensed bail agent, per SCI recommendations.
Directs the collection of recidivism data for adults sentenced to a period of probation.
Allows relocation of certain exceptions from deed restrictions on preserved farmland.
Requires electronic prescribing systems to default to three-day supply of opioid drugs, with ability for prescribers to issue prescriptions in any authorized quantity deemed medically appropriate.
Authorizes "Put Children First" license plates.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $103,000,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide preschool expansion aid to certain school districts.
Provides for certain money damages sought by State in cases of environmental contamination to be paid directly to municipalities within which damage has been sustained.
Reforms procedures concerning provisions of affordable housing; repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Allows county and municipal police departments to establish designated safe areas for Internet purchase transactions; establishes public awareness campaign.
Establishes central registry of residents with special needs for use during emergencies.
Requires State to pay educational costs of students who reside in homeless shelter outside district of residence for more than one year.
Authorizes parent or guardian to place security freeze on child's consumer report.
Establishes NJ "Landowner of the Year" award program.
Directs PANYNJ to establish requirements concerning business operations, safety requirements and violations, and emissions standards for motor carrier operations in NJ portion of port district.
Provides tax credits for constructing or renovating homes to improve accessibility for persons with disabilities.

Limits expulsions and suspensions for students in preschool through grade 2 with certain exceptions; requires early detection and prevention programs for behavioral issues in preschool through grade 2.
Requires public research universities and State colleges to develop policies and implement accounting procedures on mandatory student fees.
Prohibits sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices at pharmacies.

Clarifies that product approval from U.S. Food and Drug Administration is not required for drug manufacturer to file registration statement, and specifies timeframe by which DOH must review registration statements.
Raises minimum wage to amounts that vary throughout State based on unemployment and provides for certain other increases.
Requires University Behavioral Health Care of Rutgers University to undertake comprehensive study of firearms violence.
Raises minimum wage to varying amounts throughout State based on cost of living and provides for certain other increases.
Requires police training for interactions with persons who may have behavioral health issues.
Authorizes use of school bus monitoring systems.
Includes students who participate in school intramural sports programs in the student-athlete head injury safety program.
Establishes time periods for adverse possession of certain property.
Requires expenses incurred by Governor during out-of-State travel for political activities not be paid with or out of public funds.
Appropriates $2,565,000 from General Fund to Department of State for Educational Opportunity Fund Programs.

Requires health care practitioners prescribing opioid medications on first-time basis, or to minor children, to limit amount of prescribed medication to seven-day supply, except in certain circumstances.
Permits young adult who is claimed as a dependent on a relative's tax return to receive Work First New Jersey General Public Assistance benefits.
Requires professionals certifying death to perform any testing and related actions necessary for survivors to claim State and federal benefits.
Exempts public institutions of higher education from motor vehicle registration fee.
Requires principals and teachers of public schools to conduct an oral recitation from the Declaration of Independence before the opening of school each day in grades 3-12; appropriates $10,000.
Excludes .22 caliber tubular magazines from large capacity ammunition magazine definition.
Extends Class Two special law enforcement training for time deployed.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.
Makes Fiscal Year 2016 General Fund appropriation of $500,000 for restoration and maintenance of A.J. Meerwald.
Establishes Office of Common Interest Community Association Ombudsman.
Eliminates requirement that State reimburse municipalities for construction permit surcharge fee revenues foregone due to exemption for disabled veterans.
Prohibits electric power supplier or gas supplier from providing service to customer unless it is disclosed to customer in large print that its rates are not regulated by BPU.
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority to hold regular meetings in various counties in the State.
Provides for representation of certain regions of State on New Jersey Turnpike Authority.
Provides court with sentencing discretion in certain cases under the "Graves Act."
Concerns unemployment compensation and labor disputes.
Allows animal facilities to use artificial turf in outdoor enclosures without restrictions.
Clarifies scope of affordable housing obligations.
Requires certain county inmates be provided with reentry assistance before their release.
Concerns expedited process for foreclosing vacant and abandoned residential properties in uncontested actions.
Establishes Office of Ombudsman for Individuals with Intellectual or Developmental Disabilities and their Families.

Establishes Clean Energy Technology Center and Alternative and Clean Energy Investment Trust Fund for purposes of creating clean energy-related employment opportunities; allocates revenues from societal benefits charge to support its activities.
Prohibits public utility from terminating service for nonpayment unless customer is provided certified letter at least 10 business days prior to scheduled termination date.
Requires sale of remaining unused State-owned portion of Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital to Morris County.
Enhances protections against fraudulent deed recordings.
Permits issuance of motorcycle endorsement to certain out-of-State military personnel.
Imposes three-year moratorium on use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers for certain purposes.
Requires electronic health records systems to meet requirements to accept, process, and transmit prescriptions for Schedule II controlled dangerous substance.
Requires businesses receiving financial assistance from EDA be prohibited from any gender gap payment practice to their employees.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault when person causes bodily injury by strangling victim during act of domestic violence.

Requires mail-in ballot applications be available at polling places on election day for voting in future elections; requires poll workers to discuss application instructions with applicant upon request.
Establishes "Tiny Home Pilot Program" in three regions of State.
Permits farm income averaging credit under the New Jersey gross income tax.
Provides for early termination of terms of office for certain appointed municipal court positions when two or more municipalities enter into agreements to establish joint or shared municipal courts.
"New Jersey Rural Electric Cooperative Act."
Requires school districts to notify State after receiving offer of assistance from federal government to address environmental issue.
Limits annual increase in tuition rates charged by county vocational school districts to two percent.
Allows School of Osteopathic Medicine at Rowan University to maintain principal clinical affiliation with either osteopathic or allopathic hospital.
Permits cosmetology and hairstyling school clinics to charge certain fees for services rendered to general public.
Repeals requirement for general hospitals and State psychiatric hospitals to hold annual public meetings.

Limits annual increase in tuition rates charged by school districts, county vocational school districts, county special services districts, jointure commissions, and private schools for students with disabilities to two percent.
Requires law enforcement agencies to obtain court order prior to use of imaging surveillance device.

Provides for retained eligibility for members of NJ National Guard or reserve component of US Armed Forces called to active federal military service who met maximum age requirement at closing date of civil service examination.
Requires institutions of higher education and proprietary degree-granting institutions to improve transparency of tuition and fees.

"Personal Injury Trust Fund Transparency Act;" requires plaintiff to file personal injury trust claims under certain circumstance; addresses allocation of trust claims; establishes scheduling and discovery requirements for certain tort actions.
Prohibits designation of certain assessments as high school graduation requirement during transitional period to new Statewide assessment system.
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Secretary of Higher Education to promote establishment of higher education and business partnerships.
Authorizes certain local government entities to adopt policies for payment of certain claims through use of standard electronic funds transfer technologies.*
"Children's Caregivers Act"; revises requirements for primary caregivers for medical marijuana patients who are minors.
Requires biannual audit of managed care plan provider networks.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts and establishes uniform age requirement for enrollment in kindergarten.
Requires DOE to train teachers and administrators and monitor districts on bias and discrimination in special education classification.
Directs DOE to make database of special education decisions available on website.
Allows reemployment by school district of TPAF retiree as advisor of school sponsored club or program when compensation is under $10,000.
Upgrades crime of stalking when victim is less than 18 years old.
Provides same military service credit for compensation purposes to noncertificated employees of school districts that is provided to certificated employees under current law.
Prohibits smoking in automobile when children are present.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Prohibits sale of powdered caffeine.
Clarifies that only products assembled in U.S. meet "Buy-American" standards of public contracts laws.
Exempts judges and justices from jury duty.
Concerns arbitration for certain non-teaching school staff.

Requires laboratory analysis of waste or material generated by hydraulic fracturing; requires DEP permit, and disclosure of plans, methods, or processes to treat, store, process, or dispose of such waste or material.

Makes federal Social Security disability determination inadmissible regarding cause or extent of party's condition in alimony or child support cases; concerns proofs of party's disability when calculating payable or receivable alimony or child support award.
Imposes corporate business tax and gross income tax on income attributable to certain investment management services that a corporate or individual partner provides on behalf of a partnership.
Appropriates $50,000,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide additional State school aid to certain school districts that spend below adequacy.
Directs State Board of Education to authorize computer science education endorsement to instructional certificate.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities.
Requires preliminary finding of liability for professional malpractice by panel of three experts appointed by licensing authority prior to institution of action.
Increases penalties for violations of recordkeeping laws pertaining to secondhand jewelry and precious metal transactions.
Provides for county-municipal courts with limited, countywide jurisdiction.
Requires charter school board member to reside in charter school's district of residence.
Reduces minimum age to gamble in casino or simulcasting facility to 18 years of age.
Establishes guidelines for termination of patient-health care professional relationship.
Requires child care centers to test for and remediate lead in drinking water, and disclose test results.
Requires school district to adopt policy allowing students in grades 9 through 12 who participate in certain interscholastic extracurricular activities to earn varsity letter.
Requires restaurants to post DOH sign concerning food allergen awareness in kitchen or staff area.
Establishes pilot program to allow certain counties and municipalities to use single firm for design and inspection services on certain transportation projects.
Changes submission and notice requirements for short-term and long-term financing for environmental infrastructure projects.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2017.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2017.
Prohibits manufacture and sale of children's products and upholstered furniture made with certain flame retardant chemicals.
Imposes 2.5 percent tax on certain endowment income of private institutions of higher education in State.
Requires certification of diligent inquiry in residential mortgage foreclosure actions to be filed by attorneys.
Prohibits certain third-party property tax appeals.
Expands applicability of cap on "Spill Compensation and Control Act" tax liability to all successors in interest of certain taxpayers.
Allows consideration of purchased PERS credit for federal service in Central Intelligence Agency to qualify for employer-provided health care benefits in retirement.
Includes businesses owned by lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender persons or by persons with a disability in certain assistance programs.
Changes the time when child placement review hearings are initiated from 45 days to 60 days.
Requires labeling of poisonous plants sold at retail in NJ.
Requires students to pass test identical to United States Citizenship and Immigration Services civics test as part of high school graduation requirements.
Allows law enforcement officers to scan drivers' cell phones under certain circumstances; imposes penalties for refusal.
Concerns sale of certain tires.
Imposes certain qualification requirements for members of State Ethics Commission; provides process for appointment of members.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to award pupil transportation contracts that exceed bid threshold through request for proposals.
Prohibits surgical declawing of cats and other animals.
Provides a gross income tax deduction for homeowner's payments of certain homeowners association assessments.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.
Requires disclosure by independent expenditure committees; raises certain campaign contribution limits; repeals ban on certain intraparty fund transfers.

Increases disclosure of political contributions by business entities with public contracts; creates uniform law for contributions by such entities; repeals local option to set contribution limits for business entities.
Authorizes operation of lottery courier services.

Sets level for health care benefits; requires employee contributions; prohibits reimbursement of Medicare Part B; adds member to SHBP/SEHBP plan design committees; requires retirees to purchase health care through exchanges.
Creates Public Employee Pension and Health Care Benefits Reform Task Force.
Provides transition period of 90 days during which building service employees subject to certain building service transfers must be retained.

Requires hospital laboratories and bio-analytical or clinical laboratories to offer test for hepatitis C to certain individuals; authorizes certain laboratories to perform rapid tests for hepatitis C.
Establishes procedures for pharmacists to seek approval to dispense alternative product in place of prescribed epinephrine auto-injector device.
Allows for sharing of family leave benefits between covered individuals under certain circumstances.
Provides Medicaid coverage for doula care.
Allows existing rural development areas zoned for industrial use under pinelands comprehensive management plan to be included as eligible areas under certain business incentive programs.*
Establishes "Families At Risk Foreclosure Assistance Program."
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for hearing aids.
Enters New Jersey in multistate Nurse Licensure Compact.
Establishes NJ Solar Energy Study Commission and modifies State's solar renewable energy portfolio standards.
Limits certain State and nonprofit open space acquisitions in municipalities.
Eliminates DOLWD licensing for operators of refrigerating plants using anhydrous ammonia.
Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to make certain consumer reviews and complaints publicly available.
Requires training of certain staff and health care professionals in interacting with individuals with developmental disabilities.
Provides adjustment to school district tax levy cap for expenditures associated with opening of new school facility during budget year.
Requires financial institutions to cash payroll checks under certain circumstances.*
Modifies various aspects of charter school program including approval, student admissions and enrollment procedures, and board of trustee membership.
Establishes position of Ombudsman of Student Discipline to serve within Office of the Secretary of Higher Education.
Revises membership of New Jersey State Board of Accountancy.
Allows active duty members of United States military to carry firearm at all times.
Establishes State School Aid Funding Fairness Commission.
Clarifies that requests for public records under open public records law may be made without use of official form and may be made by certain modes of transmission.
Provides exception to weight limits for natural gas vehicles consistent with federal law.
Concerns the grading of criminal offenses committed against a child under the age of 16 years by a person armed with a weapon.
Establishes "Comprehensive State Plan for Economic Development."
Requires newly manufactured handguns to be micro-stamped; establishes handgun database.
Requires carrier of construction materials to maintain commercial general liability insurance with a minimum of one million dollars in coverage per accident.
"Student Online Personal Protection Act."
Requires DOH to establish public awareness campaign and develop policies and procedures to promote recognition and treatment of perinatal anxiety.
Directs the suspension, by operation of law, of certain offenders' child support obligations.
Directs the Department of Corrections to advise new inmates of child support obligations and modification procedures.
Establishes Task Force on School District Regionalization.
Prohibits multiple employer coverage for health care benefits of public employee and requires payment based on employee's aggregate public income.

Places question on ballot allowing Atlantic City to adopt resolution to legalize marijuana in Atlantic City; establishes regulatory scheme for marijuana controlled by State Department of Law and Public Safety; increases penalties for driving under influence of marijuana.
Changes allocation of fines collected for motor vehicle violations in certain municipalities.
Requires DOE to develop educational fact sheet for distribution to parents of student-athletes and cheerleaders concerning use and misuse of prescription opioids.
Prohibits certain possession, sale, offering for sale, trade or distribution of shark fins.
Establishes pilot program appointing third party vendors to administer commercial driver license testing.
Clarifies applicability of statutory presumption concerning alimony payor's retirement and alimony termination.
Provides for immediate issuance of marriage and civil union licenses; provides for 72 hour waiting period prior to the ceremony.
Caps attorney fee awards in actions against public entities.
Provides tax credits for performing certain repairs on primary residences of senior citizens or persons with disabilities.
Authorizes certain county to establish county hospital authority; amends title of "Municipal Hospital Authority Law."
Requires school districts to provide information on affirmative consent standard as part of core curriculum content standards.

Provides that sensors required on newly-manufactured school buses be placed around bus in accordance with National Highway Traffic Safety Administration guidelines and will not be required until one year following enactment of original law.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.
"New Jersey Open Data Initiative" to require certain information be provided on Internet to public and State agencies.
Replaces Parole Board members with certain retired judges.
Permits municipality, fire district or authority to approve transfer of certain firefighters from PERS to PFRS.
Provides for time period during which complaints may be filed for certain motor vehicle violations.
Revises "Accountancy Act of 1997."
Requires actual transportation occur as a condition of billing for ambulance services.
Dissolves New Jersey Hall of Fame Advisory Commission and New Jersey Hall of Fame corporation and transfers their functions to Foundation for New Jersey Hall of Fame.
Establishes tuition reimbursement program for certain psychiatrists who work in underserved areas in New Jersey.
Permits boards of education to convey certain school property to nonprofit senior citizen organizations for nominal consideration.
Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess appropriate endorsement to instructional certificate.
Establishes DEP rebate program for purchase of alternative fuel vehicles.
Makes membership in New Jersey Council of County Colleges optional.
Requires certain local and State government entities to issue certain emergency and warning light permits.
Requires DOH to establish standardized requirements for registration of vendors in health care facilities.
Requires DOH to establish Zika Virus State Action Plan.
Requires installation of ignition interlock device if sentence for DWI is stayed pending appeal.
Permits issuance of nine alcoholic beverage licenses in three host municipalities located in Fort Monmouth redevelopment area.
Provides gross income tax credit to persons purchasing or leasing alternative fuel vehicles.
Designates Lake Mohawk German Christmas Market as New Jersey State German Christmas Market.
Permits certain audiologists to dispense and fit hearing aids.
Permits smoking in certain facilities for purpose of medical or health-related scientific research.
Requires Attorney General to provide assistance to public schools in legal proceedings related to reduction in federal aid in certain cases if school is compliant with NJ Law Against Discrimination.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with their employment, trade or business.
Provides certain automobile insurance coverage for certain persons in event of fraudulent actions by policyholders.
Clarifies that violation of "New Jersey Insurance Fraud Prevention Act" results in loss of motor vehicle liability insurance coverage in certain circumstances.
Requires issues related to prescription opioids to be included in continuing education courses for certain health care professionals.
Establishes process for individual to petition court for involuntary commitment of another person to treatment for substance use disorder.
Requires all prescriptions be transmitted electronically, subject to certain exceptions.
Authorizes pharmacists to dispense up to 90-day supply of certain prescription drugs.

Requires opioid antidote dispensation to be monitored under Prescription Monitoring Program, and authorizes certain entities to submit info regarding opioid antidote administration for inclusion in secondary, linked database; designated as "John Wagner's Law."
Permits law enforcement agencies to buy firearms directly from manufacturers; clarifies permits and identification cards not required.*
Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to waive fees for students attending on military scholarships.

Requires greater disclosure of political contributions made by certain business entities; applies law uniformly to all levels of government; repeals permitting local units to establish independent requirements for business entities.
Allows certain fuel dealers and distributors refunds of petroleum products gross receipts tax and credits against motor fuel tax for certain bad debts from sale of fuel.
Allows use of stand-up paddleboards for fishing on lakes in wildlife management areas.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue exempt certificates for motor vehicles not required to be inspected.
Requires housing authority to advertise when applications are being accepted for housing assistance waiting lists online.
Establishes certain limitations on the prescription, dispensation, and administration of opioid medications to student athletes.
Concerns transfer of PANYNJ contracts related to marine terminals.
Establishes temporary mortgage relief and foreclosure prevention programs for certain property owners impacted by Superstorm Sandy.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of vehicular homicide.
Transfers regulatory authority over managed care plans from DOBI to DOH.
Modifies process for advertising, bidding, and awarding local public contracts.
"Steven Schmincke's Law"; facilitates sober living home construction financing.
Enables collection of voluntary contributions for Jersey Fresh Program through gross income tax returns.
Appropriates $34,800,995,000 in State funds and $15,706,712,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2016-2017.
Makes fiscal year 2016 State supplemental appropriations and amends language provisions.
Revises priority schedule for issuance of converted tax credits under Business Employment Incentive Program.

Makes supplemental appropriations totaling $9,563,415 to DOH for grants of $7,765,325 to Newark Beth Israel Hospital and $1,798,090 to St. Francis Medical Center to implement improved health outcomes and sustainable transformation of healthcare delivery.
Requires driver's license exam to include questions on distracted driving; prohibits motorists from talking or texting on hand-held wireless device while vehicle is temporarily stopped.
Adds Monmouth County as pilot county for purposes of "Common Sense Shared Services Pilot Program Act."
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to promulgate Property Taxpayer Bill of Rights.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to annually report on Office of Taxpayer Advocate.
Requires residential students at four-year institutions of higher education to receive immunization for meningitis in accordance with recommendations of Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices.

Prohibits inclusion of provision in agreements, contracts, or settlements related to pipeline siting or hydraulic fracturing, or "fracking," that would restrict parties from disclosing information, statements, or assertions related to public health or safety.
Designates USS New Jersey as New Jersey State Ship.
Permits expungement of certain older convictions.
Prohibits sale of expanded polystyrene food containers by public schools and public institutions of higher education.
Changes certain requirements for limited brewery licensees.
Establishes procedures for involuntary civil commitment for children.
Revises penalties for drunk driving and ignition interlock device violations.
Revises State's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs; implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain environmental purposes.
Aligns timeframe for renewal of disability identification card and placard with renewal of driver's license.
Permits eligible students who are members of United States Armed Forces to wear military uniform at high school graduation.
Prohibits performance of revaluation in county by firm in which tax assessor has interest if assessor serves in the county.
Permits contracting units to disqualify local public contract bidder with whom any contracting unit had prior negative experience; establishes prior negative experience database.
Permits local contracting units to disqualify local public contract bidder for creating conflict of interest with respect to prior contract.
Requires public and nonpublic school to provide student with more information about NJ STARS Program and improve notification of potenial eligibilty.
Appropriates $1 million to DEP for grants to county mosquito control agencies.
Authorizes State and local law enforcement entities to contract for bulk purchasing of heroin antidote.
Revises various requirements concerning State medical marijuana program, including facilitating access to medical marijuana for children with debilitating medical conditions and their caregivers.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.
Concerns speech rights of student journalists at public schools and public institutions of higher education.
Requires MVC to immediately suspend driver's license of alleged drunk drivers who cause a death.
Permits pharmacists to dispense self-administered hormonal contraceptives pursuant to a standing order, in accordance with protocols established by Board of Pharmacy and Board of Medical Examiners.
Creates New Jersey Crude Oil by Rail Safety Task Force.
Prohibits electric transmission company from constructing overhead electric transmission lines within 100 feet of buildings.
Establishes program in EDA providing tax credits and exemptions to certain qualified data centers.
Establishes "Monica's Law" concerning domestic violence risk assessment pilot program.
Restricts initial prescriptions for opioid drugs to seven day supply.
Requires uniform response procedures for all domestic crisis teams established or participated in by law enforcement agencies, and strengthens Statewide supervision over teams.
Reallocates portion of certain forfeited property as incentive for information of drug-related offenses and to provide inpatient treatment for certain drug-dependent individuals.
Expands crime of bias intimidation to include law enforcement officers and emergency services personnel.

Requires newly-elected county and municipal political party committee members to assume office upon their certification for election and hold first meeting on third and second Tuesday following primary election, respectively.
Requires training for law enforcement officers and assistant county prosecutors concerning handling of domestic violence cases.
Concerns appointment of person to control funeral and disposition of human remains.
Clarifies notice requirements for third party claims under the "New Jersey Tort Claims Act."
Requires all Medicaid managed care organization to permit all pharmacies in State to dispense prescriptions for all covered medications.
Prohibits non-disclosure clauses in certain contracts.
Establishes Statewide "Peace: A Learned Solution Program (PALS)."
Establishes standards for Batterers' Intervention Programs in domestic violence cases.
Exempts from reenrollment certain PERS retirees employed by boards of education.

Imposes sales and use tax, transient accommodation fee, and authorizes local transient accommodation tax on charges for providing space for accommodation of transient guests in certain residences in this State.
Permits issuance of additional alcoholic beverage licenses in municipalities located in certain project areas.

Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of student borrower death or total and permanent disability and grant deferment for temporary total disability.
Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in event of student borrower's death or total and permanent disability.
Requires State to award certain property tax credits as rebates.
Requires property record cards and tax maps prepared in conjunction with revaluations to be produced in electronic format.
Requires DOT and Division of Highway Traffic Safety to conduct study on vehicle size and weight enforcement.
Removes examination requirement for relicensure as real estate broker, broker-salesperson or salesperson by licensed real estate referral agents under certain circumstances.
Revises "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act" to require certain class study and examination requirements.
Provides Medicaid coverage for services to treat and prevent Zika virus infection and associated health outcomes.
Creates "New Jersey Criminal Justice Information Sharing Environment Coordinating Council."
Permits use of "Lead Hazard Control Assistance Fund" to test for lead hazards in water.
Requires MVC to offer driver's license knowledge test in certain languages.
Prohibits release of police internal investigation information under State's open public records law.
Establishes failure to maintain lane while engaging in distracted driving as reckless under vehicular homicide statute.
Limits use of student progress on standardized assessments to no more than 10 percent of overall evaluation.

Authorizes State Treasurer to convey surplus real property known as Millburn Regional Day School in Millburn Township, Essex County, to Millburn Township Board of Education or to Millburn Township for $3,550,000.
Appropriates up to $20 million from societal benefits charge to DEP for remediation of lead contamination in drinking water in public buildings.
Establishes annual grant program to recognize public institutions of higher education that offer comprehensive array of veteran programs and services.
Establishes New Jersey First-Time Home Buyer Savings Account Program; provides gross income tax exclusion for certain earnings on assets maintained in accounts established under program.
Establishes State pension fund preference for certain in-State infrastructure investment.
Establishes payment incentive program for home health agencies and health care service firms.
Establishes arts program for acquisition and display of visual artwork by New Jersey artists in State House and Annex.
Requires color photo on firearms identification cards, permits to purchase handgun, and permits to carry handgun.
Increases penalties for certain vehicular homicide offenses involving intoxicated drivers; designated as "Victoria's Law."
Requires data collection and issuance of report on drug evidence testing by New Jersey State Police Office of Forensic Sciences.
Establishes Office of Ombudsman for Navigating Services and Supports for Individuals with Intellectual or Developmental Disabilities.
Concerns procedures for transition of individuals with developmental disabilities from developmental centers to community placements.
Permits municipal reorganization meetings to be held on alternative dates.
Revises and codifies schedule for childhood lead screening along with other immunization and wellness checks as precondition of child's initial entry into school system.
Requires vitamin K to be administered to newborns within six hours of birth.
Provides civil immunity to persons who forcibly enter motor vehicles to remove unattended and unsupervised children.

Clarifies that apologies by health care facilities and professionals to patients or their representatives for adverse events disclosed under "Patient Safety Act" are excluded from discovery and inadmissible in legal actions involving facilities and professionals.
"Charlie's Law"; Establishes civil penalties for persons who interfere with or deny persons with disabilities accompanied by service or guide dogs access to places of public accommodation.
Establishes third or subsequent DWI offenses as fourth degree crime.

Concerns certain unused portions of tax credits issued to insurance premiums taxpayers under the Business Employment Incentive Program; exempts certain purchasers of business development incentives from certain State tax notification requirements.*

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to establish income-driven repayment option and loan rehabilitation program for borrowers under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students (NJCLASS) Loan Program.
Establishes "Succeed in New Jersey" student loan reimbursement program for certain New Jersey residents employed in designated fields.

Establishes program to provide free tuition under State Tuition Aid Grant Program to certain students who are accepted to public four-year institutions of higher education and elect to attend county college for first two years.
Establishes "New Jersey College Ready Students Program Act"; provides tuition-free dual enrollment opportunity at county college for certain high school students.
Establishes "High School to College Readiness Commission" to examine issues and develop recommendations to enhance student preparation for postsecondary education.
Establishes New Jersey Dietary Supplements Task Force to make recommendations concerning safety and regulation of dietary supplements sold in New Jersey.
Prohibits hospice from charging patient for days on which patient is not present.
Enhances resident voting participation rights in common interest communities.
Provides for protection of public's rights under public trust doctrine.
Requires recycling of scrap tires and licensing of scrap tire haulers.
Requires epinephrine auto-injectors to be packaged and sold as single units.
Directs DEP to adopt standards for certain drinking water contaminants based upon recommendations of Drinking Water Quality Institute.*
Guarantees full and equal access to all housing to disabled persons who retain their retired service or guide dog as a pet, and who also obtain a new service or guide dog.
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund and dedicates $500,000 annually from certain power vessel operator license fees to the fund.
Requires certain defendants to be eligible for monetary bail upon issuance of compliant-warrant.
Removes New Jersey Racing Commission from boards and commissions subject to reimbursement cap imposed in annual appropriations act providing continuation of funding by horse racing industry.
Requires limited liability company to disclose ownership information when submitting deed for recording.
Expands crime of bias intimidation to include law enforcement officers and emergency services personnel.
Appropriates $60,000 to NJ Development of Agriculture for Soil Conservation District Supervisors' travel and per diem costs.
Clarifies that data collected by courts for recidivism research shall contain no personal identifying information.
Clarifies that background check is required for renewal of security officer registration.
Designates portion of Interstate Highway Route 195 in Upper Freehold Township as "State Trooper Anthony A. Raspa Memorial Highway."
Establishes senior freeze credit applied directly to property tax bills.
Provides personal exemption under gross income tax for certain honorably discharged veterans.
Increases exclusion amount under New Jersey estate tax; phases out estate tax over four years.
Permits appointment as municipal police officers of certain veterans who are over age 35.
Provides gross income tax deduction for State fuel taxes paid on certain purchases of motor fuel.

Requires certain public facilities and offices to provide on-site lactation room; DOH to provide information about lactation room availability; and DOE to provide information on lactation policies in schools.
Requires Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission to regulate amusement games using crane or claw machines.
Requires seller of motor vehicle to notify MVC of sale; limits liability of seller after sale of motor vehicle.

Requires DOT to compensate local government entities for contractual delay damages resulting from shutdown of transportation projects funded by Transportation Trust Fund; authorizes local government entities to use certain funds for transportation projects.*
Provides that driver's license expires every four years on same numerical calendar day as licensee's birthday.

Provides that AG handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving person's death by law enforcement officer while acting in officer's official capacity or while in custody; requires trial in venue outside county where incident occurred.
Permits county improvement authorities to establish student loan refinancing loan programs.
Authorizes annual issuance of permit to sell alcoholic beverages at seasonal farm market.
Concerns employer inquiries about wage and salary history.
Establishes DEP program to reduce heavy-duty diesel truck emissions from trucks operating in the ports of Bayonne, Elizabeth, Jersey City, and Newark.
Concerns certain actions brought under "Truth-in-Consumer Contract, Warranty and Notice Act."
Eliminates use of standardized assessments as measure of student growth or progress in evaluations of teachers, principals, assistant principals, and vice-principals.
Requires certain local authorities to inspect, maintain, and repair fire hydrants in planned real estate developments.
Requires public employers to implement certain policies for handling and responding to reports of domestic violence.
Establishes mandatory training program for human resources officers of public employers on handling and responding to reports of domestic violence.
Enhances protections for domestic violence victims by restricting access to firearms by certain persons; provides for minimum terms of incarceration for offenders who commit physically violent acts.
Increases civil penalties for certain natural gas or hazardous liquid facility safety violations.
Exempts construction, expansion, or renovation of building or structure owned and used by municipality or volunteer fire department from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Prohibits the use of county and municipal vehicles by part-time elected local government officers.
Extends senior freeze benefits to certain disabled persons.

Increases gross income tax's pension and retirement income exclusion fivefold over four years and allows partial exclusion as of tax year 2021 for certain taxpayers with incomes exceeding eligibility cap.
Permits up to seven dollar increase in surcharge for document recordation with county in support of county homelessness housing trust funds.
Permits attorney fees awards in frivolous land use litigation.
Restricts certain campaign contributions by public employee labor organizations.
Extends duration of first five previously designated UEZs for two additional years; specifies permissable use of UEZ funds; requires DCA Commissioner to assess and issue report on UEZ program.
Establishes special license plate for family members of fallen police officers and firefighters.
Requires aggrieved person to request refund prior to commencing suit under consumer fraud law under certain circumstances.
Requires health benefits coverage for buprenorphine and buprenorphine/naloxone under certain conditions.
Requires health care facilities to test for and remediate lead in drinking water, and disclose test results.
Prohibits transport of certain items by motor vehicle on certain roadways; provides standards for loading or motor vehicle with certain items.
Requires Department of Education to encourage boards of education to offer instruction in media literacy.
Requires secured party to deliver motor vehicle certificate of ownership by certified mail.
Provides for confiscation and forfeiture of animals involved in animal cruelty violations, and for cost of their care while being held.
Authorizes creation of Wounded Warrior licence plate.
Requires nursing home facility operated by DMVA for veterans to provide State-funded transportation to health care services outside of facility.
Provides for monitoring and evaluation of transition of mental health and substance use disorder treatment service system to fee-for-service reimbursement model.
Provides State aid to counties and municipalities to fund transportation services for veterans to VA medical centers; appropriates $500,000.
Requires MVC to educate and test drivers on responsibilities during police stop.
Directs Office of CATV to promulgate rules and regulations concerning customers applying to establish CATV service, including requirement that customers provide two proofs of identity.
Provides free admission to State parks, forests, and beaches for certain veterans and military personnel.
Limits application of DEP shellfish habitat rules for certain dredging activities.
Exempts rural electric cooperatives from requirement that electric and gas public utilities deposit unclaimed property into Unclaimed Utility Deposits Trust Fund.
Concerns long term tax exemptions on certain age-restricted low-income housing.
Establishes Extended School Day and School Year Study Commission.
Requires Attorney General to establish victims of identity theft database.
Establishes Veterans Assistance Grant Program for nonprofit organizations to provide certain services to veterans.
"New Jersey Call Center Jobs Act."
Concerns crime of trafficking in personal identifying information.
Permits certain deer control activities; prohibits deer feeding; and establishes check-off donation on hunting license applications to support venison donation program.
Creates New Jersey Military Working Dog Handler and Military Working Dog medal.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to examine feasibilty of centralized property tax information system to verify property taxes paid by homestead property tax reimbursement claimants.
Clarifies DCA rulemaking authority over free-standing residential health care facilities, and prohibits eviction of residents from such facilities, except for good cause.
Requires State Auditor to annually report on unspent State account balances.
Requires high school driver education course, certain new driver brochures, and driver's license written exam to include bicycle and pedestrian safety information.
Creates State Procurement Study Commission.
Creates State Spending Commission to study expenditures of State government.
Expands Lifeline Credit and Tenants' Lifeline Assistance Programs to include assistance for water utility bill.
Requires the Division of Consumer Affairs to establish electronic monitoring system for pain management agreements, to be linked to, and used in association with, Prescription Monitoring Program.
Creates "Economic Gardening Program" in Department of State to provide customized services to certain businesses.
Establishing New Jersey Commission on Veterans' Benefits in DMVA.
Requires determination of eligibility and payment of family temporary disability leave benefits within three weeks of filing notices of claims for benefits.
Provides for a two-year statute of limitations in discrimination case under the "Law Against Discrimination" and prohibits certain waiver provisions in employment contracts.
