Permits legislator to represent person before Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control in certain circumstances.
Requires Commissioner of Education to develop guidance on identifying English language learners for gifted and talented programs.

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to obtain court order prior to using certain collection practices for defaulted loans under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students (NJCLASS) Loan Program.
Requires certain schools to maintain supply of opioid antidotes and permits emergency administration of opioid antidote by school nurse or trained employee.
"Health Care Consumer's Out-of-Network Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act."
Requires firearms purchaser identification card, permit to purchase handgun, or permit to carry handgun for temporary transfer of firearm at firing range.
Requires firearms purchaser identification card, permit to purchase handgun, or permit to carry handgun for use of firearm at firing range.
Requires DOT to create automated system to report traffic accidents and requires political subdivisions to report data; makes appropriation.
Permits family day care providers to care for up to 10 children; requires criminal history record background checks for family day care providers and certain household members.
Requires additional data in annual temporary disability and family leave insurance reports.
Establishes Zack alert system to facilitate apprehension of persons fleeing motor vehicle accident scene; designated as "Zackhary's Law."
Concerns certain business requirements for motor vehicle dealers.
Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act."
Disqualifies casino license applicant for five-year period if person substantially closed casino property in State; revokes license.
Permits voter to take photograph of own voted ballot and share it on Internet-based social media.
Extends duration of first five designated UEZs for two additional years; specifies permissible use of UEZ funds; requires DCA Commissioner to assess and issue report on UEZ program.
Replaces references to "alien" and "illegal alien" in statutes with "foreign national" and "undocumented foreign national," respectively; prohibits use of those terms by executive branch agencies.
Creates Advisory Committee on New Jersey's Historic Commercial Fishing Grounds.
Requires 10 percent reduction in certain automobile insurance premiums for installation of dashboard cameras.

Legalizes marijuana and provides for records expungement for certain past marijuana offenses; treats marijuana products similar to tobacco products, including use of civil penalties for providing marijuana to persons under 19 years of age.
Affords certain confidentiality privileges in civil proceedings to sponsors of individuals in treatment for drug or alcohol addiction.
Removes time of war requirements for receipt of distinguished service medal; codifies qualifications for receipt of meritorious service medal.
Increases fines for failing to have required markings on commercial vehicles.
Establishes "New Jersey Racetrack Growth and Development Fund" on behalf of eligible lessees of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority.
Requires paraprofessionals employed by educational services commissions to receive by May 15 either contract for employment for next year or written notice that employment will not be offered.
Requires inspection for pest infestation prior to certain demolitions.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Grants temporary, limited authority to members of Civil Service Commission and certain commission employees if commission does not have quorum for more than 30 days due to vacancies.
Establishes "Security Deposit Assistance Pilot Program" in Union, Essex, Hudson, and Gloucester counties, appropriates $210,000.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Requires Office of Emergency Management to establish county storm preparedness program.
Requires continued coverage of prescription drugs for certain medical conditions.
Requires candidates for election to school board to file with their nominating petitions specific affirmation that they have not been convicted of crimes that would disqualify them from office.
Modifies scope of "Sexual Assault Survivor Protection Act of 2015" and enforcement of protective orders under that act.
Requires school districts to provide information to high school students on cancers of the reproductive system as part of the health curriculum.
Establishes task force to study technology and other methods used to reduced or eliminate telemarketing harassment intimidation.
Requires at least 10 percent of "9-1-1 System and Emergency Response Trust Fund Account" funds be allocated to public safety answering point technology upgrades and maintenance.
"New Jersey Public Option Health Care Act."
Changes board of education voting requirements for appointment of superintendent of schools.
Establishes forest firefighter death benefit.
Provides certain overtime requirements for air carrier employees.
Creates Emergency Unemployment Benefits Program for construction workers laid off due to halted Transportation Trust Fund projects.
Requires collection of voluntary, self-disclosed information about sexual orientation and gender identity in certain surveys by State agencies.
Prohibits unfair discrimination in issuing or rating life insurance policies based on transgender status or certain gender identity information.
Requires New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority to defer lease payment due by racetrack lessees for three years under certain circumstances.
Allows minors 14 years of age or older to authorize organ donation; requires MVC to provide organ donation registration to certain minors.
Establishes one New Jersey Suicide Prevention Advisory Council in DOH.
Creates Ethnic Produce Task Force.

Exempts expansion or reconstruction, within 125 percent of existing footprint, of municipal and county buildings and certain emergency services buildings from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
"Motor Vehicle Insurance Verification Act."
Establishes tuition reimbursement program for certain advanced practice nurses who provide mental health care services in underserved areas in New Jersey.
Requires DOH to establish comprehensive searchable website concerning educational programs and resources available to special education students.
Adjusts identification of first class cities and certain counties that may have certain unclassified positions in civil service to reflect 2010 federal census.
Provides that driver's license and identification card expire on applicant's birthday.
Requires certain disclosures to consumers regarding health care costs.
Directs that decision by administrative law judge be considered final agency decision if Civil Service Commission has not met for more than 60 days.
Requires health insurance carriers; SHBP, and SEHBP to inform covered persons about organ and tissue donation.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction and veterans' property tax exemption to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault if committed against crossing guard or parking enforcement officer.
Requires high schools to offer computer science course.
Allows certain joint insurance funds to invest in bonds of State and federal agencies and to form joint cash management and investment programs.
Increases protections for domestic violence victims as part of driver's license application or renewal.
Provides civil liability immunity to nonprofit organizations engaged in gleaning activities on agricultural land.
Prohibits termination of law enforcement officer based upon determination that officer is physically unable to perform duty under certain circumstances.

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to provide annual New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program report to Governor and Legislature and develop student loan comparison information document to increase program transparency.
Revises New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program to require applicants first exhaust federal student loans, require income verification, and limit total student loan amounts.
Permits theaters with 100 seats or more to apply for liquor license.
Clarifies sales tax collection responsibilities of horse-boarding businesses in New Jersey; makes change retroactive to October 1, 2006.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support healthcare education.
Bars public entities and public employees from entering into confidential settlements of "whistleblower" claims; provides that such settlements constitute public records.
Requires DCF and DHS to study predatory alienation and its effects on young adults and senior citizens.
Requires employers to disclose certain wage information to employees.
Decreases annual thoroughbred race dates to 50 minimum upon written consent from New Jersey Thoroughbred Horsemen's Association.
Provides gross income tax deduction for State fuel taxes paid on purchases of motor fuel for personal use of motor vehicles.
Requires institutions of higher education to test for lead in drinking water and disclose test results.
Dedicates unencumbered revenue collected from vehicle size and weight enforcement to Transportation Trust Fund.
Establishes fourth degree crime of providing locksmithing services without license under certain circumstances.
Establishes housing expense reimbursements for families of certain public safety officers killed in line of duty.

Eliminates awards of punitive damages against public entities, and eliminates awards of noneconomic damages against both public entities and public employees except in certain cases involving physical injury.
Establishes "Nonprofit Security Grant Pilot Program."
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at horse racetracks, subject to voter approval; dedicates proceeds to General Fund, education, and horse racing industry.
Allows horse racetracks to be available for placing wagers at casinos in Atlantic City using the Internet.
Authorizes poker to be played in poker rooms at horse racetracks in this State.
Requires New Jersey Racing Commission to allow off-track wagering facilities to retain certain out-of-State wagering proceeds for direct distribution to permit holders.
Authorizes skill-based games to be played at horse racetracks in this State.
Authorizes horse derby game to be played at horse racetracks in this State.
Directs DOE to develop Veterans in the Schools Program to teach students about military experiences of local veterans.
Requires DCA to expand open enrollment period for federal Housing Choice Voucher Program to include non-electronic pre-application options.
Requires family day care providers and certain household members to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Requires bidders on certain State contracts to disclose, and Department of Treasury to publish, certain gender wage information.
Clarifies that correctional officers and juvenile correctional officers are permitted to carry firearm upon initial appointment.
Requires certain notification prior to mosquito spraying applications.
Provides penalties for sexually offensive or abusive communication through social networking websites.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide coverage for outpatient behavioral health care services.
Requires forms for informed consent for health care to be separate from forms related to assignment of insurance benefits or financial arrangements.
Establishes New Jersey Advisory Council on Home and Community-Based Settings to implement DHS Statewide Transition Plan.
Requires certain medical transportation vehicles to be equipped with stop signal arms and requires drivers to stop for vehicles under certain circumstances.
Allows gross income tax deduction for employees for amounts paid by employers for certain educational assistance programs for employees and for employee's student loans.

Requires institutions of higher education to send out annual student debt letters; requires students enrolled in public institutions of higher education to complete course on student loan debt repayment.
Requires State supervision of certain professional and occupational licensing boards.
Requires EDA, in consultation with Department of Agriculture, to establish loan program for certain vineyard and winery capital expenses.
Raises minimum wage to $10.10 and provides for certain other increases.
Provides a voucher to certain TANF recipients to purchase diapers.
Permits referendum question on sale or lease of municipal public utility at time of primary election and, if applicable, municipal regular election.
Establishes service for reporting employer and employment service violations and requires posting of certain notifications.
Revises temporay detention under bail reform statute.
Allows domestic violence victims to cancel television and telephone service contracts without paying early termination fee.
Exempts fuel used for operation of certain school buses from petroleum products gross receipts tax and motor fuel tax.
Establishes "Government Functions and Services Study Commission."
Provides gross income tax deduction for New Jersey fuel taxes paid through purchases of motor fuel for personal use at motor vehicles.
Provides that school districts may receive reimbursement for costs incurred on or after January 1, 2016 for testing school drinking water for lead.

"Pedals' Law"; prohibits hunting and establishes non-lethal control program for black bear for five years; prohibits certain actions that result in feeding of bears and requires use of bear-resistant containers; dumpsters, and food boxes in bear habitat.
Permits juror donation of statutory juror compensation to New Jersey Vet2Vet Hotline program.
Adds new civil penalties and increases surcharges imposed on domestic violence offenders; establishes "Domestic Violence Victims' Legal Assistance Fund.
Criminalizes certain actions of individuals who offer rental of residential property that they do not own or legally possess.
Encourages timely recording of residential deeds.
Requires electric public utility to notify property owner any time account for electric public utility service on owner's property is opened, closed, transferred, or altered.
Directs Division of Consumer Affairs to establish public information campaign concerning real estate rental scams.
Requires all creditors that acquire title to non-owner occupied residential property following foreclosure to notify municipality and common interest community.
Requires motor vehicle dealers and repair facilities to prioritize repairs on vehicles that accommodate wheel chairs.
Require Attorney General to ensure review of registration statements and financial reports of charitable organizations under certain circumstances.
Concerns emergency assistance which is repaid by the recipient.
Allows individual to receive additional lifetime emergency assistance under certain circumstances.

Requires school districts to include information on events of September 11, 2001 as part of New Jersey Student Learning Standards in Social Studies; requires public schools to hold annual assembly commemorating September 11, 2001.
Provides certain workers' compensation insurance coverage only to thoroughbred jockeys and standardbred drivers; allows use of competitive bidding process for professional service contracts.
Sets State mileage reimbursement rate at IRS rate for business use of automobile.
Establishes standards for electronic tax lien sales.
Permits local units and authorities to defer, reduce, or waive solid waste and recycling service fees for deployed military personnel.
Restricts medical expense coverage for opioid drugs unless prescribing health care professional follows certain guidelines.
Removes and repeals all prohibitions, permits, licenses, and authorizations concerning wagers on professional, collegiate, or amateur sport contests or athletic events.
Requires compilation of, and public access to, tests of soil lead levels.
Requires soil testing to determine lead content prior to certain home sales.
Requires DEP to adopt Statewide plan to reduce lead exposure from contaminated soils and drinking water.
Increases certain surrogate fees.
Requires businesses to report email address to Division of Revenue and Enterprise Services.
Establishes licensing and permit requirements and provides for adoption of standards and regulations for inspection of asbestos in certain structures.
Permits certain appointee to retain civil service position if eligibility error was made by Civil Service Commission.
Broadens scope of information sharing and civil immunity therefor, related to insurance fraud.
Excludes donations up to $15,000 when determining income eligibility for applicants to the Catastrophic Illness in Children Relief Fund program.
Establishes endangerment of a domestic companion animal as an animal cruelty offense.
Organizes the General Assembly for the Two Hundred and Seventeenth Legislature and amends Assembly Rule 10:1.
Amends Assembly Rule 10:1 to add one member to Assembly Law and Public Safety Committee.
Memorializes Congress and President of United States to enact H.R. 923, allowing reciprocity for carrying of certain concealed firearms.
Opposes certain parts of National Park Service's "Vision 2030" for Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area.
Designates June 8, 2010 as USS Liberty Remembrance Day.
Declares March 17 through March 23, 2013 as "Poison Prevention Awareness Week."
Declares violence a public health crisis.
Urges school districts to adopt and implement an aerospace and model rocketry program.
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to adopt rules to expedite child custody proceedings.
Urges Congress to pass legislation requiring publicly traded corporations to disclose all political contributions made thereby.
Urges federal government to provide increased funding for preschool, full-day kindergarten, and community college programs.
Urges US DOT to promulgate regulations concerning transport of crude oil by rail that ensures safety of NJ residents who live along railroads.
Urges United States Congress to dedicate additional federal funds for highway maintenance and infrastructure improvements in New Jersey.
Expresses profound disagreement with President's decision to restore full diplomatic relations with Cuba; urges extradition to the United States of Joanne Chesimard.
Designates month of June 2016 as "Internet Safety Month."
Disapproves BPU decision to reclassify incumbent local exchange carrier service as competitive service; urges BPU to reverse decision.
Urges Congress to pass "SAVE Act," which revokes tax-exempt status of certain professional sports leagues and uses revenue from closed tax loophole to fund domestic violence programs.
Urges Congress and President to enact "Water Quality Investment Act."
Urges Congress to authorize VA to utilize hospitals, such as Bergen Regional Medical Center, for veteran medical care and services.
Expresses disapproval of the resolution adopted by the Rutgers University New Brunswick Faculty Council opposing the selection of Dr. Condoleezza Rice as 2014 commencement speaker.
Urges Congress to reauthorize Older Americans Act.
Urges US FDA to reconsider approval of Zohydro ER pending comprehensive testing.
Honors United States Merchant Marine service.
Urges Council on Local Mandates to dismiss complaint filed by Deptford Township regarding cameras in police vehicles.
Urges State and local government entities to purchase locally made NJ products.
Urges US Fish and Wildlife Service and DEP to resolve conflict between protection of red knot shorebird and economic viability of State's oyster industry.
Opposes PennEast Pipeline project in NJ.
Urges Congress to enact legislation imposing greater safety requirements on shipment of crude oil by rail.
Expresses opposition to Iran's election to Commission on the Status of Women.
Urges Congress to use reward money offered for capture of Osama bin Laden to establish a fund for benefit of returning veterans of wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
Urges health insurance providers and prescription drug providers to offer option of speaking to or leaving a message for a human.
Urges New Jersey Chamber of Commerce to redirect annual train ride, reception, and dinner to Atlantic City, New Jersey.
Recognizes and honors service of law enforcement officers.
Urges President and Congress to enact legislation reinstating the separation between commercial and investment banking.
Urges certain New Jersey State officials to raise awareness in business community of existing "State of New Jersey - NJ Business Portal" website.
Urges Congress to pass legislation empowering and enhancing National Guard.
Urges school districts to have at least five teachers in each school certified in CPR and first aid.
Urges Congress to prohibit any U.S. citizen or resident who joins foreign terror organization from returning.
Expresses support for "Walter Patterson and Werner Foerster Justice and Extradition Act."
Requires mandatory posting of legislation with 41 or more sponsors; provides for Special Order Speeches and public comment periods at committee meetings.
Urges Congress to enact "Responding to Urgent Needs of Survivors of the Holocaust Act."
Urges DOE and school districts to develop creative solutions to address chronic absenteeism.
Opposes United States signing and United States Senate ratifying United Nations' Arms Trade Treaty.
Urges Congress to adopt "William Jefferson Clinton Voter ID Act of 2014," requiring that Social Security cards have photograph of cardholder and be displayed before voting in federal elections.
Urges President and United States Congress to remove regulatory barriers to allow and encourage cable and satellite television companies to offer "a la carte" programming.
Urges Congress to pass "Surface Transportation and Taxation Equity Act."
Calls upon NJ citizens to read full text of Declaration of Independence when celebrating Independence Day.
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to adopt a uniform modification to the juror notification system.
Requires certain bills and resolutions with at least 32 sponsors to be voted on third reading upon notice.
Urges Congress to enact "Christopher Bryski Student Loan Protection Act."
Recognizes and supports New Jersey State FFA Association and role of agricultural education in NJ.
Opposes elimination of motor vehicle safety inspections.

Constitutes and continues Assembly Transportation, Public Works and Independent Authorities Committee as special committee to investigate finances, operations, and management of PANYNJ; grants committee subpoena power and certain other enforcement powers.

Memorializes Congress and President to introduce and enact legislation to permit correctional facility supervisory authorities to block unauthorized wireless communications by prisoners within correctional facilities.
Urges approval of application to list Market Square Park in Perth Amboy on NJ Register of Historic Places.
Urges Congress to enact "Credit Union Small Business Jobs Creation Act."
Expresses respect and support for will of people of Puerto Rico for statehood.
Urges NJT to undertake construction of Hackensack to Hawthorne commuter rail line.
Urges Congress to pass "Community Parks Revitalization Act."
Urges President and Congress to enact tax credit for biodiesel fuel.
Urges institutions of higher education to offer a required undergraduate course on financial literacy.
Urges PANYNJ to implement new bus terminal plan.
Urges Congress not to cut funds from federal Preschool Development Grant Program.
Urges US DOT to prohibit transport of crude oil through certain populated areas.
Urges U.S. Congress to enact legislation protecting employee and retiree retirement benefits.
Urges PANYNJ to restore fares and tolls to 2011 levels.
Urges Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to implement frequency-based discounted toll plan for certain New Jersey residents.
Opposes President's plan to allow oil and natural gas drilling in Atlantic Ocean.
Urges Congress to develop and enact new coverage formula to help identify and end discrimination in voting under the federal Voting Rights Act of 1965.
Urges FAA to expand restrictions on flights of unmanned aerial vehicles.
Memorializes Congress and the President to reform federal trade policy.
Urges institutions of higher education to provide priority enrollment in courses to students who have dependent children.

Urges school districts to use USDA MyPlate program and information technology to promote and monitor student nutrition as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Urges Congress to pass "Community Broadband Act."
Urges residents of New Jersey to shop locally and support local businesses and organizations.
Urges Congress to enact certain gun control measures.
Urges President and Congress to enact "Industrial Hemp Farming Act of 2015" and each NJ member of Congress to sponsor the legislation and work for its enactment.
Opposes Pilgrim Pipeline project in NJ.
Urges NFL teams to donate money received from government sources for military promotions to veterans' organizations.
Urges institutions of higher education in the State with undergraduate engineering programs to offer major in aerospace engineering.
Expresses General Assembly's support for efforts of State of New Jersey in federal court in favor of allowing State to conduct sports wagering.
Urges Congress to enact legislation requiring law enforcement officers to be equipped with body cameras.
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to adopt rules temporarily admitting attorney spouses of military service members to New Jersey Bar.
Urges Congress of US to continue funding research on exposure of certain members of military to smoke from burning of waste.
Urges President and Congress to create sales tax parity for Main Street merchants and online retailers.
Memorializes Department of Defense to authorize changes on certain military service forms of veterans who are transgender.
Opposes efforts by Congress to reduce funding for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
Urges DEP to conduct thorough and thoughtful review of any proposed interstate oil pipeline.
Urges Congress to inform the public on telecommunications and Internet surveillance programs concerning national security.

Condemns anti-police rhetoric and violence.
Urges Congress and President to reauthorize "Child Nutrition Act of 1966."
Urges President to maintain U.S. responsibility over Internet's Domain Name System.
Affirms importance of modernizing and replacing certain natural gas pipelines in this State.
Endorses American Kennel Club Canine Good Citizen program.
Memorializes the President and Congress to pass and enforce immigration reform to protect the nation.
Urges Congress and President to reauthorize National Estuary Program.
Urges Division of Parks and Forestry to market and offer local NJ-based art and agricultural products at park sites, whenever possible.
Declares NJ's tourism industry and shore areas open for business; encourages visitors to explore and support destinations in State.

Urges President and Congress to amend Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) to include substance use disorder among disabilities qualifying children for special education programs and services.
Designates third full week in March as "Horticultural Therapy Week."
Designates first full week of June each year as "New Jersey Fishing and Boating Week."
Designates second weekend in July as "Cooking with Kids Weekend."
Designates first full day of spring of each year as "New Jersey Agriculture Day."
Honors 100th anniversary of NJ Nursery and Landscape Association.
Recognizes 100th anniversary of Farm Credit East Program.
Commemorates 100th anniversary of world's first commercial blueberry crop grown in Whitesbog, NJ.
Recognizes 100th anniversary of NJ Dept. of Agriculture.
Designates fourth week of March of each year as "Military Caregivers Week."
Designates June 27 of each year as "Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Awareness Day." *
Designates October 23 of each year as "Sudden, Unexpected Death in Epilepsy Awareness Day" in New Jersey.
Designates March of each year as "Fibromuscular Dysplasia Awareness Month."
Supports U.S Senator Cory Booker's efforts to persuade Federal Trade Commission to prohibit practice of sexual orientation change efforts.
Designates August of each year as "Adult Vaccine Preventable Disease Awareness and Improvement Month" in New Jersey.
Designates month of May of each year as "Mental Health Awareness Month."
Establishes a task force to study and make recommendations concerning the regulation of tax preparers.
Designates June of each year as "Native Plant Appreciation Month."
Designates second Tuesday in April as "Equal Pay Day."

Designates the second Friday of December of each year as "Paraprofessional and School-Related Personnel (PSRPs) in Our Schools Day" in New Jersey to recognize the contributions of paraprofessionals and school-related personnel.
Recognizes 100th anniversary of National Park Service on August 25, 2016.
Designates September of each year as "Youth Suicide Prevention Awareness Month" in New Jersey.
Designates November of each year as "Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month."
Urges U.S. Soccer Federation to provide U.S. Women's National Team with equal pay and conditions.
Designates June as Community Development Awareness Month.
Designates third week in September of each year as "Go Gold for Kids with Cancer Awareness Week."
Designates last full week in October of each year as "Hypophosphatasia Awareness Week."
Designates June 4 of each year as "Tourette Syndrome Awareness Day" in New Jersey.
Designates November of each year as "Diversity Month in New Jersey."
Urges Congress to ask USDOE and USDOL to modify regulations regarding Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to protect individuals with disabilities.
Designates May of each year as "Prader-Willi Syndrome Awareness Month" in New Jersey.
Designates April of each year as "Esophageal Cancer Awareness Month."
Designates May of each year as "Caregivers Awareness Month."
Designates first week in June as "Rip Current Awareness Week."
Designates third Friday in September of every year as Concussion Awareness Day.
Designates last full week in June each year as "Home and Community Garden Gleaning Week."
Urges Congress to pass "Christa McAuliffe Commemorative Coin Act of 2016."
Urges Secretary of State to assure Legislature and public that State's electoral system is protected from foreign computer hackers.
Designates February 3rd of each year as Senator Joseph Palaia Day in New Jersey.
Designates the month of September as "National Obesity Awareness Month" in New Jersey.
Designates first full week in August of each year as "Farmers Market Week."
Establishes "Disparity in State Procurement Study Commission."
Designates days of recognition for Rosh Hashanah, Yom Kippur, and Passover.
Designates September 7 through 13 of each year as "Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Awareness Week" in New Jersey.
Recognizes 100th anniversary of Fort Dix.
Commemorates establishment and service of the New Jersey State Police and celebrates 95th anniversary of first graduating class.
Designates October of each year as "Disability Employment Awareness Month."
Permanently designating October 6 as "Knock Out Opioid Abuse Day" in New Jersey.
Encourages sharing of services; makes appropriations.

Establishes the New Jersey Direct Property Tax Relief Program by providing a property tax relief credit under the gross income tax and increasing the current gross income tax credit for homestead property taxes.
Raises minimum wage rate to $10.10, makes further increases over a four-year period, and maintains annual increases based on increases in CPI-W.
Appropriates $34,800,995,000 in State funds and $15,706,712,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2016-2017.
Prohibits person whose driver's license is suspended for DWI from operating NJT train.
Restricts use of isolated confinement in correctional facilities.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Provides for presumptive parole; establishes parole compliance credits; requires inmate disciplinary database; bases commutation credits on custodial sentence.
Provides for issuance of certificate of rehabilitation to certain offenders with substance abuse disorders.

Requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in black bear habitat under certain circumstances, including garbage collection, and prohibits certain actions that would result in feeding of black bears.
Increases number of PANYNJ commissioners to 14; requires one commissioner from each state be appointed upon recommendation of American Automobile Association.
Ends the estate tax and raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $350,000.
Eliminates requirement that public-private partnership agreements for construction of certain higher education facilities be submitted to EDA for review and approval by certain dates.
Adds two public members to NJT board.
Establishes independent Office of Comptroller of Education and removes authority of State Comptroller with regard to oversight of boards of education.
Requires combined reporting of corporation business tax by certain members of unitary business groups.
Provides that two members of board of education of Type II school district will be appointed by mayor or other chief executive officer of municipality constituting district.
Revises "Pet Purchase Protection Act" to establish new requirements for pet dealers and pet shops.*
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for positron emission tomography to diagnose Alzheimer's disease.
Requires insurers to provide minimum of 30 days inpatient treatment for substance abuse when physician determines treatment is medically necessary.
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Prohibits State agencies from posting emergency medical technicians' personal information on web sites.
Requires the reporting of criminal offenses occurring on school property to law enforcement authorities.
Provides that English shall be the official language of the State.
Exempts from sales and use tax sales of carbon monoxide detectors and any device or equipment sold for residential use to detect, warn of, abate, or extinguish fires.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires adoption agency, court, or DYFS to maintain child's religious upbringing when placing child in adoptive or resource family home.
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed.
Exempts all transfers made to lineal relatives from the Transfer Inheritance Tax.
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Excludes certain federal employee Thrift Savings Fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Establishes 80 as maximum age for issuing special handgun carry permits to retired police officers.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Creates procedure for destruction of all records pertaining to juveniles who are arrested but subsequently not charged with delinquency.
Limits non-debt service portion of sewerage and utilities authority charge or fee increases to no more than two percent over previous year.
Allows counties and municipalities to use open space trust funds for remediation of collapsed mine shafts and sinkholes on property owned by county or municipality.
Provides for licensure and regulation of small business consultants.
Requires condemnor to acquire road access easement for property owner if condemnation eliminates road access.
Requires all elected or appointed local government officers to receive ethics training.
Requires warning sign to be posted at pontoon boat rental businesses; designated as "Christopher's Law."
Establishes Class Three special law enforcement officers to provide security in public and nonpublic schools and county colleges.*

Exempts disabled veterans and Purple Heart recipients from payment of municipal parking meter fees when their vehicles bear disabled veteran's or Purple Heart license plate or placard issued by N.J. Motor Vehicle Commission.
"Mainland Memoriam Act"; directs MVC to create graduated driver's license informational material to be distributed by motor vehicle dealers.
Authorizes Office of Public Defender to provide legal representation for child in proceedings after parental rights have been terminated.
Permits veteran's property tax deduction for tax year when veteran was previously qualified to receive deduction and became owner of real property after October 1 of pretax year.
Immunizes from civil liability first responders who forcibly enter property to provide emergency assistance.

Revises "Overseas Residents Absentee Voting Law" to mirror federal law; permits overseas voters to vote in any election; permits use of federal write-in absentee ballot to vote, register or request ballot for all elections.
Provides certain small businesses impacted by Hurricane Sandy a corporation business tax or gross income tax credit for certain reinvestment in shore municipalities.

Establishes small business loan guarantee program in EDA to support capital purchases and operating expenses and permits certain qualified businesses in regional centers to qualify for certain EDA loans.
Establishes criteria and requirements for shore protection project priority list and funding from Shore Protection Fund.
Authorizes public financing of primary election campaigns to fill gubernatorial vacancy and general election campaigns to fill vacancy in offices of Governor and Lieutenant Governor.
Requires electric public utilities to conduct vegetation management adjacent to service lines on certain real properties.
Establishes central registry for sickle cell trait diagnoses; provides for informational outreach and genetic counseling.
Establishes "Atlantic City Growth Tax Credit Program" to grant tax credits to promote the development of non-rental housing in Atlantic City.
Permits administration of epinephrine auto-injector device by persons who complete approved educational program.
Provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for qualified farmers that develop housing for their agricultural workforce.
Directs DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to permit certain wineries to participate in certain sign programs on freeways, interstate highways, and toll roads.
Enters New Jersey in multistate Nurse Licensure Compact.
Establishes "Green Fund" in BPU to provide funding for energy reliability, resilience, and sustainability programs.
Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Provides for reduced sales tax imposition on certain sales in certain Highlands Region Preservation Area municipalities.
Requires sex offenders in satellite-based monitoring program to pay for certain equipment and monitoring costs.
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits for surviving dependents of public safety workers who die in the line of duty.

Forbids members of the State Investment Council from voting on transactions concerning investment with which a member has certain financial or familial conflicts and requires removal for violations thereof.
Replaces TPAF, PERS, PFRS and SPRS accidental disability benefits with reduced work-related disability benefit; modifies JRS disability benefit.

"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website; requires certain public entities receiving State funds to establish similar website; makes an appropriation.
"Flood Control, Mitigation, and Prevention Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for up to $2 billion, and appropriates $5,000.
Reduces gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years.
Requires managed care plans to allow any clinical laboratory to participate in provider network.
"Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Cargo Facility Charge Act."
Exempts construction, expansion or renovation of public institutions of higher education, public schools, and police and fire academies from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Excludes from gross income the contributions that certain federal employees classified as criminal investigators make to the federal Thrift Savings Fund.
Requires DHSS to study relationship between autism and ultrasounds and issue protocol for use of ultrasounds.

Eliminates power of DRPA to finance economic development; changes composition of board; imposes restrictions regarding financing, contract procedures, conflicts of interest, and review audits; creates commuter's council.
Revises exemption from "unemployment compensation law" for operators of certain motor vehicles.
Establishes home elevation fund and dedicates up to $5 million of realty transfer fee revenue annually for this purpose.
Establishes "Small Business Bonding Readiness Assistance Program" in EDA to assist certain small businesses meet State or federal contract surety bond requirements.*
Reduces the gross income tax's top marginal rate to 7.97% from 8.97%.
Prohibits any reimbursement for donation of cadaveric fetal tissue and prohibits use of cadaveric fetal tissue in research for cosmetic treatment.

Permits certain applicants to submit personal statement of veteran status, in lieu of determination of veteran status, prior to issuance of civil service eligible list; requires submission of determination of status prior to employment.
Requires principals and teachers of public schools to conduct an oral recitation from the Declaration of Independence before the opening of school each day in grades 3-12; appropriates $10,000.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide greater assistance to certain students with military obligations.
Permits court to order involuntary outpatient treatment in any county; concerns patient compliance with taking medication.
Creates offense of making false child abuse report; permits assessment of penalty.
Transfers immunity from civil liability for certain healthcare providers to other healthcare providers in certain circumstances.
Permits use of virtual instruction to meet minimum 180-day school year requirement under certain circumstances.
Requires DEP to adopt regulations to allow cultivation of commercial shellfish species in certain coastal and inner harbor waters for research, educational, or restoration purposes.
Excludes sale of and services associated with mausoleums, memorials, and vaults from sales and use tax.
Affords civil immunity to private colleges and their police officers in certain cases.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Uphold Democracy."
Eliminates eligibility time limit on tuition benefits for spouses of certain public safety workers killed in performance of their duties.
Allows deduction against gross income for unreimbursed expenses incurred by organ donor.
Establishes "New Jersey Fire and EMS Crisis Intervention Services" telephone hotline.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires DEP to establish certification program for septic system inspectors.

Establishes annual sales tax holiday during first weekend of August for certain retail sales of computers, school computer supplies, school supplies, school art supplies, and school instructional materials.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Authorizes South Jersey Vietnam Veterans' Association license plates with proceeds to veterans' and emergency management operations.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain student athlete physical examinations.
Revises criteria to establish base year for homestead property tax reimbursement after relocation.
Creates Task Force on Distracted Driving.
Requires BPU to provide grants for cost of purchase and installation of certain electric metering equipment for solar power generation systems.
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Establishes Medicaid Smart Card Pilot Program.
Requires notification of local law enforcement prior to expungement of certain mental health records of prospective firearms purchasers.
Establishes licensure for steel construction contractors.
Criminalizes possession and sale of alpha-pyrrolidinopentiophenone (alpha-PVP), commonly known as "flakka," or "flocka."
Establishes "New Jersey Task Force on Abuse of Persons who are Elderly or Disabled."
Permits holding companies of eligible New Jersey emerging technology companies to receive investments under "New Jersey Angel Investor Tax Credit Act."
Establishes defense against exclusionary zoning litigation seeking builder's remedy.
Authorizes Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy to calculate affordable housing obligations.
Directs COAH to use growth share methodology to calculate fair share affordable housing need.
Refines five-month window established by Supreme Court begins after trial court establishes standards.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing.
Revises certain motor vehicle fines imposed on motor vehicle drivers or operators for failing to have required documentation.
Clarifies when penalty points are to be assessed for convictions of driving in an unsafe manner.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.
Makes discretionary driver's license suspension for first offense of driving without motor vehicle liability insurance under certain circumstances.
Designates Black Swallowtail butterfly as State Butterfly.
Allows certain emergency squad volunteers holding municipal elective office to vote on emergency squad concerns.
Authorizes wiretaps for investigation of certain crimes.
Increases penalties for violations of recordkeeping laws pertaining to secondhand jewelry and precious metal transactions.
Prohibits firearm possession by persons convicted of certain offenses.*
Authorizes use of juvenile records for prosecution of gang criminality.
"Uniform Trust Code."
Clarifies that certain drunk driving offenders who drive with suspended driver's license are guilty of fourth degree crime.
Establishes NJ STEM Entrepreneur Fellowship Program in DOLWD.
Establishes Task Force on School District Regionalization.
Requires DOH license additional angioplasty facilities, with at least one facility in each county.
Prohibits victims from being charged certain costs and fees and clarifies victims' right to obtain certain interviews.
Revises definition of victim in "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Prohibits snowplow or de-icing service contract from indemnifying promisee against liability for loss or damage in certain instances.
Limits time continuing care retirement communities may retain refundable entrance fee after resident vacates facility to no more than one year.
Clarifies that period of suspension remains in effect until driver's license is restored in certain cases.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to study impact of State business income taxes on business out-migration, business formation, and employment.
Establishes the New Jersey State Commission on Education Reform to develop academic outcome-based per pupil public school funding amounts.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.
Authorizes hunting of game animals every day of the week during hunting season.

Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements and to approve school district collective negotiations agreements prior to execution of agreement.
"Parent Empowerment and Choice Act"; enables parents to initiate reform in low performing schools through a petition process.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.

Requires tuition bills of public institutions of higher education to include details on student fees and opt-out provision for student-managed entertainment fees, and requires certain institutions' websites to include student fee information.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave.
Expands definition of "acquisition," for purposes of county and municipal open space trust funds, to include demolition, removal of debris, and restoration of lands being acquired.

"Direct Tax Relief for New Jersey Families Act"; Establishes the New Jersey Direct Property Tax Relief Program; increases the renter's gross income tax credit for property taxes; and increases the earned income tax credit.
Strengthens rights of certain sexual assault victims to sole custody; allows victim to place child for adoption without notice to person who committed sexual assault resulting in birth of the child.
Expands definitions of "abused child" or "abused or neglected child" to include prenatal exposure of child to controlled substances.
Permits minors to engage in certain construction work for nonprofit organizations.
Clarifies DHS authority to license and regulate sober living homes.
Establishes "County Tourism Incentive Grant Fund" within Department of Treasury to provide funding for grants to counties to support tourism advertising and promotion.
"School Children First Act"; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires principal consent for teacher placement; eliminates certain seniority rights.

"Drew's Law"; allows counties and municipalities to establish, or request DOT to establish, 15 miles per hour speed limit in or near certain parks and to set increased penalty for violating speed limit.
Authorizes installation of automatic standby generators in certain residences without zoning or planning board approval.
Requires State arts, historical, and cultural grant recipients to offer information on food and lodging in vicinity of event funded.
Provides county vocational school districts with the authority to name themselves in a manner that more accurately reflects their mission.
Authorizes establishment of regional economic development partnerships.
Prohibits additional jughandles on roads or highways in the State.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Permits municipalities and school districts to contract for video monitoring systems to assist in enforcing law against unlawfully passing a school bus.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on the dangers of texting while driving as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Requires installation of emergency power supply systems to certain common areas of new planned real estate developments; provides related tax incentives.
Prohibits public utility from filing rate increase petition under certain circumstances.
Increases criminal penalties if leaving loaded firearm within easy access of minor results in injury or death.
Requires mortgage lenders to maintain vacant, age-restricted dwelling units during foreclosure.
Requires newly-constructed grocery stores to have generators.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Prohibits sale, distribution, and use of urea as an ice melt.
Requires labeling of ingredients and restricts phosphorus in household cleansing products.
Establishes mandatory penalties for committing burglary and theft during a state of emergency.
Requires police notification when driver's license is suspended.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid via E-ZPass.
Requires DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to use only native vegetation for landscaping, land management, reforestation, or habitat restoration.
Enhances penalties imposed on drivers who have never been issued a driver's license.
Requires public utility to reimburse business customer during period when business ceases operations due to utility repairing or replacing its equipment on business customer's property.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employing immediate family members of members of the Armed Forces of the United States who were killed in action.
Authorizes court to impose rescue operation costs of public entity under certain circumstances.
Allows shore municipalities to provide spouse and dependent children of veterans free or reduced cost access to beaches.
Requires that victims of sex offense be informed of offender's risk of re-offense upon release.
Permits State aid to fund start-up costs for local shared services projects.
Provides loan redemption for certain physicians who work in State 10 years.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to convene a strategic planning summit to analyze the State's physician workforce supply.
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically modified material.
"Volunteer Medical Professional Health Care Act."
Protects home addresses of law enforcement officers from being released by governmental entities.
Requires prescribers and pharmacists to check prescription monitoring program prior to prescribing and dispensing Schedule II drugs.
Eliminates standard waiting period for issuance of marriage or civil union license.
Upgrades theft to a crime of the first degree if amount involved is $500,000 or more.
Provides for dismissal of certain traffic summonses if repairs are made within 72 hours.
Prohibits administration of standardized assessments not required under State or federal law.
Exempts sales of county property from certain requirements under certain circumstances.
Requires Rutgers University to create a liberal studies program for students with intellectual disabilities; appropriates $500,000.
Raises income threshold for pension and retirement income exclusions under gross income tax for married couples filing jointly.
Raises maximum eligibility age for exempt fireman certificates and membership in New Jersey State Firemen's Association.
Creates the "Mold Safe Housing Act."

Requires DCA to establish procedures for inspection and abatement of mold hazards in residential buildings and school facilities, and certification programs for mold inspectors and mold hazard abatement workers.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Requires prosecutors to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Imposes mandatory term of life imprisonment without eligibility for parole on persons who commit particularly brutal sexual assaults.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Creates offense of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.
Allows CRDA to finance certain highway projects outside of Atlantic City Tourism District.
Allows certain drug dealing offenses to be graded by "units," rather than weight, of controlled dangerous substances.
Creates New Jersey Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act.
Increases penalties for certain heroin offenses by revising threshold amounts for first, second, and third degree crimes of manufacturing, distributing, and dispensing heroin.
Provides for payment to small municipalities, in certain cases, of certain penalty moneys assessed for violations of fish and game laws.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.
The "Out-of-network Consumer Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act."
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Revises requirements for emergency medical services delivery.
Removes statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands categories of defendants liable in such actions.
Permits municipalities to hold certain inactive liquor licenses reserved for smart growth developments for an additional five years.
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DOH.
Revises procedure for issuance of amended birth certificate for person who has undergone change in sex.
Increases tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax rates to be on par with tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax; dedicates revenue for smoking and tobacco use cessation programs.
"New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database Act"; establishes New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database and arbitration process for reimbursing out-of-network health care providers.
Provides for Medicaid coverage and reimbursement for mental health services provided through telepsychiatry.
Concerns cigarette manufacturers and production of certain tobacco products using roll-your-own tobacco machines at retail establishments within this State.

Requires establishment of processes to identify Medicaid eligible incarcerated individuals who are awaiting pre-trial release determinations, are being released following period of incarceration, or are undergoing inpatient hospital treatment.
Requires disclosures of out-of-network services performed by health care providers under certain circumstances.
Allows municipality to establish reserved parking zone on property adjacent to disabled person's residence.
Authorizes health care providers to engage in telehealth and telemedicine.*
Establishes driver's license for residents who cannot prove lawful presence in US.
Prohibits use of smokeless tobacco in public schools.
Requires anyone receiving opioid antidote to treat drug overdose be provided with information concerning substance abuse treatment programs and resources.
Authorizes pharmacists to provide opioid antidotes to patients without individual prescriptions, in accordance with standardized protocols to be adopted by Board of Pharmacy.
Establishes certain standards for health benefits plans with tiered network.
Limits provision of services at nonprofit veterinary facilities to certain clients.
Prohibits the sale or distribution of flavored electronic smoking devices.
Provides for fair notice and opportunity to contest, or obtain waiver of a repayment of, overpayment of homestead rebate or credit and homestead property tax reimbursement.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Restores State fiscal year 2011 reductions to Garden State Preservation Trust payments in lieu of taxes; appropriates $3,400,000 to DCA.
Clarifies definition of reasonably necessary deviation when legally transporting firearm or weapon in motor vehicle.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amounts under New Jersey estate tax in accordance with provisions of federal tax law.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Revises definition of "necessary care" in the State's animal cruelty law to include more specific requirements.
Provides courts with sentencing discretion for certain convictions concerning possession of a firearm.
Creates Veterans Diversion Program to divert eligible servicemembers away from criminal justice system and into appropriate case management and treatment.*
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.
Provides court with sentencing discretion in certain cases under the "Graves Act."
Provides an excused absence on Veterans Day for pupil who participates in certain activities for veterans or active duty members of United States Armed Forces or New Jersey National Guard.
Increases amount annually credited to Shore Protection Fund to $50 million.
Establishes grant program for homeless veterans shelters.

Updates factors for consideration for grandparent and sibling petitions seeking visits with child over objection of parent, guardian, or custodian; adds preference for child's temporary placement with grandparent under "Child Placement Bill of Rights Act."
Permits sale of motor fuels that have not been blended with ethanol for certain purposes.
Appropriates $1.6 million to Dept. of Agriculture for Jersey Fresh program.
Requires Dept. of Agriculture and DEP to work with US Army Corps of Engineers to establish joint permit application process for aquaculture projects.
Requires Dept. of Agriculture and DEP to adopt coordinated permit application and review program for aquaculture projects.*
Makes supplemental appropriation of $1,000,000 to Department of State to fund Haskin Shellfish Research Laboratory at Rutgers Agricultural Experiment Station.
Clarifies right to recover certain uncompensated medical expenses under private passenger automobile insurance.
Restricts access to motor vehicle accident reports under certain circumstances.
Provides for two-year post-employment restriction on certain employees of the Department of Banking and Insurance.
Prohibits certain violations of terms of service for Internet ticket sales.
Requires liability insurance for permit to possess certain dangerous animals.
Requires private passenger automobile insurance buyer's guide to include both range of premium rate credit and actual dollar savings for coverage selections.
Expands WC coverage to parking areas provided by employer.
Makes provisions of the "New Jersey False Claims Act" retroactive under certain circumstances.
Requires State contracts to include provisions imposing penalties on vendor or contractor for contract violations.
Requires all attorneys engaged in private practice of law in New Jersey be covered by legal malpractice liability insurance.
Requires employers and multiple dwelling unit owners to maintain liability insurance policies.
Requires police vehicles to be equipped with Global Positioning System tag devices.
Requires NJT to hold public hearing and provide notice prior to any curtailment of certain bus and rail services.
Creates fencing crime involving stolen domestic companion animals.
Revises statutes governing qualifications and duties of notaries public and other notorial officers.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
"The 10-20-Life Law."
Establishes new limits for campaign contributions by individuals, certain groups and campaign committees.
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system and allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Establishes "Government Functions and Services Study Commission."
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to taxpayers contributing to scholarships for low-income children.
Restricts certain campaign contributions by public employee labor organizations.
Transfers responsibility for establishment and enforcement of ethical standards for local officials to State Ethics Commission.
Directs MVC to establish driver's license endorsement for autonomous vehicles.
Establishes New Jersey General Accounting Office.
Expands crime of invasion of privacy to include "upskirting"; photographing or filming the image of the undergarment-clad intimate parts of another.
Modifies spousal or civil union partner privilege against testifying in criminal actions to prevent invoking of privilege under certain circumstances.
Concerns stalking and related restraining order protections for adoptive children and their adoptive parents victimized by persons whose parental rights to the adoptive children have been terminated.
Establishes NJ Innovation and Research Fellowship Program in DOWLD.
Ends the estate tax and increases the gross income tax's retirement income exclusions.
Requires MVC conduct study and make recommendations concerning electronic driver's licenses and mobile applications.

Provides gross income tax credit for A-list performing artists for income derived from certain live performances contracted for and rendered within the Atlantic City Tourism District on a recurring basis and within the State.
Eliminates requirement for State residency for public officers and employees with limited historic exceptions.
Establishes New Jersey Commission on Higher Education and Business Partnerships.
Provides governance, transparency, and accountability reforms at PANYNJ.
Makes reforms to mental health treatment; clarifies law governing purchase of firearms by persons with history of mental illness.

Requires certain common interest community associations to publish certain information; requires that homeowners' association contracts for management and maintenance include 24-hour emergency services.
Exempts from disclosure as public record personal identifying information provided to government agency for emergency notification purposes.
Raises minimum age for purchase and sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices from 19 to 21.
Increases penalties for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving.
Grants subpoena power to Office of Inspector General at Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in furtherance of investigations.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Prohibits sale and possession of undetectable firearms manufactured using three dimensional printing technology.
Allows installation of solar arrays by municipalities on preserved open space in certain circumstances.
Regulates sale of certain bicycles with quick release wheels.
Requires charter schools to annually submit to Commissioner of Education salary and benefit information for certain employees.

Establishes measures to deter steroid use among students; appropriates $45,000 to DOE for New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association testing of student-athletes for steroids and other performance enhancing substances.
Establishes certain minimum and maximum temperatures in emergency shelters, rooming and boarding houses, and certain nursing homes and residential health care facilities.
Requires certification of diligent inquiry in residential mortgage foreclosure actions to be filed by attorneys.
Authorizes gun violence restraining orders and firearm seizure warrants.
Revises requirements and training standards for first responders under New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987.

Requires review of Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure guidance for substance abuse instruction provided to public school students incorporates most recent evidence-based standards and practices.
Designates five State songs.
Authorizes State-chartered banks, savings banks, savings and loans, and credit unions to conduct certain savings account promotions.
Requires coach of interscholastic sports team to provide athletic director with certification that no one associated with team was involved in player recruitment.
Prohibits sale or distribution of liquid nicotine except in child-resistant containers.
Requires hospital patient's medical record to include notation if patient has Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.
Establishes requirements for training programs for homemaker-home health aides in care of patients with Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.
Requires certain retailers to provide notice of FAA safety guidelines for flying drones to consumers.
Requires certain drones to contain geo-fencing technology; makes violation a fourth degree crime.

Prohibits school districts from joining associations which oversee Statewide interscholastic sports unless association limits interscholastic eligibility of certain student-athletes who repeat middle school grade for athletic advantage.*
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
Requires certain DOC, county, and municipal prison physicians to acquire certain training.
Requires correctional facilities to provide inmates with prescription medication that was prescribed for chronic conditions existing prior to incarceration.
Requires annual notice of assessment on property to contain bolded notice of filing deadline for appeal.
Requires notice requirements by CATV companies for changes to station channel positions to be consistent with federal law.
Limits forum of consumer contract disputes to New Jersey.
Regulates individuals engaged in the facilitation of like-kind exchanges of property pursuant to Section 1031 of the United States Tax Code.
Creates a civil cause of action for stalking.
Adds conviction of unlawfully possessing weapon to list of crimes that statutorily prohibit someone from buying or owning firearm.
Upgrades crime of manslaughter to aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Permits theaters with 250 seats or more to apply for liquor license.
Deletes CAFRA permit exemption for reconstruction activities in coastal area.
Establishes procedures for determining enforceability of standard form contracts; invalidates certain indemnification clauses.
Establishes pilot program in Edison Township requiring Attorney General to perform police internal affairs functions.
Requires school districts, nonpublic schools, and institutions of higher education to report allegations of sexual assault to law enforcement.
Requires institutions of higher education to post information on sexual assaults on website and provide the information to prospective students.

"New Jersey Sexual Assault Violence in Education Act"; requires institutions of higher education to adopt anti-sexual assault theater program, report allegations of sexual assault to county prosecutor, and provide students with information on sexual assaults.
Establishes licensure for associate marriage and family therapists.
Requires Attorney General to appoint special prosecutor when criminal complaint is filed against law enforcement officer.

Provides for Attorney General to handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving death caused by law enforcement officer while in performance of officer's duties; requires officer indictment by State grand jury.
Authorizes county prosecutor to order removal of municipal police officer unable to perform essential function of office.
Permits charging late fee for rental payments due on self-service storage units and authorizes sale of property via website.
Establishes diversionary program for certain defendants charged with driving while intoxicated.
Provides immunity from liability for certain recreational activities and from injuries caused by acts of God.
Requires the Director of the Division of Taxation to establish a gross income tax payment system by credit card or debit card.
Authorizes DMV to offer a red heart-shaped identifying symbol on personalized license plates.
Allows property taxpayers an additional year to file tax appeal after revaluation.
Establishes that passenger vehicles other than police vehicles have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.

Requires health insurers to cover treatment ordered by health care provider for covered person based on generally accepted standards of health care practice, subject to appeal; creates Carrier Appeals Program.
Limits to $5,000 per election amount contributed to and by county committee of a political party.

Prohibits former elected official from receiving for five years compensation from charitable or non-profit organization when official's candidate committee donated campaign contributions to organization.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HIV vaccine.
Prohibits solid waste collectors from billing for residential collection services more than 30 days in advance of the service.
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Clarifies calculation of at-risk weight in school funding formula.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue one license plate instead of two.
Prohibits the use of county and municipal vehicles by part-time elected local government officers.
Requires certain school buses to be equipped with lap and shoulder seat belts.
Transfers New Jersey State Forestry Services and related entities to Department of Agriculture.
Establishes the "Mental Health Treatment Reform and Violence Prevention Act."
Establishes Office of Economic Research in Department of State.
Eliminates applicable court costs in certain medical event-related motor vehicle accidents.
Expands civil rights protections to include pregnancy and breast-feeding; requires employers to provide daily break to breast-feeding mothers.

Requires tenure charges be filed against any public school employee found to have bullied a student and requires the employment of any nontenured public school employee be terminated for such activity.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Increases fine for violation of certain laws concerning pedestrian safety and traffic control; dedicates funds to certain roadways.
Requires percentage of motor vehicle fines be used to support safe routes to school initiatives.
Increases penalties for motor vehicle violations resulting in serious bodily injury or death to certain persons in highway.
Makes a $3 million supplemental appropriation for increased Per Capita Library Aid.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Enacts the "NJ Family First Employer Act"; establishes award for certain employers.
Requires court to issue animal protection order against person found guilty of abusing an animal.
Exempts storage facility space furnished to active duty military personnel from sales and use tax.
Allows identity theft victims to petition for judicial determination of factual innocence.
Requires Department of Education to encourage boards of education to offer instruction in media literacy.
Requires candidates for teacher certification to complete technology training program.
Requires annual General Fund appropriation to DMVA for Council on Armed Forces and Veterans' Affairs for purposes of base realignment and closure.
Requires disclosure of breach of security of online account.
Prohibits cloud computing service providers from disclosing data collected from public, private, or charter schools.

Requires laboratory analysis of waste or material generated by hydraulic fracturing; requires DEP permit, and disclosure of plans, methods, or processes to treat, store, process, or dispose of such waste or material.
Establishes Commission on Career and Technical Education and creates initiatives that promote career and technical education programs in State.
Requires DHS to prioritize placement of parents of children receiving services from DCPP in mental health and substance abuse treatment programs.
Establishes P-20 Workforce Development Advisory Council to advise various State agencies of workforce development needs.
Mandates public school teachers complete professional development related to appropriate professional teacher-student relationships.
Requires inspection of nail salons by NJ State Board of Cosmetology and Hairstyling.

Requires Commissioner of Education to include data on chronic absenteeism and disciplinary suspensions on School Report Card and requires public schools to make certain efforts to combat chronic absenteeism.
Requires health insurers, SHBP, and SEHBP health benefits coverage for eating disorders.
Requires two-way communications equipment on school buses.
Requires health insurance coverage for hair headpieces for patients receiving chemotherapy treatment for cancer.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons who are fingerprinted and permits law enforcement officers to collect certain biological samples.
Requires waiver of dealer obligation regarding necessary repairs impacting vehicle inspection to include description of known defects.*
Requires notice of development applications be given to residential tenants on that property.
Requires video cameras at certain ATMs.
Requires adult corrections officers in State facilities to complete in-service training program.
Provides for forfeiture of vehicle where weapon was unlawfully possessed.
Establishes grant program in DCA to provide funding to youth mentoring programs.
Upgrades crime of soliciting or recruiting for criminal street gang while on school property.
Establishes State payment in lieu of taxes to municipalities for loss of revenues due to an overburden of tax-exempt cemetery property; appropriates $66 million.
