Requires disclosure of data recording devices in motor vehicles; limits access to recorded data.
Changes law governing certain certified animal control officers.
Establishes Animal Cruelty Offender Registry; prohibits purchase, adoption, and breeding of animals by animal cruelty offenders.
Requires hospital employees assist uninsured patients with creating account to apply for insurance coverage through Federally-Facilitated Marketplace.
Requires DOE to provide certain information regarding school peer groupings.
Sets forth certain standards to be followed by law enforcement agencies and fire departments when utilizing drones.
Prohibits release of home addresses of certain public safety employees by governmental entities.
Dedicates 30 percent of all UEZ sales tax revenues to respective UEZ account and 70 percent of UEZ sales tax revenues to General Fund.
Establishes "Hazardous Drug Safe Handling Act;" requires promulgation of standards and regulations concerning safe handling of hazardous drugs by certain health care personnel.*
Reduces helicopter operations at certain aviation facilities licensed by State.
Provides veterans with up to 60 credits tuition-free at county college serving county of residence.
Prohibits tourist helicopter operations in New Jersey.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under the New Jersey gross income tax.
"Zero-Based Budget Act;" requires State Treasurer to develop and integrate certain zero-based budgeting practices and procedures in preparation and submission of Governor's annual budget message.
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
"New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Suspends "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" until certain conditions are met.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in all counties.
Revises definition of "landlord" to include rooming and boarding house owners and operators with regard to ordinances holding landlords to certain standards of responsibility.
Directs State agencies to take certain actions to expedite permitting through use of general permits and permits-by-rule. *
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption, and clarifies municipal planning or zoning authority, for certain development along commercial corridors in Highlands Region.
Requires Mandated Health Benefits Advisory Commission to study financial impact of all enacted mandated health benefits.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Excludes corrugated containers sold by the manufacturer from definition of "litter-generating product"; exempts such sales from user fee imposed under "Clean Communities Program Act."
Prohibits local units of government from adopting increased minimum wage and mandatory paid sick leave for private employers.
Requires local governments to purchase excess insurance for certain renewable energy projects financed by bonds.
Permits payments in subsidized adoption until child becomes 21 years of age under certain circumstances.
Provides for designation of new charter school authorizers.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements.

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Permits a child who moves out of a school district due to a family crisis to remain enrolled in that district until the end of the school year.
Establishes a pilot program in DOE to increase the length of the school day and school year and provides tax credits for corporate contributions to fund the program.
Establishes Response to Intervention initiative in DOE to support and encourage school districts in implementation of Response to Intervention framework.
Requires DOE to train teachers and administrators and monitor districts on bias and discrimination in special education classification.
Requires each school district to annually submit interscholastic athletic opportunity report to the Commissioner of Education.
Creates corporate business tax and gross income tax credits to fund education enrichment demonstration program.

Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Early Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics programs for students in grades K through 8.
Allows school districts to enter into school construction public-private partnership agreements with private entities.
Establishes task force to study issues related to the establishment of full-day kindergarten.

Requires that if a school district satisfies 80% or more of the required NJ Quality Single Accountability Continuum standards in an area of district effectiveness under State intervention, the State must return that area to local control.
Prohibits the DOE from regulating the maximum salary amount a school district may pay its superintendent of schools.

Requires State Board of Education to adopt standards and benchmarks of performance for the improvement of teacher preparation programs and teacher certification candidates who complete the programs, and develop a program rating system.
Establishes Statewide Assessment Review Task Force.

Authorizes the EDA to issue additional $50,000,000 in bonds to provide grants for certain county vocational school district facilities projects and increases debt service district aid percentage for such projects.
Modifies various aspects of charter school program, including authorization, regulation, and monitoring; appropriates $250,000 to DOE for expenses of charter school authorizing board.
Provides additional State aid to county colleges for students enrolled in postsecondary career and technical education certificate programs.
"Port Support Zone Act of 2015."
Requires employees of private entity with access to student information under contract with DOE, school districts, or charter schools to undergo criminal background check.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for value of certain fruit and vegetable donations made by commercial farm operators.
Requires State to reimburse counties for portion of holiday pay to county employees performing State services on certain holidays.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction and veterans' property tax exemption to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; designated as "Stephen Komninos' Law."
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act"; prohibits COAH from basing prospective need portion of fair share obligation on commercial development.
"Michael Massey's Law"; requires sanitation vehicles display flashing lights in certain circumstances and imposes conditions on drivers approaching sanitation vehicles displaying flashing lights.
Requires health care representative to make health care decisions for incapacitated patient in accordance with patient's religious beliefs.
Modifies school funding law to incorporate recommendations of DOE's Education Funding Report and Educational Adequacy Report.
Establishes moratorium on hydraulic fracturing for purpose of natural gas exploration or production until certain federal laws are changed.
Removes expiration of required payment by public employees of percentage of cost of health care coverage provided by public employers.
Expands the Address Confidentiality Program to include victims of sexual assault and stalking.
Authorizes court to include in domestic violence restraining orders a provision making the order applicable to a pregnant victim's child upon birth of the child.
Prohibits awarding alimony to domestic violence offenders; permits termination of alimony based on conviction for crime or offense involving domestic violence.
"Tyler Banuls' Law"; provides protections for children with developmental disabilities receiving services from DCF.
Creates Clinical Trials Working Group.
Establishes the offense of incest.
Requires mental health evaluation for all animal cruelty offenders; designated as "Shyanne's Law."
Permits 15 liquor licenses to be issued in three municipalities located in Fort Monmouth redevelopment area.
Permits smoking in certain facilities for purpose of medical or scientific health-related research.
Establishes "Superstorm Sandy Homeowners Protection Act."
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; upgrades crimes against individuals with developmental disabilities.
Revises penalties for certain violations of law by public movers and warehousemen.
Permits demonstration county to terminate its participation in the "Real Property Assessment Demonstration Program."
Requires law enforcement be notified of application to expunge mental commitment record.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
Imposes mandatory terms of imprisonment on persons convicted of certain sex crimes against minors.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Upgrades crime of invasion of privacy under certain circumstances.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Prohibits the unauthorized photographing or videotaping of a child.
Requires certain commissions to maintain meeting minutes; establishes Governor's authority to approve or veto the minutes of those commissions.
Provides for automatic waiver of juvenile case to adult court for repeat juvenile offenders.
Provides for mandatory forfeiture of retirement benefits of elected official convicted of crime involving office held.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.

Reauthorizes use of regional contribution agreements between municipalities within a 10-mile radius of each other for special needs housing; permits units transferred to be counted toward recipient municipality's fair share obligation.
Requires bi-state transportation authorities to make advance notification of certain projects or operations expected to impede traffic.
Establishes new crime of official interference with transportation.
Establishes "Bi-State Commission to Recommend Reforms to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey."
Establishes certain requirements for use of physical restraint on students with disabilities in school districts and approved private schools for students with disabilities.
Establishes Office of River Maintenance in DEP; repeals P.L.1993, c.376 concerning stream cleaning activities.
Prohibits student's individualized education program or 504 plan to include use of physical restraints or seclusion.
Requires Passaic Valley Water Commission to obtain approval of certain municipalities before entering into certain contracts concerning open-air reservoirs.
Bars domestic violence defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.

Requires electric public utilities to provide training, equipment, indemnity, and reimbursement to certain municipal employees for moving and securing detached, above-ground distribution lines impeding vehicular traffic during lengthy power outages.
"Madison Holleran Suicide Prevention Act"; requires institutions of higher education to have individuals who focus on reducing student suicides and attempted suicides available 24 hours a day.
Creates Office of Licensing, Grant-making, Approvals and Permitting Efficiency Ombudsman and establishes task force on feasibility of online State permit and approval transactions.
Increases judicial salaries by set amount over multiple years, and thereafter provides for annual salary cost of living adjustment.
Eliminates requirement for forensic laboratory analysis of substance in cases involving distribution of, or possession with intent to distribute, imitation CDS.
Clarifies that "Prevention of Domestic Violence Act of 1991" covers elder abuse in domestic settings.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $500 income tax deduction.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Permits DEP air quality regulation of certain outdoor wood burning units only in response to complaint.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
Provides public employee salaries at all levels of government cannot exceed salary of Governor.
Extends property tax benefit to veterans who performed active service in U.S. Armed Forces during Cold War.
Restricts use of accumulated sick leave by public employees in year prior to retirement.

Blocks beach fees in shore municipalities accepting certain government provided beach replenishment funding and dedicates two percent of taxable receipts under the sales and use tax collected in the shore municipalities to the shore municipalities.
Authorizes chiefs of part-time municipal police forces to issue firearms ID cards and handgun purchase permits.
Provides that a teaching staff member dismissed by a district due to a reduction in force who subsequently retires must be removed from preferred eligible lists and has no right of reemployment.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Permits counties to share county tax administrators.
Allows county sheriffs to issue firearms identification cards and permits to purchase handguns; authorizes county sheriffs to accept applications for permits to carry handguns.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Establishes NJ Water Supply and Pharmaceutical Product Study Commission.
Authorizes business entities to designate representatives in court proceedings without the necessity for representation by an attorney.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students to participate in school-sponsored extracurricular activities in the student's resident district.
Establishes special license plates for veterans.
Grants county governing body final authority to determine expenditures for courtroom facilities.
Provides discounted hunting and trapping license, permit, and stamp fees for senior citizens.
Reduces drug free school and public property zones to 200 feet.
Requires incarcerated individual from State to be counted at residential address for legislative redistricting purposes.
Increases penalties for failing to yield when violation results in death to pedestrian.
Allows application for PERS accidental disability benefit for injury sustained while employed at State psychiatric institution or correctional facility immediately prior to PERS membership.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law;" criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide to prospective students certain cost, loan, and debt information in financial aid shopping sheet.
Requires president of public institution of higher education to regularly report on-campus criminal and fire events to the institution's governing board.
Requires reporting of the graduation rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.
Authorizes institutions of higher education to grant college credit to high school students who complete the Jersey Boys State or Jersey Girls State program.
Requires school districts to pay advanced placement examination fees for certain students and the State to reimburse school districts for the cost.
Establishes compensation program for law enforcement officers and certain other employees injured while performing official duties.*
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Secretary of Higher Education to promote establishment of higher education and business partnerships.
Clarifies juvenile's right to attorney representation; requires 12-month judicial review hearing when juvenile is placed out-of-home.
Requires certain undergraduate students to file degree plan and requires public institutions of higher education to develop pathway systems to graduation.
Requires DOH to authorize Jersey City to issue certified copies of birth certificates by September 1, 2017.*
Revises treatment requirements for convicted drug offenders receiving general assistance benefits under Work First New Jersey program.*
"New Jersey International Arbitration, Mediation, and Conciliation Act."
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping for certain retired military personnel.
Protects property owned by military personnel and first responders from condemnation.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Requires life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of the murder of a minor under the age of 18 in the course of the commission of a sex crime.
Requires BPU to issue written decision concerning utility rate increase approvals to public via its website.
Revises requirements related to public hearings on proposed public utility rate increases.
Requires public utilities to provide customers notice of request for increase in rates; revises requirements related to hearings on proposed rate increases.
Requires public utilities to mail customers detailed explanation of rate settlement agreements prior to final BPU vote.
Gives priority status for connection of solar photovoltaic systems for customer-generators who are public entities.
Establishes "The Democracy Act" to modify various voter registration and voting procedures.
Prohibits use of education and occupation as rating factors in automobile insurance underwriting.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers to redeem loan amounts received under the New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public or nonpublic schools in New Jersey.
Regulates certain rental-purchase agreements.
Regulates pharmacy benefits management companies.
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.
Establishes pilot program in the Department of Law and Public Safety requiring the electronic recording of certain police interrogations.
Provides local board of education with approval authority of charter school application.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.
Establishes a regulatory program for rifle and shotgun ammunition sales.
Strengthens State's assault weapons ban.
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.
The "New Jersey Intern Protection Act"; provides legal protections and remedies for persons engaged in internships with employers.
"New Jersey Health Insurance Marketplace Act."
Requires AG oversight of transfer of federal surplus military equipment to local law enforcement agencies; establishes review and reporting requirement.
Prohibits award of State contracts and development subsidies to inverted domestic corporations.
Increases mandatory retirement age for Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and county prosecutors from 70 to 75.

Upgrades crime of stalking when stalking activity is carried out or assisted by installation or use of communication or location monitoring program or device on cellular phone or wireless mobile device.
Establishes Pedestrian and Bicycle Safety Advisory Council.
Revises homestead property tax reimbursement eligibility requirements for certain claimants relocating homesteads within the same municipality.
Requires school districts and DOE to post on their websites information regarding student participation in certain assessments.
Requires carriers to disclose selection standards for placement of health care providers in tiered health benefits plan network; establishes oversight monitor to review compliance.
Requires health insurance carriers to comply with certain network adequacy requirements.
Permits municipality to establish restricted parking spaces for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes the "Mental Health Court Pilot Program" in several vicinages.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts and establishes uniform age requirement for enrollment in kindergarten.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to make payment to school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing upon adoption of resolution by municipal governing body.
Establishes guidelines for creditworthiness determinations concerning affordable housing programs.
Provides awarding of contracts for professional services by State, county, municipal, and school district through competitive contracting process.
Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Reinstates automatic COLA for retirement benefits of members of the State-administered retirement systems.
Deletes requirement for certain cable television companies to fund "CATV Universal Access Fund."
Authorizes State constitutional convention to reform system of property taxation; makes appropriation.
Establishes that payment plan for motor vehicle surcharges is mandatory upon request; extends payment period.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Requires certain public contracts for insurance coverage and consulting services to be awarded through competitive contracting process.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.
Provides $21 minimum annual energy assistance to qualified families; qualifies families to receive additional nutritional assistance.
Requires family day care providers and certain household members to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Provides for Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare coverage and reimbursement for health care services provided through telemedicine.
Requires law enforcement officers to wear body cameras.
Establishes restricted use driver's license endorsement for certain motor vehicle offenders with suspended license.
Requires law enforcement agencies in this State to establish minority recruitment and selection programs; establishes reporting requirement.
Designates Thomas Alva Edison as State Inventor.
Establishes three-year moratorium on increases in charter school enrollment.
Concerns random drug testing of certain inmates.
Requires health insurance coverage for contraceptives to include prescriptions for 12 months.
Establishes procedures for moving annual fire district election to November; eliminates vote on fire district budgets, except for proposals to raise revenue above permissible levy cap.*
Reestablishes and revises public contract set-aside program.
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Establishes division in Department of Treasury to oversee and enforce equal employment opportunity requirements with regard to public works contracts.
Strengthens criminal sanctions for intentionally damaging a rental premises to establish a warranty of habitability violation.
Expands role of temporary guardian to include arranging placement of alleged incapacitated person in appropriate, less restrictive environment.
Allows a gross income tax credit to certain taxpayers for capital improvements made to principal residence.
Permits creation of local hire programs for public work contracts of political subdivisions.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Expands ability of the court to order payment of attorney fees and costs by parties who file frivolous lawsuits.
Establishes minimum and maximum sentences and penalties for election officers and employees convicted of fraud.

Requires Commissioner of Transportation to publish notice of certain transportation-related infrastructure projects and activities on Internet website, and directs State Comptroller to monitor publication of those notifications.
Requires correctional facilities to submit voting rights information packets to inmates.
Protects certain politically active employees from retaliatory action by employers.
The "New Homebuyers' Bill of Rights Act."
Permits sealing of certain criminal records.
Imposes tax on certain State lottery winnings to finance grant program for not-for-profit entities operating after school programs in certain districts.
Requires racial and ethnic impact statement for certain bills and regulations affecting sentencing.
Requires local government units to certify compliance with certain federal hiring requirements when filing annual budgets.

Places five-year limit on State control of any school district; requires local control to be returned in any area of district effectiveness under State intervention for which district meets 80 percent or more of standards.
Concerns eviction of residential tenants.
Prohibits certain school districts under State intervention from leasing building if purchase price would be less than total costs of lease.
Establishes database with certain information about individuals elected to public office in this State.
Requires that information about legal rights and responsibilities of tenants and landlords in rental dwelling units be kept up to date in both English and Spanish.

Establishes Clean Energy Technology Center and Alternative and Clean Energy Investment Trust Fund for purposes of creating clean energy-related employment opportunities; allocates revenues from societal benefits charge to support its activities.
Makes residential mortgage fraud a separate crime.
"Innovative Services for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act."
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank and State Energy Bank within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.*
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption for artificial turf field construction by local government units.
Permits counties to charge a fee to fund infrastructure through voter approval.
Increases flexibility, clarity, and available tools of optional municipal consolidation process.

Requires forms for homestead property tax reimbursement, veterans' property tax exemption, veterans' property tax deduction, and senior and disabled property tax deduction to be available in certain languages.
Establishes Behavioral Health Insurance Claims Advocacy Program.
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Requires carriers to classify medically necessary procedures as covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.
Establishes program certifying certain broadcast station personnel to undertake certain actions during emergencies.
Increases transparency and accountability at PANYNJ.
Permits independent contractors to provide cosmetology and hairstyling services or ancillary services.
Authorizes seizure and impoundment of a dog believed to have attacked, severely injured, or killed another domestic animal.
Concerns occupational safety and health for public employees of certain interstate authorities.
Requires State to pay its pension contributions quarterly on July 15, October 15, January 15 and April 15.
Requires DHS to develop specific criteria for eligibility of individuals with developmental disabilities for services from adult day health services facilities.

Imposes oversight, cost analysis, and fee requirements for State contracts; includes State contract performance in conscientious employee protection act; limits to three years all State contracts; requires certain disclosures on State contracts.
Amends law concerning county and municipal stream cleaning activities.
Reforms annual State revenue estimating and reporting, and executive State budget presentation and revenue certification processes.
Requires certain notifications for termination of services to persons with developmental disabilities and providers.
Provides transparency and accountability reforms at PANYNJ; modifies governance structure; provides legislative oversight of PANYNJ.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide coverage for outpatient behavioral health care services.
Provides transparency and accountability reforms at PANYNJ; modifies governance structure; provides legislative oversight of PANYNJ; and regulates capital planning process.
Establishes teacher recruitment grant program in DOE; appropriates $6 million to DOE.
Requires appropriate community notification when sex offender is placed in halfway house; prohibits certain county inmates in halfway house.
Requires dealership to notify buyers of recalls on used motor vehicles for sale.
Prohibits installation of payment assurance device as condition of securing motor vehicle financing.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with their employment, trade or business.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with enjoyment of any accommodation, facility, public accommodation, or privilege.
Provides active duty Armed Forces and Reserves members with exemption from jury duty and protection from assault while on military duty.
Permits local health boards to require minimum temperature of 70 degrees from October through April in certain buildings occupied by seniors and disabled persons.
Authorizes placement of involved animal with animal welfare agency or similar entity pending adjudication of alleged animal cruelty violation when not adjudicated in seven days.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
Requires inspection for pest infestation prior to certain demolition.
Clarifies that compensation may be paid for expenses related to service animals required due to injuries resulting from crime against victim.
Amends "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law"; makes corrections and modifies notice provisions.
"Linnette Lebron's Law"; modifies procedures for marriage or civil union where a party is terminally ill.
Establishes Behavioral Mental Health Advisory Board in Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services in DHS.
Establishes "Integrated Roadside Vegetation Management Program."
Requires MVC to issue motor vehicle placard to certain veterans and waives meter fees.

Extends full protection of Law Against Discrimination to persons having liability for service in Armed Forces of United States; guarantees equal employment opportunity in State contracting to all veterans.
"New Jersey Open Data Initiative;" to require certain information be provided on Internet to public and State agencies.**
Applies certain public contract bid threshold amounts to local pay to play and prevailing wage laws.*
Revises certain aspects of the New Jersey Individual Development Account Program.
Authorizes creation of special Phi Beta Sigma license plates.
Establishes criminal penalties for operating or participating in pyramid promotional schemes.
Expands municipal authority to license and inspect residential rental property.
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.

"Assistance to Firefighters' Families Act"; doubles State survivor pension amounts for beneficiaries of certain deceased volunteer emergency service providers; requires municipal life insurance and burial expenses for volunteer firefighters; permits fire code inspection surcharge.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct motor vehicle operator's vision.
Requires that sexual abuse against a child be reported to law enforcement officials.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Expands school breakfast program to all schools with 5% or more of students eligible for free or reduced price meals.
Requires board of education to enter into agreement with law enforcement authorities regarding access to live video streams of public school buildings.

Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of student borrower's death or total and permanent disability and grant deferment for temporary total disibility.*
Establishes veterans' preference for affordable housing in certain housing projects.
Permits county clerk or register of deeds and mortgages to create Gold Star Parent identification card.
Creates cidery and meadery license.
Makes all persons convicted of sexual assault subject to the No Early Release Act; specifies that any use of force elevates sexual assault to aggravated sexual assault.
Adds as additional aggravating factor in sentencing that the person committed an act of domestic violence in presence of a child under 16 years of age.
Extends post-military service protection against mortgage foreclosure.
Wounded Warrior Caregivers Relief Act; Provides income tax credit to family caregivers of certain armed service members with physical disabilities.
Increases income eligibility cap to receive respite care for certain veterans.
Creates financial planning assistance program for disabled veterans and their caregivers.
"Atlantic City Urban Enterprise Zone and Property Tax Relief Act"; creates urban enterprise zone in Atlantic City for 10 years.
"Secure Schools for All Children Act"; establishes State aid program for security services, equipment, or technology to ensure safe and secure school environment for nonpublic school students.
Prohibits certain provisions in consumer contracts.
Expands timeframe for renewal of driver's license, registration, and inspection by military personnel and immediate family members under certain circumstances.
Requires public school student with concussion to be evaluated by physician or other licensed health care provider before return to school and return to physical activity at school.*
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.

Concerns combined sewer overflows; exempts improvements thereto from 2% property tax cap; requires certain permit holders address such overflows in capital improvement plans; and appropriates $5 million.
Permits certain deer control activities; prohibits deer feeding; and establishes check-off donation on hunting license applications to support venison donation program.
Authorizes creation of stormwater utilities for certain local government entities.
Requires Site Improvement Advisory Board to offer recommendations to encourage sustainable development.
Requires, after assessment, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem.
Requires, after study, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem, and requires DEP to adopt nutrient standards for NJ marine waters.
Creates Office of Clean Energy in BPU.
Prohibits development over 35 feet in height in Hudson River Palisades viewshed.
Establishes forest stewardship program for State-owned lands.
Requires environmental sustainability plan for State House Complex.
Establishes appraisal method for taxation of watershed lands.
Requires large food waste generators to separate and recycle food waste and amends definition of "Class I renewable energy."
Requires electric public utilities to enter into long-term contracts for certain forms of Class I renewable energy.
Permits construction of electric transmission and distribution lines on certain areas of preserved farmland under certain circumstances.
Requires that each school district conducting an interscholastic athletic program must employ one or more school athletic trainers.
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Increases workers' compensation for loss of hand or foot; requires Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to study effectiveness of workers' compensation program.
Reduces thresholds for certain heroin offenses.
Requires health insurers, group health plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to share certain health benefits information with Medicaid and other State programs.
Requires property record cards and tax maps prepared in conjunction with revaluations to be produced in electronic format.
Revises population formula for issuance of certain plenary retail consumption licenses.
Establishes requirements for sale of alcoholic beverages for off-premise consumption by certain plenary retail distribution licensees and retail consumption licenses.
Allows board of education to award pupil transportation contracts that exceed bid threshold through request for proposals.
"Uncompensated Pending Medicaid Beneficiary Payment Relief Act"; provides compensation relief to nursing facilities when resident's Medicaid eligibility determination is delayed more than 90 days.
Provides for jurisdiction for prosecution for certain crimes against minors committed outside New Jersey.

Limits payments under health benefits plans to in-network amounts in certain circumstances; prohibits out-of-network health providers from charging carriers more than 150 percent of Medicare rate in certain circumstances.
Requires MVC to offer driver's license knowledge test in Italian.
Exempts law enforcement camera and 9-1-1 recordings from State's open public records law.
Provides a gross income tax exclusion for attorney's fees and costs received in connection with certain unlawful discrimination or unlawful retaliation claims or actions.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain county corrections officers.
Provides that county prosecutors receive annual salaries in amount equal to annual salary of full time Superior Court Assignment Judge.
Permits newly created regional school districts or enlarging regional school districts to determine apportionment methodology for their boards of education on basis other than population.

Prohibits president or other employee of public institution of higher education from taking final action on purchase of property unless prior notice is provided to isnstitution's governing board and general counsel and board approves action.**
"Student Digital Privacy and Parental Rights Act."
Removes examination requirement for relicensure as real estate broker, broker-salesperson or salesperson after licensure as real estate referral agent.
Requires health care practitioners to discuss risk of addiction when prescribing certain drugs to patients who are minors.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public service privatization contracts.
Concerns earned sick leave.
Establishes "Truck Operator Independent Contractor Act."
Clarifies statutory exemptions from mandatory immunizations for students.
Concerns environmental permits in low-income, minority communities.
Requires health care practitioners to inform patients of addiction potential of controlled dangerous substances prior to issuing prescription.
Requires criminal history record background check for rifle and shotgun purchases.
Revises certain laws concerning domestic violence and firearms.

Requires owner or operator of certain trains to have discharge response, cleanup, and contingency plans to transport certain hazardous materials by rail; requires NJ DOT to request bridge inspection reports from US DOT.*
Requires certain health care facilities to provide information concerning palliative care and hospice care services.
Creates NJ Cybersecurity Commission; appropriates $50,000.
Requires expenses incurred by Governor during out-of-State travel for political activities not be paid with or out of public funds.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to include crime victims as protected status.
Expands rights of crime victims.
Revises law governing testifying via closed circuit television in certain criminal cases.*
Regulates the authority of the court to make provision for the educational expenses of an unemancipated child in certain instances involving child support.
Requires health insurers to limit patient cost-sharing and provide appeal process concerning certain prescription drug coverage.
Imposes tax on petroleum received by rail at marine terminals, storage or transfer terminals, and refineries, to fund local emergency preparedness and response to spills.
Establishes commission to approve personaliized handguns; requires firearm retailers to sell personalized handguns.*
"Unfair Wage Recovery Act"; provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected.
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds.
Extends certain employment protections to professional cheerleaders.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Allows person on police officer or firefighter eligible list who is unable to complete requirements for employment due to certain military service to have name placed on subsequent eligible list.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Establishes "Court Security Enhancement Fund"; increases certain court fees and assessments.
Provides prescriber or health care facility with discretion to number prescription blank forms consecutively.
Prohibits local public employer continuation of pay programs.

Requires Division of Purchase and Property to provide additional notification of contracting opportunities to vendors or potential vendors providing or interested in providing home health care services to State agencies.
Requires forms and materials for individuals with developmental disabilities to be available in languages other than English.

Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions by certain taxpayers to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program and provides a State match for contributions to NJBEST accounts for families meeting certain income guidelines.
Provides disabled persons with discount on fishing license fees.
Requires blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death; designated as "Michelle's Law."
Directs NJEDA to establish pilot program to assist with permit and approval process related to redevelopment of certain properties.
Requires assessments prior to laboratory and diagnostic testing of persons undergoing mental health screening.
Extends health benefits coverage of a newborn infant.
Increases minimum wage for tipped workers.
Imposes time constraints on submission and analysis of rape kits.
Establishes Become A Nurse license plates and dedicates fees for nursing scholarships.
Requires nursing homes to provide training to staff in behavioral health issues.
Requires Medicaid managed care organizations to meet certain conditions prior to reducing reimbursement rates for personal care assistant services and home-based supportive care services.
Increases personal needs allowance to at least $50 for low-income persons residing in certain facilities.
Requires report and public hearing prior to DEP recommendation of site for inclusion on Superfund list.
Establishes a 1,000 foot drug free zone around playgrounds and other public parks, buildings and housing facilities.
Subjects county and municipal sewerage authority service rate increases to approval by Board of Public Utilities.
Requires owner of foreclosed property to provide relocation assistance to tenant displaced by termination of illegal occupancy.
Requires certain State oversight of budgets of regional sewerage authorities.

Eliminates payments for unused sick leave earned after effective date; limits carry forward of unused vacation leave; requires suspension and forfeiture of certain payments; limits use of unused sick leave in year before retirement.

Revises criminal history record check procedures for school personnel to provide for communication of post-employment federal criminal record information received through participation in federal rap back program to Commissioner of Education.
Restricts bail for persons charged with violent crimes; establishes bail alternatives for non-violent offenders.
Requires State oversight of budgets of joint meetings.
Requires local governments and authorities to obtain financing cost estimate required to be provided by NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust for certain projects.
Providing for AG representation of employees of county prosecutors' offices in certain civil actions and providing for State indemnification in certain cases.
Requires Commissioner of DCA to promulgate rules and regulations providing for veterans' affordable housing assistance preference.
"Boys & Girls Clubs Keystone Law"; permits minors to give consent for behavioral health care.

Prohibits sewerage authorities, municipal authorities, and local units of government from charging interest on unpaid sewer fees and charges attributable to State or local entities, including housing authorities.
Establishes insurance and safety requirements for companies that use digital network or software application to match passengers with drivers.

"Volunteers in Public Service Pension Reform Act," allows municipal elected officials in PERS to retire based on other PERS service and remain in office with no salary or health care benefits for that office.
Establishes minimum certified nurse aide-to-resident ratios in nursing homes.
Requires public utility to remove utility pole no longer in use within a right of way within 14 days of replacement of utility pole.
Dedicates one percent of cigarette tax revenue to anti-smoking initiatives.*
Revises time period at which unit owners assume control of homeowners' associations.
Establishes limits and standards for certain light frame residential construction.
Provides that solar and photovoltaic energy facilities and structures on farmland are not an inherently beneficial use, per se, for purposes of zoning approvals.
Eliminates State aid growth limit for school districts in which individuals age 65 and over comprise more than 33.3 percent of the population.
Revises sales and use tax treatment of garbage removal services.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Requires Division of Rate Counsel to evaluate NJT fare increases and determine whether increases are necessary and fair to NJT customers.
Provides corporation business tax credit and allows gross income tax deduction for purchase and installation of electric vehicle charging stations.
Increases renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements under "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Requires emergency action plans for delivery of oxygen to patient residences during public health emergency.
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.
Establishes "Energy Infrastructure Study Commission."
Requires electric public utilities to provide priority power restoration to certain medical facilities, assisted living facilities, and nursing homes.
Requires DOT to incorporate objectives of "Global Warming Response Act" into annual transportation capital program.
Provides additional State school aid to school districts experiencing enrollment increases due to conversion of age-restricted housing developments to non-restricted developments.
Prohibits termination of law enforcement officer based upon determination that officer is physically unable to perform duty under certain circumstances.
Allows certain on-site generation facilities to deliver electricity without utilizing electric public utility infrastructure.
Establishes microgrid pilot program.
Permits correctional facilities to utilize body imaging scanning equipment.
Makes various changes to tenure of faculty and other professional staff at State and county colleges.
Expands scope of law governing registration of security guards; designated as "Detective Melvin Vincent Santiago's Law."
Requires maximum contaminant level to be established for 1,2,3-trichloropropane in drinking water.
Prohibits Governor from using State helicopter for out-of-State political or personal events.
Dedicates portion of sales tax derived from electricity, natural gas, and hydrogen used to fuel motor vehicles to Transportation Trust Fund.
Allows NJ STARS and NJ STARS II scholarship recipients to maintain program eligibility in the event that medical condition prevents enrollment as full-time student.
The "New Jobs for New Jersey Act."
Revises statutes concerning firearms purchaser identification cards and handgun purchase permits; makes handgun purchase permit valid for four years.
Permits public-private partnership agreements for certain building and highway infrastructure projects; provides for EDA oversight.
Establishes Main Street Economic Growth Program to encourage business development in small, highly developed municipalities.
Prohibits baiting for black bear during authorized bear hunt and requires use of bear-resistant dumpsters and food boxes at certain campgrounds and camping facilities.
Provides tax credit to developers for affordable housing projects in certain neighborhoods.
"Earn Your Way Out Act" ; requires DOC to develop inmate reentry plan; establishes administrative parole release for certain inmates;requires study and report by DOC on fiscal impact.*
Establishes best practices for procurement and payment of legal services by local governments and school districts.
Requires forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Imposes mandatory forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program; appropriates $250,000.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Clarifies that punitive damages may not be awarded against public entities or public employees acting within the scope of their employment in any action.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Provides that civil actions concerning home improvement contracts for residential or non-commercial property may be brought in the county where the property is located.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
Exempts person who remediates property in environmental opportunity zone from remediation funding source requirement.
Provides for automatic expungement of records of certain juveniles adjudicated delinquent for engaging in prostitution.
Requires Commissioner of Banking and Insurance to establish public awareness campaign about federally required health insurance exchange.
"Corporate Disinvestment Property Tax Relief Act"; appropriates $13.5 million.
Permits hospitals to establish system for making performance-based incentive payments to physicians.
Establishes New Jersey Advisory Council on Home and Community-Based Settings to implement DHS Statewide Transition Plan.
Creates voluntary survey for physicians as part of biennial registration process with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.
"The Child and Family Suicide Prevention Act;" requires training related to screening for suicide prevention for pediatricians, physician assistants, and advanced practice nurses.
Requires filing of financial and conflict disclosure statements as condition of development approval.
Authorizes penalties for failure to file certain public employment contracts; clarifies requirement for electronic posting of public employment contracts and interest arbitration awards.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Establishes limited duration homestead property tax reimbursement.
Permits ambulatory care facility to deduct up to $125,000 in Medicare reimbursements when calculating gross receipts assessment.
Permits ambulatory care facility to deduct Medicaid payments when calculating gross receipts assessment.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Requires DEP assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring maintenance and repair of certain wharves, piers, docks and bulkheads.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Authorizes counties to reduce greenhead fly populations; appropriates $50,000.
Revises current law permitting paid leave of absence for municipal police officers.
Extends veteran's property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Eliminates demand side management programs from cost recovery through societal benefits charge.
Continues tax exempt status of certain real property owned by disabled veterans during reconstruction of homes destroyed by flood, storm, or other act of God.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Requires State Comptroller to receive and provide certain independent authority employee information on State Comptroller's website.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2012"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Eliminates employment certificate requirement for minors to engage in gainful employment.
Concerns affordable housing credits and funding of community residences for disabled persons.
Requires clinical laboratory that provides services for accountable care organization to establish clinical laboratory testing advisory board.
Changes State assistance to urban enterprise zones over seven years by increasing reduced sales tax in enterprise zones and dedicating increase to zone municipalities.
Establishes technology transfer assistance program in EDA.
Permits EDA to designate institutions of higher education or other qualified entities as manufacturing and production business resource centers.
Directs NJ Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct feasibility study of Meadowlands convention center project.
Requires immediate resumed qualification as dependent covered person under certain health benefits plans after active military duty under certain circumstances.
Makes revisions to "Contractors' Registration Act."
Provides certain homestead exemption in medical malpractice judgments; prohibits insurers from raising medical malpractice liability insurance premiums under certain circumstances.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from requiring certain consumer identification for return of merchandise.
Allows public contractors paying benefits under collective bargaining agreements to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances.
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
Requires issuance of one free copy of birth certificate for child born in New Jersey to active duty service member.
Regulates certain auditing and disclosure practices of pharmacy benefits management companies.
Establishes "New Jersey Business Advisory Council" in Business Action Center.
Establishes Rail Passenger Bill of Rights and authorizes Division of Consumer Affairs to enforce provisions.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances.
Requires State Treasurer, in consultation with State Comptroller, to promulgate rules and regulations concerning best practices for awarding independent State authority contracts.
Authorizes special Combat Action Badge license plate program.

Requires county health departments to maintain reserve stock of opioid antidotes and dispense such reserve stock to first responders and hospital pharmacies, on interim basis, in order to ensure uninterrupted supply.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Increases income eligibility limit for reduction or abatement of municipal or county utility authority fees.

Permits board of chosen freeholders to change title to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner"; requires county that changes terms to update website.
Implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain environmental purposes; revises State's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs.
The "Municipal Stabilization and Recovery Act."

Eliminates requirement that at least one of two licenses issued under small-scale and staged casino facility pilot program must be staged casino facility license; permits these facilities to be located in renovated buildings.
Establishes Child Advocacy Center-Multidisciplinary Team Advisory Board and certification program for child advocacy centers and multidisciplinary teams; appropriates $10 million.
"Early Childhood Innovation Act"; establishes early childhood innovation loan pilot program and study commission within EDA.
Provides for registration and accreditation of human milk banks.
Requires State Board of Medical Examiners to conduct international criminal history background checks and check employer references for licensees.
Requires Public Health Council to promulgate rules and regulations for use of quality control programs in bio-analytical and clinical laboratories.
Prohibits possession, transport, import, export, processing, sale, or shipment of parts and products of certain animal species threatened with extinction.
Prohibits possession and transport of parts and products of certain animals at PANYNJ airports and port facilities.
Limits eligibility of certain public employees for health care benefits; prohibits those so limited from receiving payments for waiving benefits.*
Revises "Electronic Waste Management Act."
Requires members of unitary business groups to file combined reports of corporation business tax.
Extends eligibility for certain individuals for emergency assistance.
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in EDA and transfers $2 million from societal benefits charge to initially fund program.
Concerns low emission and zero emission vehicles; establishes Clean Vehicle Task Force.
Requires paint producers to implement or participate in paint stewardship program.
Establishes position of State Oceanographer.
Permits BPU to approve qualified wind energy project; requires BPU to provide application periods for those projects.
Establishes "Einstein Scholars Program."

Requires State Board of Education high school graduation requirements include instruction on tuition assistance programs and student loan debt; requires high school students to meet with guidance counselor to discuss tuition assistance and dual enrollment.
Revises and renames NJSTARS; repeals NJSTARS II; establishes NJ HonorScholars Program.
Concerns equal pay for women and employment discrimination.
Permits DHS to request waiver of time limits for certain Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program recipients under certain circumstances.*
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Enacts new "Uniform Interstate Family Support Act"; repeals previous uniform law.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10 million to DCA for Lead Hazard Control Assistance Fund.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $103,000,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide preschool expansion aid to certain school districts.
Increases the personal income tax's pension and retirement income exclusion fivefold over three years.
Establishes "New Jersey Investing in You Promise Neighborhood Commission"; appropriates $2million.*
Increases certain filing fees, penalties and enhances enforcement provisions and procedures for violations of cigarette tax and unfair cigarette sales laws by cigarette license holders.
Provides certain immunities from spectator-based lawsuits arising from youth sports events.
Establishes "Secondhand Valuables Transaction Reporting Task Force."
Exempts police from jury duty.
Requires each municipality to establish a Reverse 9-1-1 system.
Criminalizes fourth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Requires State to lower compensation rate of civilly committed sexually violent predators to same level as State inmates for institutional work.
Requires local governing body and DCA to suspend collection of certificate of occupancy and related inspection fees for homes being rented by persons identified by FEMA as displaced individuals.
Permits county board of chosen freeholders to appoint interim member of county tax board under certain circumstances.
Directs Commissioner of Education to encourage implementation of Natural High Drug Prevention Program in school districts.*
Requires fire suppression systems in all elementary and secondary schools 12,000 square feet or larger.
Concerns telemarketing political calls.
Regulates tethering of, and outdoor shelter for, dogs.
Establishes animal cruelty offenses pertaining to chaining or other restraint of animals.
Requires State park and forest restroom facilities to include an exclusive family restroom.
Prohibits smoking at State-owned beaches.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.
Establishes minimum Medicaid reimbursement rate for personal care services.
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Requires prosecutorial or law enforcement review of fatal incidents involving police officers or State Police.
Requires AG to notify certain legislators of decision not to defend validity of challenged State statute in court.
Requires law enforcement officers to search domestic violence restraining order registry upon conducting an arrest.

Exempts certain transactions of residential property involving senior, blind, and disabled citizens from general purpose fee under realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on real property selling for more than $1,000,000.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Expands statute authorizing temporary restraining orders for certain alleged stalking victims to include victims of any age or mental capacity.
Increases penalties for unlawfully manufacturing, distributing, or dispensing fentanyl.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
Permits small, women owned, or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers or planning areas to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Modifies interest rates and accrual of interest on certain unpaid water and sewer utility bills and delinquent municipal taxes, assessments, and other municipal liens and charges.
Permits counties to impose one-percent hotel tax.
Requires for-profit hospitals to report certain information to DOH.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Establishes Capture, Control, and Conserve Reward Rebate Program in DEP to encourage property owners to implement certain techniques to conserve water or control stormwater runoff.
Establishes award of attorney's fees to prevailing party in municipal services dispute.
Provides for child custody arrangements with parenting time to include provisions for electronic communications between parent and child.
Prohibits business receiving State development subsidies from making certain campaign contributions.
Requires DHS to develop timeline for use by individuals with developmental disabilities to gain benefit of State and federal programs; requires posting timeline on DHS, DCF, and DOE websites.
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.

Requires health insurers SHBP, SEHBP, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to provide coverage for ancillary medical services in connection with outpatient diagnostic screening and surgical intervention services.
Allows gross income tax deductions totaling $300,000 over five taxable years for certain primary care physicians.
Makes various changes to law addressing meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites; makes appropriation.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
Concerns availability of services and administrative requirements of federally qualified health centers.
Establishes supervised community reintergration program in DOC for certain victims of domestic abuse.
Authorizes Victims of Crime Compensation Office to make payment for relocation expenses of certain witnesses of crimes.
Requires health benefits coverage for buprenorphine and buprenorphine/naloxone under certain conditions.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain expenses paid or incurred for care and support of qualifying senior family member; designated as Caregiver's Assistance Act.
"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; expands existing film and digital media production tax credit programs.
Sets criteria for online learning provided to public school students.
Restricts State and municipal government employee health plans to gold level and directs related savings to property tax relief.
Enhances penalties upon corporate violators of housing codes.
Enhances penalties upon certain violators of housing codes.
Requires Commissioner of Health to take certain actions to ensure that residential units are available in assisted living facilities for individuals with special needs.
Permits amusement games licenses to be issued for premises having special concessionaire permit for sale of alcoholic beverages and for airport entertainment facilities.
Establishes cruel restraint of a dog as an animal cruelty offense.
Clarifies the effective date of the "New Jersey False Claims Act."
Establishes "Domestic Violence Health Care Response Act."
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Domestic Violence and Abuse.
Transfers probation employees from Judiciary to State Parole Board.
Allows filing of birth certificate to be delayed for religious reasons, for up to 15 days after birth, in order to allow for naming of child.
Concerning development subsidies and certain employment practices.
Concerns certain contracts to privatize State services.
Establishes employment goals and requirements for development subsidies.
Concerns private entities that own, operate or manage correctional facilities or jails.
Requires repayment of development subsidies in certain cases of failure to meet job creation or retention requirements.
Establishes a partial return to work TDI program.

Permits pharmacists to dispense self-administered hormonal contraceptives pursuant to a standing order, in accordance with protocals established by Board of Pharmacy and Board of Medical Examiners; clarifies certain health insurance coverage for contraceptives.*
Requires DOBI to obtain and consider certain information from Commissioner of Health concerning provider network adequacy requirements for managed care plans.
Establishes certain network adequacy and standard application requirements for health insurance carriers; requires determination of hospital diversity for tiered networks.
Designates "Garden State" as State Slogan.
Makes various changes to civil service law concerning seasonal appointments, temporary layoffs, and rescinding adoption of civil service.
Authorizes impoundment of all-terrain vehicles and dirt bikes for certain crimes and offenses.
Regulates sale and transfer of rifle and shotgun ammunition.
Extends duration of urban enterprise zones for 10 additional years; specifies permissable use of funds.*
Increases annual property tax deduction for senior citizens and disabled persons from $250 to $500.
Requires certain information to be contained in application for homestead property tax reimbursement and revises application deadline.
Increases annual income limitation to receive senior and disabled citizens' property tax deduction to $15,000.
Concerns payment of homestead property tax reimbursement as credit on property tax bill.
Enhances transparency in exercise of municipal redevelopment powers.
Provides that preserved farmland may be sold by the State or a local government unit only to established farmers and restricts size of farmer residence which may be built thereon.
Provides that organ donor designation on driver's license or identification card remains upon renewal of license or card under certain circumstances.
Requires county emergency management coordinators to establish Code Blue Program to shelter homeless during severe weather events.
Modernizes business filing statutes to include entity conversion and domestication.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Allows certain fuel dealers and distributors refunds of petroleum products gross receipts tax and credits against motor fuel tax for certain bad debts from sale of fuel.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under gross income tax, eliminates income cap on exclusion.
Revises and expands duties and responsibilities of State Auditor in performance of certain audits and reviews.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Exempts sale of recreational safety helmets from sales and use tax.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employers who employ certain individuals who have received training from certain community rehabilitation programs.
Permits State tax debt forgiveness for taxpayers experiencing undue economic hardship.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain services to certain business-use personal property.
Removes investigation and security services from imposition of sales and use tax.

Exempts transfers of property to Class C beneficiaries from transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount under estate tax to $5,000,000 over five-year period.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Allows municipalities to acquire and sell inactive plenary retail consumption licenses.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Prohibits law enforcement agencies from considering number of arrests made and citations issued when evaluating police officer's professional performance.
Removes prohibition on possession of stun guns.
Mandates basic training for certain newly-appointed entry-level firefighters and supervisory training for full-time firefighters promoted to certain positions.
Clarifies small business consultants are subject to consumer fraud act.
Permits juveniles to be admitted to drug court program under certain circumstances.
Establishes mutual aid assistance request protocols for 9-1-1 ambulance dispatchers.
Expands membership of Police Training Commission to include representative from Chiefs of County Detectives/Investigators Association of NJ.
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.
Prohibits plea bargain if sex offender who committed Megan's Law offense would not be required to register.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squads and fire companies.
Provides two-year window for persons to transfer, render inoperable or surrender assault firearm.
Clarifies that using motor vehicle to publicly display obscene material is fourth degree crime.
Prohibits improper release of photographs or videos captured by public entities.
Establishes cap on amount that hospital can charge patients for laboratory services to 150% of Medicare.
Establishes Office of Tourism Research; requires specific measures concerning tourism advertising, marketing, research, and tourism-related business training.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Provides that Commissioner of Education rather than school districts will be responsible for implementation of nonpublic textbook and nursing services programs.

Requires chairs of certain ward political party committees to have same rights and responsibilities as chairs of municipal political party committees; specifies certain cities not required to have municipal chairs.

Requires NJT to limit fare increases under its discount program for senior citizens, persons with disabilities, and college students; designated as "Fare Affordability and Ridership Empowerment (FARE) Act."
Requires Legal Services of New Jersey to submit annual report to Legislature on its staffing, caseload, and resources.
Enhances procedures for enforcement of visitation and parenting time when parents' access to child has been denied.
Creates a Land Use Court.
Provides a gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Permits municipality to hire private company to provide construction officials, subcode officials, and technical assistants.
"Healthy Small Food Retailer Act"; provides funding to small food retailers to sell fresh and nutritious food.
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; dedicates monies from foreclosure filing fees and fines.
Provides for notification of next-of-kin in event of death of senior citizen in senior housing facility.
Authorizes certain municipalities to impose a tax on the storage of empty shipping containers to fund redevelopment plan activities.
Transit Ridership Innovation and Participation Act; provides income tax credits for employer-provided public transportation benefits.
Provides for notice to schools of court-ordered domestic violence restraints restricting contact in schools; increases penalty for violation of such orders.
