Directs public utilities and pipeline operators to reimburse municipalities for certain emergency services.
Indexes the maximum gross income tax deduction for homestead property taxes to certain changes in the State average residential property tax.
Codifies standards for court to consider in determining application for removal of child of divorced or separated persons from jurisdiction.
Requires fingerprinting for certain disorderly persons offenses.
Excludes deferred compensation of certain public school and federal tax-exempt organization employees from current taxation under the gross income tax.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Borough of Seaside Heights.
Requires insurers that sell flood insurance to provide certain policyholders with certain information.
Requires county, municipal, and campus police departments to establish cultural diversity training course and plan.*
Requires municipalities to conduct lead paint inspections in single- and two-family dwellings.
Requires a public school district to provide a daily recess period for students in grades kindergarten through 5.
Increases penalties for certain alteration of an automobile's computer and establishes penalty for resulting death or injury.
Prohibits law enforcement officer from arresting student for violation of school policy under certain circumstances.
Requires criminal background check for name change and prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from changing their name.
Provides for time period during which complaints may be filed for certain motor vehicle violations.
Establishes farm brewery and winery-brewery beverage license and permits farm wineries to produce hard cider.
Requires electric utility bills to separately list the amount of State sales tax, societal benefits charge and transitional energy facility unit rate assessment surcharge.
Requires DEP to establish "private wildlife habitat certification program"; creates affirmative defense against municipal nuisance ordinances for properties certified under the program.
Directs Attorney General to develop plan to disseminate Amber and Silver Alert information through social media.
Clarifies statute requiring motorists to yield to authorized emergency vehicles sounding sirens and displaying red lights.
Requires Attorney General to establish Statewide gun buyback program.
Regulates autocycles as motorcycles.
Establishes that police vehicles have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Changes law regulating size limits of lobsters.
Clarifies that fishing license is not required to fish at a private community lake.
Concerns valuation of property condemned for dune construction or beach replenishment.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Imposes prevailing wage for public work on properties receiving tax abatements or exemptions.

Establishes certain requirements for use of restraint and seclusion on students with disabilities in school districts and approved private schools for students with disabilities; requires DOE to collect and report data regarding restraint and seclusion.
Exempts intraoperative monitoring services rendered during certain neurosurgical, neurological, and neuro-radiological surgical procedures from physician self-referral restrictions.*
Authorizes persons with certain records of mental illness to petition court for relief from federal firearms prohibition.
Establishes Statewide database of beds in shelters for the homeless.
Prohibits sale of certain items during certain time on Thanksgiving.
Establishes process for recovering cost of caring for animals involved in animal cruelty violations.
Creates State Dredging Task Force.
Revises animal cruelty offenses involving neglect and abuse, and the penalties therefor; repeals appropriate sections of law.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Requires DHS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Establishes certain requirements, including allowable fees, for provision of medical records to patients, legally authorized representatives, and authorized third parties.
Increases Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain evidence-based behavioral health services.
Requires coverage of medication therapy management in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare.
"Group Home Fire Safety Act."
Requires DCPP to implement policies and procedures to ensure caseworker safety; "Leah's Law."
Permits inclusion of volunteer firefighters and other emergency responders within municipal eligible employee group for purposes of the small employer health benefits plan statutes.
Includes boarding of guard dogs in definition of kennel; increases license fees for kennels and pet shops.
Provides that offenses committed prior to enactment of P.L.2013, c.70 for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving are not previous violations.
Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) programs.
Exempts homeless student or student in resource family home who transfers between school districts after second year of high school from local graduation requirements.
Requires DHSS to post on website information concerning hospital emergency department staffing and services for pediatric patients.
Prohibits municipal officers and employees serving on redevelopment or housing agencies from voting to condemn property.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employer-provided child care expenditures.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Shortens term of municipal court judges from three years to one year.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program," in two vicinages including Burlington County.
Authorizes innocent spouse relief under the gross income tax.
Reduces corporation business tax rate and provides an additional rate reduction for three years for taxpayers that relocate corporate headquarters to New Jersey.
Requires insurers writing homeowners insurance policies in the State to offer certain coverage for heating oil tanks.
Revises "Contractors Registration Act" to include water remediation services.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Revises the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Concerns prompt payment of construction contracts.

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Establishes a Medical Malpractice Court.
Expands domestic violence protection for adoptive parents.
Expands registration requirements under Megan's Law to include persons committing human trafficking crimes or engaging in prostitution, when crimes involve minors.
Grants discretion to Parole Board in determining whether inmate should be released on parole.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
Requires public schools to allow certain students not enrolled in the school to participate in interscholastic athletics.
Dedicates $140,000 of revenue from motor vehicle violations to DHS for brain injury services.
Prohibits emergency service fees.
Increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $5 million over period of five years.
Requires annual evaluation reports by Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development on survey responses to be obtained from certain employers that end operations in this State.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights and Property Tax Reduction Act."
Requires certain employees and candidates for public school employment or service and youth camp employees to undergo child abuse record information check.
Requires mandatory imprisonment for child luring and requires certain information about Megan's Law to be provided to sex offenders annually.
Provides penalties for sexually offensive or abusive communication through social networking websites.
Creates first degree crime of home invasion, makes crime subject to No Early Release Act, and upgrades burglary of a residence to a second degree crime under certain circumstances.

Upgrades crime of photographing, filming, or disseminating photos or films showing person's intimate parts or sexual conduct when person has not consented to the photography, filming, or disseminating.
Reduces lawful maximum capacity of certain ammunition magazines in New Jersey.
Requires ELEC to provide ethics training for governmental affairs agents.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Revises distribution of monies from Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund to municipalities.
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Regulates teen nights by requiring security provided by police officers, prohibiting persons under age 15 from attending, and disqualifying registered sex offenders from employment.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Establishes driving privilege cards for New Jersey residents who cannot prove lawful presence in United States.
Increases additional penalty assessment for drunk driving; dedicates revenue to VCCO.
Provides that possession of air or spring gun for an unlawful purpose is a crime of the third degree.
Upgrades penalty for unlawful possession of certain firearms on grounds of an educational institution.
Establishes strategic road salt reserve fund and strategic road salt reserve within DOT.
Automatically registers or updates voter registration as part of driver's license application or renewal.
Clarifies best interests of the child should be primary consideration in actions undertaken by State governmental entities and courts of law.
Requires newborn infant screening for tongue tie.
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.
Limits liability of caregivers when facilitating normalcy for children in foster care.
Provides for oversight of DHS contracts with providers serving persons with developmental disabilities.

Increases wholesale sales and use tax rate on tobacco products, imposes tax on electronic cigarettes and similar nicotine delivery products, changes tax base, and requires licenses to conduct business in tobacco products.

Creates new taxable category of alcoholic beverages called flavored malt beverages, imposes separate rate of taxation on new category pursuant to alcoholic beverages tax and allocates associated revenue.
Makes changes to funding provisions for financial assistance and grants from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Authorizes certain gestational carrier agreements.
Clarifies that insurance broker transparency requirement only applies to sale of health benefits plans.
Requires DHS to develop or purchase electronic health record system for use by certain agencies providing services to individuals with developmental disabilities.
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Provides tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain costs incurred in purchase of equipment used by private facilities to conduct motor vehicle safety inspections.
Requires AG and county prosecutor to provide notification on website concerning persons indicted or prosecuted for crimes under certain circumstances.*
Requires development and maintenance of database to advise public about open bed availability in residential substance use disorders treatment facilities.
Establishes certain requirements for 9-1-1 public safety answering points and public safety dispatch points.
Requires DEP to offer to purchase and demolish certain contaminated residential property.
Changes priorities and maximum rewards of financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Establishes gross income tax credit for cost of certain postage for sending goods to members of United States Armed Forces and National Guard who are serving their country away from home.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
"New Jersey Public Water Supply Fluoridation Act."
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in certain portfield sites.
Clarifies that conversions of housing cooperatives into condominiums are subject to notice provisions of "The Planned Real Estate Development Full Disclosure Act."
Defines "mobile home park" as "multiple dwelling" for inspection purposes.
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Revises the statutes concerning oaths and affidavits.
Extends exemption from charitable immunity for certain civil actions to persons of any age who are beneficiaries of the nonprofit corporation.
Adds cyber-harassment to the domestic violence statutes.
Concerns victim's right to rape care advocate under certain circumstances.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Extends Medical Malpractice Liability Insurance Premium Assistance Fund and collection of annual surcharges for 5 years.
Requires managed care plans, SHBP and SEHBP, to provide for reasonable accommodation in accessing providers for persons with physical disabilities.
Permits young adult who is claimed as a dependent on a relative's tax return to receive Work First New Jersey General Public Assistance benefits.
Strengthens requirements for accreditation, inspection, and general oversight of "surgical practices."
"Parkinson's Disease Public Awareness and Education Act."
Requires Office of the Ombudsman for the Institutionalized Elderly to develop informational posters describing phone-based complaint procedure, to be conspicuously displayed in certain facilities.
Establishes permanent sterile syringe access program.*
Clarifies intent of Legislature to protect certain senior tenants; aligns housing age restrictions with federal law.
Revises "Local Bond Law" provisions to exempt certain energy projects from appropriation requirement for five percent down payment.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey and one additional public member serve as members of Government Records Council.
Establishes remote medical consultation assistance grant program in DOH.
Eliminates statute of limitations for kidnapping and increases statute of limitations for other serious crimes to 10 years.
Requires newly licensed registered professional nurse to attain baccalaureate degree in nursing within 10 years of initial licensure.
Designates September 11 each year "September 11 Remembrance Day" in New Jersey.
Supplemental appropriation of $50 million from General Fund to DHS for substance abuse treatment and prevention.

Clarifies DHS authority to regulate sober living homes and halfway houses as residential substance abuse aftercare facilities; requires background checks and other protections for residents of residential substance abuse facilities.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million for grants to certain nursing schools to address shortage of nursing faculty.
Prohibits retail motor fuel dealer from charging a credit card customer in excess of four percent above the purchase price for same fuel sold to customer paying by cash.
Revises application deadline for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Requires hospitals and health care professionals to offer hepatitis C testing to certain individuals; authorizes certain laboratories to perform rapid hepatitis C testing.
Establishes minimum registered professional nurse staffing standards for hospitals and ambulatory surgery facilities and certain DHS facilities.
Concerns special needs trusts for persons with developmental disabilities.
"Consumer Access to Health Care Act"; eliminates requirement of joint protocol with physician for advanced practice nurses to prescribe medication.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DOH.

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
"Out-of-network Consumer Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act."

Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization, and expansion, or hiring and training of new employees for manufacturing purposes.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.
Establishes process for county colleges to offer baccalaureate degree nursing programs.

Authorizes Secretary of Higher Education to impose a fine against an institution of higher education that fails to appropriately respond to a student's allegation of sexual assault by another student.

Requires insurers to provide information about organ donation and allows insurers to limit reimbursement for organ transplant if recipient has not made gift pursuant to Revised Uniform Anatomical Gift Act.
Requires certain health care facilities to offer, and health care workers to receive, annual influenza vaccination.
Prohibits substitution of prescribed epilepsy drugs by pharmacists without prior notification to and written consent of physician and patient.
Establishes Medication Management, Outreach and Support Program in DHS; appropriates $8 million.
Requires registered qualifying patient's authorized use of medical marijuana to be considered equivalent to use of any other prescribed medication.
Amends and repeals sections of "Respiratory Care Practitioner Licensing Act."
"Reproductive Donation Safety Act."

Permits candidates for school board to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot; permits short nonpolitical designation of principles on petitions and ballots; provides for study of impact of changes.
Clarifies deadline to request mail-in ballot application.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of certain entities from using title of psychologist.
Concerns hospital asset transformation program.
Requires pharmacies to install and maintain secure prescription medication drop-off receptacles, and Division of Consumer Affairs to post receptacle location information online.
Requires health benefits coverage for juvenile depression screenings.
Allows pharmacists to prescribe and dispense self-administered hormonal contraceptives under certain circumstances.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson in the Division of Consumer Affairs.
Requires Medicaid coverage for diabetes self-management education, training, services, and equipment for patients diagnosed with diabetes, gestational diabetes, and pre-diabetes.
Preserves property tax exempt status of certain nonprofit acute care hospitals; requires these hospitals to enter into payment in lieu of taxation agreement in certain circumstances.
Exempts veterans' organizations from nonprofit corporation annual report filing fee.
Requires pawnbrokers to record and report certain information.
Prohibits use of snares in trapping of wildlife.
Establishes Center for the Study of Health Care Billing Data.
"Naturopathic Doctors Licensing Act."
Prohibits anti-tiering clauses in managed care health benefits plans.
Mandates health benefits coverage for opioid analgesics with abuse-deterrent properties.
Permits water and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings.
Revises statutes regarding practice of physical therapy.
Requires all personal audio players distributed in New Jersey to contain warning about volume and hearing loss.
Provides premium assistance to certain small employers who purchase health benefits plans; appropriates $10 million.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties within 20 mile radius.
Requires local governments and school boards in SHBP/SEHBP to certify savings based on three bids from non-SHBP/SEHBP plans before continuing SHBP/SEHBP in new collective negotiations agreements.
Establishes the Workforce Shortage Loan Redemption Program.

Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research institutions; allows certain technology businesses located in certain innovation zones to receive certain tax credits under Grow New Jersey Assistance Program.
Requires filing of report comparing investment returns earned by private money managers and by State employees for public employee retirement funds and State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund.
Prohibits State administered pension fund investment in corporations shifting ownership or operations outside the U.S. for tax purposes.
Establishes the "Neighborhood Scholar Revitalization Pilot Program."
Permits domestic violence victim witness to testify via closed circuit television under certain circumstances.
Upgrades crime of invasion of privacy under certain circumstances; eliminates presumption of nonimprisonment.
Clarifies that school bus for purpose of upgraded penalties in "school zone" criminal drug laws includes any bus owned and operated by board of education or by private contractor.
Establishes Extended School Day and School Year Study Commission.

Applies provisions of "New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act" to proprietary schools and limits eligibility for State student assistance programs to students enrolled in certain proprietary schools.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to the establishment of a charter school.
Requires post-secondary educational institutions to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Requires DOE to establish NJ Dyslexia website.
Permits certain breweries to sell beer at community farm markets.
Authorizes restricted breweries to annually sell up to 1,000 barrels of beer to in-State and out-of-state retailers.
Clarifies hoverboards are motorized skateboards.
Allows consumption of food on limited brewery premises.
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Requires certain health care facilities and operators of certain transient dwellings to maintain agreements for bedbug eradication services.
The "New Jersey Bleacher Safety Act."
Increases maximum penalty under "Local Government Ethics Law."
Prohibits residential development fees on reconstruction after natural disasters.
Prohibits existing child care subsidy recipient from being treated as a new applicant for subsidy after moving to a new county of residence.
Individual's status as minor may not disqualify him from bone marrow donation if medical criteria and informed consent requirements are met.
Requires health benefits plans in Medicaid, NJ FamilyCare, SHBP, and SEHBP to offer equal terms for participation of certain health care providers in their provider networks.
Requires managed care plans to deem valid referral for a covered health care service as satisfying requirements for prior notification.
Requires insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for ovarian cancer.
Codifies Lyme disease reporting requirements.
Requires narcotic and drug abuse treatment centers to offer Hepatitis C testing to clients.
Provides dedicated funding for New Jersey Commission on Cancer Research from Workforce Development Partnership Fund.
Requires retail food establishments to donate surplus unused baked goods and surplus canned and packaged goods close to retail sale date to local nonprofits and charities.
"Post-Viability Protection Act."
"Property Tax Reduction Work Act"; permits local units to recruit residents to perform services in return for property tax vouchers.
Requires replacement of door and ignition locks on county and municipal vehicles prior to sale.
Requires installation of baby-changing stations in certain public restrooms.
Clarifies that records custodians are not subject to penalties under State's open public records law if due diligence is exercised.
Requires municipalities that receive transitional aid to certify that all municipal buildings adhere to fire codes.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax.
Guarantees full and equal access to all housing to disabled persons who retain their retired service or guide dog as a pet, and who also obtain a new service or guide dog.
Establishes free smoke detector program in DCA.
Requires minimum water usage charge to be applied per dwelling unit in multi-family dwelling.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Expands eligibility for reduced-cost spaying and neutering program to any disabled State resident.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Directs DOE to develop and implement pilot program for compressed natural gas school buses, and authorizes establishment of permanent voluntary program under certain circumstances.
Requires 30-day grace period prior to accrual of interest on late water and sewer bill payments.
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization before increasing a fee or imposing a new fee, but retains DEP authority to use ordinary administrative procedure when decreasing a fee.
Prohibits municipalities from charging annual fee for storm water permits and inspections.
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Provides for coverage of comprehensive tobacco cessation benefits in Medicaid.
Supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,560,000 for anti-tobacco programs.
Requires contracts for professional services be awarded by certain bi-state authorities pursuant to competitive contracting process.
Provides that Probation Division would file child support judgement as a lien only when amount of judgement equals or exceeds amount of child support due for a one-month period.
Changes membership of Lake Hopatcong Commission and requires DEP to develop water level management plan for Lake Hopatcong to be approved by commission.
Establishes carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide air quality standards and certification requirements for ice arenas.

Provides State Investment Council must report private money managers' fee information and that council's regulations addressing political contributions will apply to federal or national committees and non-State political committees.
Concerns NJ Transit's treatment of people with guide or service dogs; establishes Access Link Customer Service Group.
Clarifies that first aid, ambulance or rescue squads, as entities, have immunity from civil damages in certain circumstances.
Requires State Board of Education regulations regarding school nurse certification to include certain minimum eligibility requirements.
Regulates use of body cameras worn by law enforcement officers.
Enacts the "Reader Privacy Act."
Requires boards of education to adopt policies to make schools asthma-friendly.
Requires replacement of all electronic voting machines used in State by district-based optical scan voting systems by June 7, 2016; makes appropriation.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members to temporarily defer mortgage loan payments and suspend property tax payments.*
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Establishes compensation limits for licensed public adjusters.
Requires coin redemption machine operators to disclose fees.
Requires health benefits coverage for orthotic and prosthetic appliances from licensed podiatrists.
Permits certain audiologists to dispense and fit hearing aids.
Prohibits lawyers and law firms who lobby public entity from simultaneous employment or contract with that public entity.
"New Jersey Long-Term Care Oversight Act."
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics, and federally qualified health centers.
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Concerns enforcement, penalties, and procedures for law regarding failure to pay wages.
Establishes the "New Jersey Schedules That Work Act."
Expands infertility coverage under certain health insurance plans.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Codifies donated leave program for State employees in career, senior executive, and unclassified service.*
Establishes "Local Governmental Process Activities Disclosure Act."
Requires Secretary of State to establish secure Internet website for online voter registration; authorizes use of digitized signatures from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's database.

Requires governmental affairs agents to disclose on notice of representation form compensation amount received from State or local government entities; requires notice to be posted on Internet site of Election Law Enforcement Commission.

Requires boards of education to include instruction, and adopt instructional materials, that accurately portray political, economic, and social contributions of persons with disabilities and lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people.
Requires medical examination and submission of student work portfolios for home-schooled children; provides that children under supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

Modifies current law regarding regulation and restrictions on business entities who are public contractors and make campaign contributions to certain office holders, candidates and political organizations.
Requires disclosure of campaign contributions received or expenditures made by individual seeking election as political party committee officer.
Requires online data brokers to establish accountability and transparency measures for collection and use of personal information.
Directs portion of Unclaimed Child Support Trust Fund be used to balance certain unpaid receivables of State agency responsible for disbursement of child support.
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Concerns procedures for public comment about matters before municipal planning and zoning boards.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Requires school districts to inform the parent or guardian of a student recommended to use certain medications of the possible side effects and potential negative consequences of those medications.
Declares the rights of a parent to be fundamental and not subject to infringement by the State absent compelling need.
"Madison Holleran Proper Reporting Act"; requires institutions of higher education to post information on student suicides and attempted suicides on website.
Provides exceptions to garnish exemption against benefits from State-administered pension systems for certain financial claims under State law.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.
Specifies that certain images generated by body scans violate State statutes prohibiting invasion of privacy, pornography, and endangerment of child welfare under certain circumstances.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Makes certain body searches third degree crime of sexual assault under certain circumstances.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue exempt certificates for motor vehicles not required to be inspected.
Removes imposition of sales and use tax on sales of massage, bodywork and somatic services.

Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes and adjusts administration of setoffs against gross income tax refunds and homestead rebates or credits.
Repeals N.J.S.3B:23-18, concerning intestate property distribution under certain circumstances.
Changes membership of, and election process for, NJSPCA board of trustees.
Revises law concerning disposition of assets of a county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals that has dissolved or has had its charter revoked, canceled, or suspended.
Requires accountability of NJSPCA and county societies for prevention of cruelty to animals to Attorney General and county prosecutors, respectively.
Establishes various good governance requirements at certain bi-state authorities.
Establishes various good governance requirements at State and local authorities.
Requires public and independent institutions of higher education to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Requires security guards at institutions of higher education which do not employ police officers to immediately report crimes committed on campus to the local police department.
Requires public schools to include instruction on the events relating to September 11, 2001 and the death of Osama bin Laden, as part of core curriculum content standards.
Allows certain public colleges and universities to use the design-build or construction manager at-risk method as the means to contract for the construction of buildings.
"New Jersey G.I. Bill"; provides higher education benefits to New Jersey veterans.
Abolishes Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission, transfers bridges to NJ DOT and Penn DOT, removes tolls.
Supplemental appropriation of $2,200,000 to Maritime Industry Fund in Office of Maritime Resources in DOT.
Establishes public-private partnership for certain transportation projects; requires 10% of public-private partnership projects to be set aside for small businesses.
Provides assistance to manufacturing businesses by having certain State agencies promote economic development and identify credentials needed for careers in modern manufacturing.
Requires establishment of regulations for solar panel installation, maintenance, and education.
Extends time period for municipalities to commit to expend collected development fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units.

Permits municipal affordable housing trust funds and payments-in-lieu fees transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund to be returned to the originating county for affordable housing purposes.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Establishes the "New Jersey Electronic Plan Review System."
Requires municipality to comply with State audit prior to receiving State aid.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Establishes public awareness campaign advising pregnant women and new parents of the benefits of breastfeeding.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for pediatric cancer research.
Directs DOE to make database of special education decisions available on website.
Eliminates school district budget per pupil administrative cost limits.
Allows gross income tax credit for certain child and dependent care expenses.
Establishes Department of Early Childhood.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $18,000,000 from General Fund to DHS to expand eligibility for child care services in certain school districts.
Requires members of governing boards of public institutions of higher education to complete a training program developed by the Commission on Higher Education.
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for State student financial aid programs.
"Higher Education Citizenship Equality Act;" defines domicile for dependent students for the purpose of eligibility for State student loans, grants, or scholarships and in-State tuition rate.
Establishes a loan redemption program for public school teachers who meet certain academic requirements and teach Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics subjects or special education.
Requires Commissioner of Education to declare educational state of emergency for certain districts with low proficiency rates in language arts and literacy and provides for corrective measures.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No.21 in City of Newark as "Roberto Clemente Memorial Highway."
Prohibits contribution action against local public entity for cleanup and removal costs or any other damages associated with discharge of hazardous substances.
The "Full Marriage Recognition for Civil Union Couples Act"; recognizes certain civil unions as marriages dating back to inception of such civil unions.
Directs DOH to develop plan to phase out use of latex gloves in health care facilities and food establishments.
Requires registration, inspection, testing, cleaning, and disinfection of cooling towers to control outbreaks of Legionnaire's Disease.
Requires registration of certain vacant and abandoned properties with municipalities and provides enforcement tools related to maintenance of these properties.
Authorizes local tax on storage of empty shipping containers.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically engineered material.

Requires that school district's request for permission to use unrecognized position title include list of abolished positions and positions in which there have been layoffs and detailed job descriptions for them.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit disadvantaged or minority men to teach in certain failing schools under alternate route program.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers in certain fields to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in certain failing schools.

Requires teacher preparation program for instructional certificate to include certain amount of instruction or clinical experience in special education and for students with disabilities endorsement to include credit hours in autism spectrum disorder.
Establishes three-year Medicaid home visitation demonstration project.
Creates housing purchase matching grant program for reserve component of U.S. Armed Forces and the New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations; appropriates $2,000,000.
Prohibits animal cruelty violators from working at, or owning or operating, an animal-related enterprise; designated as "Moose's Law."
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement, in consultation with New Jersey Racing Commission, to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks.
Requires institutions of higher education to offer cats and dogs no longer used for educational, research, or scientific purposes to animal rescue organizations for adoption.
Authorizes free fishing licenses for persons with disabilities.
Authorizes board of education to establish community service credit program for high school students.
Clarifies that defendants are to be credited for pre-sentence jail time directly attributable to specific offense for which sentence is imposed.
Establishes per se standard for driving under the influence of drugs.
Expands and clarifies definition of gang criminality.
Permits persons at racetracks, off-track wagering facilities, and casino simulcasting facilities to place instant racing wagers.
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex and Monmouth Park racetrack.
Creates cigar night smoking ban exemption at racetracks and off-track wagering facilities.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
Ensures equal rights and opportunities for pregnant students in institutions of higher education.*
Adjusts State school aid calculations to account for student attendance rates.
Establishes a grant program for school districts to establish substance abuse prevention programs for eighth grade students.
Adds members representing fire fighting and fire safety interests to the Domestic Security Preparedness Planning Group.
Provides for a presumption of joint physical custody in a child custody determination; addresses relocation.
Increases certain arson offenses to a crime of the third degree.
Clarifies that crime victim has a right to make a victim impact statement directly to the defendant at sentencing.
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Designates Killed in Action flag as an official State flag; mandates it be displayed at certain public buildings.
Requires removal of equipment and markings on certain used emergency vehicles; requires that Attorney General issue guidelines or directives.

Makes various changes to civil service; permits institution of temporary layoffs; permits government entities to opt-out of civil service; requires civil service examinations be offered on continual basis.
Enhances consideration of fire safety issues during review of development applications.
Suspends fines for certain first-time paperwork violations committed by small businesses.
Permits voter registration up to 14 days before election.
Decreases the penalty for certain parole violations.
Allocates $10 million to the City of Trenton to hire 75 additional police officers.
Allows person with implanted medical device to voluntarily make notation on driver's license.
Prohibits sale of powdered caffeine.
Authorizes criminal background checks for au pairs and nannies.
Requires State agencies to submit notice of request for proposals or other documents pertinent to privatization contracts to certain State employees.
Establishes microenterprise training program and assistance for microentrepreneurs; gives priority status to projects involving microenterprises under Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program.*
Enhances opportunities for qualified residential projects under the Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant Program.
Requires health insurance carriers offering tiered network health benefits plans to protect covered persons from excess cost sharing in certain circumstances.
Establishes "New Jersey Task Force on Tiered Health Insurance Networks."
Prohibits award of State contracts and development subsidies to inverted domestic corporations.
Directs BPU to require certain energy businesses to maintain recordings of telemarketing sales calls for three years.
Dedicates 30 percent of all UEZ sales tax revenues to respective UEZ account and 70 percent of UEZ sales tax revenues to General Fund.
Excludes certain contributions to deferred compensation plans and provides deduction for certain individual retirement savings under the gross income tax.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Appropriates $7.5 million of Powerball lottery game proceeds to extend Part-Time Tuition Aid Grant Program from county colleges to all colleges.
Authorizes executor or administrator to take control of online accounts of deceased person.
Permits counties to establish a central municipal drug court.
The "Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at child care centers and certain schools.
Requires certain electric public utilities to file emergency response plan with Board of Public Utilities.
Directs BPU to establish certain energy-conservation programs.
Expands number of child care programs exempted from State child care licensing requirements.
Establishes $250 qualified caregiver rebate program.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.
Clarifies that only products assembled in U.S. meet "Buy-American" standards of public contracts laws.
Provides family leave insurance for certain first responders.
Requires debt collectors, in certain circumstances, to cease debt collections against certain victims of identity theft.
Creates the New Jersey Advanced Manufacturing Council.
Requires State Employment and Training Commission to prepare annual report on State workforce.
Concerns withholdings and deductions from employee wages for certain payments.
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Expands acceptable military separation forms for county veteran identification card; allows issuance to National Guard veterans of other states.*
Authorizes use of retail coupons for purchase of milk by consumers.
Adds aneutronic fusion to types of Class I renewable energies as defined for purposes of "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Revises method of determining reimbursement costs when a law enforcement entity hires a recently trained officer from another law enforcement entity.
Prohibits using cadaveric fetal tissue obtained from elective abortion procedure for research purposes and using any cadaveric fetal tissue to research cosmetic treatments.
Grants law enforcement agencies authority to order road closures; increases penalty for violations.
Encourages wearing blue to honor law enforcement officers on Peace Officers Memorial Day.
Requires public hearings on proposed off-track wagering facilities to be held in municipalities contiguous to site where proposed facilities will be located.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Requires account numbers to be truncated on certain sales receipts.
Provides gross income tax credits to support development of New Jersey-based small business start-ups.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Allows certain State agencies to sell Internet advertisements on agencies' websites as pilot program.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
Requires additional fines for certain crimes against minors to fund Amber Alert system.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Excludes value of certain manufacturer rebates from sales price of motor vehicles taxable under sales and use tax.

Exempts transfer of ownership of real property between individual and business entity controlled by that individual from realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on transfer of ownership of certain real property.
Provides temporary period for making certain estate tax refund claims and directs notice be given to certain affected parties.
Caps State use portion of energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Eliminates the New Jersey Transfer Inheritance Tax and repeals parts of chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $200,000 to Rutgers University - Camden for support of Citizenship Rutgers events.
Establishes public bidding and contracting procedures for Rutgers, the State University that mirror those in place for the State colleges.
Requires each public school to observe a period of silence on September 11 of each school year.

Clarifies that encouraging another person to cause bodily injury, by filming, photographing, or otherwise recording injury-causing act for circulation, publication, or distribution, is form of crime of endangering an injured victim.
Prohibits certain employment actions against employees affected by a declared state of emergency.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 4% over the prior academic year.
Requires initial determination of unemployment benefits to be made within three weeks of filing of claim.
Removes cap on tax on transfers of hazardous substances to fund emergency preparedness and response to certain spills.
Criminalizes using drones to conduct surveillance of or fly over critical infrastructures; requires certain drones to be registered and insured.
Repeals law providing CAFRA permit exemption for certain grading or excavation of a dune.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits and approvals for development related to drilling for oil and natural gas off NJ coast.

Authorizes municipalities to establish program for public or private financing of certain renewable and energy efficiency, microgrid conservation, and storm resiliency projects through use of voluntary special assessments for certain property owners.*
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.
The "Jobs, Trade and Democracy Act."
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
Establishes "Right to Try Act" permitting terminally ill patients to access investigational drugs and treatment.
Requires certain disclosures in advertisements by health care professionals.
Revises animal cruelty offenses involving neglect, care and euthanasia of impounded animals, and the penalties therefor.

Revises animal cruelty offenses concerning abuse, abandonment, neglect, and improper euthanizing of animals; increases criminal and civil penalties therefor; establishes such penalties for new offenses; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Extends Class Two special law enforcement training for time deployed.
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Provides civil service preference to military service members who did not serve in theater of operation but received campaign or expedition medal.
The "Municipal Volunteer Property Tax Reduction Act"; permits certain municipal property owners to perform volunteer services in return for property tax vouchers.
Establishes program allowing certain applicants to perform community service in lieu of paying motor vehicle surcharges.
Concerns membership and management of homeowners associations.
Establishes penalty for unlawfully using parking placard issued to person with qualifying disability.
Requires various measures to address effects of low levels of lead exposure.

"Transparency, Responsibility, and Accountability for New Surcharges and Increases in Ticketing (T.R.A.N.S.I.T.) Act"; increases number of public hearings NJT is required to hold prior and subsequent to fare increase or change or abandonment of service.
Requires boards of education to conduct student vision screenings that include evaluation of acuity and binocular vision.
Provides that a school district may be placed under full or partial State intervention pursuant to the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) for no longer than five years.

Allows establishment of county-wide purchasing system for certain school district services in certain counties; offers employment protections for certain food or custodial services employees; and regulates subcontracting by districts and public higher education institutions.
Provides foreclosure stay of proceedings for certain residential borrowers and exempts certain lenders that offer sustainable mortgage modifications.*

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
Establishes multi-species depredation permit.
Modifies education requirement for licensure by the NJ State Board of Cosmetology and Hairstyling.

Removes statutory requirement that health officers and registered environmental health specialists employed by municipalities receive maximum salary within their range within five years from date of appointment.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs harbored on insured property.
Requires certain professional boards to report licensure exam passage rates.
Concerns training of employees about access to public facilities for individuals with service or guide dogs.
"Music Therapist Licensing Act."
Modifies powers and allocation of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.
Authorizes PANYNJ to partially fund trans-Hudson rail tunnel and to participate in project to develop trans-Hudson rail tunnel.
Allows commercial farmer to recover reasonable costs and attorney fees of defending against unreasonable complaints under "Right to Farm Act."
Authorizes Sunday bow hunting on federal military installations and William J. Hughes Technical Center.
Provides that crimes committed outside the State under certain circumstances may be prosecuted in New Jersey.
Excludes certain health care service firms from certain requirements.
Requires DHS to approve providers that serve persons with developmental disabilities in all areas of State.
Concerns time frames for establishing or enforcing property rights related to adverse possession.
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.
Establishes guardianship monitoring program in Office of the Public Guardian for Elderly Adults.
Concerns UEZ program funding to qualifying municipalities.
Requires telemarketers making sales calls to display their name and telephone number on any caller identification service.

Revises animal cruelty offenses and penalties concerning animal abandonment and failure to report injuring certain animals with a motor vehicle; increases civil penalties for certain other animal cruelty offenses.
Restricts use of eminent domain by private pipeline companies to those demonstrating pipeline is in the public interest and that agree to certain regulation by BPU.
Directs that jury service shall extend for one day or one trial if selected to serve on a trial.
Prohibits employment discrimination based on applicant employment status.
Limits enforcement of certain employment contracts of individuals eligible for unemployment compensation.
Changes restrictions on certain county or municipal stream cleaning activities.
Establishes a manufacturing reinvestment account program to incentivize capital investment and workforce training in New Jersey with income tax rate reductions, deferrals, and accelerated deductions.
Establishes temporary mortgage relief programs for certain owners of real property impacted by "Superstorm Sandy."
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.
Requires DCA to establish training and certification program and arbitration standards for new home warranty arbitrators and publish a "New Home Buyer's Bill of Rights."
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
Provides diamondback terrapins protection as nongame indigenous species.
Establishes manufacturing machine and metal trade apprenticeships tax credit program.
Permits a joint meeting by the Senate and Assembly Budget Committees to review and veto utility rate increases approved by BPU.
Requires retail establishments to allow persons with certain medical conditions access to employee restrooms.
Establishes the "Mortgage Assistance Pilot Program."
Requires creditors to maintain interior of vacant and abandoned residential property under foreclosure.
Requires creditors to maintain vacant and abandoned non-residential properties under foreclosure.

Prohibits certain light frame residential construction in densely populated census tracts; establishes construction requirements for certain light frame residential construction in other census tracts.
Shortens waiting periods for expunging convictions and related records and related record and information for crimes, disorderly persons offense, and petty disorderly offenses.
Requires housing authority to advertise when applications are being accepted for housing assistance waiting lists online.
Requires public institutions of higher education to establish policies for the implementation of fees.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for businesses which employ eligible apprentices.
Provides dedicated funding for promotion of apprenticeships and apprenticeship programs from Workforce Development Partnership Fund.
Enhances protections afforded purchasers in planned real estate developments.
Makes various changes to interest arbitration procedures; repeals sunset provision.
Establishes failure to provide certain specific protections from weather and during emergencies for domestic companion animals as animal cruelty.
Revises animal fighting laws; establishes minimum penalty for criminal animal cruelty offenses; establishes additional penalties for animal cruelty offenses.
Establishes cruelly restraining a dog as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Establishes telemarketing fraud investigation unit.
Provides annual salary supplement for teachers earning National Board certification; appropriates $500,000.
Establishes "Higher Education Manufacturing Grant Program" for public institutions of higher education to establish or expand programs in manufacturing fields.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education for dependents of certain veterans.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Makes "Skinner's and Michelle's Law" violators subject to No Early Release Act sentencing guidelines.
Prohibits sale of certain laser pointers that exceed certain power output.
Establishes compensation program for State, county, and juvenile corrections officers and parole officers injured while performing official duties.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years based on cost analysis.
Establishes "State Vehicle Reduction Task Force."
Excludes .22 caliber tubular magazines from large capacity ammunition magazine definition.
Requires State to offer surplus State police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.

Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in urban enterprise zone program; allows zone funds to pay for storm related recovery costs for five years.*
Directs DOT Commissioner to allocate Transportation Trust Fund monies for concept development and design of Route 55 extension.
Designates New Jersey Route 47 from Wildwood City to Maurice River Township as "Veterans Memorial Highway at Delsea Drive."
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the NJ World War II Veterans' Memorial Fund.
Provides corporation business tax and the gross income tax credits for insourcing business to New Jersey.
Establishes pilot project to permit voters in military service on active duty overseas, and their eligible family members, to vote in certain elections using the Internet; makes appropriation.
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.
Allows for a gross income tax deduction for any honorably discharged member of the US Armed Forces, reserve unit or national guard.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax on Class C beneficiaries and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount for New Jersey estate tax to $1,500,000.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Designates Lake Mohawk German Christmas Market as New Jersey State German Christmas Market.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Directs DOT to establish roadside accident memorial program.
"Combat to College Act"; grants priority course registration to military service members and veterans attending public institutions of higher education.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.
Provides for representation of certain regions of State on New Jersey Turnpike Authority.
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority to hold regular meetings in various counties in the State.
Creates striped bass license plates.
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Eliminates duplication and redundancy in registration of certain apartments.
Establishes criminal background check requirement for name change and prohibits name change in certain circumstances.
Establishes special license plates to bring awareness to breast cancer.
The "School Safety and Security Act"; establishes penalties for certain criminal acts committed on school property.
Increases annual income limit for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to include sales of properties in age-restricted developments by third parties in table of equalized valuations.
Establishes task force to study issues and make recommendations related to use of educational technology in public school classrooms.
Expands crime of bias intimidation to include law enforcement officers.
Removes certain bars to employment for convicted offenders.

Increases distribution to municipalities from Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund over five years to restore municipal aid reductions; requires additional aid to be subtracted from municipal property tax levy.
Clarifies insurance coverage for certain home and health care agency employees under their own private passenger automobile insurance.
Revises licensing requirements and procedures under the "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act."
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations and partnerships.
Exempts certain motor vehicle repair dealers from consumer fraud law and regulation under certain circumstances.
Revises application and issuance procedures for employment certificates for minors.
Limits upfront costs for oral anticancer medications for persons covered under certain health benefits plans.
Requires health insurance carriers to reimburse network providers of diagnostic radiologic services at the same rate.
Prohibits bad faith assertion of patent infringement.
Provides for attachment of real property relating to terrorism.

Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to have one veteran coordinator for every 200 veteran students; requires veteran coordinator to work with DMVA to ensure veterans have access to all available services.
Provides for inclusion of students who receive equivalent instruction elsewhere than at school in NJ STARS Program.
Provides tax credits to companies contributing to loan and loan redemption program for residents who attend institutions of higher education in the State and work at such a company upon graduation.
Restores the death penalty for persons who commit certain murders.
Limits retroactive salary increases for certain public employees.
Establishes criminal penalties for unlawful control over weapons of any law enforcement officer and interference with equipment or duties of law enforcement officers and emergency services personnel.
Increases penalties for injuring school crossing guard or student pedestrian in crosswalk.
Establishes "William's Law," pertaining to pool safety.
Establishes trunk fighting as animal cruelty offense and crime of the third degree.
Establishes requirements for provision of energy from Class I renewable energy sources.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
Provides for licensure of ambulatory care facilities to provide integrated primary care services including behavioral health care.
The "Municipal Stabilization and Recovery Act."
"New Jersey Traffic Management Act"; requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.

Authorizes sale of certain property interests in public roads by local governments to connect certain electric generating facilities with customers; provides for net metering, virtual net metering and connections by public utility.
Concerns taxation of casino gaming property; redirects investment alternative tax proceeds; abolishes Atlantic City Alliance.
Conforms Megan's law to requirements of federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act.
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
"Lactation Consultants Licensing Act."
Defines information required to be included in death certificates.
Makes technical corrections to individual health coverage and small employer health benefits programs and to NJ FamilyCare.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Makes various changes to current system for approval, issuance, administration, and discontinuance of various types of special license plates.
Requires policy on use of alternative dispute resolution for State agencies; expands duties of Dispute Settlement Office.
Requires health care provider participating in carrier network to give notice to covered person of provider's referral to out-of-network provider.
Requires money transmitters to provide training materials to delegates concerning financial abuse and exploitation of elder adults.
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 28 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail or 28 days past sent date if sent electronically.
Concerns arbitration for certain non-teaching school staff.
Increases exclusion amount under New Jersey estate tax; phases out estate tax over five years.
Authorizes local units of government subject to "Local Public Contracts Law" and "Public School Contracts Law" to use electronic procurement technologies.
Increases Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain evidence-based behavioral health services; designated as the Mental Health Access Act.
Permits municipality to establish civil penalty for smoking in public places.
Establishes "Adopt a Monarch Butterfly Waystation" program.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2014.
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.

Requires disclosure of contributions received and expenditures made by committees or organizations not affiliated or coordinated with any candidate, or committee organized to support or oppose public questions.
Requires cost analysis in certain cases when State department contracts out work.

Establishes new procedure to fill congressional vacancies by election; eliminates special election option; requires congressional vacancy be filled on general election day; requires Governor to make appointment from same party to temporarily fill Senate vacancy.
Establishes "gun-free" and "weapon free" zones around certain school and public properties.
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Authorizes Historic Trenton license plates.
Regulates smoking in multiple dwellings; requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to promulgate construction standards for new multiple dwellings permitting smoking.
Establishes task force to study issues and make recommendations regarding Marie H. Katzenbach School for the Deaf.
Phases out State tuition aid grants for students enrolled in proprietary institutions.
Requires property tax bills to contain eligibility information on State tax relief programs.
Amends eligibility for expungement of criminal records.
Establishes School Asthma Protocol Task Force.
Debars permanently from government contracting any person convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Revises law concerning partnerships, limited partnerships, and limited liability companies.
Permits current Administrative Law Judges to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
Provides that deed restrictions on affordable housing units are not extinguished by foreclosure proceedings.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.

Directs institutions of higher education and proprietary degree-granting institutions to provide Higher Education Student Assistance Authority with graduation and transfer rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.
Provides counties and municipalities with additional discretion when leasing public land for agricultural or horticultural use.
Gives priority to applicants for firearms purchaser identification card and permits to purchase handguns when domestic violence restraining order is in effect.
Exempts certain surviving spouses and surviving civil union partners of certain disabled veterans from components of the realty transfer fee.
Allows veteran or personal representative to withdraw honorable discharge papers from county clerk.
Creates New Jersey Cold War medal.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Expands eligibility to receive the veteran's property tax deduction and the veteran's property tax exemption.
Directs Community College Consortium for Workforce and Economic Development to work with African American Chamber of Commerce and Statewide Hispanic Chamber of Commerce of New Jersey.
Clarifies that retired campus police officers are eligible for handgun carry permit.
Clarifies that licensed dealers may provide firearms for display at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Authorizes deer hunting with firearm on Sundays on private property.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program.
Permits municipalities to provide information on property tax bills concerning amount of local tax dollars saved through shared services.
Requires State agencies, when developing and proposing rules, to utilize approaches that will accomplish objectives of statutory law while minimizing adverse economic impact on municipalities.
Establishes requirements for sale of home baked goods.
Requires municipalities comprised within regional school districts to share certain payments received in lieu of taxes with counties and regional school districts.
Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes.
Expands acceptable military separation forms for county veteran identification card; allows issuance to National Guard veterans of other states; allows issuance only for certain classifications.
Permits pharmacists to dispense certain drugs in emergency without prescription.

Requires driver's license examination to include questions on distracted driving; makes it a violation for motorists to talk or text on hand-held wireless devices while vehicle is temporarily stopped.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Requires suspension without pay and health care benefits if public officer or employee formally charged with crime involving or touching office, position, or employment.
Imposes criminal penalties for discharges of untreated sewage from containment devices installed on watercraft.

Prohibits utility from billing customer for costs incurred for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure; allows costs for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure be recovered in utility's rate base.
Directs BPU to study whether State's electric distribution system meets certain standards.
Requires electric distribution lines be located underground in areas affected by severe weather or natural disasters.
Establishes a State aid program for charter school facilities.
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Allows certain members of PFRS to serve until age 70 upon approval by municipal governing body.
Clarifies law authorizing application of reciprocal limitations against businesses from states that give in-state preference in awarding public contracts.

Transfers records management functions of Division of Archives and Records Management from Department of State to Department of Treasury; transfers State Records Committee from Department of State to Department of Treasury.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Prohibits investment of certain public funds in companies doing business in countries that sponsor terrorism.
Expands scope of New Jersey Regulatory Flexibility Act dealing with economic impact of rules on small businesses.
Requires Adjutant General of DMVA to issue State flag to resident enrolling in federal service academy.
Establishes three regional superintendents of schools and eliminates the position of executive county superintendent of schools.
Provides a sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain high-efficiency home heating equipment.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain costs of home bedbug infestation remediation.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain child and dependent care expenses.
Provides for establishment of child support lien against life insurance proceeds; requires insurers perform child support judgment search.
Makes desecration of a military monument a crime of the third degree.
Updates process by which a fiduciary may be discharged.
Requires MVC to accept death certificate as proof of name change.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to victims injured in September 11th and 1993 World Trade Center attacks.
Prohibits bio-analytical laboratories from charging certain patients more than 115% of the applicable Medicare rate.
Requires DCA to provide accounting of monies remitted to the "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund" by municipality and allows for municipal affordable housing credit for funds remitted.
Requires HIV testing for pregnant women and marriage license applicants.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting licensed bounty hunters.
Authorizes county colleges to offer retirement incentive to employees age 65 or older with 25 years of service credit in ABP.
Exempts electric vehicle charging systems from real property taxation.
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.
"New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Eliminates requirement that State reimburse municipalities for construction permit surcharge fee revenues foregone due to exemption for disabled veterans.
Designates striped bass (Morone saxatilis) as New Jersey saltwater fish.
Expands military leave benefits for certain public officers and employees subject to proof of service.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of theft of firearm.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.

Requires Secretary of Higher Education, in consultation with various entities, to design a manufacturing career pathway to provide students with skills necessary to gain employment in manufacturing sector.
Requires any POW-MIA flag purchased with State funds be manufactured in United States.
Establishes task force to study issues facing returning members of the United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard and make recommendations on how State should address issues.
"Compounding Pharmacy Quality Assurance Act"; requires accreditation of compounding pharmacies.
Makes Fiscal Year 2016 General Fund appropriation of $500,000 for restoration and maintenance of A.J. Meerwald.
Establishes temporary mortgage relief programs for certain owners of real property damaged by "Superstorm Sandy."

Permits certain public institutions of higher education to make purchases and contract for services as participating contracting units in cooperative pricing systems and through use of nationally-recognized and accepted cooperative purchasing agreements.
Creates crime of fiscal victimization against senior citizens or disabled persons.
Increases length of time in which to file certain lien claim forms under "Construction Lien Law."
Establishes task force to study and make recommendations concerning mobility and support services needs of NJ adults with autism spectrum disorder.
Concerns calculation of net premiums on certain life insurance policies for purposes of certain DOBI assessments.
Permits nonprofit and for-profit entities operating theaters with 250 or more seats to apply for liquor license.
Requires MVC to immediately suspend driver's license of alleged drunk drivers who cause a death.
Increases amount of benefits under Work First New Jersey program.*
