Requires DOH regulations regarding elevated blood lead levels in children, and appropriate responses thereto, to be consistent with latest Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommendations.
Increases age for helmet requirement for bicycling, roller skating, and skateboarding to 17 and younger; extends helmet requirement to ice skaters and operators of non-motorized scooters.
Concerns expedited process for foreclosing vacant and abandoned residential properties in uncontested actions.

Modifies laws regarding compensation and leaves of absence for certain public employees who served in the military; requires public employers follow certain policies and procedures for leaves of absence.
Permits change in case manager for persons with developmental disabilities under certain circumstances.
Allows use of rear view backup camera and parking sensors during road test.

Authorizes EDA to approve additional Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program tax credits; reconciles simultaneous legislative enactments to clarify law which limits tax credits under that program.
Establishes notification standards regarding automatic renewal of service contracts.
Requires certain CATV companies to make CATV service available throughout residential areas of municipality within specified number of years after CATV company first provides service to municipality.
Requires each public institution of higher education to post its budget on the institution's website.
Prohibits charging fee to stop publishing personal identifying information obtained through the criminal justice system.
Establishes hours during which alcoholic beverages may be sold on international airport property.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault if committed against county or municipal official in certain circumstances.
Authorizes, by court order, furnishing of tax records or files, or information contained therein, for criminal investigations or prosecutions of non-tax crimes.
Increases criminal penalties related to certain illegal activities involving controlled dangerous substances.
Establishes right to immediate interlocutory appeal from determinations as to class certification in class action lawsuits.
Clarifies procedures for restoration of driver's license after suspension; authorizes the court to waive imprisonment under certain circumstances.
Revises statutes concerning incorporation and governance of the Protestant Episcopal Church to remove gender-specific references.
Permits juror donation of statutory juror compensation to Legal Services of New Jersey through AOC; provides for payment of State matching funds, equal to juror donation amount, to same organization.
Clarifies procedures for resignation, removal, and succession of fiduciaries.

Extends immunity from liability to nonprofit associations engaged in organizing, teaching, refereeing, or coaching sports activity under State law requiring protective eyewear for children who participate in certain sports.
Requires MVC to enter into agreement with car dealers to have car dealers notify certain motorists of availability of specialty license plates.
Provides tax credits to developers for certain affordable housing projects.*
"New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Repeals family cap in Work First New Jersey program.
Requires State to pledge to ensure availability of job training or similar activities to certain Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program recipients to prevent loss of benefits.

Provides for retained eligibility for members of NJ National Guard or reserve component of US Armed Forces called to active federal military service who met maximum age requirement at closing date of civil service examination.
Prohibits holding full-time municipal employment and certain other part-time public employment simultaneously.
Prohibits member of Legislature from holding public office, employment, or position with public enity or body while serving as legislator.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Makes various changes in the charter school program in regard to student enrollment procedures, charter revocation, and monitoring of charter schools.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.
Provides for increase and annual adjustment in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Requires candidates for school board member and local elective office to file financial disclosure statement on or before 10th day following deadline for filing nominating petitions for that office.
Provides for philosophical exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Requires DHS to use funds awarded from performance bonuses to increase staffing for processing certain applications and providing certain services.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Requires superintendent to assume responsibilities of principal in certain school districts.
Establishes gross income tax credit for full-time tuition cost at certain New Jersey institutions of post-secondary education.
Concerns automobile insurance practices.
"Higher Education Epinephrine Emergency Treatment Act."
Provides that no more than 120 credits will be required for baccalaureate degree awarded by a public institution and no more than 60 credits for an associate degree.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."

Provides for disclosure of person's medical records related to AIDS or HIV infection for investigations or prosecutions of crime of diseased person committing act of sexual penetration; makes crime ineligible for expungment.
Clarifies application of business personal property tax on local exchange telephone companies that were subject to tax as of April 1, 1997.
Requires DOT and DEP to conduct study on options to alleviate congestion on Route 47.
Creates crime of home invasion; makes crime subject to No Early Release Act.

Maintains property tax exemptions for certain nonprofit hospitals and their nursing homes; requires these hospitals to pay community service contributions to host municipalities; establishes Nonprofit Hospital Community Service Contributions Study Commission.
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet and permits custodian to advise requester of the record to obtain record directly from Internet.
Imposes certain requirements on telephone service contracts for inmates in certain correctional facilities.*

Permits registered surgical practices to convert to or combine with ambulatory surgical facilities; provides for phased-in gross receipts assessment; authorizes non-profit hospitals to acquire joint ownership interest in practices.*
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Eliminates the alternative minimum assessment under the corporation business tax.
Exempts disabled veterans from certain fees at State parks and forests.
Permits municipalities to designate newly-appointed tax assessors as professional service contractors.
Modifies "inherently beneficial use" definition for purposes of zoning variance to discourage siting of wind and solar energy facilities on agricultural land and open space.
Establishes State Transportation Cost Analysis Task Force.
Excludes paraffin used in manufacture of candles from petroleum products gross receipts tax.

Provides additional State school aid to, and increases tax levy growth limitation for, certain school districts experiencing significant increase in tuition costs; appropriates $1,719,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE.
Extends certain PERS benefits to veterans of "Operation Uphold Democracy".
Prohibits use of body imaging scanners to screen passengers and airline crew members.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Requires explosive gas detectors to be installed in certain residential properties.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Upgrades penalties for drag racing.
Extends to 90 days statute of limitations for unlawful use of cell phone while driving; increases penalties for texting while driving.
Establishes "Distracted Driver Enforcement and Education Fund."
Requires BPU to render decision on case within 12 months of final public hearing or hold another public hearing prior to deciding case.
Directs the Division of Taxation to produce instructional materials on the appropriate gross income tax treatment of certain deferred compensation plans.
Establishes Medicaid program to provide housing-related services to individuals experiencing chronic homelessness.
Regulates installation, maintenance, and repair of low-voltage alarm systems.
Establishes an apprenticeship requirement to qualify for an electrical contractor's license.
Concerns real estate licensees.
Provides mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain domestic violence crimes.
Establishes pilot program in Paterson authorizing non-disclosure of records of certain expungements.
Provides for life imprisonment without parole for killing an emergency responder.
Requires certain elected officials and appointed officers eligible for dual health benefits coverage to choose coverage by one public entity.
Requires persons and entities to report to DHS regarding their distribution or administration of opioid antidotes, and requires DHS to provide aggregate data to Govenor, Legislature, and public.
Establishes Task Force on Safety in School Transportation.
Establishes School Transportation Safety Commission in Department of Law and Public Safety.
Requires Silver Alert System receive same broadcast alerts as Amber Alert System.
"Personal Information and Privacy Protection Act"; restricts collection and use of personal information by retail establishments for certain purposes.
Upgrades certain types of assault against sports officials to aggravated assault.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education to New Jersey residents who are members of reserve component of Armed Forces of United States.
Allows person with allergy to drugs or medications to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
Establishes new crime of domestic violence committed in the presence of a child.
Requires public institutions of higher education to waive or reimburse application fees and transcript fees for veterans and members of the military.
Makes consent to register with Selective Service part of driver's license application process for males under age 26.
Invalidates consumer contracts which require a waiver of right to file a consumer complaint.
Provides credits under corporation business tax and gross income tax for qualified wages of certain disabled veterans.
Provides for licensing of pool and spa service contractors, and pool and spa builders and installers.
Prohibits investment of pension and annuity funds by State in companies that boycott Israel or Israeli businesses.
Concerns credit card interchange fees and consumer protection.
Establishes certain consumer protections related to arbitration organizations.
Requires public utilities to provide priority service to public schools, private schools, and public safety agencies.
Provides for regulation of daily fantasy sports games in New Jersey by DLPS.
Increases maximum gross income tax deduction for homestead property taxes paid to $25,000.
Requires health insurance coverage for amino acid-based elemental formula.
Requires Division of Parole to offer parole services to certain defendants who have served their maximum sentence.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million.
Allows gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions to certain New Jersey-based charitable organizations.
Enters NJ in Interstate Wildlife Violator Compact.
Places freeze on future enrollment in tiered network health benefits plans until new legislation and regulations governing those plans are in effect.

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.

Provides for designation of acute stroke ready hospitals; establishes Stroke Care Advisory Panel and Statewide stroke database; requires development of emergency services stroke care protocols; and mandates insurance coverage for telemedicine for stroke care.
Requires municipalities to conduct lead paint inspections in single- and two-family dwellings; requires reporting of inspection results to State.
Repeals law regulating charges assessed by a miller for grinding grain.
Prohibits sale of certain products using advertisements alluding to controlled dangerous substances or analogs.
Limits rescheduling, cancelation, and no-show fees providers of health care services may charge in certain instances.
Revises "New Jersey Money Transmitters Act"; provides consumer protections; increases reporting and record keeping requirements.
Provides exemption from 3-day cancellation provision of home improvement contract in case of bona fide emergency.
Permits charter school to limit admission to single gender, students at-risk of academic failure, students with disabilities, or English language learners.
Expands list of retired law enforcement officers eligible to carry handgun.
Establishes publicly accessible domestic violence Internet registry.
Authorizes the court to issue restraining orders to defendants charged with a crime as a condition of release on bail.
Requires victims of the criminally insane to be notified upon release, escape, or transfer of offender from mental health facility.
Upgrades crime of stalking when victim is less than 18 years old.
Requires disclosure of certain adverse actions based on consumer credit reports.
Requires hotels to upgrade phone systems to allow guests to dial 9-1-1 without first dialing any other digit.
Requires aftercare treatment program as part of community supervision.
Bars the disclosure of personal identifying information of grand jury witnesses except for name; creates a fourth degree offense for attorney disclosure.
Prohibits retail sales establishment from storing certain magnetic-stripe data; requires reimbursement for costs incurred by financial institution due to breach of security.
Requires health insurance carriers, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide coverage for telemedicine.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under legal drinking age.
Prohibits sale of tobacco products in vending machines with certain exceptions.
Enhances penalties for illegally operating a snowmobile or all-terrain vehicle.
Establishes that vacant permit parking spaces ordinarily reserved for NJT train passengers are available for general public use during off-peak times.
Permits a student to participate in certain voluntary surveys if the district sends prior written notification to the student's parents; limits use of information obtained from survey.
Authorizes public access to government records through government website.
Prohibits sale of flavored cigars.
Regulates deed procurement services.
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to revoke proprietary school's license to award academic degrees if school fails to achieve certain minimum graduation rates.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter, Public School Teacher, Corrections Officer, and Sanitation Worker Home-buyer Assistance Act."; appropriates $5 million.
Requires certain health benefits coverage for diagnosing and treating autism and other developmental disabilities.
Authorizes current and retired administrative law judges to solemnize marriages and civil unions.*
Updates administrative requirements and processes for unclaimed property held by State.
Requires NJ Clean Energy Program's Residential New Construction incentives be made available Statewide.
Requires State to use certain energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA.
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all elections under certain conditions.
Establishes pilot program in Camden County directing MVC to automatically transmit applicant information to Secretary of State for automatic voter registration.
Provides primary and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Establishes annual sales tax holiday for certain sales of personal computers and certain sales of school supplies and equipment during first full weekend of August.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Permits municipalities impacted by Hurricane Sandy to borrow for current expenses through December 31, 2017, and repay special emergency notes over a 10-year period.
Authorizes "100 percent Disabled Veteran" license plates for qualified veterans; entitles holders to handicapped parking privileges.
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for hearing aids.
Increases Hearing Aids Assistance for the Aged and Disabled Program annual allowance to $500.
Requires issuance of handgun carry permits to certain public officials with firearms training.
Revises definition of "antique firearm" to include handguns.
Provides for a mandatory term of imprisonment for assault involving domestic violence.
Expands types of abusive acts that constitute domestic violence under "Prevention of Domestic Violence Act of 1991."
Establishes "Milkweed for Monarchs" program.
Allows termination of motor vehicle lease in event of death; prohibits imposition of fee for early termination.
Establishes "Veterans Affordable Housing Section 8 Voucher Pilot Program."
Permits volunteer fire company or volunteer first aid or rescue squad licensed to conduct bingo games to use public building for operation of bingo games under certain circumstances.
Permits candidates for school board to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot; permits short nonpolitical designation of principles on petitions and ballots.

Requires cost-benefit analyses and local government financial impact findings for approval of long term property tax exemption; requires DCA to post Statewide database of these exemptions on its Internet website.*
Facilitates coordination of land use planning between civilian and military interests to preserve viability of federal military installations within State.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Praying Mantis."
Adjusts fee schedule for county and municipal golf courses for certain veterans and service members.
Creates pilot program to fund adult education programs for residents of certain communities.
Requires gubernatorial candidates' statements be posted online.

Requires mail-in ballot applications be available at polling places on election day for voting in future elections; requires poll workers to discuss application instructions with applicant upon request.
Establishes automatic voter registration process using MVC applicant information to be transmitted to Secretary of State; permits applicant to decline voter registration.
Establishes Military and Defense Economic Ombudsman in Department of State.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Requires certain places of public assembly to have automated external defibrillator on-site.
Allows fire district elections to be moved to November; eliminates certain fire district budget referenda; and eliminates certain fire district capital purchase referenda.
Establishes New Jersey Military Skills Council.
Requires DOLWD to permit veterans and other groups to apply for UI benefits online.
Prohibits sex offenders from holding any job, position, or type of employment that primarily consists of contact with children.
Establishes program to provide assistance to qualified veterans in in-patient and out-patient treatment programs to travel to medical counseling in State.
Provides that children under care, custody or supervision of DCPP may not be home-schooled.
Provides preference to certain employers applying for workforce development grants.
Authorizes Parole Board and sheriff's offices to hire alternate route trained police officers; exempts alternate route trainees from certain civil service requirements.
Concerns disputed medical fees in workers' compensation claims.

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault when person causes bodily injury by strangling victim during act of domestic violence.
Revises procedures for processing incomplete Medicaid applications; exempts asset transfers of up to $500 per month during look back period for determining eligibility for long-term care services.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employers engaged in farming operations.
Requires certain additional school district personnel to complete training program on suicide prevention.
Schedules the termination of the realty transfer fees.
"New Jersey Housing Assistance for Veterans Act," establishes pilot program to assist certain veterans with housing modification and rehabilitation; appropriates $5 million.
Requires municipal court to hear certain violations of animal cruelty statutes within 14 days of the summons date.
Establishes right of sexual assault victim to notification of certain developments in criminal case.
Exempts nursing mothers from jury duty.
Extends alternate route police training certification for military personnel for time deployed.
Requires public and nonpublic schools to test drinking water for lead and install lead filters or treatment devices on drinking fountains and food preparation sinks; appropriates funds therefor.
Requires OAL to maintain Internet database summarizing all State rule-making actions.

Clarifies that product approval from U.S. Food and Drug Administration is not required for drug manufacturer to file registration statement, and specifies timeframe by which DOH must review registration statements.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses providing employment to certain National Guard or reservists.
"Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act"; bans abortion 20 weeks or more after fertilization.
Requires school districts to observe Veterans Day as school holiday.
Establishes notification, signage, and monitoring requirements related to combined sewer overflows.
Concerns installation and maintenance of solar panels in common interest communities.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.
Reconciles simultaneous legislative enactments to clarify law that limits tax credits under the Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant Program.
Authorizes certain local government entities to adopt policies for payment of certain claims through use of standard electronic funds transfer technologies.*
Eliminates three year renewal requirement for disability parking identification cards and placards.
Restricts initial prescriptions for opioid drugs to seven day supply.
Requires issuance of conditional certifications for homemaker-home health aides within seven days and issuance of final certification within 120 days.
Conditions appropriation for State professional boards on expenditure of budget allocation to Board of Nursing to process and eliminate home health aide application backlog.
Updates references to DOC and DHS and refers to persons receiving services from DHS.
Exempts cable television subscriber from notifying cable television company, Office of Cable Television, or other complaint officer of cable television service outage to receive credit or rebate.
"Comprehensive Regulated Grease Recycling Act."
Authorizes additional $90 million worth of Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program tax credits.*
Directs Governor to withdraw from compact establishing Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor; dissolves compact and commission; transfers commission's NJ operations to State Police.
Prohibits State-sponsored travel to certain states without protections against discrimination based on sex, gender identity or expression, and affectional or sexual orientation.*
Prohibits certain possession, sale, trade, distribution, or offering for sale of shark fins.*
Designated the Equitable Disclosure Act of 2016, modifies provisions of MLUL concerning objectors to applications for development.
Regulates use of motor vehicle payment assurance devices.

Revises court filing fees, assessments, penalties, fines, and certain licensing fees to fund Pretrial Services Program, e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; repeals certain statutory provisions concerning court fees.
Establishes an Autism Charter School Pilot Program.

Establishes three-year nonpublic school pupil transportation pilot program in Lakewood School District to provide funding to consortium of nonpublic schools that will assume responsibility for district's mandated nonpublic school busing.
Authorizes issuance of duplicate firearms purchaser identification cards for change of address with certain proof.
Increases New Jersey Earned Income Tax Credit to 40 percent of federal benefit amount beginning in Tax Year 2016.
Restores parity among public utilities with regard to formula used to calculate amount of refund given to developers for extension of public utility infrastructure.
Allows siblings who share and equally co-own a primary residence to claim a joint homestead property tax reimbursement.
Revises restrictions for Internet access by sex offenders.
Increases monetary thresold for reporting motor vehicle accidents from $500 to $1,500.
Permits municipalities to opt out of real property assessment demonstration program.
Permits issuance of nine alcoholic beverage licenses in three host municipalities located in Fort Monmouth redevelopment area.
Adds two nurse educators to the New Jersey Board of Nursing.
Requires DOH to ensure that fetal death certification and reporting requirements are consistent with current federal standards.
Permits pharmacists to provide self-administered hormonal contraceptives to patients over the counter.
Increases accidental death benefit to 70% of final compensation for surviving children of SPRS or PFRS member; redefines child in SPRS.*
Appropriates up to $20 million from societal benefits charge to DEP for remediation of lead contamination in drinking water in public buildings.
Indexes for inflation taxable income brackets under New Jersey gross income tax.
Authorizes municipalities to accept donations to fund police equipment and salary enhancements.
Prohibits any entity receiving public funds from banning display of United States flag under certain circumstances.
Provides corporation business and gross income tax credits for three tax years for employers that allow telecommuting.
Exempts certain persons from provisions of "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act."
Provides that unlawful use, manufacture, or distribution of controlled dangerous substance by parent or caregiver in presence of child constitutes crime of endangering welfare of that child.
Permits certain off-duty law enforcement officers to carry firearms on State property.
Requires DNA sample be taken from certain arrestees.
Clarifies that handgun ammunition may be sold to retired law enforcement officers with certain identification.
Upgrades certain penalties for resisting arrest; prohibits merger of resisting arrest with other criminal convictions.
Directs Commissioner of Education to study safety of school bus passengers in emergencies.
Establishes second degree crime for threatening to kill law enforcement officers.
Authorizes courts to assess costs of prosecution against certain drug defendants.
Requires pesticide applicator to notify beekeeper when applying pesticide within three miles of registered honey or native beehive or beeyard.
Directs DEP to classify neonicotinoid pesticides as restricted use pesticides.
Requires training for pesticide applicators and operators concerning pollinating bees.
Transfers authority to regulate bail agents from DOBI to DLPS; requires certain defendants to be eligible for monetary bail upon issuance of complaint-warrant.
Permits animal facilities to use artificial turf in outdoor enclosures.

Limits expulsions and suspensions for students in preschool through grade 2 with certain exceptions; requires early detection and prevention programs for behavioral issues in preschool through grade 2.
Requires public and nonpublic schools to test for and remediate lead in drinking water, and disclose test results.
Upgrades assault on victims who are elderly or disabled.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10.5 million to DCA for State Rental Assistance Program.
Allows municipality with life guard pension fund to close enrollment to new employees or to terminate fund altogether.
Permits authorities and local units operating water supply or sewerage facilities to waive, reduce, or defer sewerage and water service fees for deployed military personnel.
Extends for two years expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008."
Provides preferences for certain businesses applying for workforce development grants.
Requires DOE to include military-connected student identifier in student-level database; requires district inform teacher when military-connected student enrolls in class taught by teacher.
Increases minimum annual amounts for appropriation for certain arts, historical heritage, and tourism purposes from hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues.
Eliminates DOLWD licensing for operators of refrigerating plants using anhydrous ammonia.
Requires baby monitors with Internet connection to include security features and warning.
Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to make certain consumer reviews and complaints publicly available.
Creates public awareness campaign concerning risks associated with unsecured, Internet-connected baby monitors.
Prohibits electric power supplier or gas supplier from providing service to customer unless it is disclosed to customer in large print that its rates are not regulated by BPU.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for purchases of certain replacement goods and services made by certain persons affected by natural disasters.
Exempts hydrogen fuel cell-powered vehicles from certain labeling requirements.
Places two-year moratorium on moving date of Type II school district's annual school election from day of general election in November back to third Tuesday in April; creates study commission.*
Imposes certain qualification requirements for members of State Ethics Commission; provides process for appointment of members.*
Requires bidder on State contract to be evaluated on report of its gender-based pay equity and job equality standards for its employees.
Requires DHS to give priority to temporary rental assistance over use of hotels or motels in emergency assistance to Work First New Jersey recipients.
Requires special paratransit vehicles to display flashing warning lights while discharging or receiving passengers.
Creates motor vehicle offenses related to special paratransit vehicles.
Creates exemption from certain MVC fees for prisoners of war.
Requires State agencies to review operations and to implement use of Internet to conduct public business when cost savings may be realized, with certain exceptions.

Provides that PERS or PFRS member who continues to be volunteer firefighter or emergency services worker after retirement with employer from whom member retires has bona fide severance for compliance with State and federal law.*
Authorizes students in State schools to operate State vehicles for driver education and provides protection for such activity under tort claims act.
Expands net metering aggregation to all customers and provides credit for excess electric generation at full retail electricity rate to net metering aggregation customers.
Establishes "Tiny Home Pilot Program" in three regions of State.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from holding position or participating in youth ministry.
Provides same military service credit for compensation purposes to noncertificated employees of school districts that is provided to certificated employees under current law.
"The Smarter Lunchroom Act;" promotes healthy food choices in school cafeterias.
Allows "100 percent Disabled Veterans" to receive parking privileges reserved for persons with disability.
Requires DMVA to create registry for organizations providing services to veterans.
"New Voter Empowerment Act"; permits 17 year olds to vote in primary election if they turn 18 years old before next succeeding general election.
"Holocaust Reparations Tax Exemption Act"; exempts value of certain payments to Holocaust survivors and their eligible descendants from transfer inheritance and estate taxes.
Requires counties to design and construct inclusive playgrounds to receive State funding for recreational and conservation purposes.
Provides incentives for certain businesses associated with military installations.
Permits agriculture-related events on preserved farmland.
Designates Dept. of Agriculture as sole agency to administer "Seniors Farmers' Market Nutrition Program."
Establishes minimum criminal penalties for animal cruelty offenses.
Allows qualified school to be called "New Jersey Farm Fresh School."
Establishes Dept. of Agriculture cooking contest.
Permits school participating in NJ "Farm to School" program to submit recipe for posting on Dept. of Agriculture website.
Authorizes free State park and forest admission and free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for persons with certain types of military service.
Creates viticulture trail tourist directional signs.
Permits qualified person with post-traumatic stress disorder to obtain handicapped parking placard.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for volunteer emergency workers and person with certain types of military service.
Establishes maximum fees for providing copies of patient medical records.
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults as crimes with bail restrictions.
Requires State to pay its pension contributions on quarterly basis by August 1, November 1, February 1 and May 1 of each year.
Entitles nursing home residents to monitor and record in-room treatment, care, and living conditions using electronic monitoring devices, upon notice to nursing home.
Authorizes expedited partner therapy, under which sexual partners or patients diagnosed with sexually transmitted disease are treated without prior clinical examination.
Prohibits sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices at pharmacies.
Concerns electronic medical bills for workers' compensation claims.*
Concerns electronic submission of certain automobile insurance claims.
Requires board of education to provide an individual textbook for each student enrolled in a class.
Authorizes medical marijuana for treatment of dysmenorrhea.
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.
Removes black bear from list of game species.
Requires persons convicted of sex offense in foreign countries to comply with Megan's Law.
Exempts honorably discharged United States military veterans from initial insurance producer licensing fee.

Requires local units and agencies to extend family health coverage for six months to surviving spouse and dependents of public safety officers who had family medical coverage but did not die in the line of duty.

Requires school districts to incorporate age-appropriate sexual abuse and assault awareness and prevention education in grades preschool through 12 as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Allows parent or guardian to exclude student from administration of State assessment.
Prohibits designation of certain assessments as high school graduation requirement during transitional period to new Statewide assessment system.
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits.
Concerns workers' cooperative societies.
Raises income eligibility threshold for pension and retirement income exclusion from gross income to $125,000.
Provides that teacher committing act of sexual penetration with student who is 18 or older is guilty of sexual assault under certain circumstances.
Establishes certain benefits for Class Two special law enforcement officers; allows arson investigators to carry a firearm at all times.
Requires NJTA to study impact of constructing rail stations at certain park and ride facilities.
Requires Alan M. Voorhees Transportation Center to study potential rail passenger service ridership along New York, Susquehanna and Western Railway right-of-way; appropriates $50,000.
Establishes bi-state commission to study and make recommendations to address rail passenger service needs of certain New Jersey and New York commuters.
Requires prescribers to discuss addiction risk associated with certain drugs prior to issuing prescription to minor patient.

Requires public and nonpublic schools, local recreation departments, and youth serving organizations to have licensed athletic trainer present at youth athletic events that involve certain contact sports.
Revises scope of public employee collective negotiations.
"Drama Therapists and Dance/Movement Therapists Licensing Act."
Concerns unemployment compensation and labor disputes.
Establishes protection from adverse employment action for authorized medical marijuana patients.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and cyber-harassment under certain circumstances.
Increases certain minimum liability coverage required for motor vehicle insurance and abolishes basic automobile insurance policy.
Requires health benefits coverage of hearing aids for children 17 years of age and younger.
Codifies regulations defining justifiable need to carry handgun.
Authorizes creation of new POW-MIA license plate.
Allows for assessment of civil and criminal penalties for violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)" even if violations were not knowingly or recklessly committed.
Establishes "breakfast after the bell" incentive fund.
Concerns the New Jersey estate tax; increases exclusion amount to $2,500,000 over five years.
Provides for establishment of publicly-funded education savings accounts for use at educational institutions other than public elementary and secondary schools.
"New Jersey Library Construction Bond Act"; authorizes issuance of $125,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance capital projects at public libraries; appropriates $5,000.
Imposes three-year moratorium on use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers for certain purposes.
Requires certain workers subject to prevailing wage requirements to be enrolled in, or have completed, registered apprenticeship.
Increases gross income tax pension and retirement income exclusion over three years and removes income eligiblity cap applicable to exclusion.
Concerns transport of certain materials by motor vehicle.
Requires that certain tenants residing in rental housing be issued monthly rent receipts that itemize heat and electricity costs when those costs are included in monthly rent.
Permits cosmetology and hairstyling school clinics to charge certain fees for services rendered to general public.
Permits local units of government to enter into shared services agreements with federal military installations located in the State.
Regulates transportation network companies.
"New Jersey Rural Electric Cooperative Act."

Allows intergovernmental transfer of law enforcement officer without consent of sending jurisdiction if officer completed two or more consecutive years of employment and consent was refused previously.
Requires public and nonpublic school to provide student with more information about NJ STARS Program and improve notification of potenial eligibilty.
Requires public schools to include instruction on cursive handwriting.
Establishes certain hiring preferences for Class Two special law enforcement officers seeking position with municipal law enforcement agency.
Permits certain fire police units to appoint fire police officers.
Prohibits State from disclosing New Jersey driver's license holders' personal information to other states seeking to issue speed camera or red light camera citations.
Permits abandoned prescription medication to be re-dispensed up to one year after original preparation.

Requires health care practitioners prescribing opioid medications on first-time basis, or to minor children, to limit amount of prescribed medication to seven-day supply, except in certain circumstances.
Transfers administration of certain nutrition programs to Department of Agriculture.
Establishes Office of Common Interest Community Association Ombudsman.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for certain firefighter training graduates.
Excludes veterans' entitlements from income for determination of PAAD eligibility.

Directs Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to establish a pilot program to assist certain unemployed and underemployed individuals to complete a career and technical education certificate program in 12 months.
Establishes Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers Task Force.
Allows operators of motorcycles, motorized bicycles, and bicycles to proceed through malfunctioning steady red light under certain circumstances.
Expresses additional rationale for existing statutory prohibition of self-service dispensing of motor fuel at service stations.
Makes Fiscal Year 2016 General Fund appropriation of $250,000 for restoration and maintenance of A.J. Meerwald.
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.
Sets fees for DEP permits and approvals for repair or reconstruction of Sandy-damaged structures at no more than amount in effect on October 28, 2012.
Allows consumption of food on craft distillery premises.
Directs Office of Emergency Management to develop and undertake annual public awareness campaign concerning State's emergency coastal evacuation plan.
Requires institution of higher education to award appropriate credit for student's military service.*
Reduces State hotel and motel occupancy fee from five to two percent starting FY2017; preserves dedication.
Clarifies that use of propane-powered noise making device is allowed as non-lethal method of wildlife control on farmland.
Requires professional boards to provide for online processing of application for licensure or renewal.
Allows eligible landscape operators to make certain purchases of certain materials and supplies without payment of sales and use tax.
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Establishes New Jersey Council on Responsible Fatherhood and Responsible Fatherhood Fund.
Concerns regulation of guaranteed asset protection waivers by DOBI.
Establishes New Jersey Business Action Center in Department of State.
Requires life insurers to use federal death master file to identify potential matches.
Prohibits certain third-party property tax appeals.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to examine feasibilty of centralized property tax information system to verify property taxes paid by homestead property tax reimbursement claimants.
Requires institutions of higher education and proprietary degree-granting institutions to improve transparency of tuition and fees.

"The Highway Worker Safety Act"; increases penalties for vehicular homicide and assault by auto of highway workers; increases fines for certain highway maintenance, construction, or incident zone violations.
Reforms procedures concerning provisions of affordable housing; repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Provides credit against CBT and gross income tax for generators that collect, reuse, and recycle hard-to-recycle materials.
Provides credit against corporation business and gross income taxes for urban area employers that rehabilitate urban housing for employees.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain reasonable and safe distance when overtaking pedestrians and certain bicycles.
Requires direct payment of homestead credit to claimant following sale of qualifying homestead and upon claimant request.
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for certain infant formulas.
Requires health insurance carriers to use standard explanation of benefits form.
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Requires pharmaceutical manufacturers and wholesale distributors accept and provide a rebate for certain returned drugs.
Eliminates requirement that notice of elections list polling place locations; requires notice include Division of Elections Internet site providing polling place locations.
Allows municipality to authorize parking authority as redevelopment entity.
Requires certain community residential facilities have standby emergency power generators.
Allows primary caregiver of handicapped person and person with autism to apply for and use handicapped parking.
Authorizes Commissioner of Corrections to establish program to operate managed cellular access system within State correctional facilities.
Requires State Treasurer to follow usual procurement process prior to entering into cooperative purchasing agreements.
Permits municipality to pay tax refund in equal installments over period of three years.
Extends from 60 days to 120 days amount of time for municipality to refund excess property taxes paid following successful property assessment appeal.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Clarifies scope of corporate by-laws; provides that by-laws may include forum selection clause.
Clarifies that corporate directors may approve actions without a meeting by electronic transmission.
Revises applicability of law concerning derivative proceedings and shareholder class actions.
Clarifies that corporation may adopt "force the vote" provision in plan of merger or consolidation; allows directors to amend plan of merger or consolidation prior to effectiveness of plan.
Permits corporation to impose reasonable limitations or conditions on use or distribution of books and records by shareholders.
Allows certain materials to be included in corporation's proxy solicitation materials.
Requires certain disclosures by non-fiduciary investment advisors.
Authorizes use of emergency reserve fund or proceeds from bonds issued by EDA to finance school security improvements.
Establishes New Jersey School Safety Specialist Academy in Department of Education and requires school districts to designate school safety specialist.
Allows parent or guardian to exclude student from administration of certain assessments.
Provides for compensation of teachers on appropriate salary guide and schedule after withholding of an increment.
Renames "county vocational school districts" as "county career academies."

Establishes a charter school review board in DOE to review charter school applications and modifies aspects of the charter school program including approval, monitoring, and evaluation of charter schools.

Permits school districts to provide transportation to nonpublic school pupils and charge parents when the per pupil amount of the route exceeds the maximum nonpublic school transportation costs per pupil.
Requires DOE to review Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure they incorporate standards regarding engineering where appropriate.
Adds two student representatives to board of governors of Rutgers University.
Adds two employees to the boards of trustees of the State colleges and the county colleges.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.
Requires public research universities and State colleges to develop policies and implement accounting procedures on mandatory student fees.
Directs PANYNJ to establish requirements concerning business operations, safety requirements and violations, and emissions standards for motor carrier operations in NJ portion of port district.
Clarifies scope of affordable housing obligations.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warnings."
Pertains to certain review and approval responsibilities of land surveyors.
Removes certain requirements for professional engineers to take examination to operate water supply and wastewater treatment systems.

Provides that settlement agents are not responsible for transmitting estimated gross income tax payment and forms for certain nonresident real estate transactions unless so responsible pursuant to contract.
Grants prescriptive authority to certain psychologists.
Increases from $15,000 to $25,000 annual compensation PERS retiree may earn in PERS-covered employment without reenrollment.
Increases duration and weekly amount of family temporary disability benefits.
Prohibits use of anti-concurrent causation clauses in homeowners insurance policies.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation for public adjusters.
Authorizes mechanism for independent determination of legal sufficiency of initiated ordinances and referendum petitions.
Imposes limits on fees charged for discovery in municipal court matters.
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for restricted use license.
Establishes asset forfeiture reporting requirements.
Revises law concerning foreign country money-judgment recognition.
Revises residential property mortgage foreclosure process.
Requires creditor to provide mortgage payoff balance on home loan within five business days after notification of request.
Provides procedure to cancel mortgage of record by affidavit of entitled person under certain circumstances.
Requires each county to establish and maintain veterans' service office.
Creates civil service preference for peacetime veterans.
Places limit on liens filed by condominium associations for unpaid assessments on timeshares.
Establishes "Neighborhood Solar Energy Investment Program."
Establishes NJ Solar Energy Study Commission and modifies State's solar renewable energy portfolio standards.
Makes FY 2017 supplemental appropriation of $7,453,000 to DOH for family planning services.*
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain home elevation expenses.
Requires taxpayer to provide certificate of merit setting forth estimated true value of certain property which is subject to county tax appeal.
Requires taxpayer appealing assessment of real property assessed at more than $1 million to file an appraisal within 90 days of filing the appeal.

Makes total property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans retroactive to effective date of determination of total disability; requires State to reimburse municipalities for reimbursement of property taxes paid to veteran.
Reduces maximum rate of interest to be charged for delinquent taxes from 18% to 12%.
Enhances transparency and accountability of online tax sales.
Requires certain county inmates be provided with reentry assistance before their release.

Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for recipients of Medicaid and Supplemental Security Income who are veterans or spouses of veterans and provides for annual cost-of-living increase in allowance.
Establishes Mike Adler Aphasia Task Force to assess needs of persons with aphasia, and their families, and ensure adequate provision of support services and information thereto.
Changes submission and notice requirements for short-term and long-term financing for environmental infrastructure projects.
"Pet Groomers Licensing Act;" designated as "Bijou's Law."

Requires breeders or other providers of dogs to pet shops to certify compliance with DOH breeding and care regulations; prohibits pet shop sale of dogs without certification; requires inspections and reallocation of dog license revenues to fund enforcement.
Requires interior light of motor vehicle be turned on when stopped by law enforcement under certain circumstances.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2017.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2017.
Requires sale of remaining unused State-owned portion of Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital to Morris County.
Establishes an animal abuser registry.
Allows School of Osteopathic Medicine at Rowan University to maintain principal clinical affiliation with either osteopathic or allopathic hospital.
Allows law enforcement officers to scan drivers' cell phones under certain circumstances; imposes penalties for refusal.
Requires suspension of driver's license for gross income tax deficiency under certain circumstances.
Permits senior citizens to ride NJ Transit motor bus service at no cost.
Ensures fairness of project deadlines, enhances transparency, and creates foreclosure protections for Superstorm Sandy victims.
Establishes requirements for sale and planting of running bamboo.
Establishes temporary mortgage relief and foreclosure prevention programs for certain property owners impacted by Superstorm Sandy.
Establishes New Jersey Transportation Consolidation Task Force.
Establishes primary health care plan with optional riders in SEHBP for school employees; requires contribution by school employees for health care benefits.
Establishes primary health care plan with optional riders in SHBP for public employees.
Concerns regulation of solid waste, hazardous waste, and recycling industries.
Requires binding arbitration for certain matters relating to dismissals or reductions in salary of tenured persons employed in a teaching capacity at a county college.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Provides for the removal of a State Board of Education member for failure to attend three consecutive board meetings without good cause.

Provides that certain corporations bidding for public contracts may submit federal Securities and Exchange Commission filings to comply with requirement to disclose certain interest holders; requires submission by limited liability companies.*
Concerns procedure applicable to applicants for professional or occupational licenses who would otherwise be barred from licensure due to certain child support or related obligations.
Requires evaluation of school buildings for air quality and mold.
Requires school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
Prohibits snowplow operators from depositing snow in front of certain access points used by persons with disabilities.
Reduces required limousine insurance in certain circumstances; eliminates sales and use tax on limousine service.
Requires in public schools instruction on the contributions of United States veterans and the observance of patriotic exercises on certain holidays.
Establishes performance and training standards for certain Medicaid transportation services and requires DHS to report compliance with standards.

Requires EDA to establish program offering low-interest loan to certain financial institutions and personal data businesses to protect business's information technology system from customer personal information disclosure.
Establishes guidelines for termination of patient-health care professional relationship.
Requires professionals certifying death to perform any testing and related actions necessary for survivors to claim State and federal benefits.
Concerns excessive price increases during state of emergency.
Authorizes special Support Our Veterans license plate with proceeds supporting New Jersey homeless veteran's centers.
Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess appropriate endorsement to instructional certificate.
Expands One-Call Damage Prevention System to include underground contamination with engineering or institutional controls.
Revises "Franchise Practices Act."
Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to make certain consumer reviews and complaints publicly available.
Increases accidental death benefit to 70 percent of compensation for surviving spouse or surviving children of PERS law enforcement, correction, and firefighter members; redefines child.
Permits bowling alleys, including alleys licensed to sell alcoholic beverages, to conduct amusement games.
Temporarily maintains property tax exemption for previously exempt non-profit hospital properties; establishes "Non-Profit Hospital Property Tax Exemption Study Commission."
Establishes law enforcement assisted addiction and recovery programs.
Establishes tuition reimbursement program for certain psychiatrists who work in underserved areas in New Jersey.
Requires DOH to establish standardized requirements for registration of vendors in health care facilities.
Establishes process for consideration of offers from short sale buyers during residential mortgage foreclosures.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for bond ordinances approved by counties and municipalities.
Establishes certain additional examination and special learner's permit requirements.
Establishes teen driver orientation program.
Permits law enforcement agencies to buy firearms directly from manufacturers; clarifies permits and identification cards not required.*
Allows existing rural development areas zoned for industrial use under pinelands comprehensive management plan to be included as eligible areas under certain business incentive programs.*
Concerns enforcement of prevailing wage in public works.
Permits boards of education to convey certain school property to nonprofit senior citizen organizations for nominal consideration.
Requires breath or blood sample be taken in certain pedestrian-involved motor vehicle accidents.
Establishes that failure to maintain lane may constitute recklessness under vehicular homicide statute; designated as Eileen's Law.*
Concerns notification of employees of procedures for wage claims.
Creates Foreclosure Prevention and Neighborhood Stabilization Revolving Trust Fund; places temporary surcharge on mortgage foreclosure complaints.
Authorizes medical marijuana for qualifying patients with post-traumatic stress disorder.
Authorizes parent or guardian to place security freeze on child's consumer report.
Permits certain municipalities to impose and collect payroll tax of up to 1 percent of employer's payroll.
Includes students who participate in school intramural sports programs in the student-athlete head injury safety program.
Establishes fee on single-use carryout bags used in certain stores and dedicates fee revenue to "Healthy Schools and Community Lead Abatement Fund."
Exempts homeless from fee for non-driver identification cards.
Permits homeless to receive certified copy of birth certificate without fee.
Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act" and increases the motor fuels tax.
"Prescription Drug Consumer Transparency Act."
Eliminates State aid growth limit for school districts in which individuals age 65 and over comprise at least 33.3 percent of the population.
Prohibits public institution of higher education from using State funds in excess of $10,000 to pay fee of commencement and other speakers.*
Establishes loan redemption program for teachers employed in chronically failing schools.
Allows nonimmigrant alien students who have applied for a green card to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education.
Replaces Parole Board members with certain retired judges.
Provides 6.8 cents-per-gallon petroleum products gross receipts tax rate for aviation fuel and removes the "burn out" limitation.

Requires Department of Agriculture to develop voluntary guidelines to encourage school districts and institutions of higher education to donate excess food; extends "Food Bank Good Samaritan Act" protections to school districts.
Authorizes certain county to establish county hospital authority; amends title of "Municipal Hospital Authority Law."
Establishes standards regarding the disqualification of claimants for unemployment compensation for misconduct.
Requires certain contractors to verify work authorization of newly hired employees.
Establishes pilot program appointing third party vendors to administer commercial driver license testing.
Requires NJEDA to establish loan program for certain farming operation equipment purchases.
Establishes Farm to School Coordinating Council.
Establishes "New Jersey Farm to Public Institution of Higher Education Program."
Expands duties and responsibilities of Lieutenant Governor; includes Lieutenant Governor in existing laws governing recall and ethics; establishes Lieutenant Governor's salary and budget.
Limits application of DEP shellfish habitat rules for certain dredging activities.
Authorizes operation of lottery courier services.
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.
Establishes State School Aid Funding Fairness Commission.
Permits municipal land banking in conjunction with online property database development.
"Rosa-Bonilla Family Act"; concerns development of carbon monoxide poisoning educational program for drivers.
Dissolves New Jersey Hall of Fame Advisory Commission and New Jersey Hall of Fame corporation and transfers their functions to Foundation for New Jersey Hall of Fame.
Revises priority schedule for issuance of converted tax credits under Business Employment Incentive Program.
Makes fiscal year 2016 State supplemental appropriations and amends language provisions.
Permits issuance of motorcycle endorsement to certain out-of-State military personnel.
Limits certain State and nonprofit open space acquisitions in municipalities.
Establishes NJ "Landowner of the Year" award program.
Establishes program providing grants for Superstorm Sandy recovery in exchange for reduction of affordable housing obligation.
Requires auto and homeowner insurers to have review process to ensure premium rate quotes are not unfairly discriminatory.

Provides tax relief: increases estate tax exclusion, provides gross income tax deductions for fuel tax and certain charitable contributions, increases NJ earned income tax credit, and increases gross income tax retirement income exclusions.
Concerns affordable housing obligations and COAH membership.
Terminates the New Jersey estate tax and increases New Jersey gross income tax rate on income over $1 million.
Revises "The Professional Service Corporation Act."
Requires training of certain staff and health care professionals in interacting with individuals with developmental disabilities.
Provides for immediate issuance of marriage and civil union licenses; provides for 72 hour waiting period prior to the ceremony.
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund and dedicates $500,000 annually from certain power vessel operator license fees to the fund.
Extends expiration date of certain permits for one year in Superstorm Sandy-impacted counties.
Clarifies applicability of statutory presumption concerning alimony payor's retirement and alimony termination.
Establishes Office of Ombudsman for Individuals with Intellectual or Developmental Disabilities and their Families.
Permits certain audiologists to dispense and fit hearing aids.
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special horse racing permit for steeplechase races; allows wagering on such races.
Establishes manufacturing business assistance program to encourage manufacturing in certain areas of the State.
Requires State to pay educational costs of students who reside in homeless shelter outside district of residence for more than one year.
Directs State Board of Education to authorize computer science education endorsement to instructional certificate.
Requires school district to adopt policy allowing students in grades 9 through 12 who participate in certain interscholastic extracurricular activities to earn varsity letter.
Requires businesses receiving financial assistance from EDA be prohibited from any gender gap payment practice to their employees.
Authorizes use of tracking dog to search for and recover wild deer during prescribed hunting season.
"Appraisal Management Company Registration and Regulatin Act."*
Requires DOE to develop educational fact sheet for distribution to parents of student-athletes and cheerleaders concerning use and misuse of prescription opioids.
Establishes Women's Vocational Training Pilot Program to promote economic self-sufficiency of low-income women through increased participation in high-wage, high-demand occupations.
Increases to under $15,000 from under $10,000 amount of permitted annual compensation paid to TPAF retiree reemployed as athletic coach by former school district within 180 days of retirement.
Eliminates partial and full State intervention under New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of vehicular homicide.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
Allows county and municipal police departments to establish designated safe areas for Internet purchase transactions; establishes public awareness campaign.
Requires that certain inmates with detainers be provided access to drug treatment programs.
Prohibits surgical declawing of cats and other animals.
Adjusts certain State taxes to support strengthened investments in public and private assets in this State.*

Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act"; establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank within NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust; renames NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust.

Makes supplemental appropriations totaling $9,563,415 to DOH for grants of $7,765,325 to Newark Beth Israel Hospital and $1,798,090 to St. Francis Medical Center to implement improved health outcomes and sustainable transformation of healthcare delivery.
Revises "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act" to require certain class study and examination requirements.
Establishes For-Hire Vehicle License Plate Task Force; requires issuance of uniquely colored license plate for certain for-hire vehicles and registration of certain for-hire vehicles.
Directs the Division of Travel and Tourism to publish on its website information of farm-to-table restaurants.
Requires newly manufactured handguns to be micro-stamped; establishes handgun database.
Requires DOH to establish public awareness campaign and develop policies and procedures to promote recognition and treatment of perinatal anxiety.
Requires issues related to prescription opioids to be included in continuing education courses for certain health care professionals.
Requires all prescriptions be transmitted electronically, subject to certain exceptions.
Requires DOH to establish Zika Virus State Action Plan.
Requires recycling of scrap tires and licensing of scrap tire haulers.
Establishes new crime of strict liability vehicular homicide; renames existing vehicular homicide as reckless vehicular homicide; designated as Ralph and David's Law.
Exempts rural electric cooperatives from requirement that electric and gas public utilities deposit unclaimed property into Unclaimed Utility Deposits Trust Fund.
Adds Monmouth County as pilot county for purposes of "Common Sense Shared Services Pilot Program Act."
Allows for sharing of family leave benefits between covered individuals under certain circumstances.
Provides Medicaid coverage for doula care.

Requires opioid antidote dispensation to be monitored under Prescription Monitoring Program, and authorizes certain entities to submit info regarding opioid antidote administration for inclusion in secondary, linked database; designated as "John Wagner's Law."
Requires institutions of higher education to provide victims of sexual assault with contact information for sexual assault crisis services.
Requires disclosure by independent expenditure committees; raises certain campaign contribution limits; repeals ban on certain intraparty fund transfers.

Increases disclosure of political contributions by business entities with public contracts; creates uniform law for contributions by such entities; repeals local option to set contribution limits for business entities.
Expands membership of NJ Task Force on Child Abuse and Neglect.

Requires institutions of higher education to send out annual student debt letters; requires students enrolled in public institutions of higher education to complete course on student loan debt repayment.
"Health Care Consumer's Out-of-Network Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act."
Appropriates $3.5 million to Phillip Alampi Beneficial Insect Rearing Laboratory improvements project.
Establishes central registry of residents with special needs for use during emergencies.

Makes supplemental appropriation of $122,200,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE to provide additional State school aid to school districts with equalized school tax rate greater than specified threshold.

Requires annual school security training for school employees to be conducted collaboratively with emergency responders; requires law enforcement officer to annually attend at least one school security drill.
Requires certain school security measures to be incorporated in architectural design of new school construction and certain school security measures for existing buildings.
Exempts construction, expansion, or renovation of building or structure owned and used by municipality or volunteer fire department from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Permits county prosecutors to enroll in Prosecutors Part of PERS.
Permits certain local authorities and utilities to charge reduced sewerage service rates for low-income persons.
Establishes "Comprehensive State Plan for Economic Development."
Authorizes counties to issue promotional labeling for county agricultural products.
Requires testing for infectious disease for certain persons who have been administered opioid antidote by first responder.

Provides public employee in State-administered retirement system who continues preexisting volunteer relationship with employer from whom employee retires has bona fide severance from employment for compliance with NJ and federal regulations.
Revises penalties for drunk driving and ignition interlock device violations.
Allows installment payments for senior and disabled property taxpayers to repay overpayments of homestead credits and homestead property tax reimbursements.
Requires hospitals and birthing centers to provide parents of newborns with information on health insurance coverage for newborn children.
Provides State agencies will not enter into contracts with business entities that require persons or public entities to give up rights or remedies provided by State law.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to annually report on Office of Taxpayer Advocate.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to promulgate Property Taxpayer Bill of Rights.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use returns to make voluntary contributions to the Boy Scouts of America Councils in New Jersey.
Provides for cost of care of animals involved in animal cruelty violations while being held pending disposition of violation.*
Establishes process for individual to petition court for involuntary commitment of another person to treatment for substance use disorder.
Revises State's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs; implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain environmental purposes.
Enables collection of voluntary contributions for Jersey Fresh Program through gross income tax returns.
Providing gross income tax exclusion for awards for unlawful gender-based compensation discrimination.
Requires health insurance consultants and carriers to provide certain information to certain local units, requires these local units to review this information.
Prohibits juror disqualification based on gender identity or sexual orientation; codifies procedures when discriminatory use of peremptory challenges is alleged.
Establishes task force to study technology and other methods used to reduced or eliminate telemarketing harassment intimidation.
Prohibits MVC from imposing duplicate license or identification card fee and digitized picture fee if duplicate is requested to reflect change in organ donor status.
Changes the time when child placement review hearings are initiated from 45 days to 60 days.
Adds one dental assistant to NJ State Board of Dentistry.
Revises and codifies schedule for childhood lead screening along with other immunization and wellness checks as precondition of child's initial entry into school system.
Requires development and maintenance of data dashboard report to advise of open bed availability in residential facilities providing behavioral health services.
Creates "New Jersey Criminal Justice Information Sharing Environment Coordinating Council."
Directs DEP to adopt standards for drinking water contaminants based upon recommendations of Drinking Water Quality Institute.*

Provides that AG handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving person's death by law enforcement officer while acting in officer's official capacity or while in custody; requires trial in venue outside county where incident occurred.
Increases petroleum products gross receipts tax.
Establishes Service Dog Pilot Program for inmates in Camden County.
Establishes Office of Ombudsman for Navigating Services and Supports for Individuals with Intellectual or Developmental Disabilities.
Requires public utility performing road excavation to repave part of road that was excavated if that road had been repaved in previous five years.
"Aid in Dying for the Terminally Ill Act"; permits qualified terminally ill patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner.
Allows firefighter to serve as crossing guard.
Provides Medicaid coverage for services to treat and prevent Zika virus infection and associated health outcomes.

Concerns certain unused portions of tax credits issued to insurance premiums taxpayers under the Business Employment Incentive Program; exempts certain purchasers of business development incentives from certain State tax notification requirements.*
Expands crime of bias intimidation to include law enforcement officers and emergency services personnel.
Permits issuance of additional alcoholic beverage licenses in municipalities located in certain project areas.
Concerns special occasion events on preserved farmland at wineries.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for Meals on Wheels.
Requires DEP to conduct vibration analysis along routes for disposal of dredged material from Delaware River.
Enhances protections for domestic violence victims by restricting access to firearms by certain persons; provides for minimum terms of incarceration for offenders who commit physically violent acts.
Allows gross income tax deduction for certain student loan interest.
Requires completion of a computer science class as part of the high school graduation requirements.
Upgrades criminal contempt under certain circumstances.
Requires Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission to regulate amusement games using crane or claw machines.
"New Jersey Insurance Fair Conduct Act."
Includes all disabled veterans in NJT discount program for senior citizens and persons with disabilities.
Provides for protection of public's rights under public trust doctrine.
Permits eligible students who are members of United States Armed Forces to wear military uniform at high school graduation.
Enhances resident voting participation rights in common interest communities.
Requires seller of motor vehicle to notify MVC of sale; limits liability of seller after sale of motor vehicle.
Requires adult Work First New Jersey recipients to complete secondary education under certain circumstances and receive life skills training.
Provides for a mandatory minimum term for assaulting a law enforcement officer.
Requires color photo on firearms identification cards, permits to purchase handgun, and permits to carry handgun.
Requires health care facilities to test for and remediate lead in drinking water, and disclose test results.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide coverage for behavioral health care services determined to be medically necessary, including 90 days per year of inpatient residential care.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide treatment for substance abuse and dependency when determined medically necessary by physician or psychologist.
Upgrades penalties for violating certain veterinary practice licensure laws.
Requires MVC to educate and test drivers on responsibilities during police stop.
Establishes New Jersey Dietary Supplements Task Force to make recommendations concerning safety and regulation of dietary supplements sold in New Jersey.
Authorizes school nurses to administer opioid antidotes to overdose victims on school property, with immunity from civil, criminal, and professional liability, pursuant to "Overdose Prevention Act."
Increases State contract sum eligible for payment and performance bond waiver to not more than $300,000; provides for CPI inflation adjustment every four years.
Places temporary moratorium on use of eminent domain; creates Eminent Domain Study Commission to examine its use Statewide.
Concerns speech rights of student journalists at public schools and public institutions of higher education.
Establishes DEP program to reduce heavy-duty diesel truck emissions from trucks operating in the ports of Bayonne, Elizabeth, Jersey City, and Newark.
"Nosey's Law"; prohibits use of elephants in traveling animal acts.

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to obtain court order prior to using certain collection practices for defaulted loans under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students (NJCLASS) Loan Program.
