Enters New Jersey in Physical Therapy Licensure Compact.
Concerns workers' compensation coverage under employee leasing agreements.
Increases fines for failing to have required markings on commercial vehicles.
Enhances eligibility for State Aid for municipalities co-extensive with historic districts.
Provides gross income tax credits for certain taxpayers who provide blood donations.
Provides gross income tax credits for certain taxpayers who donate organs.
Prohibits hospice from charging patient for days on which patient is not present.
Provides transition period of 90 days during which building service employees subject to certain building service transfers must be retained.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support autism programs.
"The Peter Falk Act"; establishes certain requirements concerning access to persons subject to order of guardianship.
Provides for monitoring and evaluation of transition of mental health and substance use disorder treatment service system to fee-for-service reimbursement model.
Requires certain local authorities to inspect, maintain, and repair fire hydrants in planned real estate developments.
Requires retirement benefits of certain PANYNJ employees to be based on salary during certain years of service.
Requires bidders on certain State contracts to disclose, and Department of Treasury to publish, certain gender wage information.

Prohibits treatment, discharge, disposal, application to roadway, or storage of wastewater, wastewater solids, sludge, drill cuttings or other byproducts from natural gas exploration or production using hydraulic fracturing.
Designates portion of Interstate Highway Route 195 in Upper Freehold Township as "State Trooper Anthony A. Raspa Memorial Highway."

"Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act"; authorizes executor, agent, guardian, or trustee, under certain circumstances, to manage electronic records of decedent, principal, incapacitated person, or trust creator.
Bars persons under age 18 from marrying or entering into a civil union.
Establishes Office of the Advocate for Private Commuter Bus Service Customers and bill of rights for customers of private carriers operating motorbus regular route services.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax for step-grandchildren.
Permits family day care providers to care for up to 10 children; requires criminal history record background checks for family day care providers and certain household members.
Increases exclusion amount under New Jersey estate tax to $1,500,000.
Concerning the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Child Support Reform.
Prohibits severance pay agreements from barring certain employee claims against employer.
Concerns employer inquires about worker's wage and salary experience.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to provide supplemental reading instruction to students in grades K through 3.
Requires Office of Emergency Management to establish county storm preparedness program.

Requires cost-benefit analyses and local government financial impact findings for approval of long term property tax exemption; requires DCA to post Statewide database of these exemptions on its Internet website.
Provides for reduction in suspended sentence, probation, or parole based on compliance with conditions of sentence; requires report on effect on recidivism.
Creates "Economic Gardening Program" in Department of State to provide customized services to certain businesses.
Requires uniform response procedures for all domestic crisis teams established or participated in by law enforcement agencies, and strengthens Statewide supervision over teams.
Establishes Statewide "Peace: A Learned Solution Program (PALS)."
Establishes standards for Batterers' Intervention Programs in domestic violence cases.
Establishes identical levels of domestic violence training for judges and judicial personnel.
Requires training for law enforcement officers and assistant county prosecutors concerning handling of domestic violence cases.
Establishes mandatory domestic violence training for municipal prosecutors.
Establishes "Monica's Law" concerning domestic violence risk assessment pilot program.
Requires denial of grant by NJEDA or other State agency to include critique of how applicant business falls short of requirements and standards.
Requires Department of Defense and FAA approval of offshore wind projects.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Authorizes reciprocal agreements with other states for academic credit transfer and directs public institutions of higher education to enter into such agreements.
Establishes the New Jersey Film and Television Project and Employment Incentive Program.

Sets level for health care benefits; requires employee contributions; prohibits reimbursement of Medicare Part B; adds member to SHBP/SEHBP plan design committees; requires retirees to purchase health care through exchanges.
Creates Public Employee Pension and Health Care Benefits Reform Task Force.
Establishes "New Jersey College Ready Students Program Act"; provides tuition-free dual enrollment opportunity at county college for certain high school students.
Requires Division of Local Government Services to include certain property tax information on division's web page.

Establishes program to provide free tuition under State Tuition Aid Grant Program to certain students who are accepted to public four-year institutions of higher education and elect to attend county college for first two years.
Establishes "Succeed in New Jersey" student loan reimbursement program for certain New Jersey residents employed in designated fields.
Authorizes establishment of drug donation programs.
Requires determination of eligibility and payment of family temporary disability leave benefits within three weeks of filing notices of claims for benefits.
Requires DCF and DHS to study predatory alienation and its effects on young adults and senior citizens.
Clarifies DCA rulemaking authority over free-standing residential health care facilities, and prohibits eviction of residents from such facilities, except for good cause.
Provides that driver's license and identification cards expire every four years on licensee or cardholder's birthday. *

Requires certain public facilities and offices to provide on-site lactation room; DOH to provide information about lactation room availability; and DOE to provide information on lactation policies in schools.
Permits new cigar lounges to be opened under certain circumstances.
Establishes "High School to College Readiness Commission" to examine issues and develop recommendations to enhance student preparation for postsecondary education.
Increases dedication of Sales and Use Tax revenue to Transportation Trust Fund Authority.
Requires each board of education to adopt policy establishing temperature control standards and guidelines for school district facilities.
Creates license to manufacture and sell hard cider and mead.
Provides that cigar bars and lounges may renew lapsed registration to permit indoor smoking under certain circumstances.

Exempts expansion or reconstruction, within 125 percent of existing footprint, of municipal and county buildings and certain emergency services buildings from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to establish income-driven repayment option and loan rehabilitation program for borrowers under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students (NJCLASS) Loan Program.

Imposes sales and use tax, transient accommodation fee, and authorizes local transient accommodation tax on charges for providing space for accommodation of transient guests in certain residences in this State.
Disqualifies casino license applicant for five-year period if person substantially closed casino property in State; revokes license; reinstates license eligibility under certain circumstances.*
Expands Lifeline Credit and Tenants' Lifeline Assistance Programs to include assistance for water utility bill.

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to provide annual New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program report to Governor and Legislature and develop student loan comparison information document to increase program transparency.
Revises New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program to require applicants first exhaust federal student loans, require income verification, and limit total student loan amounts.
Concerns long term tax exemptions on certain age-restricted low-income housing.
Excludes from gross income tax value of prizes or awards won in athletic competition in Olympic Games.
Creates State Spending Commission to study expenditures of State government.
Requires Internet-connected baby monitors to include security features.
Requires that certain information be redacted from motor vehicle accident reports submitted to the public.
Establishing New Jersey Commission on Veterans' Benefits in DMVA.
Creates New Jersey Military Working Dog Handler and Military Working Dog medal.
Directs Office of CATV to promulgate rules and regulations concerning customers applying to establish CATV service, including requirement that customers provide two proofs of identity.
Requires State Auditor to annually report on unspent State account balances.
Permits eviction of tenant from rental housing under certain circumstances due to illegal or dangerous activity.

"Disaster Victims Protection Act"; requires Governor to allocate federal and State disaster aid to municipalities in proportion to amount of catastrophic physical damage sustained within each municipality.
Provides free admission to State parks, forests, and beaches for certain veterans and military personnel.
Requires nursing home facility operated by DMVA for veterans to provide State-funded transportation to health care services outside of facility.
Establishes Veterans Assistance Grant Program for nonprofit organization to provide certain services to veterans.
Provides State aid to counties and municipalities to fund transportation services for veterans to VA medical centers; appropriates $500,000.
Adjusts identification of first class cities and certain counties that may have certain unclassified positions in civil service to reflect 2010 federal census.

Establishes "College Credit Requirement Commission" to examine academic credit requirements for associate and baccalaureate degree programs and academic majors at New Jersey's institutions of higher education.
Establishes design-build delivery system for NJTA and DOT projects.*
Creates Emergency Unemployment Benefits Program for construction workers laid off due to halted Transportation Trust Fund projects.
Adds new civil penalties and increases surcharges imposed on domestic violence offenders; establishes "Domestic Violence Victims' Legal Assistance Fund.
Exempts sales of certain materials used in industrial sand casting processes from sales and use tax.
Modifies scope of "Sexual Assault Survivor Protection Act of 2015" and enforcement of protective orders under that act.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Requires school districts to notify DOE whenever law enforcement is called to respond to incident occurring at school.
Requires school districts to provide information to high school students on cancers of the reproductive system as part of the health curriculum.
Requires school facilities projects to maintain character of historic school facilities.
Extends by two months seasonal retail consumption alcoholic beverage license.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support healthcare education.
Creates new $100 assessment for convictions of certain sexual offenses to fund counseling for victims and their families; establishes Sexual Offender Victim Counseling Fund.
Establishes public awareness campaign concerning the dangers of leaving children unattended in and around motor vehicles.
Requires certain defendants to be eligible for monetary bail upon issuance of compliant-warrant.
Increases monetary thresholds for certain theft offenses.
Requires limited liability company to disclose ownership information when submitting deed for recording.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain taxpayers that sell qualified medical devices to qualified consumers at discounted price.
Expands the types of acts for which certain practitioners incur duty to warn.
Requires firearms seizure when mental health professional determines patient poses threat of harm to self or others.
Prohibits sale of unsafe supplemental mattresses designed for children's products.

Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish communication campaign to encourage students to enroll in 15 credits per semester and institutions to report to secretary on strategies and incentives to accomplish this goal.
Requires institutions of higher education to enter into collective Statewide reverse transfer agreement.
Requires institutions of higher education to develop open textbooks available to students at no charge.
Requires four-year institutions of higher education to offer accelerated three-year baccalaureate degree programs.
Allows students to use tuition aid grant awards during summer session.

Permits establishment by county and four-year institutions of higher education of three plus one degree programs for receipt of baccalaureate degree after spending three years at county college and one year at senior institution.
Requires school districts to provide dual enrollment program for college-ready high school students and provides for sharing of tuition costs.
Requires Attorney General to establish victims of identity theft database.
Concerns crime of trafficking in personal identifying information.
Permits juror donation of statutory juror compensation to New Jersey Vet2Vet Hotline program.
Concerns certain continuing professional education requirements for licensed electrologists.
Prohibits sale of certain toy guns and imitation firearms.
Establishes offense of criminal mischief committed on historical sites.
Replaces references to "alien" and "illegal alien" in statutes with "foreign national" and "undocumented foreign national," respectively; prohibits use of those terms by executive branch agencies.
Establishes forest firefighter death benefit.
Permits increase in municipal free public library tax upon voter approval.
Establishes "Nonprofit Security Grant Pilot Program."
Requires certain schools to maintain supply of opioid antidotes and permits emergency administration of opioid antidote by school nurse or trained employee.

Clarifies duties of local health authorities with regard to retail food establishment inspection reports and placards; requires inspection results to be posted online; and revises compliance rating system used for placards.
Permits religious institutions to request DCF conduct child abuse record checks of certain prospective and current employees and volunteers.
Requires school bus transporting students using wheelchairs to be equipped with four-point securement system; requires school bus operator to secure students using wheelchairs.
Requires installation of visual monitoring systems in licensed child care centers.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Limits contributions to legal defense fund of candidate for or holder of elective public office; requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Upgrades harassment under certain circumstances; restricts cyberbullying offenders' access to the Internet.
Requires destruction of records stored on digital copy machines under certain circumstances.
Establishes central registry for background checks of youth serving organization employees and volunteers.
Prohibits the sale of certain children's products containing lead, mercury, or cadmium.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions, earnings, and qualified distributions associated with special needs trusts.
Requires health benefits coverage for mammograms for women under 40 who lack access to family medical history due to their or their parent's adoption.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain amino acid-based elemental formulas.
Authorizes pharmacists to dispense up to 90-day supply of certain prescription drugs.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Directs DOT, in consultation with other State entities, to study and report on certain solar and wind energy installations.
The New Jersey Battlefield to Boardroom Act; Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Increases pension and retirement income exclusions under gross income tax for certain taxpayers.

Requires issue advocacy organization disclosure; increases disclosure of campaign finance information; raises amount of money contributable to committees; modifies restrictions on contributions by certain business entities performing public contracts.

Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program; extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Provides tax credits for performing certain repairs on primary residences of senior citizens or persons with disabilities.
Requires certain energy tax receipts to be paid directly to municipalities.
Permits municipalities to use up to 15% of affordable housing trust fund monies to provide financial assistance grants to owners of real property that sustained certain weather-related damage.
Increases State appropriations to Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund by $387 million to restore municipal aid reductions from Fiscal Years 2009, 2010, and 2011.
Provides that Good Samaritans are not required to pay for ambulance service if injured while rendering emergency care.
"Charlie's Law"; Establishes civil penalties for persons who interfere with or deny persons with disabilities accompanied by service or guide dogs access to places of public accommodation.
Allows certain joint insurance funds to invest in bonds of State and federal agencies and to form joint cash management and investment programs.
Broadens scope of information sharing and civil immunity therefor, related to insurance fraud.
Increases penalties for unauthorized display or use of emergency warning lights.
Requires firearms purchaser identification card, permit to purchase handgun, or permit to carry handgun for temporary transfer of firearm at firing range.
Requires firearms purchaser identification card, permit to purchase handgun, or permit to carry handgun for use of firearm at firing range.
Eliminates use of standardized assessments as measure of student growth or progress in evaluations of teachers, principals, assistant principals, and vice-principals.
Directs that decision by administrative law judge be considered final agency decision if Civil Service Commission has not met for more than 60 days.
Extends duration of first five designated UEZs for two additional years; specifies permissible use of UEZ funds; requires DCA Commissioner to assess and issue report on UEZ program.
Authorizes State and local law enforcement entities to contract for bulk purchasing of heroin antidote.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Increases civil penalties for certain natural gas or hazardous liquid facility safety violations.
Requires certain disclosures to consumers regarding health care costs.
Provides that school districts may receive reimbursement for costs incurred on or after January 1, 2016 for testing school drinking water for lead.
Requires candidates for election to school board to file with their nominating petitions specific affirmation that they have not been convicted of crimes that would disqualify them from office.

Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a public servant, during a state of emergency, to use or make disposition of a public resource in an unauthorized manner with purpose to obtain a benefit for himself or another.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a private citizen to use a tracking device to track another person without that person's consent.
Establishes four-year pilot program in Ocean County for electronic monitoring of certain domestic violence offenders; designated as "Lisa's Law"; appropriates $2.5 million.

Directs poison control and drug information program to establish clearinghouse of drug overdose information, report on trends, and provide education on safe storage and disposal of medications; appropriates $500,000.

Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to publish list of certain tamper-resistant opioid drugs; establishes that certain conditions be met for pharmacist to substitute for tamper-resistant opioid drug.
Requires suspension of member of Legislature indicted for certain crimes or offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office.
Prohibits political contributions by county and municipal political party committees to other committees; increases certain penalties.
Provides grants to eligible businesses equal to five percent of annual base salary of new employees hired under employment grant component of Invest in New Jersey Business Grant Program.
Establishes green infrastructure financing program.
"Government Energy Reliability and Savings Public-Private Partnership Act."
Permits small businesses to qualify for loans from NJEDA for costs of energy audit and making energy efficiency or conservation improvements.
The "Green Building Tax Credit Act."
The "Green Building and Infrastructure Tax Credit Act"; provides tax credits for certain green buildings and wood utility poles.
The "Retrofitted Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Establishes solar power incentive program.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Requires telemarketers to provide name, mailing address, and telephone number of person on whose behalf call is made.
Establishes one-year moratorium on replacement of copper-based landline telephone service with wireless telephone service; requires BPU to report to Governor and Legislature.
Creates "New Jersey Life Sciences Internship Challenge" program.
Requires municipal agency under MLUL to notify prospective applicant of potential need for additional governmental approvals.
Allows corporation business tax credits as incentives for redevelopment of distressed shopping centers.
Directs Commissioner of Education to appoint coordinator and regional consultants to coordinate the education of students with traumatic brain injury.

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Makes homeowners' association in which developer's control of executive board has not been surrendered a public body under "Senator Byron M. Baer Open Public Meetings Act."
Clarifies sales tax collection responsibilities of horse-boarding businesses in New Jersey; makes change retroactive to October 1, 2006.

"Pedal's Law," Prohibits hunting and establishes non-lethal control program for black bear for five years; prohibits actions that result in bear feeding; and requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, and food boxes in bear habitat.*
Restricts medical expense coverage for opioid drugs unless prescribing health care professional follows certain guidelines.
Establishes grant program for school districts and charter schools to develop dual language immersion programs.
Establishes "New Jersey Hearing Impairment Task Force."
Removes requirement that winery licensees grow grapes used to produce wine on three acres on or adjacent to winery premises.
Requires NJT to release bus driver's employee records to future bus company employers and to provide written response when complaint is filed against driver.

Authorizes State Treasurer to convey surplus real property known as Millburn Regional Day School in Millburn Township, Essex County, to Millburn Township Board of Education or to Millburn Township for $3,550,000.
Expands civil rights protections to include breastfeeding; requires employers to provide reasonable accommodations for breastfeeding mothers.
Repeals law requiring nonresidents to pre-pay estimated gross income tax on gains from sale of real property in State.
Requires all creditors that acquire title to non-owner occupied residential property following foreclosure to notify municipality and common interest community.
Requires certain medical transportation vehicles to be equipped with stop signal arms and requires drivers to stop for vehicles under certain circumstances.
Directs Division of Consumer Affairs to establish public information campaign concerning real estate rental scams.

Requires school districts to include information on events of September 11, 2001 as part of New Jersey Student Learning Standards in Social Studies; requires public schools to hold annual assembly commemorating September 11, 2001.
Requires EDA, in consultation with Department of Agriculture, to establish loan program for certain vineyard and winery capital expenses.
Provides gross income tax deduction for New Jersey fuel taxes paid through purchases of motor fuel for personal use of motor vehicles.
Encourages timely recording of residential deeds.
Sets State mileage reimbursement rate at IRS rate for business use of automobile.
Requires electric public utility to notify property owner any time account for electric public utility service on owner's property is opened, closed, transferred, or altered.
Exempts fuel used for operation of certain school buses from petroleum products gross receipts tax and motor fuel tax.
Organizes the Senate for the Two Hundred and Seventeenth Legislature.
Urges Cuba to extradite Joanne Chesimard to U.S.
Encourages Governor to suspend the prevailing wage during current economic crisis.
Urges President and Congress to enact legislation designating National September 11 Memorial and Museum as national memorial.
Urges FDA to make naloxone available over the counter.
Urges Congress not to cut funds from federal Preschool Development Grant Program.
Urges revision of DHS Statewide Transition Plan.
Supports delay of draining of three reservoirs on Garrett Mountain, Passaic County, until EPA releases updated rules concerning open-air reservoirs.
Urges Congress and President of United States to enact legislation to allow states to require out-of-state merchants to collect the state's sales and use tax on sales to its residents.
Designates February 2016 as "Career and Technical Education Month" in New Jersey.
Designates week of May 11th through May 17th, 2015 as "Women's Lung Health Week" in New Jersey.
Opposes President's plan to allow oil and natural gas drilling in Atlantic Ocean.
Opposes PennEast Pipeline project in NJ.
Reconstitutes the "Senate Task Force on Health Insurance Exchange Implementation."
Urges federal government to revise official poverty measure to account for high cost of living, non-discretionary expenses, and cash and noncash income.
Urges expeditious disposition of crimes involving guns.
Memorializes Congress to increase funding for Section 8 housing vouchers and revise program requirements to enhance award of vouchers.
Urges President and Congress to enact legislation reinstating the separation between commercial and investment banking.
Endorses American Kennel Club Canine Good Citizen program.
Memorializes President and Congress to increase federal minimum wage.
Urges US Fish and Wildlife Service and DEP to resolve conflict between protection of red knot shorebird and economic viability of State's oyster industry.
Establishes South Jersey Task Force on Heroin.
Urges National Collegiate Athletic Association to strictly enforce college football rules prohibiting contact by or to a player's head or helmet to help ensure player safety.
Urges enactment of "Safe and Accurate Food Labeling Act of 2015."
Urges United States Congress to dedicate additional federal funds for highway maintenance and infrastructure improvements in New Jersey.
Urges FAA to expand restrictions on flights of unmanned aerial vehicles.
Urges Congress to use reward money offered for capture of Osama bin Laden to establish a fund for benefit of returning veterans of wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Urges U.S. Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services and Congress to investigate practices involving direct and indirect remuneration fees and take appropriate steps to safeguard fairness and transparency.
Memorializes Congress to provide Medicare coverage for eyeglasses, hearing aids, and dentures.
Urges Transportation Security Administration to terminate recent changes to its procedure for conducting pat down searches at airport checkpoints.
Memorializes Congress and Department of Housing and Urban Development to permit display of American flag and yellow ribbons on public housing premises.
Reconstitutes "First Legislative District Economic Development Task Force."
Urges FDA to withdraw approval of Essure permanent birth control device.
Urges NJ residents to continue to support "Small Business Saturday."
Encourages NJ residents to "Shop Main Street."
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to amend rule to require person to have five outstanding parking tickets before arrest warrant issued.
Recognizes that United Airlines will begin providing service at Atlantic City International Airport and urges SJTA and PANYNJ to identify and recruit additional airlines.
Designates April 2016 as "Child Abuse Prevention Month" in New Jersey.
Opposes expansion of black bear hunting season in NJ.
Urges inclusion of "Bergen Loop" option in proposed Hudson River rail tunnel project.
Recognizes strong and enduring relationship between New Jersey and Taiwan; congratulates President Dr. Tasi Ing-wen, Vice President Chen Chien-jen, and Ambassador Lily L.W. Hsu.*
Urges Comcast to resolve dispute with YES Network.
Urges State and local government entities to purchase locally made NJ products.
Urges State and local governmental entities to utilize programs that collect and reuse often unrecycled and difficult-to-recycle waste.
Urges DEP to conduct thorough and thoughtful review of any proposed interstate oil pipeline.
Urges United States Air Force to base F-35 fighter jets at 177th Fighter Wing in Atlantic City.
Urges United States Department of Veterans Affairs to expand Veterans Transportation Program between New Jersey to Wilmington, Delaware, and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to adopt rules to expedite child custody proceedings.
Urges Congress and President to remove barriers to providing employees continuation health insurance coverage during strikes.
Urges school districts and nonpublic schools to adopt policy to address abuse of prescription opioids by students.
Urges State Board of Medical Examiners to adopt CDC guideline for prescribing opioids for chronic pain.
Urges enactment of the "Repeated Objectionable Bothering of Consumers on Phones Act" (ROBOCOP Act).
Condemns publication and distribution of images inciting, glorifying, or justifying violence against law enforcemnet officers.
Urges US Air Force and Congress to place new KC-46A tanker planes at Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst.
Urges Congress to increase funding for services for veterans returning from deployment.
Urges President to establish Presidential Youth Council.
Urges Congress to promptly pass legislation to fund efforts to combat Zika virus.*
Urges Congress and President of US to enact "Arbitration Fairness Act of 2015."
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to create Technology Task Force within Supreme Court's State Domestic Violence Working Group.
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court and Attorney General to revise their jointly-created County Domestic Violence Working Groups to add additional members and responsibilities.
Urges New Jersey Supreme Court to require training on domestic violence issues as part of continuing requirements for certified matrimonial attorneys.
Urges Congress and President to enact "Manufacturing Universities Act of 2015."

Urges Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and North American Electric Reliability Corporation to reassess reliability and redundancy standards imposed on power grid and implement new standards to substantially benefit communities and minimize environmental, social, and aesthetic detriment.

Urges NJ congressional delegation to call on Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and North American Electric Reliability Corporation to reassess reliability and redundancy standards imposed on power grid and implement new standards to substantially benefit communities and minimize environmental, social, and aesthetic detriment.
Urges BPU, DEP, NJT, and Governor to reject Jersey Central Power & Light's application to undertake Monmouth County Reliability Project.
Urges Congress to allocate additional funding to understand, prevent, and treat neonatal abstinence syndrome.
Urges Internal Revenue Service to undertake public awareness campaign regarding fraudulent scheme involving nonexistent "federal student tax."
Urges US Secretary of Interior to designate Rancocas Creek as National Water Trail.
Condemns Turkey's human rights violations following recent attempted military coup against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
Opposes construction of hazardous waste incinerator in Falls Township, Pennsylvania.
Urges the announcement and posting of athletic codes of conduct on signs at youth sporting events.
Urges Commissioner of Human Services to participate in National Accuracy Clearinghouse to detect improper dual payments from Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
Opposes proposal permitting general public to utilize housing units at Naval Weapons Station Earle.
Urges establishment of additional bridge agreements between county colleges and four-year institutions of higher education.
Designates October 6, 2016 as "Knock Out Opioid Abuse Day" in New Jersey.
Urges federal Internal Revenue Service to devote additional resources to combat recent surge in tax-related scams that seek to defraud unsuspecting taxpayers.
Urges U.S. Congress to enact legislation protecting employee and retiree retirement benefits.
Urges school districts to adopt and implement an aerospace and model rocketry program.
Proposes constitutional amendment to authorize Legislature to permit by law establishment and operation of casinos in certain counties.

Proposes constitutional amendment to require payments by State to State-administered retirement systems and establish in Constitution right of public employees to pension benefit; provides for enforcement of funding obligations and benefit rights.

Determines that Fish and Game Council's proposal to allow use of enclosed foothold traps is inconsistent with plain language and legislative intent of 1984 law banning animal traps of steel-jaw leghold type.
Proposes constitutional amendment to increase to $500 veterans' property tax deduction.
Proposes constitutional amendment to increase to $500 senior and disabled persons' property tax deduction, and to increase eligibility income limits.
Proposes constitutional amendment to require primary election before general election to fill gubernatorial vacancy.
Urges Congress and President of United States to enact H.R.1769 and S.901, "Toxic Exposure Research Act of 2015.

Proposes constitutional amendment giving Legislature authority to establish slot machine gambling at horse racetracks; dedicates revenues derived to support State-administered defined benefit retirement systems, casinos, improvements to Atlantic City, and horse racing.
Proposes a constitutional amendment abolishing tenure for Supreme Court justices and establishing retention elections as part of the reappointment process.
Proposes constitutional amendment to increase amount of senior citizens' and disabled persons' property tax deduction to $500; increases annual income eligibility limit to $20,000.
Establishes Joint Legislative Task Force on Addiction Prevention and Treatment.
Proposes constitutional amendment to prohibit diversion of dedicated State revenue and suspend dedicated revenue collections if not appropriated for dedicated purpose during State fiscal year.
Proposes constitutional amendment to require two-thirds majority vote by Legislature for bills proposing a new or increased State tax, fee, surcharge or civil penalty.
Amends State Constitution to create surplus revenue funds in the State general fund and the Property Tax Relief Fund and to change the State revenue estimating process.
Urges Congress to pass legislation allowing veterans to receive hospital care and medical services at non-VA facilities.
Proposes amendment to State Constitution to provide for elected State Comptroller and eliminate Office of State Auditor.
Proposes constitutional amendment to provide for elected Attorney General.
Amends State Constitution to dedicate all State revenues from motor fuels and petroleum products gross receipts tax to transportation system.
Proposes constitutional amendment to preserve right of people to fish, hunt, trap and harvest fish and wildlife.
Amends Constitution to limit use of nonrecurring revenue in State budget except in certain times of crisis and limits State budget growth.
Proposes amendment to constitution regarding parental notification for medical or surgical procedures or treatments relating to pregnancy to be performed on minor children.
Proposes an amendment to the Constitution to describe the manner in which the Legislature shall provide for the maintenance and support of a thorough and efficient system of free public schools.
Proposes constitutional amendment to establish a 2 percent cap on annual appropriations increases for certain State government spending.
Proposes constitutional amendment authorizing Legislature to invalidate certain court decisions.
Proposed constitutional amendment providing for reduced property taxes for certain privately-held lands permanently preserved as open space.
Proposes constitutional amendment to extend eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction and disabled veterans' property tax exemption to residents of continuing care retirement communities.

Proposes an amendment to Constitution specifying a method of providing for the maintenance and support of a thorough and efficient system of free public schools and allocating all income tax receipts to school districts.
Proposes constitutional amendment not to apply unexpired term toward limit of two successive terms as Governor.
Proposes constitutional amendment to increase mandatory retirement age for judges from 70 to 75.
Urges United States Congress to approve "Puerto Rico Chapter 9 Uniformity Act of 2015."
Amends Constitution to dedicate all State moneys received from settlements and awards in cases of environmental contamination for certain environmental purposes.
Proposes constitutional amendment to authorize Legislature to permit by law establishment and operation of casinos in certain counties.
Proposes constitutional amendment granting property assessment reductions for certain improvements to dwelling houses to provide living-quarters for senior citizen relatives.
Applies to Congress for an Article V Convention of States to limit certain powers of the federal government and terms of office.
Urges DEP Commissioner to establish funding formula within Shore Protection Fund for acquisition of certain beach easements.
Urges Congress and the President of the United States to increase subsidies for federal flood insurance.
Memorializes Administrator of EPA to expedite cleanup of Garfield Ground Water Contamination site and provide for temporary relocation of residents affected thereby.
Proposes constitutional amendment to exclude military disability income from the $10,000 income limit for eligibility for the senior citizens and disabled persons property tax deduction.
Urges federal Food and Nutrition Service to relax certain time limits in Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program under certain circumstances.
Reconstitutes the "Joint Committee on Economic Justice and Equal Employment Opportunity."
Memorializes Congress to enact legislation to provide Medicare coverage for incontinence products.
Urges Congress and President to limit duration and amount of late enrollment penalties in Medicare Parts B and D.
Urges President and Congress to enact legislation that supports alopecia areata patients and promotes alopecia areata research.
Proposes constitutional amendment to increase annual income limitation for eligibility to receive property tax deduction for senior and disabled citizens.

Amends Constitution to give public employees the right to collective bargaining.
Proposes temporary constitutional amendment allowing State constitutional convention convened to reform system of property taxation to propose statutory changes.
Urges Congress and President of United States to enact legislation eliminating wasteful tax loopholes.
Urges Congress to amend the "Communication Decency Act of 1996."
Urges Congress and President to address certain concerns raised by advanced imaging technology employed at airports or to discontinue their use.
Urges Congress to enact the "Keeping All Students Safe Act."
Proposes constitutional amendment to eliminate judicial review of arbitration rulings in disputes between Judiciary and county concerning court facilities.
Amends Constitution to dedicate up to one-half of one percent of annual gross revenues of certain cable television companies for assistance to eligible senior citizens and people with disabilities.
Determines that State Board of Education regulations regarding charter schools are not consistent with legislative intent.
Proposes constitutional amendment to grant total property tax exemption to honorably discharged permanently and totally disabled peacetime veterans.
Urges Congress and President to enact H.R.5278, which prohibits awarding federal contracts to inverted domestic corporations.
Proposes constitutional amendment to authorize municipalities to provide additional $250 veterans' property tax deduction.
Prohibits adoption of DEP's proposed rules and regulations to revise its Flood Hazard Area Control Act Rules, Coastal Zone Management Rules, and Stormwater Management Rules.
Proposes constitutional amendment to grant to active military personnel who are deployed $250 property tax deduction.
Proposes constitutional amendment to permit Legislature to extend eligibility to receive veterans' property tax deduction to surviving spouse of nonresident veteran in certain circumstances.

Proposes constitutional amendment restricting use of funds realized from the transfer of State government and independent State authority capital assets only for capital projects and not for State government operating expenses.
Proposes constitutional amendment to establish annual State appropriations cap.

Amends Constitution to require that the State budget be balanced with regularly collected recurring revenue, that surplus revenue and non-recurring revenue only be used for debt service, capital improvements and pension and health benefits liabilities.

Amends State Constitution to provide 10.75% marginal personal income tax rate on annual taxable income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates amount equal to the revenue derived from tax rate to direct real property tax relief.
Memorializes Congress to propose constitutional amendment prohibiting the physical desecration of American flag.
Proposes constitutional amendment to provide Statewide initiative and referendum for directing State fiscal restraint.
Proposes constitutional amendment to prohibit person convicted of criminal offense, as defined by law, from holding elective public office.
Proposes constitutional amendment requiring Legislature to enact statute authorizing $200 property tax credit for primary residence of volunteer fire fighter or first aid squad member.
Memorializes President and Congress to enact legislation that would eliminate preferential tax treatment for oil and natural gas companies.
Commemorates women's access to reproductive health care and anniversary of Supreme Court ruling in Roe v. Wade.
Proposes constitutional amendment to allow electronic wagering terminals at racetracks, off-track wagering facilities, and casinos for wagering on horse races conducted in the past.
Proposes constitutional amendment to permit Legislature to allow by law establishment and operation of casinos in certain counties.
Urges U.S. Department of Justice to investigate certain claims handling practices related to Superstorm Sandy flood insurance claims.
Urges Congress to investigate claims that insurance companies have used revised engineering reports to deny flood claims from Superstorm Sandy.
Urges Congress enact "Stop Corporate Inversions Act of 2015."

Amends the State Constitution to dedicate certain motor vehicle fee and surcharge revenues collected by the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission for the cost of funding the State transportation system.

Provides that Senate and General Assembly will join petition filed with BPU by county of Cumberland challenging discontinuance of maintenance of copper wire landline infrastructure by Verizon NJ in certain communities.
Establishes "Joint Legislative Task Force on Drinking Water Infrastructure."
Amends Constitution to require State to make payments in lieu of taxes to municipalities for certain preserved open space.
Calls on Congress and President of United States to enact "Federal Reserve Transparency Act of 2015," H.R.24, H.R.3189 and S.264.
Proposes amendment to Constitution to prohibit State or federal law or regulation from compelling a person to obtain, provide, or participate in health care coverage.
Expresses Legislature's objections to certain recommendations included in Governor's Educational Adequacy Report.
Proposes constitutional amendment authorizing statute transferring probation functions from Judiciary to State Parole Board.
Proposes constitutional amendment permitting individuals who will be 18 by general election to register and vote in primary election.
Urges parties to 1954 U.S. Supreme Court Decree to address ongoing risk of Delaware River Basin flooding.
Amends Constitution to require legislative consent for any State approval of a trade agreement.
Respectfully memorializes Congress to pass S.1980, which posthumously awards Congressional Gold Medal to Alice Paul.

Proposes constitutional amendment to provide for enactment of laws concerning property tax reform, campaign finance, lobbying, government ethics, and elections procedure by Statewide initiative and referendum.
Honors 50th anniversary of "National Historic Preservation Act."
Proposes Constitutional amendment to limit exercise of eminent domain to acquisition of land for essential public purposes.
Proposes constitutional amendment authorizing Legislature to extend civil service hiring preference to veterans who did not serve in time of war.

Constitutes Joint Committee on the Public Schools as special committee to investigate operation of Newark School District in regard to its ability to ensure students thorough and efficient education; grants committee subpoena power.
Determines that State Police rule to expand definition of justtifiable need for purpose of handgun carry permit is inconsistent with legislative intent.*
Urges Congress to pass legislation that would proctect children and their interests in child custody disputes.
Strongly urges DEP to adopt standards for certain drinking water contaminants as recommended by NJ Drinking Water Quality Institute.
Encourages four-year public and independent institutions of higher education to offer baccalaureate degree programs that cost no more than $10,000 in tuition and fees.
Amends State Constitution to prohibit increase in tax on motor fuels.
Urges President and Congress to enact legislation that supports alopecia areata patients and promotes alopecia arceata research.
Proposes constitutional amendment to change legislative Apportionment Commission membership; establishes new requirements on commission for process and legislative district composition.
Urges construction of microgrids at municipal facilities in New Jersey.
Approves FY 2017 Financial Plan of NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust.

Proposes constitutional amendments to establish redistricting standards for Apportionment Commission; requires Chief Justice of Supreme Court to select 11th member from pool of general public applicants; requires commission to hold public hearings.
Memorializes Congress to enact legislation enhancing safeguards prior to sale of firearms.
Proposes Constitutional amendment authorizing creation of State lottery to fund conservation programs.
Proposes constitutional amendment to dedicate revenue collected from sales tax on paint for lead hazard remediation purposes.
Proposes amendment to Constitution to change minimum and maximum local tax levy requirements for funding of public schools and minimum and maximum State support for special education.
Proposes constitutional amendment to permit disabled veterans who served in U.S. Armed Forces at any time to receive civil service preference.
Recognizes 134th anniversary of Knights of Columbus.
Prohibits adoption of State Police proposed rule expanding justifiable need standard for issuing handgun carry permits.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to veterans who did not serve during time of war or other emergency.

Urges President and Congress to revise laws, and Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to change rules, concerning interstate natural gas pipeline approvals to more fully address adverse impacts.
Provides for special session of Legislature to consider property tax relief and reform.
Proposes constitutional amendment to authorize changes to pension and health care benefits of public employees and to require State to make annual pension payments in certain circumstances.

Proposes constitutional amendment to incrementally increase amount of veterans' property tax deduction from $250 to $500 per year.

Urges Congress to pass and fund "Assisted Living Pilot Program for Veterans with Traumatic Brain Injury Extension Act."
Proposes constitutional amendment to extend veterans' property tax deduction and veterans' property tax exemption to veterans who did not serve in time of war or other emergency.
Proposes amendment to Constitution to provide that State aid to school districts will be allocated on equal per pupil basis.
Proposes constitutional amendment setting minimum wage at $9 per hour, raising it in one dollar increments until it reaches $15 per hour.
